translations.hebrew: אַ֥שְֽׁרֵי־הָאִ֗ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֤ר ׀ לֹ֥א הָלַךְ֮ בַּעֲצַ֢ת רְשָׁ֫עִ֥ים וּבְדֶ֣רֶךְ חַ֭טָּאִים לֹ֥א עָמָ֑ד וּבְמוֹשַׁ֥ב לֵ֝צִ֗ים לֹ֣א יָשָֽׁב׃
translations.english:
Happy is the man who has not followed the counsel of the wicked,
or taken the path of sinners,
or joined the company of the insolent;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אִ֥ם־בְּתוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֗ה חֶ֫פְצ֥וֹ וּֽבְתוֹרָת֥וֹ יֶהְגֶּ֗ה יוֹמָ֥ם וָלָֽיְלָה׃
translations.english:
rather, the teaching of the LORD is his delight,
and he studiesaOr “recites”; lit. “utters.” that teaching day and night.

translations.hebrew: וְֽהָיָ֗ה כְּעֵץ֮ שָׁת֢וּל עַֽל־פַּלְגֵ֫י־מָ֥יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר פִּרְי֨וֹ ׀ יִתֵּ֬ן בְּעִתּ֗וֹ וְעָלֵ֥הוּ לֹֽא־יִבּ֑וֹל וְכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה יַצְלִֽיחַ׃
translations.english:
He is like a tree planted beside streams of water,
which yields its fruit in season,
whose foliage never fades,
and whatever bOr “he does prospers.”it produces thrives.-b

translations.hebrew: לֹא־כֵ֥ן הָרְשָׁעִ֑ים כִּ֥י אִם־כַּ֝מֹּ֗ץ אֲֽשֶׁר־תִּדְּפֶ֥נּוּ רֽוּחַ׃
translations.english:
Not so the wicked;
rather, they are like chaff that wind blows away.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֤ן ׀ לֹא־יָקֻ֣מוּ רְ֭שָׁעִים בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט וְ֝חַטָּאִ֗ים בַּעֲדַ֥ת צַדִּיקִֽים׃
translations.english:
Therefore the wicked will not survive judgment,
nor will sinners, in the assembly of the righteous.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יוֹדֵ֣עַ יְ֭הֹוָה דֶּ֣רֶךְ צַדִּיקִ֑ים וְדֶ֖רֶךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים תֹּאבֵֽד׃
translations.english:
For the LORD cherishes the way of the righteous,
but the way of the wicked is doomed.

translations.hebrew: לָ֭מָּה רָגְשׁ֣וּ גוֹיִ֑ם וּ֝לְאֻמִּ֗ים יֶהְגּוּ־רִֽיק׃
translations.english:
Why do nations assemble,
and peoples plotaLit. “utter.” vain things;

translations.hebrew: יִ֥תְיַצְּב֨וּ ׀ מַלְכֵי־אֶ֗רֶץ וְרוֹזְנִ֥ים נֽוֹסְדוּ־יָ֑חַד עַל־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וְעַל־מְשִׁיחֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
kings of the earth take their stand,
and regents intrigue together
against the LORD and against His anointed?

translations.hebrew: נְֽ֭נַתְּקָה אֶת־מֽוֹסְרוֹתֵ֑ימוֹ וְנַשְׁלִ֖יכָה מִמֶּ֣נּוּ עֲבֹתֵֽימוֹ׃
translations.english:
“Let us break the cords of their yoke,
shake off their ropes from us!”

translations.hebrew: יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם יִשְׂחָ֑ק אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י יִלְעַג־לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
He who is enthroned in heaven laughs;
the Lord mocks at them.

translations.hebrew: אָ֤ז יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֵלֵ֣ימוֹ בְאַפּ֑וֹ וּֽבַחֲרוֹנ֥וֹ יְבַהֲלֵֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
Then He speaks to them in anger,
terrifying them in His rage,

translations.hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי נָסַ֣כְתִּי מַלְכִּ֑י עַל־צִ֝יּ֗וֹן הַר־קׇדְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
“But I have installed My king
on Zion, My holy mountain!”

translations.hebrew: אֲסַפְּרָ֗ה אֶֽ֫ל־חֹ֥ק יְֽהֹוָ֗ה אָמַ֘ר־אֵלַ֥י בְּנִ֥י אַ֑תָּה אֲ֝נִ֗י הַיּ֥וֹם יְלִדְתִּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Let me tell of the decree:
the LORD said to me,
bCompare 2 Sam. 7.14, and Ps. 89.27 ff.“You are My son,
I have fathered you this day.-b

translations.hebrew: שְׁאַ֤ל מִמֶּ֗נִּי וְאֶתְּנָ֣ה ג֭וֹיִם נַחֲלָתֶ֑ךָ וַ֝אֲחֻזָּתְךָ֗ אַפְסֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Ask it of Me,
and I will make the nations your domain;
your estate, the limits of the earth.

translations.hebrew: תְּ֭רֹעֵם בְּשֵׁ֣בֶט בַּרְזֶ֑ל כִּכְלִ֖י יוֹצֵ֣ר תְּנַפְּצֵֽם׃
translations.english:
You can smash them with an iron mace,
shatter them like potter’s ware.”

translations.hebrew: וְ֭עַתָּה מְלָכִ֣ים הַשְׂכִּ֑ילוּ הִ֝וָּסְר֗וּ שֹׁ֣פְטֵי אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
So now, O kings, be prudent;
accept discipline, you rulers of the earth!

translations.hebrew: עִבְד֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּיִרְאָ֑ה וְ֝גִ֗ילוּ בִּרְעָדָֽה׃
translations.english:
Serve the LORD in awe;
cMeaning of Heb. uncertain; others “rejoice with trembling.”tremble with fright,-c

translations.hebrew: נַשְּׁקוּ־בַ֡ר פֶּן־יֶאֱנַ֤ף ׀ וְתֹ֬אבְדוּ דֶ֗רֶךְ כִּֽי־יִבְעַ֣ר כִּמְעַ֣ט אַפּ֑וֹ אַ֝שְׁרֵ֗י כׇּל־ח֥וֹסֵי בֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.pay homage in good faith,-d
lest He be angered, and your way be doomed
in the mere flash of His anger.
Happy are all who take refuge in Him.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִ֑ד בְּ֝בׇרְח֗וֹ מִפְּנֵ֤י ׀ אַבְשָׁל֬וֹם בְּנֽוֹ׃
translations.english: A psalm of David when he fled from his son Absalom.

translations.hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה מָה־רַבּ֣וּ צָרָ֑י רַ֝בִּ֗ים קָמִ֥ים עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
O LORD, my foes are so many!
Many are those who attack me;

translations.hebrew: רַבִּים֮ אֹמְרִ֢ים לְנַ֫פְשִׁ֥י אֵ֤ין יְֽשׁוּעָ֓תָה לּ֬וֹ בֵאלֹהִ֬ים סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
many say of me,
“There is no deliverance for him through God.” Selah.aA liturgical direction of uncertain meaning.

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה מָגֵ֣ן בַּעֲדִ֑י כְּ֝בוֹדִ֗י וּמֵרִ֥ים רֹאשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
But You, O LORD, are a shield about me,
my glory, He who holds my head high.

translations.hebrew: ק֭וֹלִי אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶקְרָ֑א וַיַּעֲנֵ֨נִי מֵהַ֖ר קׇדְשׁ֣וֹ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
I cry aloud to the LORD,
and He answers me from His holy mountain. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אֲנִ֥י שָׁכַ֗בְתִּי וָאִ֫ישָׁ֥נָה הֱקִיצ֑וֹתִי כִּ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה יִסְמְכֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
I lie down and sleep and wake again,
for the LORD sustains me.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־אִ֭ירָא מֵרִבְב֥וֹת עָ֑ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר סָ֝בִ֗יב שָׁ֣תוּ עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
I have no fear of the myriad forces
arrayed against me on every side.

translations.hebrew: ק֘וּמָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ הוֹשִׁ֘יעֵ֤נִי אֱלֹהַ֗י כִּֽי־הִכִּ֣יתָ אֶת־כׇּל־אֹיְבַ֣י לֶ֑חִי שִׁנֵּ֖י רְשָׁעִ֣ים שִׁבַּֽרְתָּ׃
translations.english:
Rise, O LORD!
Deliver me, O my God!
For You slap all my enemies in the face;bLit. “cheek.”
You break the teeth of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: לַֽיהֹוָ֥ה הַיְשׁוּעָ֑ה עַֽל־עַמְּךָ֖ בִרְכָתֶ֣ךָ סֶּֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Deliverance is the LORD’s;
Your blessing be upon Your people! Selah.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינ֗וֹת מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.For the leader; with instrumental music.-a A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: בְּקׇרְאִ֡י עֲנֵ֤נִי ׀ אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י צִדְקִ֗י בַּ֭צָּר הִרְחַ֣בְתָּ לִּ֑י חׇ֝נֵּ֗נִי וּשְׁמַ֥ע תְּפִלָּתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Answer me when I call,
O God, my vindicator!
You freed me from distress;
have mercy on me and hear my prayer.

translations.hebrew: בְּנֵ֥י אִ֡ישׁ עַד־מֶ֬ה כְבוֹדִ֣י לִ֭כְלִמָּה תֶּאֱהָב֣וּן רִ֑יק תְּבַקְשׁ֖וּ כָזָ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
You men, how long will my glory be mocked,
will you love illusions,
have recourse to frauds? Selah.

translations.hebrew: וּדְע֗וּ כִּֽי־הִפְלָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה חָסִ֣יד ל֑וֹ יְהֹוָ֥ה יִ֝שְׁמַ֗ע בְּקׇרְאִ֥י אֵלָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Know that the LORD singles out the faithful for Himself;
the LORD hears when I call to Him.

translations.hebrew: רִגְז֗וּ וְֽאַל־תֶּ֫חֱטָ֥אוּ אִמְר֣וּ בִ֭לְבַבְכֶם עַֽל־מִשְׁכַּבְכֶ֗ם וְדֹ֣מּוּ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
So tremble, and sin no more;
ponder it on your bed, and sigh.bOthers “be still.”

translations.hebrew: זִבְח֥וּ זִבְחֵי־צֶ֑דֶק וּ֝בִטְח֗וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Offer sacrifices in righteousness
and trust in the LORD.

translations.hebrew: רַבִּ֥ים אֹמְרִים֮ מִֽי־יַרְאֵ֢נ֫וּ ט֥וֹב נְֽסָה־עָ֭לֵינוּ א֨וֹר פָּנֶ֬יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Many say, “O for good days!”
cLit. “Lift up the light of Your countenance upon us”; cf. Num. 6.25 f.Bestow Your favor on us,-c O LORD.

translations.hebrew: נָתַ֣תָּה שִׂמְחָ֣ה בְלִבִּ֑י מֵעֵ֬ת דְּגָנָ֖ם וְתִירוֹשָׁ֣ם רָֽבּוּ׃
translations.english:
You put joy into my heart
when their grain and wine show increase.

translations.hebrew: בְּשָׁל֣וֹם יַחְדָּו֮ אֶשְׁכְּבָ֢ה וְאִ֫ישָׁ֥ן כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה לְבָדָ֑ד לָ֝בֶ֗טַח תּוֹשִׁיבֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Safe and sound, I lie down and sleep,
dOr “for You, O Lord, keep me alone and secure.”for You alone, O LORD, keep me secure.-d

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אֶֽל־הַנְּחִיל֗וֹת מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.For the leader; on neḥiloth.-a A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: אֲמָרַ֖י הַאֲזִ֥ינָה <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֗ה בִּ֣ינָה הֲגִיגִֽי׃
translations.english:
Give ear to my speech, O LORD;
consider my utterance.

translations.hebrew: הַקְשִׁ֤יבָה ׀ לְק֬וֹל שַׁוְעִ֗י מַלְכִּ֥י וֵאלֹהָ֑י כִּֽי־אֵ֝לֶ֗יךָ אֶתְפַּלָּֽל׃
translations.english:
Heed the sound of my cry,
my king and God,
for I pray to You.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בֹּ֭קֶר תִּשְׁמַ֣ע קוֹלִ֑י בֹּ֥קֶר אֶעֱרׇךְ־לְ֝ךָ֗ וַאֲצַפֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
Hear my voice, O LORD, at daybreak;
at daybreak I plead before You, and wait.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹ֤א אֵֽל־חָפֵ֘ץ־רֶ֥שַׁע ׀ אָ֑תָּה לֹ֖א יְגֻרְךָ֣ רָֽע׃
translations.english:
For You are not a God who desires wickedness;
evil cannot abide with You;

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־יִתְיַצְּב֣וּ ה֭וֹלְלִים לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינֶ֑יךָ שָׂ֝נֵ֗אתָ כׇּל־פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
wanton men cannot endure in Your sight.
You detest all evildoers;

translations.hebrew: תְּאַבֵּד֮ דֹּבְרֵ֢י כָ֫זָ֥ב אִישׁ־דָּמִ֥ים וּמִרְמָ֗ה יְתָ֘עֵ֥ב <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
You doom those who speak lies;
murderous, deceitful men the LORD abhors.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י בְּרֹ֣ב חַ֭סְדְּךָ אָב֣וֹא בֵיתֶ֑ךָ אֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֥ה אֶל־הֵֽיכַל־קׇ֝דְשְׁךָ֗ בְּיִרְאָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
But I, through Your abundant love, enter Your house;
I bow down in awe at Your holy temple.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ נְחֵ֬נִי בְצִדְקָתֶ֗ךָ לְמַ֥עַן שׁוֹרְרָ֑י (הושר) [הַיְשַׁ֖ר] לְפָנַ֣י דַּרְכֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
O LORD, bOr “as You are righteous, lead me.”lead me along Your righteous [path]-b
because of my watchful foes;
make Your way straight before me.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֪ין בְּפִ֡יהוּ נְכוֹנָה֮ קִרְבָּ֢ם הַ֫וּ֥וֹת קֶֽבֶר־פָּת֥וּחַ גְּרֹנָ֑ם לְ֝שׁוֹנָ֗ם יַחֲלִיקֽוּן׃
translations.english:
For there is no sincerity on their lips;cLit. “mouth.”
their heart is [filled with] malice;
their throat is an open grave;
their tongue slippery.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥אֲשִׁימֵ֨ם ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים יִפְּלוּ֮ מִֽמֹּעֲצ֢וֹתֵ֫יהֶ֥ם בְּרֹ֣ב פִּ֭שְׁעֵיהֶם הַדִּיחֵ֑מוֹ כִּי־מָ֥רוּ בָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Condemn them, O God;
let them fall by their own devices;
cast them out for their many crimes,
for they defy You.

translations.hebrew: וְיִשְׂמְח֨וּ כׇל־ח֪וֹסֵי בָ֡ךְ לְעוֹלָ֣ם יְ֭רַנֵּנוּ וְתָסֵ֣ךְ עָלֵ֑ימוֹ וְֽיַעְלְצ֥וּ בְ֝ךָ֗ אֹהֲבֵ֥י שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
But let all who take refuge in You rejoice,
ever jubilant as You shelter them;
and let those who love Your name exult in You.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּה֮ תְּבָרֵ֢ךְ צַ֫דִּ֥יק יְהֹוָ֑ה כַּ֝צִּנָּ֗ה רָצ֥וֹן תַּעְטְרֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
For You surely bless the righteous man, O LORD,
encompassing him with favor like a shield.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ בִּ֭נְגִינוֹת עַֽל־הַשְּׁמִינִ֗ית מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.For the leader; with instrumental music on the sheminith.aMeaning of Heb. uncertain. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה אַל־בְּאַפְּךָ֥ תוֹכִיחֵ֑נִי וְֽאַל־בַּחֲמָתְךָ֥ תְיַסְּרֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
O LORD, do not punish me in anger,
do not chastise me in fury.

translations.hebrew: חׇנֵּ֥נִי יְהֹוָה֮ כִּ֤י אֻמְלַ֫ל־אָ֥נִי רְפָאֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֖י נִבְהֲל֣וּ עֲצָמָֽי׃
translations.english:
Have mercy on me, O LORD, for I languish;
heal me, O LORD, for my bones shake with terror.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭נַפְשִׁי נִבְהֲלָ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד (ואת) [וְאַתָּ֥ה] יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עַד־מָתָֽי׃
translations.english:
My whole being is stricken with terror,
while You, LORD—O, how long!

translations.hebrew: שׁוּבָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה חַלְּצָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֑י ה֝וֹשִׁיעֵ֗נִי לְמַ֣עַן חַסְדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
O LORD, turn! Rescue me!
Deliver me as befits Your faithfulness.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֣ין בַּמָּ֣וֶת זִכְרֶ֑ךָ בִּ֝שְׁא֗וֹל מִ֣י יֽוֹדֶה־לָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
For there is no praise of You among the dead;
in Sheol, who can acclaim You?

translations.hebrew: יָגַ֤עְתִּי ׀ בְּֽאַנְחָתִ֗י אַשְׂחֶ֣ה בְכׇל־לַ֭יְלָה מִטָּתִ֑י בְּ֝דִמְעָתִ֗י עַרְשִׂ֥י אַמְסֶֽה׃
translations.english:
I am weary with groaning;
every night I drench my bed,
I melt my couch in tears.

translations.hebrew: עָשְׁשָׁ֣ה מִכַּ֣עַס עֵינִ֑י עָ֝תְקָ֗ה בְּכׇל־צוֹרְרָֽי׃
translations.english:
My eyes are wasted by vexation,
worn out because of all my foes.

translations.hebrew: ס֣וּרוּ מִ֭מֶּנִּי כׇּל־פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן כִּֽי־שָׁמַ֥ע יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה ק֣וֹל בִּכְיִֽי׃
translations.english:
Away from me, all you evildoers,
for the LORD heeds the sound of my weeping.

translations.hebrew: שָׁמַ֣ע יְ֭הֹוָה תְּחִנָּתִ֑י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה תְּֽפִלָּתִ֥י יִקָּֽח׃
translations.english:
The LORD heeds my plea,
the LORD accepts my prayer.

translations.hebrew: יֵבֹ֤שׁוּ ׀ וְיִבָּהֲל֣וּ מְ֭אֹד כׇּל־אֹיְבָ֑י יָ֝שֻׁ֗בוּ יֵבֹ֥שׁוּ רָֽגַע׃
translations.english:
All my enemies will be frustrated and stricken with terror;
they will turn back in an instant, frustrated.

translations.hebrew: שִׁגָּי֗וֹן לְדָ֫וִ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֥ר לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה עַל־דִּבְרֵי־כ֝֗וּשׁ בֶּן־יְמִינִֽי׃
translations.english: aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Shiggaion of David,-a which he sang to the LORD, concerning Cush, a Benjaminite.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהַי בְּךָ֣ חָסִ֑יתִי הוֹשִׁיעֵ֥נִי מִכׇּל־רֹ֝דְפַ֗י וְהַצִּילֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
O LORD, my God, in You I seek refuge;
deliver me from all my pursuers and save me,

translations.hebrew: פֶּן־יִטְרֹ֣ף כְּאַרְיֵ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֑י פֹּ֝רֵ֗ק וְאֵ֣ין מַצִּֽיל׃
translations.english:
lest, like a lion, they tear me apart,
rending in pieces, and no one save me.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהַי אִם־עָשִׂ֣יתִי זֹ֑את אִֽם־יֶשׁ־עָ֥וֶל בְּכַפָּֽי׃
translations.english:
O LORD, my God, if I have done such things,
if my hands bear the guilt of wrongdoing,

translations.hebrew: אִם־גָּ֭מַלְתִּי שֽׁוֹלְמִ֥י רָ֑ע וָאֲחַלְּצָ֖ה צֽוֹרְרִ֣י רֵיקָֽם׃
translations.english:
if I have dealt evil to my ally—
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain; others “or stripped my foe clean.”I who rescued my foe without reward-b—

translations.hebrew: יִ֥רַדֹּֽף־אוֹיֵ֨ב ׀ נַפְשִׁ֡י וְיַשֵּׂ֗ג וְיִרְמֹ֣ס לָאָ֣רֶץ חַיָּ֑י וּכְבוֹדִ֓י ׀ לֶעָפָ֖ר יַשְׁכֵּ֣ן סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
then let the enemy pursue and overtake me;
let him trample my life to the ground,
and lay my body in the dust. Selah.

translations.hebrew: ק֘וּמָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ בְּאַפֶּ֗ךָ הִ֭נָּשֵׂא בְּעַבְר֣וֹת צוֹרְרָ֑י וְע֥וּרָה אֵ֝לַ֗י מִשְׁפָּ֥ט צִוִּֽיתָ׃
translations.english:
Rise, O LORD, in Your anger;
assert Yourself cOr “in Your fury against my foes.”against the fury of my foes;-c
bestir Yourself on my behalf;
You have ordained judgment.

translations.hebrew: וַעֲדַ֣ת לְ֭אֻמִּים תְּסֽוֹבְבֶ֑ךָּ וְ֝עָלֶ֗יהָ לַמָּר֥וֹם שֽׁוּבָה׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Let the assembly of peoples gather about You,
with You enthroned above, on high.-a

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָה֮ יָדִ֢ין עַ֫מִּ֥ים שׇׁפְטֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּצִדְקִ֖י וּכְתֻמִּ֣י עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
The LORD judges the peoples;
vindicate me, O LORD,
for the righteousness and blamelessness that are mine.

translations.hebrew: יִגְמׇר־נָ֬א רַ֨ע ׀ רְשָׁעִים֮ וּתְכוֹנֵ֢ן צַ֫דִּ֥יק וּבֹחֵ֣ן לִ֭בּוֹת וּכְלָי֗וֹת אֱלֹהִ֥ים צַדִּֽיק׃
translations.english:
Let the evil of the wicked come to an end,
but establish the righteous;
he who probes the mind and consciencedLit. “kidneys.” is God the righteous.

translations.hebrew: מָגִנִּ֥י עַל־אֱלֹהִ֑ים מ֝וֹשִׁ֗יעַ יִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
eCf. Ibn Ezra and Kimhi; lit. “My Shield is upon God.”I look to God to shield me;-e
the deliverer of the upright.

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים שׁוֹפֵ֣ט צַדִּ֑יק וְ֝אֵ֗ל זֹעֵ֥ם בְּכׇל־יֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
God vindicates the righteous;
God fOthers “has indignation.”pronounces doom-f each day.

translations.hebrew: אִם־לֹ֣א יָ֭שׁוּב חַרְבּ֣וֹ יִלְט֑וֹשׁ קַשְׁתּ֥וֹ דָ֝רַ֗ךְ וַֽיְכוֹנְנֶֽהָ׃
translations.english:
gMeaning of vv. 13–14 uncertain; an alternate rendering, with God as the main subject, is: 13If one does not turn back, He whets His sword, / bends His bow and aims it; / 14deadly weapons He prepares for him, / and makes His arrows sharp.If one does not turn back, but whets his sword,
bends his bow and aims it,

translations.hebrew: וְ֭לוֹ הֵכִ֣ין כְּלֵי־מָ֑וֶת חִ֝צָּ֗יו לְֽדֹלְקִ֥ים יִפְעָֽל׃
translations.english:
then against himself he readies deadly weapons,
and makes his arrows sharp.-g

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֥ה יְחַבֶּל־אָ֑וֶן וְהָרָ֥ה עָ֝מָ֗ל וְיָ֣לַד שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
See, he hatches evil, conceives mischief,
and gives birth to fraud.

translations.hebrew: בּ֣וֹר כָּ֭רָה וַֽיַּחְפְּרֵ֑הוּ וַ֝יִּפֹּ֗ל בְּשַׁ֣חַת יִפְעָֽל׃
translations.english:
He has dug a pit and deepened it,
and will fall into the trap he made.

translations.hebrew: יָשׁ֣וּב עֲמָל֣וֹ בְרֹאשׁ֑וֹ וְעַ֥ל קׇ֝דְקֳד֗וֹ חֲמָס֥וֹ יֵרֵֽד׃
translations.english:
His mischief will recoil upon his own head;
his lawlessness will come down upon his skull.

translations.hebrew: אוֹדֶ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה כְּצִדְק֑וֹ וַ֝אֲזַמְּרָ֗ה שֵֽׁם־יְהֹוָ֥ה עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
I will praise the LORD for His righteousness,
and sing a hymn to the name of the LORD Most High.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־הַגִּתִּ֗ית מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.For the leader; on the gittith.-a A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה אֲדֹנֵ֗ינוּ מָה־אַדִּ֣יר שִׁ֭מְךָ בְּכׇל־הָאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר תְּנָ֥ה ה֝וֹדְךָ֗ עַל־הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
O LORD, our Lord,
How majestic is Your name throughout the earth,
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain; or “You whose splendor is celebrated all over the heavens!”You who have covered the heavens with Your splendor!-b

translations.hebrew: מִפִּ֤י עוֹלְלִ֨ים ׀ וְֽיֹנְקִים֮ יִסַּ֢דְתָּ֫ עֹ֥ז לְמַ֥עַן צוֹרְרֶ֑יךָ לְהַשְׁבִּ֥ית א֝וֹיֵ֗ב וּמִתְנַקֵּֽם׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.From the mouths of infants and sucklings
You have founded strength on account of Your foes,
to put an end to enemy and avenger.-a

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אֶרְאֶ֣ה שָׁ֭מֶיךָ מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה אֶצְבְּעֹתֶ֑יךָ יָרֵ֥חַ וְ֝כוֹכָבִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר כּוֹנָֽנְתָּה׃
translations.english:
When I behold Your heavens, the work of Your fingers,
the moon and stars that You set in place,

translations.hebrew: מָה־אֱנ֥וֹשׁ כִּֽי־תִזְכְּרֶ֑נּוּ וּבֶן־אָ֝דָ֗ם כִּ֣י תִפְקְדֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
what is man that You have been mindful of him,
mortal man that You have taken note of him,

translations.hebrew: וַתְּחַסְּרֵ֣הוּ מְּ֭עַט מֵאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְכָב֖וֹד וְהָדָ֣ר תְּעַטְּרֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
that You have made him little less than divine,cOr “the angels.”
and adorned him with glory and majesty;

translations.hebrew: תַּ֭מְשִׁילֵהוּ בְּמַעֲשֵׂ֣י יָדֶ֑יךָ כֹּ֝֗ל שַׁ֣תָּה תַֽחַת־רַגְלָֽיו׃
translations.english:
You have made him master over Your handiwork,
laying the world at his feet,

translations.hebrew: צֹנֶ֣ה וַאֲלָפִ֣ים כֻּלָּ֑ם וְ֝גַ֗ם בַּהֲמ֥וֹת שָׂדָֽי׃
translations.english:
sheep and oxen, all of them,
and wild beasts, too;

translations.hebrew: צִפּ֣וֹר שָׁ֭מַיִם וּדְגֵ֣י הַיָּ֑ם עֹ֝בֵ֗ר אׇרְח֥וֹת יַמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
the birds of the heavens, the fish of the sea,
whatever travels the paths of the seas.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה אֲדֹנֵ֑ינוּ מָה־אַדִּ֥יר שִׁ֝מְךָ֗ בְּכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english: O L<small>ORD</small>, our Lord, how majestic is Your name throughout the earth!

translations.hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ עַל־מ֥וּת לַבֵּ֗ן מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: aMeaning of Heb. uncertain; some mss. and ancient versions, ‘al muth labben, as though “over the death of the son.”For the leader; ‘almuth labben.-a A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: אוֹדֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה בְּכׇל־לִבִּ֑י אֲ֝סַפְּרָ֗ה כׇּל־נִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I will praise You, LORD, with all my heart;
I will tell all Your wonders.

translations.hebrew: אֶשְׂמְחָ֣ה וְאֶעֶלְצָ֣ה בָ֑ךְ אֲזַמְּרָ֖ה שִׁמְךָ֣ עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
I will rejoice and exult in You,
singing a hymn to Your name, O Most High.

translations.hebrew: בְּשׁוּב־אוֹיְבַ֥י אָח֑וֹר יִכָּשְׁל֥וּ וְ֝יֹאבְד֗וּ מִפָּנֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
When my enemies retreat,
they stumble to their doom at Your presence.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־עָ֭שִׂיתָ מִשְׁפָּטִ֣י וְדִינִ֑י יָשַׁ֥בְתָּ לְ֝כִסֵּ֗א שׁוֹפֵ֥ט צֶֽדֶק׃
translations.english:
For You uphold my right and claim,
enthroned as righteous judge.

translations.hebrew: גָּעַ֣רְתָּ ג֭וֹיִם אִבַּ֣דְתָּ רָשָׁ֑ע שְׁמָ֥ם מָ֝חִ֗יתָ לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
translations.english:
You blast the nations;
You destroy the wicked;
You blot out their name forever.

translations.hebrew: הָֽאוֹיֵ֨ב ׀ תַּ֥מּוּ חֳרָב֗וֹת לָ֫נֶ֥צַח וְעָרִ֥ים נָתַ֑שְׁתָּ אָבַ֖ד זִכְרָ֣ם הֵֽמָּה׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.The enemy is no more—
ruins everlasting;
You have torn down their cities;
their very names are lost.-b

translations.hebrew: וַֽ֭יהֹוָה לְעוֹלָ֣ם יֵשֵׁ֑ב כּוֹנֵ֖ן לַמִּשְׁפָּ֣ט כִּסְאֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
But the LORD abides forever;
He has set up His throne for judgment;

translations.hebrew: וְה֗וּא יִשְׁפֹּֽט־תֵּבֵ֥ל בְּצֶ֑דֶק יָדִ֥ין לְ֝אֻמִּ֗ים בְּמֵישָׁרִֽים׃
translations.english:
it is He who judges the world with righteousness,
rules the peoples with equity.

translations.hebrew: וִ֘יהִ֤י יְהֹוָ֣ה מִשְׂגָּ֣ב לַדָּ֑ךְ מִ֝שְׂגָּ֗ב לְעִתּ֥וֹת בַּצָּרָֽה׃
translations.english:
The LORD is a haven for the oppressed,
a haven in times of trouble.

translations.hebrew: וְיִבְטְח֣וּ בְ֭ךָ יוֹדְעֵ֣י שְׁמֶ֑ךָ כִּ֤י לֹֽא־עָזַ֖בְתָּ דֹרְשֶׁ֣יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Those who know Your name trust You,
for You do not abandon those who turn to You, O LORD.

translations.hebrew: זַמְּר֗וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה יֹשֵׁ֣ב צִיּ֑וֹן הַגִּ֥ידוּ בָ֝עַמִּ֗ים עֲלִֽילוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Sing a hymn to the LORD, cOr “O You who dwell in Zion.”who reigns in Zion;-c
declare His deeds among the peoples.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־דֹרֵ֣שׁ דָּ֭מִים אוֹתָ֣ם זָכָ֑ר לֹֽא־שָׁ֝כַ֗ח צַעֲקַ֥ת (עניים) [עֲנָוִֽים]׃
translations.english:
dOrder of Hebrew clauses inverted for clarity.For He does not ignore the cry of the afflicted;
He who requites bloodshed is mindful of them.-d

translations.hebrew: חָֽנְנֵ֬נִי יְהֹוָ֗ה רְאֵ֣ה עׇ֭נְיִי מִשֹּׂנְאָ֑י מְ֝רוֹמְמִ֗י מִשַּׁ֥עֲרֵי מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
Have mercy on me, O LORD;
see my affliction at the hands of my foes,
You who lift me from the gates of death,

translations.hebrew: לְמַ֥עַן אֲסַפְּרָ֗ה כׇּֽל־תְּהִלָּ֫תֶ֥יךָ בְּשַׁעֲרֵ֥י בַת־צִיּ֑וֹן אָ֝גִ֗ילָה בִּישׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
so that in the gates of eLit. “the Daughter of Zion.”Fair Zion-e
I might tell all Your praise,
I might exult in Your deliverance.

translations.hebrew: טָבְע֣וּ ג֭וֹיִם בְּשַׁ֣חַת עָשׂ֑וּ בְּרֶֽשֶׁת־ז֥וּ טָ֝מָ֗נוּ נִלְכְּדָ֥ה רַגְלָֽם׃
translations.english:
The nations sink in the pit they have made;
their own foot is caught in the net they have hidden.

translations.hebrew: נ֤וֹדַ֨ע ׀ יְהֹוָה֮ מִשְׁפָּ֢ט עָ֫שָׂ֥ה בְּפֹ֣עַל כַּ֭פָּיו נוֹקֵ֣שׁ רָשָׁ֑ע הִגָּי֥וֹן סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
The LORD has made Himself known:
He works judgment;
the wicked man is snared by his own devices. Higgaion.bMeaning of Heb. uncertain. Selah.

translations.hebrew: יָשׁ֣וּבוּ רְשָׁעִ֣ים לִשְׁא֑וֹלָה כׇּל־גּ֝וֹיִ֗ם שְׁכֵחֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
Let the wicked befOthers “return to.” in Sheol,
all the nations who ignore God!

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א לָ֭נֶצַח יִשָּׁכַ֣ח אֶבְי֑וֹן תִּקְוַ֥ת (ענוים) [עֲ֝נִיִּ֗ים] תֹּאבַ֥ד לָעַֽד׃
translations.english:
Not always shall the needy be ignored,
nor the hope of the afflicted forever lost.

translations.hebrew: קוּמָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אַל־יָעֹ֣ז אֱנ֑וֹשׁ יִשָּׁפְט֥וּ ג֝וֹיִ֗ם עַל־פָּנֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Rise, O LORD!
Let not men have power;
let the nations be judged in Your presence.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֘יתָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ מוֹרָ֗ה לָ֫הֶ֥ם יֵדְע֥וּ גוֹיִ֑ם אֱנ֖וֹשׁ הֵ֣מָּה סֶּֽלָה׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Strike fear into them,-b O LORD;
let the nations know they are only men. Selah.

translations.hebrew: לָמָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה תַּעֲמֹ֣ד בְּרָח֑וֹק תַּ֝עְלִ֗ים לְעִתּ֥וֹת בַּצָּרָֽה׃
translations.english:
Why, O LORD, do You stand aloof,
heedless in times of trouble?

translations.hebrew: בְּגַאֲוַ֣ת רָ֭שָׁע יִדְלַ֣ק עָנִ֑י יִתָּפְשׂ֓וּ ׀ בִּמְזִמּ֖וֹת ז֣וּ חָשָֽׁבוּ׃
translations.english:
The wicked in his arrogance hounds the lowly—
aOr “they (i.e., the lowly) are caught by the schemes they devised.”may they be caught in the schemes they devise! -a

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הִלֵּ֣ל רָ֭שָׁע עַל־תַּאֲוַ֣ת נַפְשׁ֑וֹ וּבֹצֵ֥עַ בֵּ֝רֵ֗ךְ נִ֘אֵ֥ץ <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.The wicked crows about his unbridled lusts;
the grasping man reviles and scorns the LORD.

translations.hebrew: רָשָׁ֗ע כְּגֹ֣בַהּ אַ֭פּוֹ בַּל־יִדְרֹ֑שׁ אֵ֥ין אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים כׇּל־מְזִמּוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
The wicked, arrogant as he is,
in all his scheming [thinks],-b
“He does not call to account;
cLit. “There is no God.”God does not care.”-c

translations.hebrew: יָ֘חִ֤ילוּ דְרָכָ֨ו ׀ בְּכׇל־עֵ֗ת מָר֣וֹם מִ֭שְׁפָּטֶיךָ מִנֶּגְדּ֑וֹ כׇּל־צ֝וֹרְרָ֗יו יָפִ֥יחַ בָּהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
His ways prosper at all times;
Your judgments are far beyond him;
he snorts at all his foes.

translations.hebrew: אָמַ֣ר בְּ֭לִבּוֹ בַּל־אֶמּ֑וֹט לְדֹ֥ר וָ֝דֹ֗ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־בְרָֽע׃
translations.english:
He thinks, “I shall not be shaken,
through all time never be in trouble.”

translations.hebrew: אָלָ֤ה ׀ פִּ֣יהוּ מָ֭לֵא וּמִרְמ֣וֹת וָתֹ֑ךְ תַּ֥חַת לְ֝שׁוֹנ֗וֹ עָמָ֥ל וָאָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
His mouth is full of oaths, deceit, and fraud;
mischief and evil are under his tongue.

translations.hebrew: יֵשֵׁ֤ב ׀ בְּמַאְרַ֬ב חֲצֵרִ֗ים בַּֽ֭מִּסְתָּרִים יַהֲרֹ֣ג נָקִ֑י עֵ֝ינָ֗יו לְֽחֵלְכָ֥ה יִצְפֹּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
He lurks in outlying places;
from a covert he slays the innocent;
his eyes spy out the hapless.

translations.hebrew: יֶאֱרֹ֬ב בַּמִּסְתָּ֨ר ׀ כְּאַרְיֵ֬ה בְסֻכֹּ֗ה יֶ֭אֱרֹב לַחֲט֣וֹף עָנִ֑י יַחְטֹ֥ף עָ֝נִ֗י בְּמׇשְׁכ֥וֹ בְרִשְׁתּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He waits in a covert like a lion in his lair;
waits to seize the lowly;
he seizes the lowly as he pulls his net shut;

translations.hebrew: (ודכה) [יִדְכֶּ֥ה] יָשֹׁ֑חַ וְנָפַ֥ל בַּ֝עֲצוּמָ֗יו (חלכאים) [חֵ֣ל כָּאִֽים]׃
translations.english:
he stoops, he crouches,
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.and the hapless fall prey to his might.-b

translations.hebrew: אָמַ֣ר בְּ֭לִבּוֹ שָׁ֣כַֽח אֵ֑ל הִסְתִּ֥יר פָּ֝נָ֗יו בַּל־רָאָ֥ה לָנֶֽצַח׃
translations.english:
He thinks, “God is not mindful,
He hides His face, He never looks.”

translations.hebrew: קוּמָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵ֭ל נְשָׂ֣א יָדֶ֑ךָ אַל־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח (עניים) [עֲנָוִֽים]׃
translations.english:
Rise, O LORD!
dLit. “Lift Your hand.”Strike at him,-d O God!
Do not forget the lowly.

translations.hebrew: עַל־מֶ֤ה ׀ נִאֵ֖ץ רָשָׁ֥ע ׀ אֱלֹהִ֑ים אָמַ֥ר בְּ֝לִבּ֗וֹ לֹ֣א תִדְרֹֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
Why should the wicked man scorn God,
thinking You do not call to account?

translations.hebrew: רָאִ֡תָה כִּי־אַתָּ֤ה ׀ עָ֘מָ֤ל וָכַ֨עַס ׀ תַּבִּיט֮ לָתֵ֢ת בְּיָ֫דֶ֥ךָ עָ֭לֶיךָ יַעֲזֹ֣ב חֵלֵ֑כָה יָ֝ת֗וֹם אַתָּ֤ה ׀ הָיִ֬יתָ עוֹזֵֽר׃
translations.english:
You do look!
You take note of mischief and vexation!
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.To requite is in Your power.-b
To You the hapless can entrust himself;
You have ever been the orphan’s help.

translations.hebrew: שְׁ֭בֹר זְר֣וֹעַ רָשָׁ֑ע וָ֝רָ֗ע תִּֽדְרוֹשׁ־רִשְׁע֥וֹ בַל־תִּמְצָֽא׃
translations.english:
O break the power of the wicked and evil man,
so that when You eA play on darash, which in vv. 4 and 13 means “to call to account.”look for-e his wickedness
You will find it no more.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה מֶ֭לֶךְ עוֹלָ֣ם וָעֶ֑ד אָבְד֥וּ ג֝וֹיִ֗ם מֵאַרְצֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The LORD is king for ever and ever;
the nations will perish from His land.

translations.hebrew: תַּאֲוַ֬ת עֲנָוִ֣ים שָׁמַ֣עְתָּ יְהֹוָ֑ה תָּכִ֥ין לִ֝בָּ֗ם תַּקְשִׁ֥יב אׇזְנֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
You will listen to the entreaty of the lowly, O LORD,
You will make their hearts firm;
You will incline Your ear

translations.hebrew: לִשְׁפֹּ֥ט יָת֗וֹם וָ֫דָ֥ךְ בַּל־יוֹסִ֥יף ע֑וֹד לַעֲרֹ֥ץ אֱ֝נ֗וֹשׁ מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
to champion the orphan and the downtrodden,
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.that men who are of the earth tyrannize no more.-b

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ לְדָ֫וִ֥ד בַּֽיהֹוָ֨ה ׀ חָסִ֗יתִי אֵ֭יךְ תֹּאמְר֣וּ לְנַפְשִׁ֑י (נודו) [נ֝֗וּדִי] הַרְכֶ֥ם צִפּֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
For the leader. Of David.

In the LORD I take refuge;
how can you say to me,
“Take to aMeaning of Heb. uncertain; lit. “your hill, bird!”the hills like a bird!-a

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י הִנֵּ֪ה הָרְשָׁעִ֡ים יִדְרְכ֬וּן קֶ֗שֶׁת כּוֹנְנ֣וּ חִצָּ֣ם עַל־יֶ֑תֶר לִיר֥וֹת בְּמוֹ־אֹ֝֗פֶל לְיִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
For see, the wicked bend the bow,
they set their arrow on the string
to shoot from the shadows at the upright.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י הַ֭שָּׁתוֹת יֵהָרֵס֑וּן צַ֝דִּ֗יק מַה־פָּעָֽל׃
translations.english:
bOr “For the foundations are destroyed; what has the Righteous One done?” Or “If the foundations are destroyed, what has the righteous man accomplished?”When the foundations are destroyed,
what can the righteous man do?”-b

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ בְּֽהֵ֘יכַ֤ל קׇדְשׁ֗וֹ יְהֹוָה֮ בַּשָּׁמַ֢יִם כִּ֫סְא֥וֹ עֵינָ֥יו יֶחֱז֑וּ עַפְעַפָּ֥יו יִ֝בְחֲנ֗וּ בְּנֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
The LORD is in His holy palace;
the LORD—His throne is in heaven;
His eyes behold, His gaze searches mankind.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָה֮ צַדִּ֢יק יִ֫בְחָ֥ן וְ֭רָשָׁע וְאֹהֵ֣ב חָמָ֑ס שָֽׂנְאָ֥ה נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
The LORD seeks out the righteous man,
but loathes the wicked one who loves injustice.

translations.hebrew: יַמְטֵ֥ר עַל־רְשָׁעִ֗ים פַּ֫חִ֥ים אֵ֣שׁ וְ֭גׇפְרִית וְר֥וּחַ זִלְעָפ֗וֹת מְנָ֣ת כּוֹסָֽם׃
translations.english:
He will rain down upon the wicked blazing coals and sulfur;
a scorching wind shall be cLit. “the portion of their cup.”their lot.-c

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־צַדִּ֣יק יְ֭הֹוָה צְדָק֣וֹת אָהֵ֑ב יָ֝שָׁ֗ר יֶחֱז֥וּ פָנֵֽימוֹ׃
translations.english:
For the LORD is righteous;
He loves righteous deeds;
the upright shall behold His face.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־הַשְּׁמִינִ֗ית מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader; on the sheminith. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: הוֹשִׁ֣יעָה יְ֭הֹוָה כִּֽי־גָמַ֣ר חָסִ֑יד כִּי־פַ֥סּוּ אֱ֝מוּנִ֗ים מִבְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
Help, O LORD!
For the faithful are no more;
the loyal have vanished from among men.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֤וְא ׀ יְֽדַבְּרוּ֮ אִ֤ישׁ אֶת־רֵ֫עֵ֥הוּ שְׂפַ֥ת חֲלָק֑וֹת בְּלֵ֖ב וָלֵ֣ב יְדַבֵּֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
Men speak lies to one another;
their speech is smooth;
they talk with duplicity.

translations.hebrew: יַכְרֵ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־שִׂפְתֵ֣י חֲלָק֑וֹת לָ֝שׁ֗וֹן מְדַבֶּ֥רֶת גְּדֹלֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
May the LORD cut off all flattering lips,
every tongue that speaks arrogance.

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָמְר֨וּ ׀ לִלְשֹׁנֵ֣נוּ נַ֭גְבִּיר שְׂפָתֵ֣ינוּ אִתָּ֑נוּ מִ֖י אָד֣וֹן לָֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
They say, “By our tongues we shall prevail;
with lips such as ours, who can be our master?”

translations.hebrew: מִשֹּׁ֥ד עֲנִיִּים֮ מֵאֶנְקַ֢ת אֶבְי֫וֹנִ֥ים עַתָּ֣ה אָ֭קוּם יֹאמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה אָשִׁ֥ית בְּ֝יֵ֗שַׁע יָפִ֥יחַֽ־לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
“Because of the groans of the plundered poor and needy,
I will now act,” says the LORD.
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.“I will give help,” He affirms to him.aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.

translations.hebrew: אִ֥מְר֣וֹת יְהֹוָה֮ אֲמָר֢וֹת טְהֹ֫ר֥וֹת כֶּ֣סֶף צָ֭רוּף בַּעֲלִ֣יל לָאָ֑רֶץ מְ֝זֻקָּ֗ק שִׁבְעָתָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
The words of the LORD are pure words,
silver purged in an earthen crucible,
refined sevenfold.

translations.hebrew: אַתָּֽה־יְהֹוָ֥ה תִּשְׁמְרֵ֑ם תִּצְּרֶ֓נּוּ ׀ מִן־הַדּ֖וֹר ז֣וּ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
You, O LORD, will keep them,
guarding each aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.from this age-a evermore.

translations.hebrew: סָבִ֗יב רְשָׁעִ֥ים יִתְהַלָּכ֑וּן כְּרֻ֥ם זֻ֝לּ֗וּת לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
On every side the wicked roam
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.when baseness is exalted among men.-a

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: עַד־אָ֣נָה יְ֭הֹוָה תִּשְׁכָּחֵ֣נִי נֶ֑צַח עַד־אָ֓נָה ׀ תַּסְתִּ֖יר אֶת־פָּנֶ֣יךָ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
How long, O LORD; will You ignore me forever?
How long will You hide Your face from me?

translations.hebrew: עַד־אָ֨נָה אָשִׁ֪ית עֵצ֡וֹת בְּנַפְשִׁ֗י יָג֣וֹן בִּלְבָבִ֣י יוֹמָ֑ם עַד־אָ֓נָה ׀ יָר֖וּם אֹיְבִ֣י עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
How long will I have cares on my mind,
grief in my heart all day?
How long will my enemy have the upper hand?

translations.hebrew: הַבִּ֣יטָֽה עֲ֭נֵנִי יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑י הָאִ֥ירָה עֵ֝ינַ֗י פֶּן־אִישַׁ֥ן הַמָּֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
Look at me, answer me, O LORD, my God!
Restore the luster to my eyes,
lest I sleep the sleep of death;

translations.hebrew: פֶּן־יֹאמַ֣ר אֹיְבִ֣י יְכׇלְתִּ֑יו צָרַ֥י יָ֝גִ֗ילוּ כִּ֣י אֶמּֽוֹט׃
translations.english:
lest my enemy say, “I have overcome him,”
my foes exult when I totter.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ בְּחַסְדְּךָ֣ בָטַחְתִּי֮ יָ֤גֵ֥ל לִבִּ֗י בִּישׁוּעָ֫תֶ֥ךָ אָשִׁ֥ירָה לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֖י גָמַ֣ל עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
But I trust in Your faithfulness,
my heart will exult in Your deliverance.
I will sing to the LORD,
for He has been good to me.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ לְדָ֫וִ֥ד אָ֘מַ֤ר נָבָ֣ל בְּ֭לִבּוֹ אֵ֣ין אֱלֹהִ֑ים הִֽשְׁחִ֗יתוּ הִֽתְעִ֥יבוּ עֲלִילָ֗ה אֵ֣ין עֹֽשֵׂה־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
aCf. Ps. 53.For the leader. Of David.

The benighted man thinks,
bLit. “There is no God”; cf. Ps. 10.4.“God does not care.”-b
Man’s deeds are corrupt and loathsome;
no one does good.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה מִשָּׁמַיִם֮ הִשְׁקִ֢יף עַֽל־בְּנֵי־אָ֫דָ֥ם לִ֭רְאוֹת הֲיֵ֣שׁ מַשְׂכִּ֑יל דֹּ֝רֵ֗שׁ אֶת־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
The LORD looks down from heaven on mankind
to find a man of understanding,
a man mindful of God.

translations.hebrew: הַכֹּ֥ל סָר֮ יַחְדָּ֢ו נֶ֫אֱלָ֥חוּ אֵ֤ין עֹֽשֵׂה־ט֑וֹב אֵ֝֗ין גַּם־אֶחָֽד׃
translations.english:
All have turned bad,
altogether foul;
there is none who does good,
not even one.

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹ֥א יָדְעוּ֮ כׇּל־פֹּ֢עֲלֵ֫י אָ֥וֶן אֹכְלֵ֣י עַ֭מִּי אָ֣כְלוּ לֶ֑חֶם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לֹ֣א קָרָֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
Are they so witless, all those evildoers,
who devour my people as they devour food,
and do not invoke the LORD?

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֤ם ׀ פָּ֣חֲדוּ פָ֑חַד כִּֽי־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים בְּד֣וֹר צַדִּֽיק׃
translations.english:
There they will be seized with fright,
for God is present in the circle of the righteous.

translations.hebrew: עֲצַת־עָנִ֥י תָבִ֑ישׁוּ כִּ֖י יְהֹוָ֣ה מַחְסֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
You may set at naught the counsel of the lowly,
but the LORD is his refuge.

translations.hebrew: מִ֥י־יִתֵּ֣ן מִצִּיּוֹן֮ יְשׁוּעַ֢ת יִשְׂרָ֫אֵ֥ל בְּשׁ֣וּב יְ֭הֹוָה שְׁב֣וּת עַמּ֑וֹ יָגֵ֥ל יַ֝עֲקֹ֗ב יִשְׂמַ֥ח יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
O that the deliverance of Israel might come from Zion!
When the LORD restores the fortunes of His people,
Jacob will exult, Israel will rejoice.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָ֫וִ֥ד יְ֭הֹוָה מִי־יָג֣וּר בְּאׇהֳלֶ֑ךָ מִֽי־יִ֝שְׁכֹּ֗ן בְּהַ֣ר קׇדְשֶֽׁךָ׃
translations.english:
A psalm of David.

LORD, who may sojourn in Your tent,
who may dwell on Your holy mountain?

translations.hebrew: הוֹלֵ֣ךְ תָּ֭מִים וּפֹעֵ֥ל צֶ֑דֶק וְדֹבֵ֥ר אֱ֝מֶ֗ת בִּלְבָבֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He who lives without blame,
who does what is right,
and in his heart acknowledges the truth;

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־רָגַ֨ל ׀ עַל־לְשֹׁנ֗וֹ לֹא־עָשָׂ֣ה לְרֵעֵ֣הוּ רָעָ֑ה וְ֝חֶרְפָּ֗ה לֹא־נָשָׂ֥א עַל־קְרֹבֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain; or “who has no slander upon his tongue.”whose tongue is not given to evil;-a
who has never done harm to his fellow,
or borne reproach for [his acts toward] his neighbor;

translations.hebrew: נִבְזֶ֤ה ׀ בְּֽעֵ֘ינָ֤יו נִמְאָ֗ס וְאֶת־יִרְאֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֣ה יְכַבֵּ֑ד נִשְׁבַּ֥ע לְ֝הָרַ֗ע וְלֹ֣א יָמִֽר׃
translations.english:
for whom a contemptible man is abhorrent,
but who honors those who fear the LORD;
who stands by his oath even to his hurt;

translations.hebrew: כַּסְפּ֤וֹ ׀ לֹא־נָתַ֣ן בְּנֶשֶׁךְ֮ וְשֹׁ֥חַד עַל־נָקִ֗י לֹ֥א־לָ֫קָ֥ח עֹֽשֵׂה־אֵ֑לֶּה לֹ֖א יִמּ֣וֹט לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
who has never lent money at interest,
or accepted a bribe against the innocent.
The man who acts thus shall never be shaken.

translations.hebrew: מִכְתָּ֥ם לְדָוִ֑ד שׇֽׁמְרֵ֥נִי אֵ֝֗ל כִּֽי־חָסִ֥יתִי בָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
A michtamaMeaning of Heb. uncertain. of David.

Protect me, O God, for I seek refuge in You.

translations.hebrew: אָמַ֣רְתְּ לַֽ֭יהֹוָה אֲדֹנָ֣י אָ֑תָּה ט֝וֹבָתִ֗י בַּל־עָלֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I say to the LORD,
“You are my Lord, bOthers “I have no good but in You.”my benefactor;
there is none above You.”-b

translations.hebrew: לִ֭קְדוֹשִׁים אֲשֶׁר־בָּאָ֣רֶץ הֵ֑מָּה וְ֝אַדִּירֵ֗י כׇּל־חֶפְצִי־בָֽם׃
translations.english:
cMeaning of Heb. uncertain; “holy and mighty ones” taken as epithets for divine beings; cf. qedoshim in Ps. 89.6, 8, and ’addirim in 1 Sam. 4.8.As to the holy and mighty ones that are in the land,
my whole desire concerning them is that

translations.hebrew: יִרְבּ֥וּ עַצְּבוֹתָם֮ אַחֵ֢ר מָ֫הָ֥רוּ בַּל־אַסִּ֣יךְ נִסְכֵּיהֶ֣ם מִדָּ֑ם וּֽבַל־אֶשָּׂ֥א אֶת־שְׁ֝מוֹתָ֗ם עַל־שְׂפָתָֽי׃
translations.english:
those who espouse another [god]
may have many sorrows!-c
I will have no part of their bloody libations;
their names will not pass my lips.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה מְנָת־חֶלְקִ֥י וְכוֹסִ֑י אַ֝תָּ֗ה תּוֹמִ֥יךְ גּוֹרָלִֽי׃
translations.english:
The LORD is my allotted share and portion;dLit. “cup.”
You control my fate.

translations.hebrew: חֲבָלִ֣ים נָֽפְלוּ־לִ֭י בַּנְּעִמִ֑ים אַף־נַ֝חֲלָ֗ת שָֽׁפְרָ֥ה עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
Delightful country has fallen to my lot;
lovely indeed is my estate.

translations.hebrew: אֲבָרֵ֗ךְ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְעָצָ֑נִי אַף־לֵ֝יל֗וֹת יִסְּר֥וּנִי כִלְיוֹתָֽי׃
translations.english:
I bless the LORD who has guided me;
my conscienceeLit. “kidneys.” admonishes me at night.

translations.hebrew: שִׁוִּ֬יתִי יְהֹוָ֣ה לְנֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִ֑יד כִּ֥י מִֽ֝ימִינִ֗י בַּל־אֶמּֽוֹט׃
translations.english:
I am ever mindful of the LORD’s presence;
He is at my right hand; I shall never be shaken.

translations.hebrew: לָכֵ֤ן ׀ שָׂמַ֣ח לִ֭בִּי וַיָּ֣גֶל כְּבוֹדִ֑י אַף־בְּ֝שָׂרִ֗י יִשְׁכֹּ֥ן לָבֶֽטַח׃
translations.english:
So my heart rejoices,
my whole being exults,
and my body rests secure.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־תַעֲזֹ֣ב נַפְשִׁ֣י לִשְׁא֑וֹל לֹֽא־תִתֵּ֥ן חֲ֝סִידְךָ֗ לִרְא֥וֹת שָֽׁחַת׃
translations.english:
For You will not abandon me to Sheol,
or let Your faithful one see the Pit.

translations.hebrew: תּֽוֹדִיעֵנִי֮ אֹ֤רַח חַ֫יִּ֥ים שֹׂ֣בַע שְׂ֭מָחוֹת אֶת־פָּנֶ֑יךָ נְעִמ֖וֹת בִּימִינְךָ֣ נֶֽצַח׃
translations.english:
You will teach me the path of life.
In Your presence is perfect joy;
delights are ever in Your right hand.

translations.hebrew: תְּפִלָּ֗ה לְדָ֫וִ֥ד שִׁמְעָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ צֶ֗דֶק הַקְשִׁ֥יבָה רִנָּתִ֗י הַאֲזִ֥ינָה תְפִלָּתִ֑י בְּ֝לֹ֗א שִׂפְתֵ֥י מִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
A prayer of David.

Hear, O LORD, what is just;
heed my cry, give ear to my prayer,
uttered without guile.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭לְּפָנֶיךָ מִשְׁפָּטִ֣י יֵצֵ֑א עֵ֝ינֶ֗יךָ תֶּחֱזֶ֥ינָה מֵישָׁרִֽים׃
translations.english:
My vindication will come from You;
Your eyes will behold what is right.

translations.hebrew: בָּ֘חַ֤נְתָּ לִבִּ֨י ׀ פָּ֘קַ֤דְתָּ לַּ֗יְלָה צְרַפְתַּ֥נִי בַל־תִּמְצָ֑א זַ֝מֹּתִ֗י בַּל־יַעֲבׇר־פִּֽי׃
translations.english:
You have visited me at night, probed my mind,
You have tested me and found nothing amiss;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.I determined that my mouth should not transgress.

translations.hebrew: לִפְעֻלּ֣וֹת אָ֭דָם בִּדְבַ֣ר שְׂפָתֶ֑יךָ אֲנִ֥י שָׁ֝מַ֗רְתִּי אׇרְח֥וֹת פָּרִֽיץ׃
translations.english:
As for man’s dealings,
in accord with the command of Your lips,-a
I have kept in view the fatebCf. Prov. 1.19; lit. “paths.” of the lawless.

translations.hebrew: תָּמֹ֣ךְ אֲ֭שֻׁרַי בְּמַעְגְּלוֹתֶ֑יךָ בַּל־נָמ֥וֹטּוּ פְעָמָֽי׃
translations.english:
My feet have held to Your paths;
my legs have not given way.

translations.hebrew: אֲנִֽי־קְרָאתִ֣יךָ כִֽי־תַעֲנֵ֣נִי אֵ֑ל הַֽט־אׇזְנְךָ֥ לִ֝֗י שְׁמַ֣ע אִמְרָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
I call on You;
You will answer me, God;
turn Your ear to me,
hear what I say.

translations.hebrew: הַפְלֵ֣ה חֲ֭סָדֶיךָ מוֹשִׁ֣יעַ חוֹסִ֑ים מִ֝מִּתְקוֹמְמִ֗ים בִּֽימִינֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Display Your faithfulness in wondrous deeds,
You who deliver with Your right hand
those who seek refuge from assailants.

translations.hebrew: שׇׁ֭מְרֵנִי כְּאִישׁ֣וֹן בַּת־עָ֑יִן בְּצֵ֥ל כְּ֝נָפֶ֗יךָ תַּסְתִּירֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Guard me like the apple of Your eye;
hide me in the shadow of Your wings

translations.hebrew: מִפְּנֵ֣י רְ֭שָׁעִים ז֣וּ שַׁדּ֑וּנִי אֹיְבַ֥י בְּ֝נֶ֗פֶשׁ יַקִּ֥יפוּ עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
from the wicked who despoil me,
cOr “from my enemies who avidly.”my mortal enemies who-c encircle me.

translations.hebrew: חֶלְבָּ֥מוֹ סָּגְר֑וּ פִּ֝֗ימוֹ דִּבְּר֥וּ בְגֵאֽוּת׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Their hearts are closed to pity;-a
they mouth arrogance;

translations.hebrew: אַ֭שֻּׁרֵינוּ עַתָּ֣ה (סבבוני) [סְבָב֑וּנוּ] עֵינֵיהֶ֥ם יָ֝שִׁ֗יתוּ לִנְט֥וֹת בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
now they hem in our feet on every side;
they set their eyes roaming over the land.

translations.hebrew: דִּמְיֹנ֗וֹ כְּ֭אַרְיֵה יִכְס֣וֹף לִטְרֹ֑ף וְ֝כִכְפִ֗יר יֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּמִסְתָּרִֽים׃
translations.english:
He is like a lion eager for prey,
a king of beasts lying in wait.

translations.hebrew: קוּמָ֤ה יְהֹוָ֗ה קַדְּמָ֣ה פָ֭נָיו הַכְרִיעֵ֑הוּ פַּלְּטָ֥ה נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י מֵרָשָׁ֥ע חַרְבֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Rise, O LORD! Go forth to meet him.
Bring him down;
rescue me from the wicked with Your sword,

translations.hebrew: מִ֥מְתִֽים־יָדְךָ֨ ׀ יְהֹוָ֡ה מִֽמְתִ֬ים מֵחֶ֗לֶד חֶלְקָ֥ם בַּֽחַיִּים֮ (וצפינך) [וּֽצְפוּנְךָ֮] תְּמַלֵּ֢א בִ֫טְנָ֥ם יִשְׂבְּע֥וּ בָנִ֑ים וְהִנִּ֥יחוּ יִ֝תְרָ֗ם לְעוֹלְלֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.from men, O LORD, with Your hand,
from men whose share in life is fleeting.
But as to Your treasured ones,
fill their bellies.-a
Their sons too shall be satisfied,
and have something to leave over for their young.

translations.hebrew: אֲנִ֗י בְּ֭צֶדֶק אֶחֱזֶ֣ה פָנֶ֑יךָ אֶשְׂבְּעָ֥ה בְ֝הָקִ֗יץ תְּמוּנָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Then I, justified, will behold Your face;
awake, I am filled with the vision of You.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֤חַ ׀ לְעֶ֥בֶד יְהֹוָ֗ה לְדָ֫וִ֥ד אֲשֶׁ֤ר דִּבֶּ֨ר ׀ לַיהֹוָ֗ה אֶת־דִּ֭בְרֵי הַשִּׁירָ֣ה הַזֹּ֑את בְּי֤וֹם הִֽצִּיל־יְהֹוָ֘ה־אוֹת֥וֹ מִכַּ֥ף כׇּל־אֹ֝יְבָ֗יו וּמִיַּ֥ד שָׁאֽוּל׃
translations.english: aThis poem occurs again at 2 Sam. 22, with a number of variations, some of which are cited in the following notes.For the leader. Of David, the servant of the LORD, who addressed the words of this song to the LORD after the LORD had saved him from the hands of all his enemies and from the clutches of Saul.

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֡ר אֶרְחׇמְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה חִזְקִֽי׃
translations.english:
He said:
bNot in 2 Sam. 22.2.I adore you, O LORD, my strength,-b

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ סַ֥לְעִ֥י וּמְצוּדָתִ֗י וּמְפַ֫לְטִ֥י אֵלִ֣י צ֭וּרִי אֶֽחֱסֶה־בּ֑וֹ מָֽגִנִּ֥י וְקֶֽרֶן־יִ֝שְׁעִ֗י מִשְׂגַּבִּֽי׃
translations.english:
O LORD, my crag, my fortress, my rescuer,
my God, my rock in whom I seek refuge,
my shield, my cLit. “horn of rescue.”mighty champion,-c my haven.

translations.hebrew: מְ֭הֻלָּל אֶקְרָ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמִן־אֹ֝יְבַ֗י אִוָּשֵֽׁעַ׃
translations.english:
dConstruction of Heb. uncertain.All praise! I called on the LORD-d
and was delivered from my enemies.

translations.hebrew: אֲפָפ֥וּנִי חֶבְלֵי־מָ֑וֶת וְֽנַחֲלֵ֖י בְלִיַּ֣עַל יְבַֽעֲתֽוּנִי׃
translations.english:
Ropese2 Sam. 22.5, “breakers.” of Death encompassed me;
torrents of BelialfI.e., the netherworld, like “Death” and “Sheol.” terrified me;

translations.hebrew: חֶבְלֵ֣י שְׁא֣וֹל סְבָב֑וּנִי קִ֝דְּמ֗וּנִי מ֣וֹקְשֵׁי מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
ropes of Sheol encircled me;
snares of Death confronted me.

translations.hebrew: בַּצַּר־לִ֤י ׀ אֶ֥קְרָ֣א יְהֹוָה֮ וְאֶל־אֱלֹהַ֢י אֲשַׁ֫וֵּ֥עַ יִשְׁמַ֣ע מֵהֵיכָל֣וֹ קוֹלִ֑י וְ֝שַׁוְעָתִ֗י לְפָנָ֤יו ׀ תָּב֬וֹא בְאׇזְנָֽיו׃
translations.english:
In my distress I called on the LORD,
cried out to my God;
in His temple He heard my voice;
my cry to Him reached His ears.

translations.hebrew: וַתִּגְעַ֬שׁ וַתִּרְעַ֨שׁ ׀ הָאָ֗רֶץ וּמוֹסְדֵ֣י הָרִ֣ים יִרְגָּ֑זוּ וַ֝יִּתְגָּֽעֲשׁ֗וּ כִּי־חָ֥רָה לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Then the earth rocked and quaked;
the foundations of the mountains shook,
rocked by His indignation;

translations.hebrew: עָ֘לָ֤ה עָשָׁ֨ן ׀ בְּאַפּ֗וֹ וְאֵשׁ־מִפִּ֥יו תֹּאכֵ֑ל גֶּ֝חָלִ֗ים בָּעֲר֥וּ מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
smoke went up from His nostrils,
from His mouth came devouring fire;
live coals blazed forth from Him.

translations.hebrew: וַיֵּ֣ט שָׁ֭מַיִם וַיֵּרַ֑ד וַ֝עֲרָפֶ֗ל תַּ֣חַת רַגְלָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He bent the sky and came down,
thick cloud beneath His feet.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּרְכַּ֣ב עַל־כְּ֭רוּב וַיָּעֹ֑ף וַ֝יֵּ֗דֶא עַל־כַּנְפֵי־רֽוּחַ׃
translations.english:
He mounted a cherub and flew,
gliding on the wings of the wind.

translations.hebrew: יָ֤שֶׁת־חֹ֨שֶׁךְ ׀ סִתְר֗וֹ סְבִֽיבוֹתָ֥יו סֻכָּת֑וֹ חֶשְׁכַת־מַ֝֗יִם עָבֵ֥י שְׁחָקִֽים׃
translations.english:
He made darkness His screen;
dark thunderheads, dense clouds of the sky
were His pavilion round about Him.

translations.hebrew: מִנֹּ֗גַהּ נֶ֫גְדּ֥וֹ עָבָ֥יו עָבְר֑וּ בָּ֝רָ֗ד וְגַֽחֲלֵי־אֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
Out of the brilliance before Him,
hail and fiery coals g2 Sam. 22.13, “blazed.”pierced His clouds.-g

translations.hebrew: וַיַּרְעֵ֬ם בַּשָּׁמַ֨יִם ׀ יְֽהֹוָ֗ה וְ֭עֶלְיוֹן יִתֵּ֣ן קֹל֑וֹ בָּ֝רָ֗ד וְגַֽחֲלֵי־אֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
Then the LORD thundered from heaven,
the Most High gave forth His voice—
hNot in 2 Sam. 22.14.hail and fiery coals.-h

translations.hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח חִ֭צָּיו וַיְפִיצֵ֑ם וּבְרָקִ֥ים רָ֝֗ב וַיְהֻמֵּֽם׃
translations.english:
He let fly His shafts and scattered them;
He discharged lightning and routed them.

translations.hebrew: וַיֵּ֤רָא֨וּ ׀ אֲפִ֥יקֵי מַ֗יִם וַֽיִּגָּלוּ֮ מוֹסְד֢וֹת תֵּ֫בֵ֥ל מִגַּעֲרָ֣תְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֑ה מִ֝נִּשְׁמַ֗ת ר֣וּחַ אַפֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
The ocean bed was exposed;
the foundations of the world were laid bare
by Your mighty roaring, O LORD,
at the blast of the breath of Your nostrils.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׁלַ֣ח מִ֭מָּרוֹם יִקָּחֵ֑נִי יַֽ֝מְשֵׁ֗נִי מִמַּ֥יִם רַבִּֽים׃
translations.english:
He reached down from on high, He took me;
He drew me out of the mighty waters;

translations.hebrew: יַצִּילֵ֗נִי מֵאֹיְבִ֥י עָ֑ז וּ֝מִשֹּׂנְאַ֗י כִּֽי־אָמְצ֥וּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
He saved me from my fierce enemy,
from foes too strong for me.

translations.hebrew: יְקַדְּמ֥וּנִי בְיוֹם־אֵידִ֑י וַֽיְהִי־יְהֹוָ֖ה לְמִשְׁעָ֣ן לִֽי׃
translations.english:
They confronted me on the day of my calamity,
but the LORD was my support.

translations.hebrew: וַיּוֹצִיאֵ֥נִי לַמֶּרְחָ֑ב יְ֝חַלְּצֵ֗נִי כִּ֘י־חָ֥פֵֽץ־בִּֽי׃
translations.english:
He brought me out to freedom;
He rescued me because He was pleased with me.

translations.hebrew: יִגְמְלֵ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֣ה כְּצִדְקִ֑י כְּבֹ֥ר יָ֝דַ֗י יָשִׁ֥יב לִֽי׃
translations.english:
The LORD rewarded me according to my merit;
He requited the cleanness of my hands;

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־שָׁ֭מַרְתִּי דַּרְכֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־רָ֝שַׁ֗עְתִּי מֵאֱלֹהָֽי׃
translations.english:
for I have kept to the ways of the LORD,
and have not been guilty before my God;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י כׇל־מִשְׁפָּטָ֣יו לְנֶגְדִּ֑י וְ֝חֻקֹּתָ֗יו לֹא־אָסִ֥יר מֶֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
for I am mindful of all His rules;
I have not disregarded His laws.

translations.hebrew: וָאֱהִ֣י תָמִ֣ים עִמּ֑וֹ וָ֝אֶשְׁתַּמֵּ֗ר מֵעֲוֺנִֽי׃
translations.english:
I have been blameless toward Him,
and have guarded myself against sinning;

translations.hebrew: וַיָּֽשֶׁב־יְהֹוָ֣ה לִ֣י כְצִדְקִ֑י כְּבֹ֥ר יָ֝דַ֗י לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינָֽיו׃
translations.english:
and the LORD has requited me according to my merit,
the cleanness of my hands in His sight.

translations.hebrew: עִם־חָסִ֥יד תִּתְחַסָּ֑ד עִם־גְּבַ֥ר תָּ֝מִ֗ים תִּתַּמָּֽם׃
translations.english:
With the loyal, You deal loyally;
with the blameless man, blamelessly.

translations.hebrew: עִם־נָבָ֥ר תִּתְבָּרָ֑ר וְעִם־עִ֝קֵּ֗שׁ תִּתְפַּתָּֽל׃
translations.english:
With the pure, You act purely,
and with the perverse, You are wily.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אַ֭תָּה עַם־עָנִ֣י תוֹשִׁ֑יעַ וְעֵינַ֖יִם רָמ֣וֹת תַּשְׁפִּֽיל׃
translations.english:
It is You who deliver lowly folk,
but haughty eyes You humble.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אַ֭תָּה תָּאִ֣יר נֵרִ֑י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י יַגִּ֥יהַּ חׇשְׁכִּֽי׃
translations.english:
It is You who light my lamp;
the LORD, my God, lights up my darkness.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־בְ֭ךָ אָרֻ֣ץ גְּד֑וּד וּ֝בֵֽאלֹהַ֗י אֲדַלֶּג־שֽׁוּר׃
translations.english:
With You, I can rush a barrier;iCf. note to 2 Sam. 22.30; or “troop.”
with my God I can scale a wall;

translations.hebrew: הָאֵל֮ תָּמִ֢ים דַּ֫רְכּ֥וֹ אִמְרַֽת־יְהֹוָ֥ה צְרוּפָ֑ה מָגֵ֥ן ה֝֗וּא לְכֹ֤ל ׀ הַחֹסִ֬ים בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
the way of God is perfect;
the word of the LORD is pure;
He is a shield to all who seek refuge in Him.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י מִ֣י אֱ֭לוֹהַּ מִבַּלְעֲדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמִ֥י צ֝֗וּר זוּלָתִ֥י אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
Truly, who is a god except the LORD,
who is a rock but our God?—

translations.hebrew: הָ֭אֵל הַמְאַזְּרֵ֣נִי חָ֑יִל וַיִּתֵּ֖ן תָּמִ֣ים דַּרְכִּֽי׃
translations.english:
the God who girded me with might,
who made my way perfect;

translations.hebrew: מְשַׁוֶּ֣ה רַ֭גְלַי כָּאַיָּל֑וֹת וְעַ֥ל בָּ֝מֹתַ֗י יַעֲמִידֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
who made my legs like a deer’s,
and let me stand firm on thejTaking bamothai as a poetic form of bamoth; cf. Hab. 3.19; others “my.” heights;

translations.hebrew: מְלַמֵּ֣ד יָ֭דַי לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וְֽנִחֲתָ֥ה קֶֽשֶׁת־נְ֝חוּשָׁ֗ה זְרוֹעֹתָֽי׃
translations.english:
who trained my hands for battle;
my arms can bend a bow of bronze.

translations.hebrew: וַתִּתֶּן־לִי֮ מָגֵ֢ן יִ֫שְׁעֶ֥ךָ וִֽימִינְךָ֥ תִסְעָדֵ֑נִי וְֽעַנְוַתְךָ֥ תַרְבֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
You have given me the shield of Your protection;
Your right hand has sustained me,
Your carekMeaning of Heb. uncertain; others “condescension.” has made me great.

translations.hebrew: תַּרְחִ֣יב צַעֲדִ֣י תַחְתָּ֑י וְלֹ֥א מָ֝עֲד֗וּ קַרְסֻלָּֽי׃
translations.english:
You have let me stride on freely;
my feet have not slipped.

translations.hebrew: אֶרְדּ֣וֹף א֭וֹיְבַי וְאַשִּׂיגֵ֑ם וְלֹֽא־אָ֝שׁ֗וּב עַד־כַּלּוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
I pursued my enemies and overtook them;
I did not turn back till I destroyed them.

translations.hebrew: אֶ֭מְחָצֵם וְלֹא־יֻ֣כְלוּ ק֑וּם יִ֝פְּל֗וּ תַּ֣חַת רַגְלָֽי׃
translations.english:
I struck them down,
and they could rise no more;
they lay fallen at my feet.

translations.hebrew: וַתְּאַזְּרֵ֣נִי חַ֭יִל לַמִּלְחָמָ֑ה תַּכְרִ֖יעַ קָמַ֣י תַּחְתָּֽי׃
translations.english:
You have girded me with strength for battle,
brought my adversaries low before me,

translations.hebrew: וְֽאֹיְבַ֗י נָתַ֣תָּה לִּ֣י עֹ֑רֶף וּ֝מְשַׂנְאַ֗י אַצְמִיתֵֽם׃
translations.english:
made my enemies turn tail before me;
I wiped out my foes.

translations.hebrew: יְשַׁוְּע֥וּ וְאֵין־מוֹשִׁ֑יעַ עַל־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וְלֹ֣א עָנָֽם׃
translations.english:
They cried out, but there was none to deliver;
[cried] to the LORD, but He did not answer them.

translations.hebrew: וְֽאֶשְׁחָקֵ֗ם כְּעָפָ֥ר עַל־פְּנֵי־ר֑וּחַ כְּטִ֖יט חוּצ֣וֹת אֲרִיקֵֽם׃
translations.english:
I ground them fine as windswept dust;
I trod them flat as dirt of the streets.

translations.hebrew: תְּפַלְּטֵנִי֮ מֵרִ֢יבֵ֫י עָ֥ם תְּ֭שִׂימֵנִי לְרֹ֣אשׁ גּוֹיִ֑ם עַ֖ם לֹא־יָדַ֣עְתִּי יַֽעַבְדֽוּנִי׃
translations.english:
You have rescued me from the strife of people;
You have set me at the head of nations;
peoples I knew not must serve me.

translations.hebrew: לְשֵׁ֣מַֽע אֹ֭זֶן יִשָּׁ֣מְעוּ לִ֑י בְּנֵֽי־נֵ֝כָ֗ר יְכַחֲשׁוּ־לִֽי׃
translations.english:
At the mere report of me they are submissive;
foreign peoples cower before me;

translations.hebrew: בְּנֵי־נֵכָ֥ר יִבֹּ֑לוּ וְ֝יַחְרְג֗וּ מִֽמִּסְגְּרֽוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
foreign peoples lose courage,
lMeaning of Heb. uncertain.and come trembling out of their strongholds.-l

translations.hebrew: חַי־יְ֭הֹוָה וּבָר֣וּךְ צוּרִ֑י וְ֝יָר֗וּם אֱלוֹהֵ֥י יִשְׁעִֽי׃
translations.english:
The LORD lives! Blessed is my rock!
Exalted be God, my deliverer,

translations.hebrew: הָאֵ֗ל הַנּוֹתֵ֣ן נְקָמ֣וֹת לִ֑י וַיַּדְבֵּ֖ר עַמִּ֣ים תַּחְתָּֽי׃
translations.english:
the God who has vindicated me
and made peoples subject to me,

translations.hebrew: מְפַלְּטִ֗י מֵאֹ֫יְבָ֥י אַ֣ף מִן־קָ֭מַי תְּרוֹמְמֵ֑נִי מֵאִ֥ישׁ חָ֝מָ֗ס תַּצִּילֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
who rescued me from my enemies,
who raised me clear of my adversaries,
saved me from lawless men.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֤ן ׀ אוֹדְךָ֖ בַגּוֹיִ֥ם ׀ יְהֹוָ֑ה וּלְשִׁמְךָ֥ אֲזַמֵּֽרָה׃
translations.english:
For this I sing Your praise among the nations, LORD,
and hymn Your name:

translations.hebrew: מַגְדִּל֮ יְשׁוּע֢וֹת מַ֫לְכּ֥וֹ וְעֹ֤שֶׂה חֶ֨סֶד ׀ לִמְשִׁיח֗וֹ לְדָוִ֥ד וּלְזַרְע֗וֹ עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
m2 Sam. 22.51, “Tower of victory.”He accords great victories-m to His king,
keeps faith with His anointed,
with David and his offspring forever.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: הַשָּׁמַ֗יִם מְֽסַפְּרִ֥ים כְּבֽוֹד־אֵ֑ל וּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָ֝דָ֗יו מַגִּ֥יד הָרָקִֽיעַ׃
translations.english:
The heavens declare the glory of God,
the sky proclaims His handiwork.

translations.hebrew: י֣וֹם לְ֭יוֹם יַבִּ֣יעַֽ אֹ֑מֶר וְלַ֥יְלָה לְּ֝לַ֗יְלָה יְחַוֶּה־דָּֽעַת׃
translations.english:
Day to day makes utterance,
night to night speaks out.

translations.hebrew: אֵֽין־אֹ֭מֶר וְאֵ֣ין דְּבָרִ֑ים בְּ֝לִ֗י נִשְׁמָ֥ע קוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
There is no utterance,
there are no words,
aWith Septuagint, Symmachus, and Vulgate; or “their sound is not heard.”whose sound goes unheard.-a

translations.hebrew: בְּכׇל־הָאָ֨רֶץ ׀ יָ֘צָ֤א קַוָּ֗ם וּבִקְצֵ֣ה תֵ֭בֵל מִלֵּיהֶ֑ם לַ֝שֶּׁ֗מֶשׁ שָֽׂם־אֹ֥הֶל בָּהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Their voicebCf. Septuagint, Symmachus, and Vulgate; Arabic qawwah, “to shout.” carries throughout the earth,
their words to the end of the world.
He placed in themcViz., the heavens. a tent for the sun,

translations.hebrew: וְה֗וּא כְּ֭חָתָן יֹצֵ֣א מֵחֻפָּת֑וֹ יָשִׂ֥ישׂ כְּ֝גִבּ֗וֹר לָר֥וּץ אֹֽרַח׃
translations.english:
who is like a groom coming forth from the chamber,
like a hero, eager to run his course.

translations.hebrew: מִקְצֵ֤ה הַשָּׁמַ֨יִם ׀ מֽוֹצָא֗וֹ וּתְקוּפָת֥וֹ עַל־קְצוֹתָ֑ם וְאֵ֥ין נִ֝סְתָּ֗ר מֵחַמָּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
His rising-place is at one end of heaven,
and his circuit reaches the other;
nothing escapes his heat.

translations.hebrew: תּ֘וֹרַ֤ת יְהֹוָ֣ה תְּ֭מִימָה מְשִׁ֣יבַת נָ֑פֶשׁ עֵד֥וּת יְהֹוָ֥ה נֶ֝אֱמָנָ֗ה מַחְכִּ֥ימַת פֶּֽתִי׃
translations.english:
The teaching of the LORD is perfect,
renewing life;
the decrees of the LORD are enduring,
making the simple wise;

translations.hebrew: פִּקּ֘וּדֵ֤י יְהֹוָ֣ה יְ֭שָׁרִים מְשַׂמְּחֵי־לֵ֑ב מִצְוַ֥ת יְהֹוָ֥ה בָּ֝רָ֗ה מְאִירַ֥ת עֵינָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
The precepts of the LORD are just,
rejoicing the heart;
the instruction of the LORD is lucid,
making the eyes light up.

translations.hebrew: יִרְאַ֤ת יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ טְהוֹרָה֮ עוֹמֶ֢דֶת לָ֫עַ֥ד מִֽשְׁפְּטֵי־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱמֶ֑ת צָֽדְק֥וּ יַחְדָּֽו׃
translations.english:
The fear of the LORD is pure,
abiding forever;
the judgments of the LORD are true,
righteous altogether,

translations.hebrew: הַֽנֶּחֱמָדִ֗ים מִ֭זָּהָב וּמִפַּ֣ז רָ֑ב וּמְתוּקִ֥ים מִ֝דְּבַ֗שׁ וְנֹ֣פֶת צוּפִֽים׃
translations.english:
more desirable than gold,
than much fine gold;
sweeter than honey,
than drippings of the comb.

translations.hebrew: גַּֽם־עַ֭בְדְּךָ נִזְהָ֣ר בָּהֶ֑ם בְּ֝שׇׁמְרָ֗ם עֵ֣קֶב רָֽב׃
translations.english:
Your servant pays them heed;
in obeying them there is much reward.

translations.hebrew: שְׁגִיא֥וֹת מִֽי־יָבִ֑ין מִֽנִּסְתָּר֥וֹת נַקֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Who can be aware of errors?
Clear me of unperceived guilt,

translations.hebrew: גַּ֤ם מִזֵּדִ֨ים ׀ חֲשֹׂ֬ךְ עַבְדֶּ֗ךָ אַֽל־יִמְשְׁלוּ־בִ֣י אָ֣ז אֵיתָ֑ם וְ֝נִקֵּ֗יתִי מִפֶּ֥שַֽׁע רָֽב׃
translations.english:
and from dOr “arrogant men”; cf. Ps. 119.51.willful sins-d keep Your servant;
let them not dominate me;
then shall I be blameless
and clear of grave offense.

translations.hebrew: יִ֥הְיֽוּ־לְרָצ֨וֹן ׀ אִמְרֵי־פִ֡י וְהֶגְי֣וֹן לִבִּ֣י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה צוּרִ֥י וְגֹאֲלִֽי׃
translations.english:
May the words of my mouth
and the prayer of my hearteFor leb as a source of speech, see note to Eccl. 5.1.
be acceptable to You,
O LORD, my rock and my redeemer.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: יַֽעַנְךָ֣ יְ֭הֹוָה בְּי֣וֹם צָרָ֑ה יְ֝שַׂגֶּבְךָ֗ שֵׁ֤ם ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֬י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
May the LORD answer you in time of trouble,
the name of Jacob’s God keep you safe.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׁלַֽח־עֶזְרְךָ֥ מִקֹּ֑דֶשׁ וּ֝מִצִּיּ֗וֹן יִסְעָדֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
May He send you help from the sanctuary,
and sustain you from Zion.

translations.hebrew: יִזְכֹּ֥ר כׇּל־מִנְחֹתֶ֑ךָ וְעוֹלָתְךָ֖ יְדַשְּׁנֶ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
May He receive the tokensaReference to azkara, “token portion” of meal offering; Lev. 2.2, 9, 16, etc. of all your meal offerings,
and approvebMeaning of Heb. uncertain. your burnt offerings. Selah.

translations.hebrew: יִֽתֶּן־לְךָ֥ כִלְבָבֶ֑ךָ וְֽכׇל־עֲצָתְךָ֥ יְמַלֵּֽא׃
translations.english:
May He grant you your desire,
and fulfill your every plan.

translations.hebrew: נְרַנְּנָ֤ה ׀ בִּ֘ישׁ֤וּעָתֶ֗ךָ וּבְשֵֽׁם־אֱלֹהֵ֥ינוּ נִדְגֹּ֑ל יְמַלֵּ֥א יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־מִשְׁאֲלוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
May we shout for joy in your victory,
arrayed by standards in the name of our God.
May the LORD fulfill your every wish.

translations.hebrew: עַתָּ֤ה יָדַ֗עְתִּי כִּ֤י הוֹשִׁ֥יעַ <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֗ה מְשִׁ֫יח֥וֹ יַ֭עֲנֵהוּ מִשְּׁמֵ֣י קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ בִּ֝גְבֻר֗וֹת יֵ֣שַׁע יְמִינֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Now I know that the LORD will give victory to His anointed,
will answer him from His heavenly sanctuary
with the mighty victories of His right arm.

translations.hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה בָ֭רֶכֶב וְאֵ֣לֶּה בַסּוּסִ֑ים וַאֲנַ֓חְנוּ ׀ בְּשֵׁם־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣ינוּ נַזְכִּֽיר׃
translations.english:
They [call] on chariots, they [call] on horses,
but we call on the name of the LORD our God.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֭מָּה כָּרְע֣וּ וְנָפָ֑לוּ וַאֲנַ֥חְנוּ קַּ֝֗מְנוּ וַנִּתְעוֹדָֽד׃
translations.english:
They collapse and lie fallen,
but we rally and gather strength.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה הוֹשִׁ֑יעָה הַ֝מֶּ֗לֶךְ יַעֲנֵ֥נוּ בְיוֹם־קׇרְאֵֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
cOr in the light of v. 7, “O Lord, grant victory to the king; may He answer us when we call.”O LORD, grant victory!
May the King answer us when we call.-c

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בְּעׇזְּךָ֥ יִשְׂמַח־מֶ֑לֶךְ וּ֝בִישׁ֥וּעָתְךָ֗ מַה־[יָּ֥גֶל] (יגיל) מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
O LORD, the king rejoices in Your strength;
how greatly he exults in Your victory!

translations.hebrew: תַּאֲוַ֣ת לִ֭בּוֹ נָתַ֣תָּה לּ֑וֹ וַאֲרֶ֥שֶׁת שְׂ֝פָתָ֗יו בַּל־מָנַ֥עְתָּ סֶּֽלָה׃
translations.english:
You have granted him the desire of his heart,
have not denied the request of his lips. Selah.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־תְ֭קַדְּמֶנּוּ בִּרְכ֣וֹת ט֑וֹב תָּשִׁ֥ית לְ֝רֹאשׁ֗וֹ עֲטֶ֣רֶת פָּֽז׃
translations.english:
You have proffered him blessings of good things,
have set upon his head a crown of fine gold.

translations.hebrew: חַיִּ֤ים ׀ שָׁאַ֣ל מִ֭מְּךָ נָתַ֣תָּה לּ֑וֹ אֹ֥רֶךְ יָ֝מִ֗ים עוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
translations.english:
He asked You for life; You granted it;
a long life, everlasting.

translations.hebrew: גָּד֣וֹל כְּ֭בוֹדוֹ בִּישׁוּעָתֶ֑ךָ ה֥וֹד וְ֝הָדָ֗ר תְּשַׁוֶּ֥ה עָלָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Great is his glory through Your victory;
You have endowed him with splendor and majesty.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־תְשִׁיתֵ֣הוּ בְרָכ֣וֹת לָעַ֑ד תְּחַדֵּ֥הוּ בְ֝שִׂמְחָ֗ה אֶת־פָּנֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
You have made him blessed forever,
gladdened him with the joy of Your presence.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הַ֭מֶּלֶךְ בֹּטֵ֣חַ בַּיהֹוָ֑ה וּבְחֶ֥סֶד עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן בַּל־יִמּֽוֹט׃
translations.english:
For the king trusts in the LORD;
Through the faithfulness of the Most High
he will not be shaken.

translations.hebrew: תִּמְצָ֣א יָ֭דְךָ לְכׇל־אֹיְבֶ֑יךָ יְ֝מִֽינְךָ֗ תִּמְצָ֥א שֹׂנְאֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Your hand is equal to all Your enemies;
Your right hand overpowers Your foes.

translations.hebrew: תְּשִׁיתֵ֤מוֹ ׀ כְּתַנּ֥וּר אֵשׁ֮ לְעֵ֢ת פָּ֫נֶ֥יךָ יְ֭הֹוָה בְּאַפּ֣וֹ יְבַלְּעֵ֑ם וְֽתֹאכְלֵ֥ם אֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
You set them ablaze like a furnace
aOr “at the time of Your anger.”when You show Your presence.-a
The LORD in anger destroys them;
fire consumes them.

translations.hebrew: פִּ֭רְיָמוֹ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ תְּאַבֵּ֑ד וְ֝זַרְעָ֗ם מִבְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
You wipe their offspring from the earth,
their issue from among men.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־נָט֣וּ עָלֶ֣יךָ רָעָ֑ה חָֽשְׁב֥וּ מְ֝זִמָּ֗ה בַּל־יוּכָֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
For they schemed against You;
they laid plans,
but could not succeed.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭י תְּשִׁיתֵ֣מוֹ שֶׁ֑כֶם בְּ֝מֵֽיתָרֶ֗יךָ תְּכוֹנֵ֥ן עַל־פְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.For You make them turn back-b
by Your bows aimed at their face.

translations.hebrew: ר֣וּמָה יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּעֻזֶּ֑ךָ נָשִׁ֥ירָה וּֽ֝נְזַמְּרָ֗ה גְּבוּרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Be exalted, O LORD, through Your strength;
we will sing and chant the praises of Your mighty deeds.

translations.hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ עַל־אַיֶּ֥לֶת הַשַּׁ֗חַר מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader; on aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.ayyeleth ha-shaḥar.-a A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: אֵלִ֣י אֵ֭לִי לָמָ֣ה עֲזַבְתָּ֑נִי רָח֥וֹק מִֽ֝ישׁוּעָתִ֗י דִּבְרֵ֥י שַׁאֲגָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
My God, my God,
why have You abandoned me;
why so far from delivering me
and from my anguished roaring?

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהַ֗י אֶקְרָ֣א י֭וֹמָם וְלֹ֣א תַעֲנֶ֑ה וְ֝לַ֗יְלָה וְֽלֹא־דֻֽמִיָּ֥ה לִֽי׃
translations.english:
My God,
I cry by day—You answer not;
by night, and have no respite.

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֥ה קָד֑וֹשׁ י֝וֹשֵׁ֗ב תְּהִלּ֥וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
bOr “But You are holy, enthroned upon the praises of Israel.”But You are the Holy One,
enthroned,
the Praise of Israel.-b

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭ךָ בָּטְח֣וּ אֲבֹתֵ֑ינוּ בָּ֝טְח֗וּ וַֽתְּפַלְּטֵֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
In You our fathers trusted;
they trusted, and You rescued them.

translations.hebrew: אֵלֶ֣יךָ זָעֲק֣וּ וְנִמְלָ֑טוּ בְּךָ֖ בָטְח֣וּ וְלֹא־בֽוֹשׁוּ׃
translations.english:
To You they cried out
and they escaped;
in You they trusted
and were not disappointed.

translations.hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֣י תוֹלַ֣עַת וְלֹא־אִ֑ישׁ חֶרְפַּ֥ת אָ֝דָ֗ם וּבְז֥וּי עָֽם׃
translations.english:
But I am a worm, less than human;
scorned by men, despised by people.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־רֹ֭אַי יַלְעִ֣גוּ לִ֑י יַפְטִ֥ירוּ בְ֝שָׂפָ֗ה יָנִ֥יעוּ רֹֽאשׁ׃
translations.english:
All who see me mock me;
cLit. “they open wide with a lip.”they curl their lips,-c
they shake their heads.

translations.hebrew: גֹּ֣ל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה יְפַלְּטֵ֑הוּ יַ֝צִּילֵ֗הוּ כִּ֘י־חָ֥פֵֽץ־בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
“Let him commit himself to the LORD;
let Him rescue him,
let Him save him,
for He is pleased with him.”

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה גֹחִ֣י מִבָּ֑טֶן מַ֝בְטִיחִ֗י עַל־שְׁדֵ֥י אִמִּֽי׃
translations.english:
You aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.drew me-a from the womb,
made me secure at my mother’s breast.

translations.hebrew: עָ֭לֶיךָ הׇשְׁלַ֣כְתִּי מֵרָ֑חֶם מִבֶּ֥טֶן אִ֝מִּ֗י אֵ֣לִי אָֽתָּה׃
translations.english:
I became Your charge at birth;
from my mother’s womb You have been my God.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּרְחַ֣ק מִ֭מֶּנִּי כִּי־צָרָ֣ה קְרוֹבָ֑ה כִּי־אֵ֥ין עוֹזֵֽר׃
translations.english:
Do not be far from me,
for trouble is near,
and there is none to help.

translations.hebrew: סְ֭בָבוּנִי פָּרִ֣ים רַבִּ֑ים אַבִּירֵ֖י בָשָׁ֣ן כִּתְּרֽוּנִי׃
translations.english:
Many bulls surround me,
mighty ones of Bashan encircle me.

translations.hebrew: פָּצ֣וּ עָלַ֣י פִּיהֶ֑ם אַ֝רְיֵ֗ה טֹרֵ֥ף וְשֹׁאֵֽג׃
translations.english:
They open their mouths at me
like tearing, roaring lions.

translations.hebrew: כַּמַּ֥יִם נִשְׁפַּכְתִּי֮ וְהִתְפָּֽרְד֗וּ כׇּֽל־עַצְמ֫וֹתָ֥י הָיָ֣ה לִ֭בִּי כַּדּוֹנָ֑ג נָ֝מֵ֗ס בְּת֣וֹךְ מֵעָֽי׃
translations.english:
dLit. “I am poured out like water.”My life ebbs away:-d
all my bones are disjointed;
my heart is like wax,
melting within me;

translations.hebrew: יָ֘בֵ֤שׁ כַּחֶ֨רֶשׂ ׀ כֹּחִ֗י וּ֭לְשׁוֹנִי מֻדְבָּ֣ק מַלְקוֹחָ֑י וְֽלַעֲפַר־מָ֥וֶת תִּשְׁפְּתֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
my vigor dries up like a shard;
my tongue cleaves to my palate;
You commit me to the dust of death.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֥י סְבָב֗וּנִי כְּלָ֫בִ֥ים עֲדַ֣ת מְ֭רֵעִים הִקִּיפ֑וּנִי כָּ֝אֲרִ֗י יָדַ֥י וְרַגְלָֽי׃
translations.english:
Dogs surround me;
a pack of evil ones closes in on me,
eWith Rashi; cf. Isa. 38.13.like lions [they maul] my hands and feet.-e

translations.hebrew: אֲסַפֵּ֥ר כׇּל־עַצְמוֹתָ֑י הֵ֥מָּה יַ֝בִּ֗יטוּ יִרְאוּ־בִֽי׃
translations.english:
I take the count of all my bones
while they look on and gloat.

translations.hebrew: יְחַלְּק֣וּ בְגָדַ֣י לָהֶ֑ם וְעַל־לְ֝בוּשִׁ֗י יַפִּ֥ילוּ גוֹרָֽל׃
translations.english:
They divide my clothes among themselves,
casting lots for my garments.

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אַל־תִּרְחָ֑ק אֱ֝יָלוּתִ֗י לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי חֽוּשָׁה׃
translations.english:
But You, O LORD, be not far off;
my strength, hasten to my aid.

translations.hebrew: הַצִּ֣ילָה מֵחֶ֣רֶב נַפְשִׁ֑י מִיַּד־כֶּ֝֗לֶב יְחִידָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Save my life from the sword,
my precious lifefLit. “only one.” from the clutches of a dog.

translations.hebrew: ה֭וֹשִׁיעֵנִי מִפִּ֣י אַרְיֵ֑ה וּמִקַּרְנֵ֖י רֵמִ֣ים עֲנִיתָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Deliver me from a lion’s mouth;
from the horns of wild oxen rescuegLit. “answer.” me.

translations.hebrew: אֲסַפְּרָ֣ה שִׁמְךָ֣ לְאֶחָ֑י בְּת֖וֹךְ קָהָ֣ל אֲהַלְלֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Then will I proclaim Your fame to my brethren,
praise You in the congregation.

translations.hebrew: יִרְאֵ֤י יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ הַֽלְל֗וּהוּ כׇּל־זֶ֣רַע יַעֲקֹ֣ב כַּבְּד֑וּהוּ וְג֥וּרוּ מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ כׇּל־זֶ֥רַע יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
You who fear the LORD, praise Him!
All you offspring of Jacob, honor Him!
Be in dread of Him, all you offspring of Israel!

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹֽא־בָזָ֨ה וְלֹ֪א שִׁקַּ֡ץ עֱנ֬וּת עָנִ֗י וְלֹא־הִסְתִּ֣יר פָּנָ֣יו מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וּֽבְשַׁוְּע֖וֹ אֵלָ֣יו שָׁמֵֽעַ׃
translations.english:
For He did not scorn, He did not spurn
the pleahOr “plight.” of the lowly;
He did not hide His face from him;
when he cried out to Him, He listened.

translations.hebrew: מֵ֥אִתְּךָ֗ תְּֽהִלָּ֫תִ֥י בְּקָהָ֥ל רָ֑ב נְדָרַ֥י אֲ֝שַׁלֵּ֗ם נֶ֣גֶד יְרֵאָֽיו׃
translations.english:
iLit. “From You is my praise.”Because of You I offer praise-i in the great congregation;
I pay my vows in the presence of His worshipers.

translations.hebrew: יֹאכְל֬וּ עֲנָוִ֨ים ׀ וְיִשְׂבָּ֗עוּ יְהַֽלְל֣וּ יְ֭הֹוָה דֹּ֣רְשָׁ֑יו יְחִ֖י לְבַבְכֶ֣ם לָעַֽד׃
translations.english:
Let the lowly eat and be satisfied;
let all who seek the LORD praise Him.
Always be of good cheer!

translations.hebrew: יִזְכְּר֤וּ ׀ וְיָשֻׁ֣בוּ אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְיִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ לְ֝פָנֶ֗יךָ כׇּֽל־מִשְׁפְּח֥וֹת גּוֹיִֽם׃
translations.english:
Let all the ends of the earth pay heed and turn to the LORD,
and the peoples of all nations prostrate themselves before You;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י לַ֭יהֹוָה הַמְּלוּכָ֑ה וּ֝מֹשֵׁ֗ל בַּגּוֹיִֽם׃
translations.english:
for kingship is the LORD’s
and He rules the nations.

translations.hebrew: אָכְל֬וּ וַיִּֽשְׁתַּחֲו֨וּ ׀ כׇּֽל־דִּשְׁנֵי־אֶ֗רֶץ לְפָנָ֣יו יִ֭כְרְעוּ כׇּל־יוֹרְדֵ֣י עָפָ֑ר וְ֝נַפְשׁ֗וֹ לֹ֣א חִיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
jMeaning of Heb. uncertain; others “All the fat ones of the earth shall eat and worship; / All they that go down to the dust shall kneel before Him, / Even he that cannot keep his soul alive.”All those in full vigor shall eat and prostrate themselves;
all those at death’s door, whose spirits flag,
shall bend the knee before Him.-j

translations.hebrew: זֶ֥רַע יַֽעַבְדֶ֑נּוּ יְסֻפַּ֖ר לַֽאדֹנָ֣י לַדּֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Offspring shall serve Him;
the Lord’s fame shall be proclaimed to the generation

translations.hebrew: יָ֭בֹאוּ וְיַגִּ֣ידוּ צִדְקָת֑וֹ לְעַ֥ם נ֝וֹלָ֗ד כִּ֣י עָשָֽׂה׃
translations.english:
to come;
they shall tell of His beneficence to people yet to be born,
for He has acted.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִ֑ד יְהֹוָ֥ה רֹ֝עִ֗י לֹ֣א אֶחְסָֽר׃
translations.english:
A psalm of David.

The LORD is my shepherd;
I lack nothing.

translations.hebrew: בִּנְא֣וֹת דֶּ֭שֶׁא יַרְבִּיצֵ֑נִי עַל־מֵ֖י מְנֻח֣וֹת יְנַהֲלֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
He makes me lie down in green pastures;
He leads me to aOthers “still waters.”water in places of repose;-a

translations.hebrew: נַפְשִׁ֥י יְשׁוֹבֵ֑ב יַֽנְחֵ֥נִי בְמַעְגְּלֵי־צֶ֝֗דֶק לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He renews my life;
He guides me in right paths
as befits His name.

translations.hebrew: גַּ֤ם כִּֽי־אֵלֵ֨ךְ בְּגֵ֪יא צַלְמָ֡וֶת לֹא־אִ֘ירָ֤א רָ֗ע כִּי־אַתָּ֥ה עִמָּדִ֑י שִׁבְטְךָ֥ וּ֝מִשְׁעַנְתֶּ֗ךָ הֵ֣מָּה יְנַֽחֲמֻֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Though I walk through bOthers “the valley of the shadow of death.”a valley of deepest darkness,-b
I fear no harm, for You are with me;
Your rod and Your staff—they comfort me.

translations.hebrew: תַּעֲרֹ֬ךְ לְפָנַ֨י ׀ שֻׁלְחָ֗ן נֶ֥גֶד צֹרְרָ֑י דִּשַּׁ֥נְתָּ בַשֶּׁ֥מֶן רֹ֝אשִׁ֗י כּוֹסִ֥י רְוָיָֽה׃
translations.english:
You spread a table for me in full view of my enemies;
You anoint my head with oil;
my drink is abundant.

translations.hebrew: אַ֤ךְ ׀ ט֤וֹב וָחֶ֣סֶד יִ֭רְדְּפוּנִי כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י חַיָּ֑י וְשַׁבְתִּ֥י בְּבֵית־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לְאֹ֣רֶךְ יָמִֽים׃
translations.english:
Only goodness and steadfast love shall pursue me
all the days of my life,
and I shall dwell in the house of the LORD
for many long years.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֗ד מִ֫זְמ֥וֹר לַֽ֭יהֹוָה הָאָ֣רֶץ וּמְלוֹאָ֑הּ תֵּ֝בֵ֗ל וְיֹ֣שְׁבֵי בָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Of David. A psalm.

The earth is the LORD’s and all that it holds,
the world and its inhabitants.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־ה֭וּא עַל־יַמִּ֣ים יְסָדָ֑הּ וְעַל־נְ֝הָר֗וֹת יְכוֹנְנֶֽהָ׃
translations.english:
For He founded it upon the ocean,
set it on the nether-streams.

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־יַעֲלֶ֥ה בְהַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמִי־יָ֝ק֗וּם בִּמְק֥וֹם קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who may ascend the mountain of the LORD?
Who may stand in His holy place?—

translations.hebrew: נְקִ֥י כַפַּ֗יִם וּֽבַר־לֵ֫בָ֥ב אֲשֶׁ֤ר ׀ לֹא־נָשָׂ֣א לַשָּׁ֣וְא נַפְשִׁ֑י וְלֹ֖א נִשְׁבַּ֣ע לְמִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
He who has clean hands and a pure heart,
who has not taken a false oath by MyaAncient versions and some mss. read “His.” life
or sworn deceitfully.

translations.hebrew: יִשָּׂ֣א בְ֭רָכָה מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וּ֝צְדָקָ֗ה מֵאֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׁעֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He shall carry away a blessing from the LORD,
a just reward from God, his deliverer.

translations.hebrew: זֶ֭ה דּ֣וֹר דֹּרְשָׁ֑ו מְבַקְשֵׁ֨י פָנֶ֖יךָ יַעֲקֹ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Such is the circlebLit. “generation.” of those who turn to Him,
Jacob, who seek Your presence. Selah.

translations.hebrew: שְׂא֤וּ שְׁעָרִ֨ים ׀ רָֽאשֵׁיכֶ֗ם וְֽ֭הִנָּשְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵ֣י עוֹלָ֑ם וְ֝יָב֗וֹא מֶ֣לֶךְ הַכָּבֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
O gates, lift up your heads!
Up high, you everlasting doors,
so the King of glory may come in!

translations.hebrew: מִ֥י זֶה֮ מֶ֤לֶךְ הַכָּ֫ב֥וֹד יְ֭הֹוָה עִזּ֣וּז וְגִבּ֑וֹר יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה גִּבּ֥וֹר מִלְחָמָֽה׃
translations.english:
Who is the King of glory?—
the LORD, mighty and valiant,
the LORD, valiant in battle.

translations.hebrew: שְׂא֤וּ שְׁעָרִ֨ים ׀ רָֽאשֵׁיכֶ֗ם וּ֭שְׂאוּ פִּתְחֵ֣י עוֹלָ֑ם וְ֝יָבֹ֗א מֶ֣לֶךְ הַכָּבֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
O gates, lift up your heads!
Lift them up, you everlasting doors,
so the King of glory may come in!

translations.hebrew: מִ֤י־ה֣וּא זֶה֮ מֶ֤לֶךְ הַכָּ֫ב֥וֹד יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֑וֹת ה֤וּא מֶ֖לֶךְ הַכָּב֣וֹד סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Who is the King of glory?—
the LORD of hosts,
He is the King of glory! Selah.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֡ד אֵלֶ֥יךָ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה נַפְשִׁ֥י אֶשָּֽׂא׃
translations.english:
Of David.
O LORD, I set my hope on You;

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהַ֗י בְּךָ֣ בָ֭טַחְתִּי אַל־אֵב֑וֹשָׁה אַל־יַעַלְצ֖וּ אוֹיְבַ֣י לִֽי׃
translations.english:
my God, in You I trust;
may I not be disappointed,
may my enemies not exult over me.

translations.hebrew: גַּ֣ם כׇּל־קֹ֭וֶיךָ לֹ֣א יֵבֹ֑שׁוּ יֵ֝בֹ֗שׁוּ הַבּוֹגְדִ֥ים רֵיקָֽם׃
translations.english:
O let none who look to You be disappointed;
let the faithless be disappointed, empty-handed.

translations.hebrew: דְּרָכֶ֣יךָ יְ֭הֹוָה הוֹדִיעֵ֑נִי אֹ֖רְחוֹתֶ֣יךָ לַמְּדֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Let me know Your paths, O LORD;
teach me Your ways;

translations.hebrew: הַדְרִ֘יכֵ֤נִי בַאֲמִתֶּ֨ךָ ׀ וְֽלַמְּדֵ֗נִי כִּֽי־אַ֭תָּה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעִ֑י אוֹתְךָ֥ קִ֝וִּ֗יתִי כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
guide me in Your true way and teach me,
for You are God, my deliverer;
it is You I look to at all times.

translations.hebrew: זְכֹר־רַחֲמֶ֣יךָ יְ֭הֹוָה וַחֲסָדֶ֑יךָ כִּ֖י מֵעוֹלָ֣ם הֵֽמָּה׃
translations.english:
O LORD, be mindful of Your compassion
and Your faithfulness;
they are old as time.

translations.hebrew: חַטֹּ֤אות נְעוּרַ֨י ׀ וּפְשָׁעַ֗י אַל־תִּ֫זְכֹּ֥ר כְּחַסְדְּךָ֥ זְכׇר־לִי־אַ֑תָּה לְמַ֖עַן טוּבְךָ֣ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Be not mindful of my youthful sins and transgressions;
in keeping with Your faithfulness consider what is in my favor,
as befits Your goodness, O LORD.

translations.hebrew: טוֹב־וְיָשָׁ֥ר יְהֹוָ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֤ן יוֹרֶ֖ה חַטָּאִ֣ים בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
translations.english:
Good and upright is the LORD;
therefore He shows sinners the way.

translations.hebrew: יַדְרֵ֣ךְ עֲ֭נָוִים בַּמִּשְׁפָּ֑ט וִילַמֵּ֖ד עֲנָוִ֣ים דַּרְכּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He guides the lowly in the right path,
and teaches the lowly His way.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־אׇרְח֣וֹת יְ֭הֹוָה חֶ֣סֶד וֶאֱמֶ֑ת לְנֹצְרֵ֥י בְ֝רִית֗וֹ וְעֵדֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
All the LORD’s paths are steadfast love
for those who keep the decrees of His covenant.

translations.hebrew: לְמַֽעַן־שִׁמְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְֽסָלַחְתָּ֥ לַ֝עֲוֺנִ֗י כִּ֣י רַב־הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
As befits Your name, O LORD,
pardon my iniquity though it be great.

translations.hebrew: מִי־זֶ֣ה הָ֭אִישׁ יְרֵ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה י֝וֹרֶ֗נּוּ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ יִבְחָֽר׃
translations.english:
Whoever fears the LORD,
he shall be shown what path to choose.

translations.hebrew: נַ֭פְשׁוֹ בְּט֣וֹב תָּלִ֑ין וְ֝זַרְע֗וֹ יִ֣ירַשׁ אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
He shall live a happy life,
and his children shall inherit the land.

translations.hebrew: ס֣וֹד יְ֭הֹוָה לִירֵאָ֑יו וּ֝בְרִית֗וֹ לְהוֹדִיעָֽם׃
translations.english:
The counselaOr “secret.” of the LORD is for those who fear Him;
to them He makes known His covenant.

translations.hebrew: עֵינַ֣י תָּ֭מִיד אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֤י הֽוּא־יוֹצִ֖יא מֵרֶ֣שֶׁת רַגְלָֽי׃
translations.english:
My eyes are ever toward the LORD,
for He will loose my feet from the net.

translations.hebrew: פְּנֵֽה־אֵלַ֥י וְחׇנֵּ֑נִי כִּֽי־יָחִ֖יד וְעָנִ֣י אָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Turn to me, have mercy on me,
for I am alone and afflicted.

translations.hebrew: צָר֣וֹת לְבָבִ֣י הִרְחִ֑יבוּ מִ֝מְּצוּקוֹתַ֗י הוֹצִיאֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
bLit. “The distress of my heart.”My deep distress-b increases;
deliver me from my straits.

translations.hebrew: רְאֵ֣ה עׇ֭נְיִי וַעֲמָלִ֑י וְ֝שָׂ֗א לְכׇל־חַטֹּאותָֽי׃
translations.english:
Look at my affliction and suffering,
and forgive all my sins.

translations.hebrew: רְאֵֽה־אֹיְבַ֥י כִּי־רָ֑בּוּ וְשִׂנְאַ֖ת חָמָ֣ס שְׂנֵאֽוּנִי׃
translations.english:
See how numerous my enemies are,
and how unjustly they hate me!

translations.hebrew: שׇׁמְרָ֣ה נַ֭פְשִׁי וְהַצִּילֵ֑נִי אַל־אֵ֝ב֗וֹשׁ כִּֽי־חָסִ֥יתִי בָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Protect me and save me;
let me not be disappointed,
for I have sought refuge in You.

translations.hebrew: תֹּם־וָיֹ֥שֶׁר יִצְּר֑וּנִי כִּ֝֗י קִוִּיתִֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
May integrity and uprightness watch over me,
for I look to You.

translations.hebrew: פְּדֵ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִ֝כֹּ֗ל צָרוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
O God, redeem Israel
from all its distress.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ שׇׁפְטֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּֽי־אֲ֭נִי בְּתֻמִּ֣י הָלַ֑כְתִּי וּבַיהֹוָ֥ה בָּ֝טַ֗חְתִּי לֹ֣א אֶמְעָֽד׃
translations.english:
Of David.

Vindicate me, O LORD,
for I have walked without blame;
I have trusted in the LORD;
I have not faltered.

translations.hebrew: בְּחָנֵ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֣ה וְנַסֵּ֑נִי (צרופה) [צׇרְפָ֖ה] כִלְיוֹתַ֣י וְלִבִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Probe me, O LORD, and try me,
test my aLit. “kidneys and heart.”heart and mind;-a

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־חַ֭סְדְּךָ לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינָ֑י וְ֝הִתְהַלַּ֗כְתִּי בַּאֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
bOr “I am aware of Your faithfulness, and always walk in Your true [path].”for my eyes are on Your steadfast love;
I have set my course by it.-b

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־יָ֭שַׁבְתִּי עִם־מְתֵי־שָׁ֑וְא וְעִ֥ם נַ֝עֲלָמִ֗ים לֹ֣א אָבֽוֹא׃
translations.english:
I do not consort with scoundrels,
or mix with hypocrites;

translations.hebrew: שָׂ֭נֵאתִי קְהַ֣ל מְרֵעִ֑ים וְעִם־רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים לֹ֣א אֵשֵֽׁב׃
translations.english:
I detest the company of evil men,
and do not consort with the wicked;

translations.hebrew: אֶרְחַ֣ץ בְּנִקָּי֣וֹן כַּפָּ֑י וַאֲסֹבְבָ֖ה אֶת־מִזְבַּחֲךָ֣ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
I wash my hands in innocence,
and walk around Your altar, O LORD,

translations.hebrew: לַ֭שְׁמִעַ בְּק֣וֹל תּוֹדָ֑ה וּ֝לְסַפֵּ֗ר כׇּל־נִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
raising my voice in thanksgiving,
and telling all Your wonders.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה אָ֭הַבְתִּי מְע֣וֹן בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ וּ֝מְק֗וֹם מִשְׁכַּ֥ן כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
O LORD, I love Your temple abode,
the dwelling-place of Your glory.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תֶּאֱסֹ֣ף עִם־חַטָּאִ֣ים נַפְשִׁ֑י וְעִם־אַנְשֵׁ֖י דָמִ֣ים חַיָּֽי׃
translations.english:
Do not sweep me away with sinners,
or [snuff out] my life with murderers,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־בִּידֵיהֶ֥ם זִמָּ֑ה וִ֝ימִינָ֗ם מָ֣לְאָה שֹּֽׁחַד׃
translations.english:
who have schemes at their fingertips,
and hands full of bribes.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי בְּתֻמִּ֥י אֵלֵ֗ךְ פְּדֵ֣נִי וְחׇנֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
But I walk without blame;
redeem me, have mercy on me!

translations.hebrew: רַ֭גְלִי עָמְדָ֣ה בְמִישׁ֑וֹר בְּ֝מַקְהֵלִ֗ים אֲבָרֵ֥ךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
My feet are on level ground.
In assemblies I will bless the LORD.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ אוֹרִ֣י וְ֭יִשְׁעִי מִמִּ֣י אִירָ֑א יְהֹוָ֥ה מָעוֹז־חַ֝יַּ֗י מִמִּ֥י אֶפְחָֽד׃
translations.english:
Of David.

The LORD is my light and my help;
whom should I fear?
The LORD is the stronghold of my life,
whom should I dread?

translations.hebrew: בִּקְרֹ֤ב עָלַ֨י ׀ מְרֵעִים֮ לֶאֱכֹ֢ל אֶת־בְּשָׂ֫רִ֥י צָרַ֣י וְאֹיְבַ֣י לִ֑י הֵ֖מָּה כָשְׁל֣וּ וְנָפָֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
When evil men assail me
aOr “to slander me”; cf. Dan. 3.8; 6.25.to devour my flesh-a—
it is they, my foes and my enemies,
who stumble and fall.

translations.hebrew: אִם־תַּחֲנֶ֬ה עָלַ֨י ׀ מַחֲנֶה֮ לֹא־יִירָ֢א לִ֫בִּ֥י אִם־תָּק֣וּם עָ֭לַי מִלְחָמָ֑ה בְּ֝זֹ֗את אֲנִ֣י בוֹטֵֽחַ׃
translations.english:
Should an army besiege me,
my heart would have no fear;
should war beset me,
still would I be confident.

translations.hebrew: אַחַ֤ת ׀ שָׁאַ֣לְתִּי מֵאֵת־יְהֹוָה֮ אוֹתָ֢הּ אֲבַ֫קֵּ֥שׁ שִׁבְתִּ֣י בְּבֵית־יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־יְמֵ֣י חַיַּ֑י לַחֲז֥וֹת בְּנֹעַם־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וּלְבַקֵּ֥ר בְּהֵֽיכָלֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
