One thing I ask of the LORD,
only that do I seek:
to live in the house of the LORD
all the days of my life,
to gaze upon the beauty of the LORD,
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.to frequent-b His temple.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י יִצְפְּנֵ֨נִי ׀ בְּסֻכֹּה֮ בְּי֢וֹם רָ֫עָ֥ה יַ֭סְתִּרֵנִי בְּסֵ֣תֶר אׇהֳל֑וֹ בְּ֝צ֗וּר יְרוֹמְמֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
He will shelter me in His pavilion
on an evil day,
grant me the protection of His tent,
raise me high upon a rock.

translations.hebrew: וְעַתָּ֨ה יָר֪וּם רֹאשִׁ֡י עַ֤ל אֹיְבַ֬י סְֽבִיבוֹתַ֗י וְאֶזְבְּחָ֣ה בְ֭אׇהֳלוֹ זִבְחֵ֣י תְרוּעָ֑ה אָשִׁ֥ירָה וַ֝אֲזַמְּרָ֗ה לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Now is my head high
over my enemies round about;
I sacrifice in His tent with shouts of joy,
singing and chanting a hymn to the LORD.

translations.hebrew: שְׁמַע־יְהֹוָ֖ה קוֹלִ֥י אֶקְרָ֗א וְחׇנֵּ֥נִי וַעֲנֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Hear, O LORD, when I cry aloud;
have mercy on me, answer me.

translations.hebrew: לְךָ֤ ׀ אָמַ֣ר לִ֭בִּי בַּקְּשׁ֣וּ פָנָ֑י אֶת־פָּנֶ֖יךָ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֲבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.In Your behalf-b my heart says:
“Seek My face!”
O LORD, I seek Your face.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּסְתֵּ֬ר פָּנֶ֨יךָ ׀ מִמֶּנִּי֮ אַ֥ל תַּט־בְּאַ֗ף עַ֫בְדֶּ֥ךָ עֶזְרָתִ֥י הָיִ֑יתָ אַֽל־תִּטְּשֵׁ֥נִי וְאַל־תַּ֝עַזְבֵ֗נִי אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׁעִֽי׃
translations.english:
Do not hide Your face from me;
do not thrust aside Your servant in anger;
You have ever been my help.
Do not forsake me, do not abandon me,
O God, my deliverer.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אָבִ֣י וְאִמִּ֣י עֲזָב֑וּנִי וַֽיהֹוָ֣ה יַאַסְפֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Though my father and mother abandon me,
the LORD will take me in.

translations.hebrew: ה֤וֹרֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֗ה דַּ֫רְכֶּ֥ךָ וּ֭נְחֵנִי בְּאֹ֣רַח מִישׁ֑וֹר לְ֝מַ֗עַן שֽׁוֹרְרָֽי׃
translations.english:
Show me Your way, O LORD,
and lead me on a level path
because of my watchful foes.

translations.hebrew: אַֽל־תִּ֭תְּנֵנִי בְּנֶ֣פֶשׁ צָרָ֑י כִּ֥י קָמוּ־בִ֥י עֵדֵי־שֶׁ֝֗קֶר וִיפֵ֥חַ חָמָֽס׃
translations.english:
Do not subject me to the will of my foes,
for false witnesses and unjust accusers
have appeared against me.

translations.hebrew: לׅׄוּׅׄלֵׅ֗ׄאׅׄ הֶ֭אֱמַנְתִּי לִרְא֥וֹת בְּֽטוּב־יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
Had I not the assurance
that I would enjoy the goodness of the LORD
in the land of the living…

translations.hebrew: קַוֵּ֗ה אֶל־יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה חֲ֭זַק וְיַאֲמֵ֣ץ לִבֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝קַוֵּ֗ה אֶל־יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Look to the LORD;
be strong and of good courage!
O look to the LORD!

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֡ד אֵ֘לֶ֤יךָ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ אֶקְרָ֗א צוּרִי֮ אַֽל־תֶּחֱרַ֢שׁ מִ֫מֶּ֥נִּי פֶּן־תֶּחֱשֶׁ֥ה מִמֶּ֑נִּי וְ֝נִמְשַׁ֗לְתִּי עִם־י֥וֹרְדֵי בֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Of David.

O LORD, I call to You;
my rock, do not disregard me,
for if You hold aloof from me,
I shall be like those gone down into the Pit.

translations.hebrew: שְׁמַ֤ע ק֣וֹל תַּ֭חֲנוּנַי בְּשַׁוְּעִ֣י אֵלֶ֑יךָ בְּנׇשְׂאִ֥י יָ֝דַ֗י אֶל־דְּבִ֥יר קׇדְשֶֽׁךָ׃
translations.english:
Listen to my plea for mercy
when I cry out to You,
when I lift my hands
toward Your inner sanctuary.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּמְשְׁכֵ֣נִי עִם־רְשָׁעִים֮ וְעִם־פֹּ֢עֲלֵ֫י אָ֥וֶן דֹּבְרֵ֣י שָׁ֭לוֹם עִם־רֵעֵיהֶ֑ם וְ֝רָעָ֗ה בִּלְבָבָֽם׃
translations.english:
Do not aOr “drag me off”; Meaning of Heb. uncertain.count me-a with the wicked and evildoers
who profess goodwill toward their fellows
while malice is in their heart.

translations.hebrew: תֶּן־לָהֶ֣ם כְּפׇעֳלָם֮ וּכְרֹ֢עַ מַעַלְלֵ֫יהֶ֥ם כְּמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יְ֭דֵיהֶם תֵּ֣ן לָהֶ֑ם הָשֵׁ֖ב גְּמוּלָ֣ם לָהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Pay them according to their deeds,
their malicious acts;
according to their handiwork pay them,
give them their deserts.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֪א יָבִ֡ינוּ אֶל־פְּעֻלֹּ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה וְאֶל־מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָדָ֑יו יֶ֝הֶרְסֵ֗ם וְלֹ֣א יִבְנֵֽם׃
translations.english:
For they do not consider the LORD’s deeds,
the work of His hands.
May He tear them down,
never to rebuild them!

translations.hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּי־שָׁ֝מַ֗ע ק֣וֹל תַּחֲנוּנָֽי׃
translations.english:
Blessed is the LORD,
for He listens to my plea for mercy.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ עֻזִּ֥י וּמָגִנִּי֮ בּ֤וֹ בָטַ֥ח לִבִּ֗י וְֽנֶ֫עֱזָ֥רְתִּי וַיַּעֲלֹ֥ז לִבִּ֑י וּֽמִשִּׁירִ֥י אֲהוֹדֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
The LORD is my strength and my shield;
my heart trusts in Him.
I was helped,bOr “strengthened.” and my heart exulted,
so I will glorify Him with my song.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה עֹֽז־לָ֑מוֹ וּמָ֘ע֤וֹז יְשׁוּע֖וֹת מְשִׁיח֣וֹ הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
The LORD is cSeptuagint, Saadia, and others render, and some mss. read, ‘oz le‘ammo, “the strength of His people.”their strength;-c
He is a stronghold for the deliverance of His anointed.

translations.hebrew: הוֹשִׁ֤יעָה ׀ אֶת־עַמֶּ֗ךָ וּבָרֵ֥ךְ אֶת־נַחֲלָתֶ֑ךָ וּֽרְעֵ֥ם וְ֝נַשְּׂאֵ֗ם עַד־הָעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
Deliver and bless Your very own people;
tend them and sustain them forever.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָ֫וִ֥ד הָב֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה בְּנֵ֣י אֵלִ֑ים הָב֥וּ לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה כָּב֥וֹד וָעֹֽז׃
translations.english:
A psalm of David.

Ascribe to the LORD, O divine beings,
ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

translations.hebrew: הָב֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה כְּב֣וֹד שְׁמ֑וֹ הִשְׁתַּחֲו֥וּ לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה בְּהַדְרַת־קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name;
bow down to the LORD, majestic in holiness.

translations.hebrew: ק֥וֹל יְהֹוָ֗ה עַל־הַ֫מָּ֥יִם אֵֽל־הַכָּב֥וֹד הִרְעִ֑ים יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עַל־מַ֥יִם רַבִּֽים׃
translations.english:
The voice of the LORD is over the waters;
the God of glory thunders,
the LORD, over the mighty waters.

translations.hebrew: קוֹל־יְהֹוָ֥ה בַּכֹּ֑חַ ק֥וֹל יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בֶּהָדָֽר׃
translations.english:
The voice of the LORD is power;
the voice of the LORD is majesty;

translations.hebrew: ק֣וֹל יְ֭הֹוָה שֹׁבֵ֣ר אֲרָזִ֑ים וַיְשַׁבֵּ֥ר יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אֶת־אַרְזֵ֥י הַלְּבָנֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
the voice of the LORD breaks cedars;
the LORD shatters the cedars of Lebanon.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּרְקִידֵ֥ם כְּמוֹ־עֵ֑גֶל לְבָנ֥וֹן וְ֝שִׂרְיֹ֗ן כְּמ֣וֹ בֶן־רְאֵמִֽים׃
translations.english:
aLit. “He makes them skip like a calf, Lebanon and Sirion, etc.”He makes Lebanon skip like a calf,-a
Sirion, like a young wild ox.

translations.hebrew: קוֹל־יְהֹוָ֥ה חֹצֵ֗ב לַהֲב֥וֹת אֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english: The voice of the L<small>ORD</small> kindles flames of fire;

translations.hebrew: ק֣וֹל יְ֭הֹוָה יָחִ֣יל מִדְבָּ֑ר יָחִ֥יל יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מִדְבַּ֥ר קָדֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
the voice of the LORD convulses the wilderness;
the LORD convulses the wilderness of Kadesh;

translations.hebrew: ק֤וֹל יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ יְחוֹלֵ֣ל אַיָּלוֹת֮ וַֽיֶּחֱשֹׂ֢ף יְעָ֫ר֥וֹת וּבְהֵיכָל֑וֹ כֻּ֝לּ֗וֹ אֹמֵ֥ר כָּבֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
the voice of the LORD causes hinds to calve,
bOr “brings ewes to early birth.”and strips forests bare;-b
while in His temple all say “Glory!”

translations.hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה לַמַּבּ֣וּל יָשָׁ֑ב וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מֶ֣לֶךְ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
The LORD sat enthroned at the Flood;
the LORD sits enthroned, king forever.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה עֹ֭ז לְעַמּ֣וֹ יִתֵּ֑ן יְהֹוָ֓ה ׀ יְבָרֵ֖ךְ אֶת־עַמּ֣וֹ בַשָּׁלֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
May the LORD grant strength to His people;
may the LORD bestow on His people wellbeing.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֡וֹר שִׁיר־חֲנֻכַּ֖ת הַבַּ֣יִת לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: A psalm of David. A song for the dedication of the House.aI.e., the Temple.

translations.hebrew: אֲרוֹמִמְךָ֣ יְ֭הֹוָה כִּ֣י דִלִּיתָ֑נִי וְלֹֽא־שִׂמַּ֖חְתָּ אֹיְבַ֣י לִֽי׃
translations.english:
I extol You, O LORD,
for You have lifted me up,
and not let my enemies rejoice over me.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָ֑י שִׁוַּ֥עְתִּי אֵ֝לֶ֗יךָ וַתִּרְפָּאֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
O LORD, my God,
I cried out to You,
and You healed me.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה הֶעֱלִ֣יתָ מִן־שְׁא֣וֹל נַפְשִׁ֑י חִ֝יִּיתַ֗נִי (מיורדי) [מִיׇּֽרְדִי־]בֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
O LORD, You brought me up from Sheol,
preserved me from going down into the Pit.

translations.hebrew: זַמְּר֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חֲסִידָ֑יו וְ֝הוֹד֗וּ לְזֵ֣כֶר קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
O you faithful of the LORD, sing to Him,
and praise His holy name.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י רֶ֨גַע ׀ בְּאַפּוֹ֮ חַיִּ֢ים בִּרְצ֫וֹנ֥וֹ בָּ֭עֶרֶב יָלִ֥ין בֶּ֗כִי וְלַבֹּ֥קֶר רִנָּֽה׃
translations.english:
For He is angry but a moment,
and when He is pleased there is life.
bOr “Weeping may linger for the night.”One may lie down weeping at nightfall;-b
but at dawn there are shouts of joy.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי אָמַ֣רְתִּי בְשַׁלְוִ֑י בַּל־אֶמּ֥וֹט לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
When I was untroubled,
I thought, “I shall never be shaken,”

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בִּרְצוֹנְךָ֮ הֶעֱמַ֢דְתָּה לְֽהַרְרִ֫י־עֹ֥ז הִסְתַּ֥רְתָּ פָנֶ֗יךָ הָיִ֥יתִי נִבְהָֽל׃
translations.english:
for You, O LORD, when You were pleased,
made [me]cFollowing Saadia, R. Isaiah of Trani; cf. Ibn Ezra. firm as a mighty mountain.
When You hid Your face,
I was terrified.

translations.hebrew: אֵלֶ֣יךָ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶקְרָ֑א וְאֶל־אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י אֶתְחַנָּֽן׃
translations.english:
I called to You, O LORD;
to my Lord I made appeal,

translations.hebrew: מַה־בֶּ֥צַע בְּדָמִי֮ בְּרִדְתִּ֢י אֶ֫ל־שָׁ֥חַת הֲיוֹדְךָ֥ עָפָ֑ר הֲיַגִּ֥יד אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
“What is to be gained from my death,dLit. “blood.”
from my descent into the Pit?
Can dust praise You?
Can it declare Your faithfulness?

translations.hebrew: שְׁמַע־יְהֹוָ֥ה וְחׇנֵּ֑נִי יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הֱֽיֵה־עֹזֵ֥ר לִֽי׃
translations.english:
Hear, O LORD, and have mercy on me;
O LORD, be my help!”

translations.hebrew: הָפַ֣כְתָּ מִסְפְּדִי֮ לְמָח֢וֹל לִ֥֫י פִּתַּ֥חְתָּ שַׂקִּ֑י וַֽתְּאַזְּרֵ֥נִי שִׂמְחָֽה׃
translations.english:
You turned my lament into dancing,
you undid my sackcloth and girded me with joy,

translations.hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן ׀ יְזַמֶּרְךָ֣ כָ֭בוֹד וְלֹ֣א יִדֹּ֑ם יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י לְעוֹלָ֥ם אוֹדֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
that [my] whole being might sing hymns to You endlessly;
O LORD my God, I will praise You forever.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: בְּךָֽ־יְהֹוָ֣ה חָ֭סִיתִי אַל־אֵב֣וֹשָׁה לְעוֹלָ֑ם בְּצִדְקָתְךָ֥ פַלְּטֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
I seek refuge in You, O LORD;
may I never be disappointed;
as You are righteous, rescue me.

translations.hebrew: הַטֵּ֤ה אֵלַ֨י ׀ אׇזְנְךָ֮ מְהֵרָ֢ה הַצִּ֫ילֵ֥נִי הֱיֵ֤ה לִ֨י ׀ לְֽצוּר־מָ֭עוֹז לְבֵ֥ית מְצוּד֗וֹת לְהוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Incline Your ear to me;
be quick to save me;
be a rock, a stronghold for me,
a citadel, for my deliverance.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־סַלְעִ֣י וּמְצוּדָתִ֣י אָ֑תָּה וּלְמַ֥עַן שִׁ֝מְךָ֗ תַּֽנְחֵ֥נִי וּֽתְנַהֲלֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
For You are my rock and my fortress;
You lead me and guide me as befits Your name.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹצִיאֵ֗נִי מֵרֶ֣שֶׁת ז֭וּ טָ֣מְנוּ לִ֑י כִּי־אַ֝תָּ֗ה מָעוּזִּֽי׃
translations.english:
You free me from the net laid for me,
for You are my stronghold.

translations.hebrew: בְּיָדְךָ֮ אַפְקִ֢יד ר֫וּחִ֥י פָּדִ֖יתָ אוֹתִ֥י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵ֣ל אֱמֶֽת׃
translations.english:
Into Your hand I entrust my spirit;
You redeem me, O LORD, faithful God.

translations.hebrew: שָׂנֵ֗אתִי הַשֹּׁמְרִ֥ים הַבְלֵי־שָׁ֑וְא וַ֝אֲנִ֗י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֥ה בָּטָֽחְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I detest those who rely on empty folly,
but I trust in the LORD.

translations.hebrew: אָגִ֥ילָה וְאֶשְׂמְחָ֗ה בְּחַ֫סְדֶּ֥ךָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רָ֭אִיתָ אֶת־עׇנְיִ֑י יָ֝דַ֗עְתָּ בְּצָר֥וֹת נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
Let me exult and rejoice in Your faithfulness
when You notice my affliction,
are mindful of my deep distress,

translations.hebrew: וְלֹ֣א הִ֭סְגַּרְתַּנִי בְּיַד־אוֹיֵ֑ב הֶעֱמַ֖דְתָּ בַמֶּרְחָ֣ב רַגְלָֽי׃
translations.english:
and do not hand me over to my enemy,
but aLit. “make my feet stand in a broad place.”grant me relief.-a

translations.hebrew: חׇנֵּ֥נִי יְהֹוָה֮ כִּ֤י צַ֫ר־לִ֥י עָשְׁשָׁ֖ה בְכַ֥עַס עֵינִ֗י נַפְשִׁ֥י וּבִטְנִֽי׃
translations.english:
Have mercy on me, O LORD,
for I am in distress;
my eyes are wasted by vexation,
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.my substance and body too.-b

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י כָל֪וּ בְיָג֡וֹן חַיַּי֮ וּשְׁנוֹתַ֢י בַּאֲנָ֫חָ֥ה כָּשַׁ֣ל בַּעֲוֺנִ֣י כֹחִ֑י וַעֲצָמַ֥י עָשֵֽׁשׁוּ׃
translations.english:
My life is spent in sorrow,
my years in groaning;
my strength fails because of my iniquity,
my limbs waste away.

translations.hebrew: מִכׇּל־צֹרְרַ֨י הָיִ֪יתִי חֶרְפָּ֡ה וְלִ֥שְׁכֵנַ֨י ׀ מְאֹד֮ וּפַ֢חַד לִֽמְיֻדָּ֫עָ֥י רֹאַ֥י בַּח֑וּץ נָדְד֥וּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
Because of all my foes
I am the particular butt of my neighbors,
a horror to my friends;
those who see me on the street avoid me.

translations.hebrew: נִ֭שְׁכַּחְתִּי כְּמֵ֣ת מִלֵּ֑ב הָ֝יִ֗יתִי כִּכְלִ֥י אֹבֵֽד׃
translations.english:
I am put out of mind like the dead;
I am like an object given up for lost.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁמַ֨עְתִּי ׀ דִּבַּ֥ת רַבִּים֮ מָג֢וֹר מִסָּ֫בִ֥יב בְּהִוָּסְדָ֣ם יַ֣חַד עָלַ֑י לָקַ֖חַת נַפְשִׁ֣י זָמָֽמוּ׃
translations.english:
I hear the whisperings of many,
intriguecOthers “terror.” on every side,
as they scheme together against me,
plotting to take my life.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ עָלֶ֣יךָ בָטַ֣חְתִּי יְהֹוָ֑ה אָ֝מַ֗רְתִּי אֱלֹהַ֥י אָֽתָּה׃
translations.english:
But I trust in You, O LORD;
I say, “You are my God!”

translations.hebrew: בְּיָדְךָ֥ עִתֹּתָ֑י הַצִּ֘ילֵ֤נִי מִיַּד־א֝וֹיְבַ֗י וּמֵֽרֹדְפָֽי׃
translations.english:
My fate is in Your hand;
save me from the hand of my enemies and pursuers.

translations.hebrew: הָאִ֣ירָה פָ֭נֶיךָ עַל־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ ה֖וֹשִׁיעֵ֣נִי בְחַסְדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Show favor to Your servant;
as You are faithful, deliver me.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה אַל־אֵ֭בוֹשָׁה כִּ֣י קְרָאתִ֑יךָ יֵבֹ֥שׁוּ רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יִדְּמ֥וּ לִשְׁאֽוֹל׃
translations.english:
O LORD, let me not be disappointed when I call You;
let the wicked be disappointed;
let them be silenced in Sheol;

translations.hebrew: תֵּ֥אָלַ֗מְנָה שִׂפְתֵ֫י־שָׁ֥קֶר הַדֹּבְר֖וֹת עַל־צַדִּ֥יק עָתָ֗ק בְּגַאֲוָ֥ה וָבֽוּז׃
translations.english:
let lying lips be stilled
that speak haughtily against the righteous
with arrogance and contempt.

translations.hebrew: מָ֤ה רַֽב־טוּבְךָ֮ אֲשֶׁר־צָפַ֢נְתָּ לִּירֵ֫אֶ֥יךָ פָּ֭עַלְתָּ לַחֹסִ֣ים בָּ֑ךְ נֶ֝֗גֶד בְּנֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
How abundant is the good
that You have in store for those who fear You,
that You do in the full view of men
for those who take refuge in You.

translations.hebrew: תַּסְתִּירֵ֤ם ׀ בְּסֵ֥תֶר פָּנֶיךָ֮ מֵרֻכְסֵ֫י־אִ֥ישׁ תִּצְפְּנֵ֥ם בְּסֻכָּ֗ה מֵרִ֥יב לְשֹׁנֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
You grant them the protection of Your presence
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.against scheming men;-b
You shelter them in Your pavilion
from contentious tongues.

translations.hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֥י הִפְלִ֘יא־חַסְדּ֥וֹ לִ֝֗י בְּעִ֣יר מָצֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Blessed is the LORD,
for He has been wondrously faithful to me,
a veritable bastion.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ אָ֘מַ֤רְתִּי בְחׇפְזִ֗י נִגְרַזְתִּי֮ מִנֶּ֢גֶד עֵ֫ינֶ֥יךָ אָכֵ֗ן שָׁ֭מַעְתָּ ק֥וֹל תַּחֲנוּנַ֗י בְּשַׁוְּעִ֥י אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Alarmed, I had thought,
“I am thrust out of Your sight”;
yet You listened to my plea for mercy
when I cried out to You.

translations.hebrew: אֶ֥הֱב֥וּ אֶֽת־יְהֹוָ֗ה כׇּֽל־חֲסִ֫ידָ֥יו אֱ֭מוּנִים נֹצֵ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמְשַׁלֵּ֥ם עַל־יֶ֝֗תֶר עֹשֵׂ֥ה גַאֲוָֽה׃
translations.english:
So love the LORD, all you faithful;
the LORD guards the loyal,
and more than requites
him who acts arrogantly.

translations.hebrew: חִ֭זְקוּ וְיַאֲמֵ֣ץ לְבַבְכֶ֑ם כׇּל־הַ֝מְיַחֲלִ֗ים לַֽיהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Be strong and of good courage,
all you who wait for the LORD.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֗ד מַ֫שְׂכִּ֥יל אַשְׁרֵ֥י נְֽשׂוּי־פֶּ֗שַׁע כְּס֣וּי חֲטָאָֽה׃
translations.english:
Of David. aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.A maskil.-a

Happy is he whose transgression is forgiven,
whose sin is covered over.

translations.hebrew: אַ֥שְֽׁרֵי־אָדָ֗ם לֹ֤א יַחְשֹׁ֬ב יְהֹוָ֣ה ל֣וֹ עָוֺ֑ן וְאֵ֖ין בְּרוּח֣וֹ רְמִיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Happy the man whom the LORD does not hold guilty,
and in whose spirit there is no deceit.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הֶ֭חֱרַשְׁתִּי בָּל֣וּ עֲצָמָ֑י בְּ֝שַׁאֲגָתִ֗י כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
As long as I said nothing,
my limbs wasted away
from my anguished roaring all day long.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלַיְלָה֮ תִּכְבַּ֥ד עָלַ֗י יָ֫דֶ֥ךָ נֶהְפַּ֥ךְ לְשַׁדִּ֑י בְּחַרְבֹ֖נֵי קַ֣יִץ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
For night and day
Your hand lay heavy on me;
my vigor waned
as in the summer drought. Selah.

translations.hebrew: חַטָּאתִ֨י אוֹדִ֪יעֲךָ֡ וַעֲ֘וֺנִ֤י לֹֽא־כִסִּ֗יתִי אָמַ֗רְתִּי אוֹדֶ֤ה עֲלֵ֣י פְ֭שָׁעַי לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְאַתָּ֨ה נָ֘שָׂ֤אתָ עֲוֺ֖ן חַטָּאתִ֣י סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Then I acknowledged my sin to You;
I did not cover up my guilt;
I resolved, “I will confess my transgressions to the LORD,”
and You forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah.

translations.hebrew: עַל־זֹ֡את יִתְפַּלֵּ֬ל כׇּל־חָסִ֨יד ׀ אֵלֶיךָ֮ לְעֵ֢ת מְ֫צֹ֥א רַ֗ק לְ֭שֵׁטֶף מַ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים אֵ֝לָ֗יו לֹ֣א יַגִּֽיעוּ׃
translations.english:
Therefore let every faithful man pray to You
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain; others “in a time when You may be found.”upon discovering [his sin],-b
that the rushing mighty waters
not overtake him.

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה ׀ סֵ֥תֶר לִי֮ מִצַּ֢ר תִּ֫צְּרֵ֥נִי רׇנֵּ֥י פַלֵּ֑ט תְּס֖וֹבְבֵ֣נִי סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
You are my shelter;
You preserve me from distress;
You surround me with the joyous shouts of deliverance. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׂכִּֽילְךָ֨ ׀ וְֽאוֹרְךָ֗ בְּדֶֽרֶךְ־ז֥וּ תֵלֵ֑ךְ אִיעֲצָ֖ה עָלֶ֣יךָ עֵינִֽי׃
translations.english:
Let me enlighten you
and show you which way to go;
let me offer counsel; my eye is on you.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּהְי֤וּ ׀ כְּס֥וּס כְּפֶרֶד֮ אֵ֤ין הָ֫בִ֥ין בְּמֶתֶג־וָרֶ֣סֶן עֶדְי֣וֹ לִבְל֑וֹם בַּ֝֗ל קְרֹ֣ב אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Be not like a senseless horse or mule
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.whose movement must be curbed by bit and bridle;-a
cMeaning of Heb. uncertain; for this rendering cf. Ibn Ezra.far be it from you!-c

translations.hebrew: רַבִּ֥ים מַכְאוֹבִ֗ים לָ֫רָשָׁ֥ע וְהַבּוֹטֵ֥חַ בַּֽיהֹוָ֑ה חֶ֝֗סֶד יְסוֹבְבֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
Many are the torments of the wicked,
but he who trusts in the LORD
shall be surrounded with favor.

translations.hebrew: שִׂמְח֬וּ בַיהֹוָ֣ה וְ֭גִילוּ צַדִּיקִ֑ים וְ֝הַרְנִ֗ינוּ כׇּל־יִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
Rejoice in the LORD and exult, O you righteous;
shout for joy, all upright men!

translations.hebrew: רַנְּנ֣וּ צַ֭דִּיקִים בַּֽיהֹוָ֑ה לַ֝יְשָׁרִ֗ים נָאוָ֥ה תְהִלָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Sing forth, O you righteous, to the LORD;
it is fit that the upright acclaim Him.

translations.hebrew: הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה בְּכִנּ֑וֹר בְּנֵ֥בֶל עָ֝שׂ֗וֹר זַמְּרוּ־לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Praise the LORD with the lyre;
with the ten-stringed harp sing to Him;

translations.hebrew: שִֽׁירוּ־ל֭וֹ שִׁ֣יר חָדָ֑שׁ הֵיטִ֥יבוּ נַ֝גֵּ֗ן בִּתְרוּעָֽה׃
translations.english:
sing Him a new song;
play sweetly with shouts of joy.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יָשָׁ֥ר דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְכׇל־מַ֝עֲשֵׂ֗הוּ בֶּאֱמוּנָֽה׃
translations.english:
For the word of the LORD is right;
His every deed is faithful.

translations.hebrew: אֹ֭הֵב צְדָקָ֣ה וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט חֶ֥סֶד יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מָלְאָ֥ה הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
He loves what is right and just;
the earth is full of the LORD’s faithful care.

translations.hebrew: בִּדְבַ֣ר יְ֭הֹוָה שָׁמַ֣יִם נַעֲשׂ֑וּ וּבְר֥וּחַ פִּ֝֗יו כׇּל־צְבָאָֽם׃
translations.english:
By the word of the LORD the heavens were made,
by the breath of His mouth, all their host.

translations.hebrew: כֹּנֵ֣ס כַּ֭נֵּד מֵ֣י הַיָּ֑ם נֹתֵ֖ן בְּאוֹצָר֣וֹת תְּהוֹמֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
He heaps up the ocean waters like a mound,
stores the deep in vaults.

translations.hebrew: יִֽירְא֣וּ מֵ֭יְהֹוָה כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ מִמֶּ֥נּוּ יָ֝ג֗וּרוּ כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י תֵבֵֽל׃
translations.english:
Let all the earth fear the LORD;
let all the inhabitants of the world dread Him.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ה֣וּא אָמַ֣ר וַיֶּ֑הִי הֽוּא־צִ֝וָּ֗ה וַֽיַּעֲמֹֽד׃
translations.english:
For He spoke, and it was;
He commanded, and it endured.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה הֵפִ֥יר עֲצַת־גּוֹיִ֑ם הֵ֝נִ֗יא מַחְשְׁב֥וֹת עַמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
The LORD frustrates the plans of nations,
brings to naught the designs of peoples.

translations.hebrew: עֲצַ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה לְעוֹלָ֣ם תַּעֲמֹ֑ד מַחְשְׁב֥וֹת לִ֝בּ֗וֹ לְדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃
translations.english:
What the LORD plans endures forever,
what He designs, for ages on end.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י הַ֭גּוֹי אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑יו הָעָ֓ם ׀ בָּחַ֖ר לְנַחֲלָ֣ה לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Happy the nation whose God is the LORD,
the people He has chosen to be His own.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭שָּׁמַיִם הִבִּ֣יט יְהֹוָ֑ה רָ֝אָ֗ה אֶֽת־כׇּל־בְּנֵ֥י הָאָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
The LORD looks down from heaven;
He sees all mankind.

translations.hebrew: מִֽמְּכוֹן־שִׁבְתּ֥וֹ הִשְׁגִּ֑יחַ אֶ֖ל כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
From His dwelling-place He gazes
on all the inhabitants of the earth—

translations.hebrew: הַיֹּצֵ֣ר יַ֣חַד לִבָּ֑ם הַ֝מֵּבִ֗ין אֶל־כׇּל־מַעֲשֵׂיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
He who fashions the hearts of them all,
who discerns all their doings.

translations.hebrew: אֵֽין־הַ֭מֶּלֶךְ נוֹשָׁ֣ע בְּרׇב־חָ֑יִל גִּ֝בּ֗וֹר לֹא־יִנָּצֵ֥ל בְּרׇב־כֹּֽחַ׃
translations.english:
Kings are not delivered by a large force;
warriors are not saved by great strength;

translations.hebrew: שֶׁ֣קֶר הַ֭סּוּס לִתְשׁוּעָ֑ה וּבְרֹ֥ב חֵ֝יל֗וֹ לֹ֣א יְמַלֵּֽט׃
translations.english:
horses are a false hope for deliverance;
for all their great power they provide no escape.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה עֵ֣ין יְ֭הֹוָה אֶל־יְרֵאָ֑יו לַֽמְיַחֲלִ֥ים לְחַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Truly the eye of the LORD is on those who fear Him,
who wait for His faithful care

translations.hebrew: לְהַצִּ֣יל מִמָּ֣וֶת נַפְשָׁ֑ם וּ֝לְחַיּוֹתָ֗ם בָּרָעָֽב׃
translations.english:
to save them from death,
to sustain them in famine.

translations.hebrew: נַ֭פְשֵׁנוּ חִכְּתָ֣ה לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה עֶזְרֵ֖נוּ וּמָגִנֵּ֣נוּ הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
We set our hope on the LORD,
He is our help and shield;

translations.hebrew: כִּי־ב֭וֹ יִשְׂמַ֣ח לִבֵּ֑נוּ כִּ֤י בְשֵׁ֖ם קׇדְשׁ֣וֹ בָטָֽחְנוּ׃
translations.english:
in Him our hearts rejoice,
for in His holy name we trust.

translations.hebrew: יְהִי־חַסְדְּךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֣ה עָלֵ֑ינוּ כַּ֝אֲשֶׁ֗ר יִחַ֥לְנוּ לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
May we enjoy, O LORD, Your faithful care,
as we have put our hope in You.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֗ד בְּשַׁנּוֹת֣וֹ אֶת־טַ֭עְמוֹ לִפְנֵ֣י אֲבִימֶ֑לֶךְ וַ֝יְגָרְשֵׁ֗הוּ וַיֵּלַֽךְ׃
translations.english: Of David, aCf. 1 Sam. 21.14 ff.when he feigned madness in the presence of Abimelech, who turned him out, and he left.-a

translations.hebrew: אֲבָרְכָ֣ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּכׇל־עֵ֑ת תָּ֝מִ֗יד תְּֽהִלָּת֥וֹ בְּפִֽי׃
translations.english:
I bless the LORD at all times;
praise of Him is ever in my mouth.

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭יהֹוָה תִּתְהַלֵּ֣ל נַפְשִׁ֑י יִשְׁמְע֖וּ עֲנָוִ֣ים וְיִשְׂמָֽחוּ׃
translations.english:
I glory in the LORD;
let the lowly hear it and rejoice.

translations.hebrew: גַּדְּל֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה אִתִּ֑י וּנְרוֹמְמָ֖ה שְׁמ֣וֹ יַחְדָּֽו׃
translations.english:
Exalt the LORD with me;
let us extol His name together.

translations.hebrew: דָּרַ֣שְׁתִּי אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה וְעָנָ֑נִי וּמִכׇּל־מְ֝גוּרוֹתַ֗י הִצִּילָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
I turned to the LORD, and He answered me;
He saved me from all my terrors.

translations.hebrew: הִבִּ֣יטוּ אֵלָ֣יו וְנָהָ֑רוּ וּ֝פְנֵיהֶ֗ם אַל־יֶחְפָּֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
Men look to Him and are radiant;
let their faces not be downcast.

translations.hebrew: זֶ֤ה עָנִ֣י קָ֭רָא וַיהֹוָ֣ה שָׁמֵ֑עַ וּמִכׇּל־צָ֝רוֹתָ֗יו הוֹשִׁיעֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Here was a lowly man who called,
and the LORD listened,
and delivered him from all his troubles.

translations.hebrew: חֹנֶ֤ה מַלְאַךְ־יְהֹוָ֓ה סָ֘בִ֤יב לִירֵאָ֗יו וַֽיְחַלְּצֵֽם׃
translations.english:
The angel of the LORD camps around those who fear Him
and rescues them.

translations.hebrew: טַעֲמ֣וּ וּ֭רְאוּ כִּֽי־ט֣וֹב יְהֹוָ֑ה אַֽשְׁרֵ֥י הַ֝גֶּ֗בֶר יֶחֱסֶה־בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Taste and see how good the LORD is;
happy the man who takes refuge in Him!

translations.hebrew: יְר֣אוּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה קְדֹשָׁ֑יו כִּי־אֵ֥ין מַ֝חְס֗וֹר לִירֵאָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Fear the LORD, you His consecrated ones,
for those who fear Him lack nothing.

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭פִירִים רָשׁ֣וּ וְרָעֵ֑בוּ וְדֹרְשֵׁ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לֹא־יַחְסְר֥וּ כׇל־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
Lions have been reduced to starvation,
but those who turn to the LORD shall not lack any good.

translations.hebrew: לְֽכוּ־בָ֭נִים שִׁמְעוּ־לִ֑י יִֽרְאַ֥ת יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אֲלַמֶּדְכֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Come, my sons, listen to me;
I will teach you what it is to fear the LORD.

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־הָ֭אִישׁ הֶחָפֵ֣ץ חַיִּ֑ים אֹהֵ֥ב יָ֝מִ֗ים לִרְא֥וֹת טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
Who is the man who is eager for life,
who desires years of good fortune?

translations.hebrew: נְצֹ֣ר לְשׁוֹנְךָ֣ מֵרָ֑ע וּ֝שְׂפָתֶ֗יךָ מִדַּבֵּ֥ר מִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
Guard your tongue from evil,
your lips from deceitful speech.

translations.hebrew: ס֣וּר מֵ֭רָע וַעֲשֵׂה־ט֑וֹב בַּקֵּ֖שׁ שָׁל֣וֹם וְרׇדְפֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
Shun evil and do good,
seek amitybOr “integrity.” and pursue it.

translations.hebrew: עֵינֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה אֶל־צַדִּיקִ֑ים וְ֝אׇזְנָ֗יו אֶל־שַׁוְעָתָֽם׃
translations.english:
The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous,
His ears attentive to their cry.

translations.hebrew: פְּנֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה בְּעֹ֣שֵׂי רָ֑ע לְהַכְרִ֖ית מֵאֶ֣רֶץ זִכְרָֽם׃
translations.english:
The face of the LORD is set against evildoers,
to erase their names from the earth.

translations.hebrew: צָ֭עֲקוּ וַיהֹוָ֣ה שָׁמֵ֑עַ וּמִכׇּל־צָ֝רוֹתָ֗ם הִצִּילָֽם׃
translations.english:
TheycViz., the righteous of v. 16. cry out, and the LORD hears,
and saves them from all their troubles.

translations.hebrew: קָר֣וֹב יְ֭הֹוָה לְנִשְׁבְּרֵי־לֵ֑ב וְֽאֶת־דַּכְּאֵי־ר֥וּחַ יוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
translations.english:
The LORD is close to the brokenhearted;
those crushed in spirit He delivers.

translations.hebrew: רַ֭בּוֹת רָע֣וֹת צַדִּ֑יק וּ֝מִכֻּלָּ֗ם יַצִּילֶ֥נּוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Though the misfortunes of the righteous be many,
the LORD will save him from them all,

translations.hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֥ר כׇּל־עַצְמוֹתָ֑יו אַחַ֥ת מֵ֝הֵ֗נָּה לֹ֣א נִשְׁבָּֽרָה׃
translations.english:
Keeping all his bones intact,
not one of them being broken.

translations.hebrew: תְּמוֹתֵ֣ת רָשָׁ֣ע רָעָ֑ה וְשֹׂנְאֵ֖י צַדִּ֣יק יֶאְשָֽׁמוּ׃
translations.english:
One misfortune is the deathblow of the wicked;
the foes of the righteous shall be ruined.

translations.hebrew: פֹּדֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה נֶ֣פֶשׁ עֲבָדָ֑יו וְלֹ֥א יֶ֝אְשְׁמ֗וּ כׇּֽל־הַחֹסִ֥ים בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The LORD redeems the life of His servants;
all who take refuge in Him shall not be ruined.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ רִיבָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־יְרִיבַ֑י לְ֝חַ֗ם אֶת־לֹחֲמָֽי׃
translations.english:
Of David.

O LORD, strive with my adversaries,
give battle to my foes,

translations.hebrew: הַחֲזֵ֣ק מָגֵ֣ן וְצִנָּ֑ה וְ֝ק֗וּמָה בְּעֶזְרָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
take up shield and buckler,
and come to my defense;

translations.hebrew: וְהָ֘רֵ֤ק חֲנִ֣ית וּ֭סְגֹר לִקְרַ֣את רֹדְפָ֑י אֱמֹ֥ר לְ֝נַפְשִׁ֗י יְֽשֻׁעָתֵ֥ךְ אָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
ready the spear and javelin
against my pursuers;
tell me, “I am your deliverance.”

translations.hebrew: יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ וְיִכָּלְמוּ֮ מְבַקְשֵׁ֢י נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י יִסֹּ֣גוּ אָח֣וֹר וְיַחְפְּר֑וּ חֹ֝שְׁבֵ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Let those who seek my life
be frustrated and put to shame;
let those who plan to harm me
fall back in disgrace.

translations.hebrew: יִֽהְי֗וּ כְּמֹ֥ץ לִפְנֵי־ר֑וּחַ וּמַלְאַ֖ךְ יְהֹוָ֣ה דּוֹחֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Let them be as chaff in the wind,
the LORD’s angel driving them on.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהִי־דַרְכָּ֗ם חֹ֥שֶׁךְ וַחֲלַקְלַקֹּ֑ת וּמַלְאַ֥ךְ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה רֹדְפָֽם׃
translations.english:
Let their path be dark and slippery,
with the LORD’s angel in pursuit.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־חִנָּ֣ם טָֽמְנוּ־לִ֭י שַׁ֣חַת רִשְׁתָּ֑ם חִ֝נָּ֗ם חָפְר֥וּ לְנַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
For without cause they hid a net to trap me;
without cause they dug a pitaTransferred from first clause for clarity. for me.

translations.hebrew: תְּבוֹאֵ֣הוּ שׁוֹאָה֮ לֹֽא־יֵ֫דָ֥ע וְרִשְׁתּ֣וֹ אֲשֶׁר־טָמַ֣ן תִּלְכְּד֑וֹ בְּ֝שׁוֹאָ֗ה יִפׇּל־בָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Let disaster overtake them unawares;
let the net they hid catch them;
let them fall into it when disaster [strikes].

translations.hebrew: וְ֭נַפְשִׁי תָּגִ֣יל בַּיהֹוָ֑ה תָּ֝שִׂ֗ישׂ בִּישׁוּעָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Then shall I exult in the LORD,
rejoice in His deliverance.

translations.hebrew: כׇּ֥ל־עַצְמוֹתַ֨י ׀ תֹּאמַרְנָה֮ יְהֹוָ֗ה מִ֥י־כָ֫מ֥וֹךָ מַצִּ֣יל עָ֭נִי מֵחָזָ֣ק מִמֶּ֑נּוּ וְעָנִ֥י וְ֝אֶבְי֗וֹן מִגֹּֽזְלֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
All my bones shall say,
“LORD, who is like You?
You save the poor from one stronger than he,
the poor and needy from his despoiler.”

translations.hebrew: יְ֭קוּמוּן עֵדֵ֣י חָמָ֑ס אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי יִשְׁאָלֽוּנִי׃
translations.english:
Malicious witnesses appear
who question me about things I do not know.

translations.hebrew: יְשַׁלְּמ֣וּנִי רָ֭עָה תַּ֥חַת טוֹבָ֗ה שְׁכ֣וֹל לְנַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
They repay me evil for good,
[seeking] my bereavement.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ בַּחֲלוֹתָ֡ם לְב֬וּשִׁי שָׂ֗ק עִנֵּ֣יתִי בַצּ֣וֹם נַפְשִׁ֑י וּ֝תְפִלָּתִ֗י עַל־חֵיקִ֥י תָשֽׁוּב׃
translations.english:
Yet, when they were ill,
my dress was sackcloth,
I kept a fast—
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain; lit. “my prayer returns upon my bosom.”may what I prayed for happen to me!-b

translations.hebrew: כְּרֵעַ־כְּאָ֣ח לִ֭י הִתְהַלָּ֑כְתִּי כַּאֲבֶל־אֵ֝֗ם קֹדֵ֥ר שַׁחֽוֹתִי׃
translations.english:
I walked about as though it were my friend or my brother;
I was bowed with gloom, like one mourning for his mother.

translations.hebrew: וּבְצַלְעִי֮ שָׂמְח֢וּ וְֽנֶ֫אֱסָ֥פוּ נֶאֶסְפ֬וּ עָלַ֣י נֵ֭כִים וְלֹ֣א יָדַ֑עְתִּי קָרְע֥וּ וְלֹא־דָֽמּוּ׃
translations.english:
But when I stumble, they gleefully gather;
wretches gather against me,
I know not why;
cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.they tear at me without end.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭חַנְפֵי לַעֲגֵ֣י מָע֑וֹג חָרֹ֖ק עָלַ֣י שִׁנֵּֽימוֹ׃
translations.english:
With impious, mocking grimace-c
they gnash their teeth at me.

translations.hebrew: אֲדֹנָי֮ כַּמָּ֢ה תִ֫רְאֶ֥ה הָשִׁ֣יבָה נַ֭פְשִׁי מִשֹּׁאֵיהֶ֑ם מִ֝כְּפִירִ֗ים יְחִידָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
O Lord, how long will You look on?
Rescue me cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.from their attacks,-c
my precious life, from the lions,

translations.hebrew: א֭וֹדְךָ בְּקָהָ֣ל רָ֑ב בְּעַ֖ם עָצ֣וּם אֲהַלְלֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
that I may praise You in a great congregation,
acclaim You in a mighty throng.

translations.hebrew: אַֽל־יִשְׂמְחוּ־לִ֣י אֹיְבַ֣י שֶׁ֑קֶר שֹׂנְאַ֥י חִ֝נָּ֗ם יִקְרְצוּ־עָֽיִן׃
translations.english:
Let not my treacherous enemies rejoice over me,
or those who hate me without reason wink their eyes.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֥א שָׁל֗וֹם יְדַ֫בֵּ֥רוּ וְעַ֥ל רִגְעֵי־אֶ֑רֶץ דִּבְרֵ֥י מִ֝רְמ֗וֹת יַחֲשֹׁבֽוּן׃
translations.english:
For they do not offer amity,
but devise fraudulent schemes against harmless folk.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּרְחִ֥יבוּ עָלַ֗י פִּ֫יהֶ֥ם אָ֭מְרוּ הֶאָ֣ח <small>׀</small> הֶאָ֑ח רָאֲתָ֥ה עֵינֵֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
They open wide their mouths at me,
saying, “Aha, aha, we have seen it!”

translations.hebrew: רָאִ֣יתָה יְ֭הֹוָה אַֽל־תֶּחֱרַ֑שׁ אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י אַל־תִּרְחַ֥ק מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
You have seen it, O LORD;
do not hold aloof!
O Lord, be not far from me!

translations.hebrew: הָעִ֣ירָה וְ֭הָקִיצָה לְמִשְׁפָּטִ֑י אֱלֹהַ֖י וַאדֹנָ֣י לְרִיבִֽי׃
translations.english:
Wake, rouse Yourself for my cause,
for my claim, O my God and my Lord!

translations.hebrew: שׇׁפְטֵ֣נִי כְ֭צִדְקְךָ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָ֗י וְאַל־יִשְׂמְחוּ־לִֽי׃
translations.english:
Take up my cause, O LORD my God, as You are beneficent,
and let them not rejoice over me.

translations.hebrew: אַל־יֹאמְר֣וּ בְ֭לִבָּם הֶאָ֣ח נַפְשֵׁ֑נוּ אַל־יֹ֝אמְר֗וּ בִּֽלַּעֲנֽוּהוּ׃
translations.english:
Let them not think,
“Aha, just what we wished!”
Let them not say,
“We have destroyed him!”

translations.hebrew: יֵ֘בֹ֤שׁוּ וְיַחְפְּר֨וּ ׀ יַחְדָּו֮ שְׂמֵחֵ֢י רָעָ֫תִ֥י יִֽלְבְּשׁוּ־בֹ֥שֶׁת וּכְלִמָּ֑ה הַֽמַּגְדִּילִ֥ים עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
May those who rejoice at my misfortune
be frustrated and utterly disgraced;
may those who vaunt themselves over me
be clad in frustration and shame.

translations.hebrew: יָרֹ֣נּוּ וְיִשְׂמְחוּ֮ חֲפֵצֵ֢י צִ֫דְקִ֥י וְיֹאמְר֣וּ תָ֭מִיד יִגְדַּ֣ל יְהֹוָ֑ה הֶ֝חָפֵ֗ץ שְׁל֣וֹם עַבְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
May those who desire my vindication
sing forth joyously;
may they always say,
“Extolled be the LORD
who desires the well-being of His servant,”

translations.hebrew: וּ֭לְשׁוֹנִי תֶּהְגֶּ֣ה צִדְקֶ֑ךָ כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
while my tongue shall recite Your beneficent acts,
Your praises all day long.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> לְעֶבֶד־יְהֹוָ֬ה לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. Of the servant of the LORD, of David.

translations.hebrew: נְאֻֽם־פֶּ֣שַׁע לָ֭רָשָׁע בְּקֶ֣רֶב לִבִּ֑י אֵֽין־פַּ֥חַד אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינָֽיו׃
translations.english:
aLit. “In my heart is.”I know-a what Transgression says to the wicked;
he has no sense of the dread of God,

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הֶחֱלִ֣יק אֵלָ֣יו בְּעֵינָ֑יו לִמְצֹ֖א עֲוֺנ֣וֹ לִשְׂנֹֽא׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.because its speech is seductive to him
till his iniquity be found out and he be hated.-b

translations.hebrew: דִּבְרֵי־פִ֭יו אָ֣וֶן וּמִרְמָ֑ה חָדַ֖ל לְהַשְׂכִּ֣יל לְהֵיטִֽיב׃
translations.english:
His words are evil and deceitful;
he will not consider doing good.

translations.hebrew: אָ֤וֶן ׀ יַחְשֹׁ֗ב עַֽל־מִשְׁכָּ֫ב֥וֹ יִ֭תְיַצֵּב עַל־דֶּ֣רֶךְ לֹא־ט֑וֹב רָ֝֗ע לֹ֣א יִמְאָֽס׃
translations.english:
In bed he plots mischief;
he is set on a path of no good,
he does not reject evil.

translations.hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה בְּהַשָּׁמַ֣יִם חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ אֱ֝מ֥וּנָתְךָ֗ עַד־שְׁחָקִֽים׃
translations.english:
O LORD, Your faithfulness reaches to heaven;
Your steadfastness to the sky;

translations.hebrew: צִדְקָתְךָ֨ ׀ כְּֽהַרְרֵי־אֵ֗ל מִ֭שְׁפָּטֶיךָ תְּה֣וֹם רַבָּ֑ה אָ֤דָֽם־וּבְהֵמָ֖ה תוֹשִׁ֣יעַ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Your beneficence is like the high mountains;
Your justice like the great deep;
man and beast You deliver, O LORD.

translations.hebrew: מַה־יָּקָ֥ר חַסְדְּךָ֗ אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים וּבְנֵ֥י אָדָ֑ם בְּצֵ֥ל כְּ֝נָפֶ֗יךָ יֶחֱסָיֽוּן׃
translations.english:
How precious is Your faithful care, O God!
Mankind shelters in the shadow of Your wings.

translations.hebrew: יִ֭רְוְיֻן מִדֶּ֣שֶׁן בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ וְנַ֖חַל עֲדָנֶ֣יךָ תַשְׁקֵֽם׃
translations.english:
They feast on the rich fare of Your house;
You let them drink at Your refreshing stream.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־עִ֭מְּךָ מְק֣וֹר חַיִּ֑ים בְּ֝אוֹרְךָ֗ נִרְאֶה־אֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
With You is the fountain of life;
by Your light do we see light.

translations.hebrew: מְשֹׁ֣ךְ חַ֭סְדְּךָ לְיֹדְעֶ֑יךָ וְ֝צִדְקָתְךָ֗ לְיִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
Bestow Your faithful care on those devoted to You,
and Your beneficence on upright men.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תְּ֭בוֹאֵנִי רֶ֣גֶל גַּאֲוָ֑ה וְיַד־רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים אַל־תְּנִדֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Let not the foot of the arrogant tread on me,
or the hand of the wicked drive me away.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֣ם נָ֭פְלוּ פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן דֹּ֝ח֗וּ וְלֹא־יָ֥כְלוּ קֽוּם׃
translations.english:
There lie the evildoers, fallen,
thrust down, unable to rise.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ אַל־תִּתְחַ֥ר בַּמְּרֵעִ֑ים אַל־תְּ֝קַנֵּ֗א בְּעֹשֵׂ֥י עַוְלָֽה׃
translations.english:
Of David.

Do not be vexed by evil men;
do not be incensed by wrongdoers;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י כֶ֭חָצִיר מְהֵרָ֣ה יִמָּ֑לוּ וּכְיֶ֥רֶק דֶּ֝֗שֶׁא יִבּוֹלֽוּן׃
translations.english:
for they soon wither like grass,
like verdure fade away.

translations.hebrew: בְּטַ֣ח בַּ֭יהֹוָה וַעֲשֵׂה־ט֑וֹב שְׁכׇן־אֶ֝֗רֶץ וּרְעֵ֥ה אֱמוּנָֽה׃
translations.english:
Trust in the LORD and do good,
abide in the land and remain loyal.

translations.hebrew: וְהִתְעַנַּ֥ג עַל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְיִֽתֶּן־לְ֝ךָ֗ מִשְׁאֲלֹ֥ת לִבֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Seek the favor of the LORD,
and He will grant you the desires of your heart.

translations.hebrew: גּ֣וֹל עַל־יְהֹוָ֣ה דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ וּבְטַ֥ח עָ֝לָ֗יו וְה֣וּא יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃
translations.english:
Leave allaLit. “your way.” to the LORD;
trust in Him; He will do it.

translations.hebrew: וְהוֹצִ֣יא כָא֣וֹר צִדְקֶ֑ךָ וּ֝מִשְׁפָּטֶ֗ךָ כַּֽצׇּהֳרָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
He will cause your vindication to shine forth like the light,
the justice of your case, like the noonday sun.

translations.hebrew: דּ֤וֹם ׀ לַיהֹוָה֮ וְהִתְח֢וֹלֵֽ֫ל ל֥וֹ אַל־תִּ֭תְחַר בְּמַצְלִ֣יחַ דַּרְכּ֑וֹ בְּ֝אִ֗ישׁ עֹשֶׂ֥ה מְזִמּֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
Be patient and wait for the LORD,
do not be vexed by the prospering man
who carries out his schemes.

translations.hebrew: הֶ֣רֶף מֵ֭אַף וַעֲזֹ֣ב חֵמָ֑ה אַל־תִּ֝תְחַ֗ר אַךְ־לְהָרֵֽעַ׃
translations.english:
Give up anger, abandon fury,
do not be vexed;
it can only do harm.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־מְ֭רֵעִים יִכָּרֵת֑וּן וְקֹוֵ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הֵ֣מָּה יִֽירְשׁוּ־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
For evil men will be cut off,
but those who look to the LORD—
they shall inherit the land.

translations.hebrew: וְע֣וֹד מְ֭עַט וְאֵ֣ין רָשָׁ֑ע וְהִתְבּוֹנַ֖נְתָּ עַל־מְקוֹמ֣וֹ וְאֵינֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
A little longer and there will be no wicked man;
you will look at where he was—
he will be gone.

translations.hebrew: וַעֲנָוִ֥ים יִֽירְשׁוּ־אָ֑רֶץ וְ֝הִֽתְעַנְּג֗וּ עַל־רֹ֥ב שָׁלֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
But the lowly shall inherit the land,
and delight in abundant well-being.

translations.hebrew: זֹמֵ֣ם רָ֭שָׁע לַצַּדִּ֑יק וְחֹרֵ֖ק עָלָ֣יו שִׁנָּֽיו׃
translations.english:
The wicked man schemes against the righteous,
and gnashes his teeth at him.

translations.hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֥י יִשְׂחַק־ל֑וֹ כִּי־רָ֝אָ֗ה כִּֽי־יָבֹ֥א יוֹמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The Lord laughs at him,
for He knows that his day will come.

translations.hebrew: חֶ֤רֶב ׀ פָּ֥תְח֣וּ רְשָׁעִים֮ וְדָרְכ֢וּ קַ֫שְׁתָּ֥ם לְ֭הַפִּיל עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְי֑וֹן לִ֝טְב֗וֹחַ יִשְׁרֵי־דָֽרֶךְ׃
translations.english:
The wicked draw their swords, bend their bows,
to bring down the lowly and needy,
to slaughter bLit. “those whose way is upright.”upright men.-b

translations.hebrew: חַ֭רְבָּם תָּב֣וֹא בְלִבָּ֑ם וְ֝קַשְּׁתוֹתָ֗ם תִּשָּׁבַֽרְנָה׃
translations.english:
Their swords shall pierce their own hearts,
and their bows shall be broken.

translations.hebrew: טוֹב־מְ֭עַט לַצַּדִּ֑יק מֵ֝הֲמ֗וֹן רְשָׁעִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃
translations.english:
Better the little that the righteous man has
than the great abundance of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י זְרוֹע֣וֹת רְ֭שָׁעִים תִּשָּׁבַ֑רְנָה וְסוֹמֵ֖ךְ צַדִּיקִ֣ים יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
For the arms of the wicked shall be broken,
but the LORD is the support of the righteous.

translations.hebrew: יוֹדֵ֣עַ יְ֭הֹוָה יְמֵ֣י תְמִימִ֑ם וְ֝נַחֲלָתָ֗ם לְעוֹלָ֥ם תִּהְיֶֽה׃
translations.english:
The LORD is concerned for the needscLit. “days.” of the blameless;
their portion lasts forever;

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־יֵ֭בֹשׁוּ בְּעֵ֣ת רָעָ֑ה וּבִימֵ֖י רְעָב֣וֹן יִשְׂבָּֽעוּ׃
translations.english:
they shall not come to grief in bad times;
in famine, they shall eat their fill.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י רְשָׁעִ֨ים ׀ יֹאבֵ֗דוּ וְאֹיְבֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה כִּיקַ֣ר כָּרִ֑ים כָּל֖וּ בֶעָשָׁ֣ן כָּֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
But the wicked shall perish,
and the enemies of the LORD shall be consumed,
like meadow grassdMeaning of Heb. uncertain. consumed in smoke.

translations.hebrew: לֹוֶ֣ה רָ֭שָׁע וְלֹ֣א יְשַׁלֵּ֑ם וְ֝צַדִּ֗יק חוֹנֵ֥ן וְנוֹתֵֽן׃
translations.english:
The wicked man borrows and does not repay;
the righteous is generous and keeps giving.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י מְ֭בֹרָכָיו יִ֣ירְשׁוּ אָ֑רֶץ וּ֝מְקֻלָּלָ֗יו יִכָּרֵֽתוּ׃
translations.english:
Those blessed by Him shall inherit the land,
but those cursed by Him shall be cut off.

translations.hebrew: מֵ֭יְהֹוָה מִֽצְעֲדֵי־גֶ֥בֶר כּוֹנָ֗נוּ וְדַרְכּ֥וֹ יֶחְפָּֽץ׃
translations.english:
The steps of a man are made firm by the LORD,
when He delights in his way.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יִפֹּ֥ל לֹֽא־יוּטָ֑ל כִּֽי־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה סוֹמֵ֥ךְ יָדֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Though he stumbles, he does not fall down,
for the LORD gives him support.

translations.hebrew: נַ֤עַר ׀ הָיִ֗יתִי גַּם־זָ֫קַ֥נְתִּי וְֽלֹא־רָ֭אִיתִי צַדִּ֣יק נֶעֱזָ֑ב וְ֝זַרְע֗וֹ מְבַקֶּשׁ־לָֽחֶם׃
translations.english:
I have been young and am now old,
but I have never seen a righteous man abandoned,
or his children seeking bread.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם חוֹנֵ֣ן וּמַלְוֶ֑ה וְ֝זַרְע֗וֹ לִבְרָכָֽה׃
translations.english:
He is always generous, and lends,
and his children are held blessed.

translations.hebrew: ס֣וּר מֵ֭רָע וַעֲשֵׂה־ט֗וֹב וּשְׁכֹ֥ן לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
Shun evil and do good,
and you shall abide forever.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ אֹ֘הֵ֤ב מִשְׁפָּ֗ט וְלֹא־יַעֲזֹ֣ב אֶת־חֲ֭סִידָיו לְעוֹלָ֣ם נִשְׁמָ֑רוּ וְזֶ֖רַע רְשָׁעִ֣ים נִכְרָֽת׃
translations.english:
For the LORD loves what is right,
He does not abandon His faithful ones.
They are preserved forever,
while the children of the wicked will be cut off.

translations.hebrew: צַדִּיקִ֥ים יִֽירְשׁוּ־אָ֑רֶץ וְיִשְׁכְּנ֖וּ לָעַ֣ד עָלֶֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
The righteous shall inherit the land,
and abide forever in it.

translations.hebrew: פִּֽי־צַ֭דִּיק יֶהְגֶּ֣ה חׇכְמָ֑ה וּ֝לְשׁוֹנ֗וֹ תְּדַבֵּ֥ר מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
The mouth of the righteous utters wisdom,
and his tongue speaks what is right.

translations.hebrew: תּוֹרַ֣ת אֱלֹהָ֣יו בְּלִבּ֑וֹ לֹ֖א תִמְעַ֣ד אֲשֻׁרָֽיו׃
translations.english:
The teaching of his God is in his heart;
his feet do not slip.

translations.hebrew: צוֹפֶ֣ה רָ֭שָׁע לַצַּדִּ֑יק וּ֝מְבַקֵּ֗שׁ לַהֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The wicked watches for the righteous,
seeking to put him to death;

translations.hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה לֹא־יַעַזְבֶ֣נּוּ בְיָד֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א יַ֝רְשִׁיעֶ֗נּוּ בְּהִשָּׁפְטֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
the LORD will not abandon him to his power;
He will not let him be condemned in judgment.

translations.hebrew: קַוֵּ֤ה אֶל־יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ וּשְׁמֹ֬ר דַּרְכּ֗וֹ וִֽ֭ירוֹמִמְךָ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אָ֑רֶץ בְּהִכָּרֵ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תִּרְאֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Look to the LORD and keep to His way,
and He will raise you high that you may inherit the land;
when the wicked are cut off, you shall see it.

translations.hebrew: רָ֭אִיתִי רָשָׁ֣ע עָרִ֑יץ וּ֝מִתְעָרֶ֗ה כְּאֶזְרָ֥ח רַעֲנָֽן׃
translations.english:
I saw a wicked man, powerful,
well-rooted like a robust native tree.

translations.hebrew: וַֽ֭יַּעֲבֹר וְהִנֵּ֣ה אֵינֶ֑נּוּ וָ֝אֲבַקְשֵׁ֗הוּ וְלֹ֣א נִמְצָֽא׃
translations.english:
Suddenly he vanished and was gone;
I sought him, but he was not to be found.

translations.hebrew: שְׁמׇר־תָּ֭ם וּרְאֵ֣ה יָשָׁ֑ר כִּֽי־אַחֲרִ֖ית לְאִ֣ישׁ שָׁלֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
Mark the blameless, note the upright,
for there is a future for the man of integrity.

translations.hebrew: וּֽ֭פֹשְׁעִים נִשְׁמְד֣וּ יַחְדָּ֑ו אַחֲרִ֖ית רְשָׁעִ֣ים נִכְרָֽתָה׃
translations.english:
But transgressors shall be utterly destroyed,
the future of the wicked shall be cut off.

translations.hebrew: וּתְשׁוּעַ֣ת צַ֭דִּיקִים מֵיְהֹוָ֑ה מָ֝עוּזָּ֗ם בְּעֵ֣ת צָרָֽה׃
translations.english:
The deliverance of the righteous comes from the LORD,
their stronghold in time of trouble.

translations.hebrew: וַ֥יַּעְזְרֵ֥ם יְהֹוָ֗ה וַֽיְפַ֫לְּטֵ֥ם יְפַלְּטֵ֣ם מֵ֭רְשָׁעִים וְיוֹשִׁיעֵ֑ם כִּי־חָ֥סוּ בֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The LORD helps them and rescues them,
rescues them from the wicked and delivers them,
for they seek refuge in Him.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֖וֹר לְדָוִ֣ד לְהַזְכִּֽיר׃
translations.english: A psalm of David. Lehazkir.aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה אַל־בְּקֶצְפְּךָ֥ תוֹכִיחֵ֑נִי וּֽבַחֲמָתְךָ֥ תְיַסְּרֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
O LORD, do not punish me in wrath;
do not chastise me in fury.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־חִ֭צֶּיךָ נִ֣חֲתוּ בִ֑י וַתִּנְחַ֖ת עָלַ֣י יָדֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
For Your arrows have struck me;
Your blows have fallen upon me.

translations.hebrew: אֵין־מְתֹ֣ם בִּ֭בְשָׂרִי מִפְּנֵ֣י זַעְמֶ֑ךָ אֵין־שָׁל֥וֹם בַּ֝עֲצָמַ֗י מִפְּנֵ֥י חַטָּאתִֽי׃
translations.english:
There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your rage,
no wholeness in my bones because of my sin.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י עֲ֭וֺנֹתַי עָבְר֣וּ רֹאשִׁ֑י כְּמַשָּׂ֥א כָ֝בֵ֗ד יִכְבְּד֥וּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
For my iniquities have bLit. “passed over my head.”overwhelmed me;-b
they are like a heavy burden, more than I can bear.

translations.hebrew: הִבְאִ֣ישׁוּ נָ֭מַקּוּ חַבּוּרֹתָ֑י מִ֝פְּנֵ֗י אִוַּלְתִּֽי׃
translations.english:
My wounds stink and fester
because of my folly.

translations.hebrew: נַעֲוֵ֣יתִי שַׁחֹ֣תִי עַד־מְאֹ֑ד כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם קֹדֵ֥ר הִלָּֽכְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I am all bent and bowed;
I walk about in gloom all day long.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־כְ֭סָלַי מָלְא֣וּ נִקְלֶ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין מְ֝תֹ֗ם בִּבְשָׂרִֽי׃
translations.english:
For my sinews are full of fever;
there is no soundness in my flesh.

translations.hebrew: נְפוּג֣וֹתִי וְנִדְכֵּ֣יתִי עַד־מְאֹ֑ד שָׁ֝אַ֗גְתִּי מִֽנַּהֲמַ֥ת לִבִּֽי׃
translations.english:
I am all benumbed and crushed;
I roar because of the turmoil in my mind.

translations.hebrew: אֲֽדֹנָ֗י נֶגְדְּךָ֥ כׇל־תַּאֲוָתִ֑י וְ֝אַנְחָתִ֗י מִמְּךָ֥ לֹֽא־נִסְתָּֽרָה׃
translations.english:
O Lord, You are aware of all my entreaties;
my groaning is not hidden from You.

translations.hebrew: לִבִּ֣י סְ֭חַרְחַר עֲזָבַ֣נִי כֹחִ֑י וְֽאוֹר־עֵינַ֥י גַּם־הֵ֝֗ם אֵ֣ין אִתִּֽי׃
translations.english:
My mind reels;
my strength fails me;
my eyes too have lost their luster.

translations.hebrew: אֹֽהֲבַ֨י ׀ וְרֵעַ֗י מִנֶּ֣גֶד נִגְעִ֣י יַעֲמֹ֑דוּ וּ֝קְרוֹבַ֗י מֵרָחֹ֥ק עָמָֽדוּ׃
translations.english:
My friends and companions stand back from my affliction;
my kinsmen stand far off.

translations.hebrew: וַיְנַקְשׁ֤וּ ׀ מְבַקְשֵׁ֬י נַפְשִׁ֗י וְדֹרְשֵׁ֣י רָ֭עָתִי דִּבְּר֣וּ הַוּ֑וֹת וּ֝מִרְמ֗וֹת כׇּל־הַיּ֥וֹם יֶהְגּֽוּ׃
translations.english:
Those who seek my life lay traps;
those who wish me harm speak malice;
they utter deceit all the time.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י כְ֭חֵרֵשׁ לֹ֣א אֶשְׁמָ֑ע וּ֝כְאִלֵּ֗ם לֹ֣א יִפְתַּח־פִּֽיו׃
translations.english:
But I am like a deaf man, unhearing,
like a dumb man who cannot speak up;

translations.hebrew: וָאֱהִ֗י כְּ֭אִישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־שֹׁמֵ֑עַ וְאֵ֥ין בְּ֝פִ֗יו תּוֹכָחֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
I am like one who does not hear,
who has no retort on his lips.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־לְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֣ה הוֹחָ֑לְתִּי אַתָּ֥ה תַ֝עֲנֶ֗ה אֲדֹנָ֥י אֱלֹהָֽי׃
translations.english:
But I wait for You, O LORD;
You will answer, O Lord, my God.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי פֶּן־יִשְׂמְחוּ־לִ֑י בְּמ֥וֹט רַ֝גְלִ֗י עָלַ֥י הִגְדִּֽילוּ׃
translations.english:
For I fear they will rejoice over me;
when my foot gives way they will vaunt themselves against me.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אֲ֭נִי לְצֶ֣לַע נָכ֑וֹן וּמַכְאוֹבִ֖י נֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִֽיד׃
translations.english:
For I am on the verge of collapse;
my pain is always with me.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־עֲוֺנִ֥י אַגִּ֑יד אֶ֝דְאַ֗ג מֵ֖חַטָּאתִֽי׃
translations.english:
I acknowledge my iniquity;
I am fearful over my sin;

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭אֹיְבַי חַיִּ֣ים עָצֵ֑מוּ וְרַבּ֖וּ שֹׂנְאַ֣י שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
for my mortal enemies are numerous;
my treacherous foes are many.

translations.hebrew: וּמְשַׁלְּמֵ֣י רָ֭עָה תַּ֣חַת טוֹבָ֑ה יִ֝שְׂטְנ֗וּנִי תַּ֣חַת (רדופי) [רׇֽדְפִי־]טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
Those who repay evil for good
harass me for pursuing good.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּעַזְבֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֑ה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י אַל־תִּרְחַ֥ק מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
Do not abandon me, O LORD;
my God, be not far from me;

translations.hebrew: ח֥וּשָׁה לְעֶזְרָתִ֑י אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י תְּשׁוּעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
hasten to my aid,
O Lord, my deliverance.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ (לידיתון) [לִֽידוּת֗וּן] מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader; for Jeduthun. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: אָמַ֗רְתִּי אֶ֥שְׁמְרָ֣ה דְרָכַי֮ מֵחֲט֢וֹא בִלְשׁ֫וֹנִ֥י אֶשְׁמְרָ֥ה לְפִ֥י מַחְס֑וֹם בְּעֹ֖ד רָשָׁ֣ע לְנֶגְדִּֽי׃
translations.english:
I resolved I would watch my step
lest I offend by my speech;
I would keep my mouth muzzled
while the wicked man was in my presence.

translations.hebrew: נֶאֱלַ֣מְתִּי ד֭וּמִיָּה הֶחֱשֵׁ֣יתִי מִטּ֑וֹב וּכְאֵבִ֥י נֶעְכָּֽר׃
translations.english:
I was dumb, silent;
I was veryaCf. use of t·wb in Hos. 10.1; Jonah 4.4. still
while my pain was intense.

translations.hebrew: חַם־לִבִּ֨י ׀ בְּקִרְבִּ֗י בַּהֲגִיגִ֥י תִבְעַר־אֵ֑שׁ דִּ֝בַּ֗רְתִּי בִּלְשׁוֹנִֽי׃
translations.english:
My mind was in a rage,
my thoughts were all aflame;
I spoke out:

translations.hebrew: הוֹדִ֘יעֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ קִצִּ֗י וּמִדַּ֣ת יָמַ֣י מַה־הִ֑יא אֵ֝דְעָ֗ה מֶה־חָדֵ֥ל אָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Tell me, O LORD, what my term is,
what is the measure of my days;
I would know how fleeting my life is.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה טְפָח֨וֹת ׀ נָ֘תַ֤תָּה יָמַ֗י וְחֶלְדִּ֣י כְאַ֣יִן נֶגְדֶּ֑ךָ אַ֥ךְ כׇּֽל־הֶ֥בֶל כׇּל־אָ֝דָ֗ם נִצָּ֥ב סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
You have made my life just handbreadths long;
its span is as nothing in Your sight;
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.no man endures any longer than a breath.-b Selah.

translations.hebrew: אַךְ־בְּצֶ֤לֶם ׀ יִֽתְהַלֶּךְ־אִ֗ישׁ אַךְ־הֶ֥בֶל יֶהֱמָי֑וּן יִ֝צְבֹּ֗ר וְֽלֹא־יֵדַ֥ע מִֽי־אֹסְפָֽם׃
translations.english:
Man walks about as a mere shadow;
mere futility is his hustle and bustle,
amassing and not knowing who will gather in.

translations.hebrew: וְעַתָּ֣ה מַה־קִּוִּ֣יתִי אֲדֹנָ֑י תּ֝וֹחַלְתִּ֗י לְךָ֣ הִֽיא׃
translations.english:
What, then, can I count on, O Lord?
In You my hope lies.

translations.hebrew: מִכׇּל־פְּשָׁעַ֥י הַצִּילֵ֑נִי חֶרְפַּ֥ת נָ֝בָ֗ל אַל־תְּשִׂימֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Deliver me from all my transgressions;
make me not the butt of the benighted.

translations.hebrew: נֶ֭אֱלַמְתִּי לֹ֣א אֶפְתַּח־פִּ֑י כִּ֖י אַתָּ֣ה עָשִֽׂיתָ׃
translations.english:
I am dumb, I do not speak up,
for it is Your doing.

translations.hebrew: הָסֵ֣ר מֵעָלַ֣י נִגְעֶ֑ךָ מִתִּגְרַ֥ת יָ֝דְךָ֗ אֲנִ֣י כָלִֽיתִי׃
translations.english:
Take away Your plague from me;
I perish from Your blows.

translations.hebrew: בְּֽתוֹכָ֘ח֤וֹת עַל־עָוֺ֨ן ׀ יִסַּ֬רְתָּ אִ֗ישׁ וַתֶּ֣מֶס כָּעָ֣שׁ חֲמוּד֑וֹ אַ֤ךְ הֶ֖בֶל כׇּל־אָדָ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
You chastise a man in punishment for his sin,
consuming like a moth what he treasures.
No man is more than a breath. Selah.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֥מְעָֽה־תְפִלָּתִ֨י ׀ יְהֹוָ֡ה וְשַׁוְעָתִ֨י ׀ הַאֲזִינָה֮ אֶֽל־דִּמְעָתִ֗י אַֽל־תֶּ֫חֱרַ֥שׁ כִּ֤י גֵ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י עִמָּ֑ךְ תּ֝וֹשָׁ֗ב כְּכׇל־אֲבוֹתָֽי׃
translations.english:
Hear my prayer, O LORD;
give ear to my cry;
do not disregard my tears;
for like all my forebears
I am an alien, resident with You.

translations.hebrew: הָשַׁ֣ע מִמֶּ֣נִּי וְאַבְלִ֑יגָה בְּטֶ֖רֶם אֵלֵ֣ךְ וְאֵינֶֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
Look away from me, bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.that I may recover,-b
before I pass away and am gone.

translations.hebrew: לַ֝מְנַצֵּ֗חַ לְדָוִ֥ד מִזְמֽוֹר׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: קַוֺּ֣ה קִוִּ֣יתִי יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֵּ֥ט אֵ֝לַ֗י וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע שַׁוְעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
I put my hope in the LORD;
He inclined toward me,
and heeded my cry.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּעֲלֵ֤נִי ׀ מִבּ֥וֹר שָׁאוֹן֮ מִטִּ֢יט הַיָּ֫וֵ֥ן וַיָּ֖קֶם עַל־סֶ֥לַע רַגְלַ֗י כּוֹנֵ֥ן אֲשֻׁרָֽי׃
translations.english:
He lifted me out of the miry pit,
the slimy clay,
and set my feet on a rock,
steadied my legs.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֬ן בְּפִ֨י ׀ שִׁ֥יר חָדָשׁ֮ תְּהִלָּ֢ה לֵאלֹ֫הֵ֥ינוּ יִרְא֣וּ רַבִּ֣ים וְיִירָ֑אוּ וְ֝יִבְטְח֗וּ בַּיהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
He put a new song into my mouth,
a hymn to our God.
May many see it and stand in awe,
and trust in the LORD.

translations.hebrew: אַ֥שְֽׁרֵי־הַגֶּ֗בֶר אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם יְ֭הֹוָה מִבְטַח֑וֹ וְֽלֹא־פָנָ֥ה אֶל־רְ֝הָבִ֗ים וְשָׂטֵ֥י כָזָֽב׃
translations.english:
Happy is the man who makes the LORD his trust,
who turns not to the arrogant or to followers of falsehood.

translations.hebrew: רַבּ֤וֹת עָשִׂ֨יתָ ׀ אַתָּ֤ה ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהַי֮ נִ֥פְלְאֹתֶ֥יךָ וּמַחְשְׁבֹתֶ֗יךָ אֵ֫לֵ֥ינוּ אֵ֤ין ׀ עֲרֹ֬ךְ אֵלֶ֗יךָ אַגִּ֥ידָה וַאֲדַבֵּ֑רָה עָ֝צְמ֗וּ מִסַּפֵּֽר׃
translations.english:
aOr “You, O Lord my God, have done many things—/ the wonders You have devised for us; / none can equal You.”You, O LORD my God, have done many things;
the wonders You have devised for us
cannot be set out before You;-a
I would rehearse the tale of them,
but they are more than can be told.

translations.hebrew: זֶ֤בַח וּמִנְחָ֨ה ׀ לֹֽא־חָפַ֗צְתָּ אׇ֭זְנַיִם כָּרִ֣יתָ לִּ֑י עוֹלָ֥ה וַ֝חֲטָאָ֗ה לֹ֣א שָׁאָֽלְתָּ׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.You gave me to understand that-b
You do not desire sacrifice and meal offering;
You do not ask for burnt offering and sin offering.

translations.hebrew: אָ֣ז אָ֭מַרְתִּי הִנֵּה־בָ֑אתִי בִּמְגִלַּת־סֵ֝֗פֶר כָּת֥וּב עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
Then I said,
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.“See, I will bring a scroll recounting what befell me.”-b

translations.hebrew: לַ֥עֲשׂוֹת־רְצוֹנְךָ֣ אֱלֹהַ֣י חָפָ֑צְתִּי וְ֝ת֥וֹרָתְךָ֗ בְּת֣וֹךְ מֵעָֽי׃
translations.english:
To do what pleases You, my God, is my desire;
Your teaching is in my inmost parts.

translations.hebrew: בִּשַּׂ֤רְתִּי צֶ֨דֶק ׀ בְּקָ֘הָ֤ל רָ֗ב הִנֵּ֣ה שְׂ֭פָתַי לֹ֣א אֶכְלָ֑א יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אַתָּ֥ה יָדָֽעְתָּ׃
translations.english:
I proclaimed [Your] righteousness in a great congregation;
see, I did not withhold my words;
O LORD, You must know it.

translations.hebrew: צִדְקָתְךָ֬ לֹֽא־כִסִּ֨יתִי ׀ בְּת֬וֹךְ לִבִּ֗י אֱמוּנָתְךָ֣ וּתְשׁוּעָתְךָ֣ אָמָ֑רְתִּי לֹא־כִחַ֥דְתִּי חַסְדְּךָ֥ וַ֝אֲמִתְּךָ֗ לְקָהָ֥ל רָֽב׃
translations.english:
I did not keep Your beneficence to myself;
I declared Your faithful deliverance;
I did not fail to speak of Your steadfast love in a great congregation.

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָ֗ה לֹֽא־תִכְלָ֣א רַחֲמֶ֣יךָ מִמֶּ֑נִּי חַסְדְּךָ֥ וַ֝אֲמִתְּךָ֗ תָּמִ֥יד יִצְּרֽוּנִי׃
translations.english:
O LORD, You will not withhold from me Your compassion;
Your steadfast love will protect me always.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אָפְפֽוּ־עָלַ֨י ׀ רָע֡וֹת עַד־אֵ֬ין מִסְפָּ֗ר הִשִּׂיג֣וּנִי עֲ֭וֺנֹתַי וְלֹא־יָכֹ֣לְתִּי לִרְא֑וֹת עָצְמ֥וּ מִשַּׂעֲר֥וֹת רֹ֝אשִׁ֗י וְלִבִּ֥י עֲזָבָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
For misfortunes without number envelop me;
my iniquities have caught up with me;
I cannot see;
they are more than the hairs of my head;
cOr “my courage fails me.”I am at my wits’ end.-c

translations.hebrew: רְצֵ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה לְהַצִּילֵ֑נִי יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי חֽוּשָׁה׃
translations.english:
dWith vv. 14–18, cf. Ps. 70.O favor me, LORD, and save me;
O LORD, hasten to my aid.

translations.hebrew: יֵ֘בֹ֤שׁוּ וְיַחְפְּר֨וּ ׀ יַחַד֮ מְבַקְשֵׁ֥י נַפְשִׁ֗י לִסְפּ֫וֹתָ֥הּ יִסֹּ֣גוּ אָ֭חוֹר וְיִכָּלְמ֑וּ חֲ֝פֵצֵ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Let those who seek to destroy my life
be frustrated and disgraced;
let those who wish me harm
fall back in shame.

translations.hebrew: יָ֭שֹׁמּוּ עַל־עֵ֣קֶב בׇּשְׁתָּ֑ם הָאֹמְרִ֥ים לִ֝֗י הֶ֘אָ֥ח <small>׀</small> הֶאָֽח׃
translations.english:
Let those who say “Aha! Aha!” over me
be desolate because of their frustration.

translations.hebrew: יָ֘שִׂ֤ישׂוּ וְיִשְׂמְח֨וּ ׀ בְּךָ֗ כׇּֽל־מְבַ֫קְשֶׁ֥יךָ יֹאמְר֣וּ תָ֭מִיד יִגְדַּ֣ל יְהֹוָ֑ה אֹ֝הֲבֵ֗י תְּשׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
But let all who seek You be glad and rejoice in You;
let those who are eager for Your deliverance always say,
“Extolled be the LORD!”

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְיוֹן֮ אֲדֹנָ֢י יַחֲשׇׁ֫ב־לִ֥י עֶזְרָתִ֣י וּמְפַלְטִ֣י אַ֑תָּה אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י אַל־תְּאַחַֽר׃
translations.english:
But I am poor and needy;
may the Lord devise [deliverance] for me.
You are my help and my rescuer;
my God, do not delay.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭שְׁרֵי מַשְׂכִּ֣יל אֶל־דָּ֑ל בְּי֥וֹם רָ֝עָ֗ה יְֽמַלְּטֵ֥הוּ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Happy is he who is thoughtful of the wretched;
in bad times may the LORD keep him from harm.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ יִשְׁמְרֵ֣הוּ וִ֭יחַיֵּהוּ (יאשר) [וְאֻשַּׁ֣ר] בָּאָ֑רֶץ וְאַֽל־תִּ֝תְּנֵ֗הוּ בְּנֶ֣פֶשׁ אֹיְבָֽיו׃
translations.english:
May the LORD guard him and preserve him;
and may he be thought happy in the land.
Do not subject him to the will of his enemies.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה יִ֭סְעָדֶנּוּ עַל־עֶ֣רֶשׂ דְּוָ֑י כׇּל־מִ֝שְׁכָּב֗וֹ הָפַ֥כְתָּ בְחׇלְיֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The LORD will sustain him on his sickbed;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.You shall wholly transform his bed of suffering.-a

translations.hebrew: אֲֽנִי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי יְהֹוָ֣ה חׇנֵּ֑נִי רְפָאָ֥ה נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י כִּי־חָטָ֥אתִי לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
I said, “O LORD, have mercy on me,
heal me, for I have sinned against You.”

translations.hebrew: אוֹיְבַ֗י יֹאמְר֣וּ רַ֣ע לִ֑י מָתַ֥י יָ֝מ֗וּת וְאָבַ֥ד שְׁמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
My enemies speak evilly of me,
“When will he die and his name perish?”

translations.hebrew: וְאִם־בָּ֤א לִרְא֨וֹת ׀ שָׁ֤וְא יְדַבֵּ֗ר לִבּ֗וֹ יִקְבׇּץ־אָ֥וֶן ל֑וֹ יֵצֵ֖א לַח֣וּץ יְדַבֵּֽר׃
translations.english:
If one comes to visit, he speaks falsely;
his mind stores up evil thoughts;
once outside, he speaks them.

translations.hebrew: יַ֗חַד עָלַ֣י יִ֭תְלַחֲשׁוּ כׇּל־שֹׂנְאָ֑י עָלַ֓י ׀ יַחְשְׁב֖וּ רָעָ֣ה לִֽי׃
translations.english:
All my enemies whisper together against me,
imagining the worst for me.

translations.hebrew: דְּֽבַר־בְּ֭לִיַּעַל יָצ֣וּק בּ֑וֹ וַאֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁ֝כַ֗ב לֹא־יוֹסִ֥יף לָקֽוּם׃
translations.english:
“Something baneful has settled in him;
he’ll not rise from his bed again.”

translations.hebrew: גַּם־אִ֤ישׁ שְׁלוֹמִ֨י ׀ אֲשֶׁר־בָּטַ֣חְתִּי ב֭וֹ אוֹכֵ֣ל לַחְמִ֑י הִגְדִּ֖יל עָלַ֣י עָקֵֽב׃
translations.english:
My ally in whom I trusted,
even he who shares my bread,
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.has been utterly false to me.-a

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָ֗ה חׇנֵּ֥נִי וַהֲקִימֵ֑נִי וַאֲשַׁלְּמָ֥ה לָהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
But You, O LORD, have mercy on me;
let me rise again and repay them.

translations.hebrew: בְּזֹ֣את יָ֭דַעְתִּי כִּֽי־חָפַ֣צְתָּ בִּ֑י כִּ֤י לֹֽא־יָרִ֖יעַ אֹיְבִ֣י עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
Then shall I know that You are pleased with me:
when my enemy cannot shout in triumph over me.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י בְּ֭תֻמִּי תָּמַ֣כְתָּ בִּ֑י וַתַּצִּיבֵ֖נִי לְפָנֶ֣יךָ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
You will support me because of my integrity,
and let me abide in Your presence forever.

translations.hebrew: בָּ֘ר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מֵֽ֭הָעוֹלָם וְעַ֥ד הָעוֹלָ֗ם אָ֘מֵ֥ן ׀ וְאָמֵֽן׃
translations.english:
Blessed is the LORD, God of Israel,
from eternity to eternity.
Amen and Amen.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לִבְנֵי־קֹֽרַח׃
translations.english: For the leader. A maskil of the Korahites.

translations.hebrew: כְּאַיָּ֗ל תַּעֲרֹ֥ג עַל־אֲפִֽיקֵי־מָ֑יִם כֵּ֤ן נַפְשִׁ֨י תַעֲרֹ֖ג אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
Like a hind crying for water,aLit. “watercourses.”
my soul cries for You, O God;

translations.hebrew: צָמְאָ֬ה נַפְשִׁ֨י ׀ לֵאלֹהִים֮ לְאֵ֢ל חָ֥֫י מָתַ֥י אָב֑וֹא וְ֝אֵרָאֶ֗ה פְּנֵ֣י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
my soul thirsts for God, the living God;
O when will I come to appear before God!

translations.hebrew: הָֽיְתָה־לִּ֬י דִמְעָתִ֣י לֶ֭חֶם יוֹמָ֣ם וָלָ֑יְלָה בֶּאֱמֹ֥ר אֵלַ֥י כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם אַיֵּ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
My tears have been my food day and night;
I am ever taunted with, “Where is your God?”

translations.hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה אֶזְכְּרָ֨ה ׀ וְאֶשְׁפְּכָ֬ה עָלַ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁ֗י כִּ֤י אֶעֱבֹ֨ר ׀ בַּסָּךְ֮ אֶדַּדֵּ֗ם עַד־בֵּ֥ית־אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים בְּקוֹל־רִנָּ֥ה וְתוֹדָ֗ה הָמ֥וֹן חוֹגֵֽג׃
translations.english:
When I think of this, I pour out my soul:
how I bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.walked with the crowd, moved with them,-b
the festive throng, to the House of God
with joyous shouts of praise.

translations.hebrew: מַה־תִּשְׁתּ֬וֹחֲחִ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ וַתֶּהֱמִ֢י עָ֫לָ֥י הוֹחִ֣לִי לֵ֭אלֹהִים כִּי־ע֥וֹד אוֹדֶ֗נּוּ יְשׁוּע֥וֹת פָּנָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Why so downcast, my soul,
why disquieted within me?
Have hope in God;
I will yet praise Him
cSeveral ancient versions and Heb. mss. connect the first word in v. 7 with the end of 6, reading yeshu‘ot panai we’Elohai, “my ever-present help, my God,” as in vv. 12 and Ps. 43.5.for His saving presence.-c

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהַ֗י עָלַי֮ נַפְשִׁ֢י תִשְׁתּ֫וֹחָ֥ח עַל־כֵּ֗ן אֶ֭זְכׇּרְךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ יַרְדֵּ֑ן וְ֝חֶרְמוֹנִ֗ים מֵהַ֥ר מִצְעָֽר׃
translations.english:
O my God, my soul is downcast;
therefore I think of You
in this land of Jordan and Hermon,
in Mount Mizar,

translations.hebrew: תְּהוֹם־אֶל־תְּה֣וֹם ק֭וֹרֵא לְק֣וֹל צִנּוֹרֶ֑יךָ כׇּֽל־מִשְׁבָּרֶ֥יךָ וְ֝גַלֶּ֗יךָ עָלַ֥י עָבָֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
where deep calls to deep
in the roar of bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Your cataracts;-b
all Your breakers and billows have swept over me.

translations.hebrew: יוֹמָ֤ם ׀ יְצַוֶּ֬ה יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ חַסְדּ֗וֹ וּ֭בַלַּיְלָה שִׁירֹ֣ה עִמִּ֑י תְּ֝פִלָּ֗ה לְאֵ֣ל חַיָּֽי׃
translations.english:
By day may the LORD vouchsafe His faithful care,
so that at night a song to Him may be with me,
a prayer to the God of my life.

translations.hebrew: אוֹמְרָ֤ה ׀ לְאֵ֥ל סַלְעִי֮ לָמָ֢ה שְׁכַ֫חְתָּ֥נִי לָֽמָּה־קֹדֵ֥ר אֵלֵ֗ךְ בְּלַ֣חַץ אוֹיֵֽב׃
translations.english:
I say to God, my rock,
“Why have You forgotten me,
why must I walk in gloom,
oppressed by my enemy?”

translations.hebrew: בְּרֶ֤צַח ׀ בְּֽעַצְמוֹתַ֗י חֵרְפ֥וּנִי צוֹרְרָ֑י בְּאׇמְרָ֥ם אֵלַ֥י כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם אַיֵּ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Crushing my bones,-b
my foes revile me,
taunting me always with, “Where is your God?”

translations.hebrew: מַה־תִּשְׁתּ֬וֹחֲחִ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ וּֽמַה־תֶּהֱמִ֢י עָ֫לָ֥י הוֹחִ֣ילִי לֵ֭אלֹהִים כִּי־ע֣וֹד אוֹדֶ֑נּוּ יְשׁוּעֹ֥ת פָּ֝נַ֗י וֵאלֹהָֽי׃
translations.english:
Why so downcast, my soul,
why disquieted within me?
Have hope in God;
I will yet praise Him,
my ever-present help, my God.

translations.hebrew: שׇׁפְטֵ֤נִי אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ וְרִ֘יבָ֤ה רִיבִ֗י מִגּ֥וֹי לֹֽא־חָסִ֑יד מֵ֤אִישׁ־מִרְמָ֖ה וְעַוְלָ֣ה תְפַלְּטֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
aA continuation of Ps. 42.Vindicate me, O God,
champion my cause
against faithless people;
rescue me from the treacherous, dishonest man.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־אַתָּ֤ה ׀ אֱלֹהֵ֣י מָעוּזִּי֮ לָמָ֢ה זְנַ֫חְתָּ֥נִי לָֽמָּה־קֹדֵ֥ר אֶתְהַלֵּ֗ךְ בְּלַ֣חַץ אוֹיֵֽב׃
translations.english:
For You are my God, my stronghold;
why have You rejected me?
Why must I walk in gloom,
oppressed by the enemy?

translations.hebrew: שְׁלַח־אוֹרְךָ֣ וַ֭אֲמִתְּךָ הֵ֣מָּה יַנְח֑וּנִי יְבִיא֥וּנִי אֶל־הַֽר־קׇ֝דְשְׁךָ֗ וְאֶל־מִשְׁכְּנוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Send forth Your light and Your truth;
they will lead me;
they will bring me to Your holy mountain,
to Your dwelling-place,

translations.hebrew: וְאָב֤וֹאָה ׀ אֶל־מִזְבַּ֬ח אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֶל־אֵל֮ שִׂמְחַ֢ת גִּ֫ילִ֥י וְאוֹדְךָ֥ בְכִנּ֗וֹר אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֱלֹהָֽי׃
translations.english:
that I may come to the altar of God,
God, my delight, my joy;
that I may praise You with the lyre,
O God, my God.

translations.hebrew: מַה־תִּשְׁתּ֬וֹחֲחִ֨י ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ וּֽמַה־תֶּהֱמִ֢י עָ֫לָ֥י הוֹחִ֣ילִי לֵ֭אלֹהִים כִּי־ע֣וֹד אוֹדֶ֑נּוּ יְשׁוּעֹ֥ת פָּ֝נַ֗י וֵאלֹהָֽי׃
translations.english:
Why so downcast, my soul,
why disquieted within me?
Have hope in God;
I will yet praise Him,
my ever-present help, my God.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃
translations.english: For the leader. Of the Korahites. A maskil.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ בְּאׇזְנֵ֬ינוּ שָׁמַ֗עְנוּ אֲבוֹתֵ֥ינוּ סִפְּרוּ־לָ֑נוּ פֹּ֥עַל פָּעַ֥לְתָּ בִ֝ימֵיהֶ֗ם בִּ֣ימֵי קֶֽדֶם׃
translations.english:
We have heard, O God,
our fathers have told us
the deeds You performed in their time,
in days of old.

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה ׀ יָדְךָ֡ גּוֹיִ֣ם ה֭וֹרַשְׁתָּ וַתִּטָּעֵ֑ם תָּרַ֥ע לְ֝אֻמִּ֗ים וַֽתְּשַׁלְּחֵֽם׃
translations.english:
With Your hand You planted them,
displacing nations;
You brought misfortune on peoples,
and drove them out.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֪א בְחַרְבָּ֡ם יָ֥רְשׁוּ אָ֗רֶץ וּזְרוֹעָם֮ לֹא־הוֹשִׁ֢יעָ֫ה לָּ֥מוֹ כִּֽי־יְמִינְךָ֣ וּ֭זְרוֹעֲךָ וְא֥וֹר פָּנֶ֗יךָ כִּ֣י רְצִיתָֽם׃
translations.english:
It was not by their sword that they took the land,
their arm did not give them victory,
but Your right hand, Your arm, and Your goodwill,
for You favored them.

translations.hebrew: אַתָּה־ה֣וּא מַלְכִּ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים צַ֝וֵּ֗ה יְשׁוּע֥וֹת יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
You are my king, O God;
decree victories for Jacob!

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭ךָ צָרֵ֣ינוּ נְנַגֵּ֑חַ בְּ֝שִׁמְךָ֗ נָב֥וּס קָמֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
Through You we gore our foes;
by Your name we trample our adversaries;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א בְקַשְׁתִּ֣י אֶבְטָ֑ח וְ֝חַרְבִּ֗י לֹ֣א תוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
I do not trust in my bow;
it is not my sword that gives me victory;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י ה֭וֹשַׁעְתָּנוּ מִצָּרֵ֑ינוּ וּמְשַׂנְאֵ֥ינוּ הֱבִישֽׁוֹתָ׃
translations.english:
You give us victory over our foes;
You thwart those who hate us.

translations.hebrew: בֵּ֭אלֹהִים הִלַּ֣לְנוּ כׇל־הַיּ֑וֹם וְשִׁמְךָ֓ ׀ לְעוֹלָ֖ם נוֹדֶ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
In God we glory at all times,
and praise Your name unceasingly. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אַף־זָ֭נַחְתָּ וַתַּכְלִימֵ֑נוּ וְלֹא־תֵ֝צֵ֗א בְּצִבְאוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
Yet You have rejected and disgraced us;
You do not go with our armies.

translations.hebrew: תְּשִׁיבֵ֣נוּ אָ֭חוֹר מִנִּי־צָ֑ר וּ֝מְשַׂנְאֵ֗ינוּ שָׁ֣סוּ לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
You make us retreat before our foe;
our enemies plunder us at will.

translations.hebrew: תִּ֭תְּנֵנוּ כְּצֹ֣אן מַאֲכָ֑ל וּ֝בַגּוֹיִ֗ם זֵרִיתָֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
You let them devour us like sheep;
You disperse us among the nations.

translations.hebrew: תִּמְכֹּֽר־עַמְּךָ֥ בְלֹא־ה֑וֹן וְלֹֽא־רִ֝בִּ֗יתָ בִּמְחִירֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
You sell Your people for no fortune,
You set no high price on them.

translations.hebrew: תְּשִׂימֵ֣נוּ חֶ֭רְפָּה לִשְׁכֵנֵ֑ינוּ לַ֥עַג וָ֝קֶ֗לֶס לִסְבִיבוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
You make us the butt of our neighbors,
the scorn and derision of those around us.

translations.hebrew: תְּשִׂימֵ֣נוּ מָ֭שָׁל בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם מְנֽוֹד־רֹ֝֗אשׁ בַּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
You make us a byword among the nations,
a laughingstockaLit. “a wagging of the head.” among the peoples.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם כְּלִמָּתִ֣י נֶגְדִּ֑י וּבֹ֖שֶׁת פָּנַ֣י כִּסָּֽתְנִי׃
translations.english:
I am always aware of my disgrace;
I am wholly covered with shame

translations.hebrew: מִ֭קּוֹל מְחָרֵ֣ף וּמְגַדֵּ֑ף מִפְּנֵ֥י א֝וֹיֵ֗ב וּמִתְנַקֵּֽם׃
translations.english:
at the sound of taunting revilers,
in the presence of the vengeful foe.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־זֹ֣את בָּ֭אַתְנוּ וְלֹ֣א שְׁכַחֲנ֑וּךָ וְלֹֽא־שִׁ֝קַּ֗רְנוּ בִּבְרִיתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
All this has come upon us,
yet we have not forgotten You,
or been false to Your covenant.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־נָס֣וֹג אָח֣וֹר לִבֵּ֑נוּ וַתֵּ֥ט אֲ֝שֻׁרֵ֗ינוּ מִנִּ֥י אׇרְחֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Our hearts have not gone astray,
nor have our feet swerved from Your path,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י דִ֭כִּיתָנוּ בִּמְק֣וֹם תַּנִּ֑ים וַתְּכַ֖ס עָלֵ֣ינוּ בְצַלְמָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
though You cast us, crushed, to where the bHeb. tannim = tannin, as in Ezek. 29.3 and 32.2.sea monster-b is,
and covered us over with deepest darkness.

translations.hebrew: אִם־שָׁ֭כַחְנוּ שֵׁ֣ם אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וַנִּפְרֹ֥שׂ כַּ֝פֵּ֗ינוּ לְאֵ֣ל זָֽר׃
translations.english:
If we forgot the name of our God
and spread forth our hands to a foreign god,

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹ֣א אֱ֭לֹהִים יַחֲקׇר־זֹ֑את כִּי־ה֥וּא יֹ֝דֵ֗עַ תַּעֲלֻמ֥וֹת לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
God would surely search it out,
for He knows the secrets of the heart.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־עָ֭לֶיךָ הֹרַ֣גְנוּ כׇל־הַיּ֑וֹם נֶ֝חְשַׁ֗בְנוּ כְּצֹ֣אן טִבְחָֽה׃
translations.english:
It is for Your sake that we are slain all day long,
that we are regarded as sheep to be slaughtered.

translations.hebrew: ע֤וּרָה ׀ לָ֖מָּה תִישַׁ֥ן ׀ אֲדֹנָ֑י הָ֝קִ֗יצָה אַל־תִּזְנַ֥ח לָנֶֽצַח׃
translations.english:
Rouse Yourself; why do You sleep, O Lord?
Awaken, do not reject us forever!

translations.hebrew: לָֽמָּה־פָנֶ֥יךָ תַסְתִּ֑יר תִּשְׁכַּ֖ח עׇנְיֵ֣נוּ וְֽלַחֲצֵֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Why do You hide Your face,
ignoring our affliction and distress?

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁ֣חָה לֶעָפָ֣ר נַפְשֵׁ֑נוּ דָּבְקָ֖ה לָאָ֣רֶץ בִּטְנֵֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
We lie prostrate in the dust;
our body clings to the ground.

translations.hebrew: ק֭וּמָֽה עֶזְרָ֣תָה לָּ֑נוּ וּ֝פְדֵ֗נוּ לְמַ֣עַן חַסְדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Arise and help us,
redeem us, as befits Your faithfulness.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ עַל־שֹׁ֭שַׁנִּים לִבְנֵי־קֹ֑רַח מַ֝שְׂכִּ֗יל שִׁ֣יר יְדִידֹֽת׃
translations.english: For the leader; aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.on shoshannim.-a Of the Korahites. A maskil. A love song.

translations.hebrew: רָ֘חַ֤שׁ לִבִּ֨י ׀ דָּ֘בָ֤ר ט֗וֹב אֹמֵ֣ר אָ֭נִי מַעֲשַׂ֣י לְמֶ֑לֶךְ לְ֝שׁוֹנִ֗י עֵ֤ט ׀ סוֹפֵ֬ר מָהִֽיר׃
translations.english:
My heart is astir with gracious words;
I speak my poem to a king;
my tongue is the pen of an expert scribe.

translations.hebrew: יׇפְיָפִ֡יתָ מִבְּנֵ֬י אָדָ֗ם ה֣וּצַק חֵ֭ן בְּשִׂפְתוֹתֶ֑יךָ עַל־כֵּ֤ן בֵּרַכְךָ֖ אֱלֹהִ֣ים לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
You are fairer than all men;
your speech is endowed with grace;
rightly has God given you an eternal blessing.

translations.hebrew: חֲגֽוֹר־חַרְבְּךָ֣ עַל־יָרֵ֣ךְ גִּבּ֑וֹר ה֝וֹדְךָ֗ וַהֲדָרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Gird your sword upon your thigh, O hero,
in your splendor and glory;

translations.hebrew: וַהֲדָ֬רְךָ֨ ׀ צְלַ֬ח רְכַ֗ב עַֽל־דְּבַר־אֱ֭מֶת וְעַנְוָה־צֶ֑דֶק וְתוֹרְךָ֖ נוֹרָא֣וֹת יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.in your glory, win success;
ride on in the cause of truth and meekness and right;
and let your right hand lead you to awesome deeds.-a

translations.hebrew: חִצֶּ֗יךָ שְׁנ֫וּנִ֥ים עַ֭מִּים תַּחְתֶּ֣יךָ יִפְּל֑וּ בְּ֝לֵ֗ב אוֹיְבֵ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
translations.english:
Your arrows, sharpened,
bOrder of Heb. clauses inverted for clarity.[pierce] the breast of the king’s enemies;
peoples fall at your feet.-b

translations.hebrew: כִּסְאֲךָ֣ אֱ֭לֹהִים עוֹלָ֣ם וָעֶ֑ד שֵׁ֥בֶט מִ֝ישֹׁ֗ר שֵׁ֣בֶט מַלְכוּתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Your cCf. 1 Chron. 29.23.divine throne-c is everlasting;
your royal scepter is a scepter of equity.

translations.hebrew: אָהַ֣בְתָּ צֶּדֶק֮ וַתִּשְׂנָ֫א־רֶ֥שַׁע עַל־כֵּ֤ן ׀ מְשָׁחֲךָ֡ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֱ֭לֹהֶיךָ שֶׁ֥מֶן שָׂשׂ֗וֹן מֵחֲבֵרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
You love righteousness and hate wickedness;
rightly has God, your God, chosen to anoint you
with oil of gladness over all your peers.

translations.hebrew: מֹר־וַאֲהָל֣וֹת קְ֭צִיעוֹת כׇּל־בִּגְדֹתֶ֑יךָ מִֽן־הֵ֥יכְלֵי שֵׁ֝֗ן מִנִּ֥י שִׂמְּחֽוּךָ׃
translations.english:
All your robes [are fragrant] with
myrrh and aloes and cassia;
from ivoried palaces
lutes entertain you.

translations.hebrew: בְּנ֣וֹת מְ֭לָכִים בְּיִקְּרוֹתֶ֑יךָ נִצְּבָ֥ה שֵׁגַ֥ל לִ֝ימִינְךָ֗ בְּכֶ֣תֶם אוֹפִֽיר׃
translations.english:
Royal princesses are your favorites;
the consort stands at your right hand,
decked in gold of Ophir.

translations.hebrew: שִׁמְעִי־בַ֣ת וּ֭רְאִי וְהַטִּ֣י אׇזְנֵ֑ךְ וְשִׁכְחִ֥י עַ֝מֵּ֗ךְ וּבֵ֥ית אָבִֽיךְ׃
translations.english:
Take heed, lass, and note,
incline your ear:
forget your people and your father’s house,

translations.hebrew: וְיִתְאָ֣ו הַמֶּ֣לֶךְ יׇפְיֵ֑ךְ כִּי־ה֥וּא אֲ֝דֹנַ֗יִךְ וְהִשְׁתַּֽחֲוִי־לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
and let the king be aroused by your beauty;
since he is your lord, bow to him.

translations.hebrew: וּבַֽת־צֹ֨ר ׀ בְּ֭מִנְחָה פָּנַ֥יִךְ יְחַלּ֗וּ עֲשִׁ֣ירֵי עָֽם׃
translations.english:
O Tyrian lass,
the wealthiest people will court your favor with gifts,

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־כְּבוּדָּ֣ה בַת־מֶ֣לֶךְ פְּנִ֑ימָה מִֽמִּשְׁבְּצ֖וֹת זָהָ֣ב לְבוּשָֽׁהּ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.goods of all sorts.

The royal princess,
her dress embroidered with golden mountings,

translations.hebrew: לִרְקָמוֹת֮ תּוּבַ֢ל לַ֫מֶּ֥לֶךְ בְּתוּל֣וֹת אַ֭חֲרֶיהָ רֵעוֹתֶ֑יהָ מ֖וּבָא֣וֹת לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
is led inside to the king;-a
maidens in her train, her companions,
are presented to you.

translations.hebrew: תּ֭וּבַלְנָה בִּשְׂמָחֹ֣ת וָגִ֑יל תְּ֝בֹאֶ֗ינָה בְּהֵ֣יכַל מֶֽלֶךְ׃
translations.english:
They are led in with joy and gladness;
they enter the palace of the king.

translations.hebrew: תַּ֣חַת אֲ֭בֹתֶיךָ יִהְי֣וּ בָנֶ֑יךָ תְּשִׁיתֵ֥מוֹ לְ֝שָׂרִ֗ים בְּכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Your sons will succeed your ancestors;
you will appoint them princes throughout the land.

translations.hebrew: אַזְכִּ֣ירָה שִׁ֭מְךָ בְּכׇל־דֹּ֣ר וָדֹ֑ר עַל־כֵּ֥ן עַמִּ֥ים יְ֝הוֹד֗וּךָ לְעֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
translations.english:
I commemorate your fame for all generations,
so peoples will praise you forever and ever.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ לִבְנֵי־קֹ֑רַח עַֽל־עֲלָמ֥וֹת שִֽׁיר׃
translations.english:
For the leader. Of the Korahites;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.on alamoth.-a A song.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֣ים לָ֭נוּ מַחֲסֶ֣ה וָעֹ֑ז עֶזְרָ֥ה בְ֝צָר֗וֹת נִמְצָ֥א מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
God is our refuge and stronghold,
a help in trouble, very near.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֣ן לֹֽא־נִ֭ירָא בְּהָמִ֣יר אָ֑רֶץ וּבְמ֥וֹט הָ֝רִ֗ים בְּלֵ֣ב יַמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
Therefore we are not afraid
though the earth reels,
though mountains topple into the sea—

translations.hebrew: יֶהֱמ֣וּ יֶחְמְר֣וּ מֵימָ֑יו יִ֥רְעֲשֽׁוּ־הָרִ֖ים בְּגַאֲוָת֣וֹ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
its waters rage and foam;
in its swell mountains quake. Selah.

translations.hebrew: נָהָ֗ר פְּלָגָ֗יו יְשַׂמְּח֥וּ עִיר־אֱלֹהִ֑ים קְ֝דֹ֗שׁ מִשְׁכְּנֵ֥י עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
There is a river whose streams gladden God’s city,
the holy dwelling-place of the Most High.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֣ים בְּ֭קִרְבָּהּ בַּל־תִּמּ֑וֹט יַעְזְרֶ֥הָ אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לִפְנ֥וֹת בֹּֽקֶר׃
translations.english:
God is in its midst, it will not be toppled;
by daybreak God will come to its aid.

translations.hebrew: הָמ֣וּ ג֭וֹיִם מָ֣טוּ מַמְלָכ֑וֹת נָתַ֥ן בְּ֝קוֹל֗וֹ תָּמ֥וּג אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Nations rage, kingdoms topple;
at the sound of His thunder the earth dissolves.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֣וֹת עִמָּ֑נוּ מִשְׂגָּֽב־לָ֨נוּ אֱלֹהֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
The LORD of hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our haven. Selah.

translations.hebrew: לְֽכוּ־חֲ֭זוּ מִפְעֲל֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֖ם שַׁמּ֣וֹת בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Come and see what the LORD has done,
how He has wrought desolation on the earth.

translations.hebrew: מַשְׁבִּ֥ית מִלְחָמוֹת֮ עַד־קְצֵ֢ה הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ קֶ֣שֶׁת יְ֭שַׁבֵּר וְקִצֵּ֣ץ חֲנִ֑ית עֲ֝גָל֗וֹת יִשְׂרֹ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
He puts a stop to wars throughout the earth,
breaking the bow, snapping the spear,
consigning wagons to the flames.

translations.hebrew: הַרְפּ֣וּ וּ֭דְעוּ כִּֽי־אָנֹכִ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים אָר֥וּם בַּ֝גּוֹיִ֗ם אָר֥וּם בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
“Desist! Realize that I am God!
I dominate the nations;
I dominate the earth.”

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֣וֹת עִמָּ֑נוּ מִשְׂגָּֽב־לָ֨נוּ אֱלֹהֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
The LORD of hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our haven. Selah.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מִזְמֽוֹר׃
translations.english: For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.

translations.hebrew: כׇּֽל־הָ֭עַמִּים תִּקְעוּ־כָ֑ף הָרִ֥יעוּ לֵ֝אלֹהִ֗ים בְּק֣וֹל רִנָּֽה׃
translations.english:
All you peoples, clap your hands,
raise a joyous shout for God.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יְהֹוָ֣ה עֶלְי֣וֹן נוֹרָ֑א מֶ֥לֶךְ גָּ֝ד֗וֹל עַל־כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
For the LORD Most High is awesome,
great king over all the earth;

translations.hebrew: יַדְבֵּ֣ר עַמִּ֣ים תַּחְתֵּ֑ינוּ וּ֝לְאֻמִּ֗ים תַּ֣חַת רַגְלֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
He subjects peoples to us,
sets nations at our feet.

translations.hebrew: יִבְחַר־לָ֥נוּ אֶת־נַחֲלָתֵ֑נוּ אֶ֥ת־גְּא֨וֹן יַעֲקֹ֖ב אֲשֶׁר־אָהֵ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
He chose our heritage for us,
the pride of Jacob whom He loved. Selah.

translations.hebrew: עָלָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים בִּתְרוּעָ֑ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בְּק֣וֹל שׁוֹפָֽר׃
translations.english:
God ascends midst acclamation;
the LORD, to the blasts of the horn.

translations.hebrew: זַמְּר֣וּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים זַמֵּ֑רוּ זַמְּר֖וּ לְמַלְכֵּ֣נוּ זַמֵּֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
Sing, O sing to God;
sing, O sing to our king;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י מֶ֖לֶךְ כׇּל־הָאָ֥רֶץ אֱלֹהִ֗ים זַמְּר֥וּ מַשְׂכִּֽיל׃
translations.english:
for God is king over all the earth;
sing a hymn.aHeb. maskil, a musical term of uncertain meaning.

translations.hebrew: מָלַ֣ךְ אֱ֭לֹהִים עַל־גּוֹיִ֑ם אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים יָשַׁ֤ב ׀ עַל־כִּסֵּ֬א קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
God reigns over the nations;
God is seated on His holy throne.

translations.hebrew: נְדִ֘יבֵ֤י עַמִּ֨ים ׀ נֶאֱסָ֗פוּ עַם֮ אֱלֹהֵ֢י אַבְרָ֫הָ֥ם כִּ֣י לֵ֭אלֹהִים מָֽגִנֵּי־אֶ֗רֶץ מְאֹ֣ד נַעֲלָֽה׃
translations.english:
The great of the peoples are gathered together,
the retinue of Abraham’s God;
for the guardians of the earth belong to God;
He is greatly exalted.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֥יר מִ֝זְמ֗וֹר לִבְנֵי־קֹֽרַח׃
translations.english: A song. A psalm of the Korahites.

translations.hebrew: גָּ֘ד֤וֹל יְהֹוָ֣ה וּמְהֻלָּ֣ל מְאֹ֑ד בְּעִ֥יר אֱ֝לֹהֵ֗ינוּ הַר־קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
The LORD is great and much acclaimed
in the city of our God,
His holy mountain—

translations.hebrew: יְפֵ֥ה נוֹף֮ מְשׂ֢וֹשׂ כׇּל־הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ הַר־צִ֭יּוֹן יַרְכְּתֵ֣י צָפ֑וֹן קִ֝רְיַ֗ת מֶ֣לֶךְ רָֽב׃
translations.english:
fair-crested, joy of all the earth,
Mount Zion, summit of Zaphon,aA term for the divine abode.
city of the great king.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֥ים בְּאַרְמְנוֹתֶ֗יהָ נוֹדַ֥ע לְמִשְׂגָּֽב׃
translations.english: Through its citadels, God has made Himself known as a haven.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֣ה הַ֭מְּלָכִים נ֥וֹעֲד֑וּ עָבְר֥וּ יַחְדָּֽו׃
translations.english:
See, the kings joined forces;
they advanced together.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֣מָּה רָ֭אוּ כֵּ֣ן תָּמָ֑הוּ נִבְהֲל֥וּ נֶחְפָּֽזוּ׃
translations.english:
At the mere sight of it they were stunned,
they were terrified, they panicked;

translations.hebrew: רְ֭עָדָה אֲחָזָ֣תַם שָׁ֑ם חִ֝֗יל כַּיּוֹלֵדָֽה׃
translations.english:
they were seized there with a trembling,
like a woman in the throes of labor,

translations.hebrew: בְּר֥וּחַ קָדִ֑ים תְּ֝שַׁבֵּ֗ר אֳנִיּ֥וֹת תַּרְשִֽׁישׁ׃
translations.english:
as the Tarshish fleet was wrecked
in an easterly gale.bSee 1 Kings 22.49.

translations.hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר שָׁמַ֨עְנוּ ׀ כֵּ֤ן רָאִ֗ינוּ בְּעִיר־יְהֹוָ֣ה צְ֭בָאוֹת בְּעִ֣יר אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ אֱלֹ֘הִ֤ים יְכוֹנְנֶ֖הָ עַד־עוֹלָ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
The likes of what we heard we have now witnessed
in the city of the LORD of hosts,
in the city of our God—
may God preserve it forever! Selah.

translations.hebrew: דִּמִּ֣ינוּ אֱלֹהִ֣ים חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ בְּ֝קֶ֗רֶב הֵיכָלֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
In Your temple, God,
we meditate upon Your faithful care.

translations.hebrew: כְּשִׁמְךָ֤ אֱלֹהִ֗ים כֵּ֣ן תְּ֭הִלָּתְךָ עַל־קַצְוֵי־אֶ֑רֶץ צֶ֝֗דֶק מָלְאָ֥ה יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
The praise of You, God, like Your name,
reaches to the ends of the earth;
Your right hand is filled with beneficence.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׂמַ֤ח ׀ הַר־צִיּ֗וֹן תָּ֭גֵלְנָה בְּנ֣וֹת יְהוּדָ֑ה לְ֝מַ֗עַן מִשְׁפָּטֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Let Mount Zion rejoice!
Let the townscOr “women.” of Judah exult,
because of Your judgments.

translations.hebrew: סֹ֣בּוּ צִ֭יּוֹן וְהַקִּיפ֑וּהָ סִ֝פְר֗וּ מִגְדָּלֶֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
Walk around Zion,
circle it;
count its towers,
