translations.hebrew: שִׁ֤יתוּ לִבְּכֶ֨ם ׀ לְֽחֵילָ֗הֿ פַּסְּג֥וּ אַרְמְנוֹתֶ֑יהָ לְמַ֥עַן תְּ֝סַפְּר֗וּ לְד֣וֹר אַחֲרֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
take note of its ramparts;
dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.go through-d its citadels,
that you may recount it to a future age.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י זֶ֨ה ׀ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֱ֭לֹהֵינוּ עוֹלָ֣ם וָעֶ֑ד ה֖וּא יְנַהֲגֵ֣נוּ עַל־מֽוּת׃
translations.english:
For God—He is our God forever;
He will lead us dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.evermore.-d

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מִזְמֽוֹר׃
translations.english: For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.

translations.hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־זֹ֭את כׇּל־הָעַמִּ֑ים הַ֝אֲזִ֗ינוּ כׇּל־יֹ֥שְׁבֵי חָֽלֶד׃
translations.english:
Hear this, all you peoples;
give ear, all inhabitants of the world,

translations.hebrew: גַּם־בְּנֵ֣י אָ֭דָם גַּם־בְּנֵי־אִ֑ישׁ יַ֝֗חַד עָשִׁ֥יר וְאֶבְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
men of all estates,
rich and poor alike.

translations.hebrew: פִּ֭י יְדַבֵּ֣ר חׇכְמ֑וֹת וְהָג֖וּת לִבִּ֣י תְבוּנֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
My mouth utters wisdom,
my speechaLit. “utterance of my heart”; on leb, cf. Ps. 19.15. is full of insight.

translations.hebrew: אַטֶּ֣ה לְמָשָׁ֣ל אׇזְנִ֑י אֶפְתַּ֥ח בְּ֝כִנּ֗וֹר חִידָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
I will turn my attention to a theme,
set forth my lesson to the music of a lyre.

translations.hebrew: לָ֣מָּה אִ֭ירָא בִּ֣ימֵי רָ֑ע עֲוֺ֖ן עֲקֵבַ֣י יְסוּבֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
In time of trouble, why should I fear
the encompassing evil of those who would supplant me—

translations.hebrew: הַבֹּטְחִ֥ים עַל־חֵילָ֑ם וּבְרֹ֥ב עׇ֝שְׁרָ֗ם יִתְהַלָּֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
men who trust in their riches,
who glory in their great wealth?

translations.hebrew: אָ֗ח לֹא־פָדֹ֣ה יִפְדֶּ֣ה אִ֑ישׁ לֹא־יִתֵּ֖ן לֵאלֹהִ֣ים כׇּפְרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
bOr “A brother.”Ah, it-b cannot redeem a man,
or pay his ransom to God;

translations.hebrew: וְ֭יֵקַר פִּדְי֥וֹן נַפְשָׁ֗ם וְחָדַ֥ל לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
the price of life is too high;
and so one ceases to be, forever.

translations.hebrew: וִיחִי־ע֥וֹד לָנֶ֑צַח לֹ֖א יִרְאֶ֣ה הַשָּֽׁחַת׃
translations.english:
Shall he live eternally,
and never see the grave?

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י יִרְאֶ֨ה ׀ חֲכָ֘מִ֤ים יָמ֗וּתוּ יַ֤חַד כְּסִ֣יל וָבַ֣עַר יֹאבֵ֑דוּ וְעָזְב֖וּ לַאֲחֵרִ֣ים חֵילָֽם׃
translations.english:
For one sees that the wise die,
that the foolish and ignorant both perish,
leaving their wealth to others.

translations.hebrew: קִרְבָּ֤ם בָּתֵּ֨ימוֹ ׀ לְֽעוֹלָ֗ם מִ֭שְׁכְּנֹתָם לְד֣וֹר וָדֹ֑ר קָרְא֥וּ בִ֝שְׁמוֹתָ֗ם עֲלֵ֣י אֲדָמֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
Their gravecTaken with ancient versions and medieval commentators as the equivalent of qibram. is their eternal home,
the dwelling-place for all generations
of those once famous on earth.

translations.hebrew: וְאָדָ֣ם בִּ֭יקָר בַּל־יָלִ֑ין נִמְשַׁ֖ל כַּבְּהֵמ֣וֹת נִדְמֽוּ׃
translations.english:
Man does not abide in honor;
he is like the beasts that perish.

translations.hebrew: זֶ֣ה דַ֭רְכָּם כֵּ֣סֶל לָ֑מוֹ וְאַחֲרֵיהֶ֓ם ׀ בְּפִיהֶ֖ם יִרְצ֣וּ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Such is the fate of those who are self-confident,
dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.the end of those pleased with their own talk.-d Selah.

translations.hebrew: כַּצֹּ֤אן ׀ לִ֥שְׁא֣וֹל שַׁתּוּ֮ מָ֤וֶת יִ֫רְעֵ֥ם וַיִּרְדּ֘וּ־בָ֤ם יְשָׁרִ֨ים ׀ לַבֹּ֗קֶר (וצירם) [וְ֭צוּרָם] לְבַלּ֥וֹת שְׁא֗וֹל מִזְּבֻ֥ל לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Sheeplike they head for Sheol,
with Death as their shepherd.
The upright shall rule over them at daybreak,
dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.and their form shall waste away in Sheol
till its nobility be gone.-d

translations.hebrew: אַךְ־אֱלֹהִ֗ים יִפְדֶּ֣ה נַ֭פְשִׁי מִֽיַּד־שְׁא֑וֹל כִּ֖י יִקָּחֵ֣נִי סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
But God will redeem my life from the clutches of Sheol,
for He will take me. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּ֭ירָא כִּֽי־יַעֲשִׁ֣ר אִ֑ישׁ כִּי־יִ֝רְבֶּ֗ה כְּב֣וֹד בֵּיתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Do not be afraid when a man becomes rich,
when his household goods increase;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א בְ֭מוֹתוֹ יִקַּ֣ח הַכֹּ֑ל לֹֽא־יֵרֵ֖ד אַחֲרָ֣יו כְּבוֹדֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
for when he dies he can take none of it along;
his goods cannot follow him down.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־נַ֭פְשׁוֹ בְּחַיָּ֣יו יְבָרֵ֑ךְ וְ֝יוֹדֻ֗ךָ כִּי־תֵיטִ֥יב לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Though he congratulates himself in his lifetime
—dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.“They must admit that you did well by yourself”-d—

translations.hebrew: תָּ֭בוֹא עַד־דּ֣וֹר אֲבוֹתָ֑יו עַד־נֵ֝֗צַח לֹ֣א יִרְאוּ־אֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
yet he must join the company of his ancestors,
who will never see daylight again.

translations.hebrew: אָדָ֣ם בִּ֭יקָר וְלֹ֣א יָבִ֑ין נִמְשַׁ֖ל כַּבְּהֵמ֣וֹת נִדְמֽוּ׃
translations.english:
Man does not understand honor;
he is like the beasts that perish.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אֵ֤ל ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֡ים יְֽהֹוָ֗ה דִּבֶּ֥ר וַיִּקְרָא־אָ֑רֶץ מִמִּזְרַח־שֶׁ֝֗מֶשׁ עַד־מְבֹאֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A psalm of Asaph.

aHeb. ’El ’Elohim YHWH.God, the LORD God-a spoke
and summoned the world from east to west.

translations.hebrew: מִצִּיּ֥וֹן מִכְלַל־יֹ֗פִי אֱלֹהִ֥ים הוֹפִֽיעַ׃
translations.english:
From Zion, perfect in beauty,
God appeared

translations.hebrew: יָ֤בֹ֥א אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וְֽאַל־יֶ֫חֱרַ֥שׁ אֵשׁ־לְפָנָ֥יו תֹּאכֵ֑ל וּ֝סְבִיבָ֗יו נִשְׂעֲרָ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
—let our God come and not fail to act!
Devouring fire preceded Him;
it stormed around Him fiercely.

translations.hebrew: יִקְרָ֣א אֶל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם מֵעָ֑ל וְאֶל־הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ לָדִ֥ין עַמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He summoned the heavens above,
and the earth, for the trial of His people.

translations.hebrew: אִסְפוּ־לִ֥י חֲסִידָ֑י כֹּרְתֵ֖י בְרִיתִ֣י עֲלֵי־זָֽבַח׃
translations.english:
“Bring in My devotees,
who made a covenant with Me over sacrifice!”

translations.hebrew: וַיַּגִּ֣ידוּ שָׁמַ֣יִם צִדְק֑וֹ כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֓ים ׀ שֹׁפֵ֖ט ה֣וּא סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Then the heavens proclaimed His righteousness,
for He is a God who judges. Selah.

translations.hebrew: שִׁמְעָ֤ה עַמִּ֨י ׀ וַאֲדַבֵּ֗רָה יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל וְאָעִ֣ידָה בָּ֑ךְ אֱלֹהִ֖ים אֱלֹהֶ֣יךָ אָנֹֽכִי׃
translations.english:
“Pay heed, My people, and I will speak,
O Israel, and I will arraign you.
I am God, your God.

translations.hebrew: לֹ֣א עַל־זְ֭בָחֶיךָ אוֹכִיחֶ֑ךָ וְעוֹלֹתֶ֖יךָ לְנֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִֽיד׃
translations.english:
I censure you not for your sacrifices,
and your burnt offerings, made to Me daily;

translations.hebrew: לֹא־אֶקַּ֣ח מִבֵּיתְךָ֣ פָ֑ר מִ֝מִּכְלְאֹתֶ֗יךָ עַתּוּדִֽים׃
translations.english:
I claim no bull from your estate,
no he-goats from your pens.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־לִ֥י כׇל־חַיְתוֹ־יָ֑עַר בְּ֝הֵמ֗וֹת בְּהַרְרֵי־אָֽלֶף׃
translations.english:
For Mine is every animal of the forest,
the beasts on bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.a thousand mountains.-b

translations.hebrew: יָ֭דַעְתִּי כׇּל־ע֣וֹף הָרִ֑ים וְזִ֥יז שָׂ֝דַ֗י עִמָּדִֽי׃
translations.english:
I know every bird of the mountains,
the creatures of the field are subject to Me.

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֶ֭רְעַב לֹא־אֹ֣מַר לָ֑ךְ כִּי־לִ֥י תֵ֝בֵ֗ל וּמְלֹאָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Were I hungry, I would not tell you,
for Mine is the world and all it holds.

translations.hebrew: הַ֭אוֹכַל בְּשַׂ֣ר אַבִּירִ֑ים וְדַ֖ם עַתּוּדִ֣ים אֶשְׁתֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
Do I eat the flesh of bulls,
or drink the blood of he-goats?

translations.hebrew: זְבַ֣ח לֵאלֹהִ֣ים תּוֹדָ֑ה וְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לְעֶלְי֣וֹן נְדָרֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Sacrifice a thank offering to God,
and pay your vows to the Most High.

translations.hebrew: וּ֭קְרָאֵנִי בְּי֣וֹם צָרָ֑ה אֲ֝חַלֶּצְךָ֗ וּֽתְכַבְּדֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Call upon Me in time of trouble;
I will rescue you, and you shall honor Me.”

translations.hebrew: וְלָ֤רָשָׁ֨ע ׀ אָ֘מַ֤ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים מַה־לְּ֭ךָ לְסַפֵּ֣ר חֻקָּ֑י וַתִּשָּׂ֖א בְרִיתִ֣י עֲלֵי־פִֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
And to the wicked, God said:
“Who are you to recite My laws,
and mouth the terms of My covenant,

translations.hebrew: וְ֭אַתָּה שָׂנֵ֣אתָ מוּסָ֑ר וַתַּשְׁלֵ֖ךְ דְּבָרַ֣י אַחֲרֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
seeing that you spurn My discipline,
and brush My words aside?

translations.hebrew: אִם־רָאִ֣יתָ גַ֭נָּב וַתִּ֣רֶץ עִמּ֑וֹ וְעִ֖ם מְנָאֲפִ֣ים חֶלְקֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
When you see a thief, you fall in with him,
and throw in your lot with adulterers;

translations.hebrew: פִּ֭יךָ שָׁלַ֣חְתָּ בְרָעָ֑ה וּ֝לְשׁוֹנְךָ֗ תַּצְמִ֥יד מִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
you devote your mouth to evil,
and yoke your tongue to deceit;

you are busy maligning your brother,
defaming the son of your mother.

translations.hebrew: אֵ֤לֶּה עָשִׂ֨יתָ ׀ וְֽהֶחֱרַ֗שְׁתִּי דִּמִּ֗יתָ הֱיֽוֹת־אֶהְיֶ֥ה כָמ֑וֹךָ אוֹכִיחֲךָ֖ וְאֶעֶרְכָ֣ה לְעֵינֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
If I failed to act when you did these things,
you would fancy that I was like you;
so I censure you and confront you with charges.

translations.hebrew: בִּינוּ־נָ֣א זֹ֭את שֹׁכְחֵ֣י אֱל֑וֹהַּ פֶּן־אֶ֝טְרֹ֗ף וְאֵ֣ין מַצִּֽיל׃
translations.english:
Mark this, you who are unmindful of God,
lest I tear you apart and no one save you.

translations.hebrew: זֹבֵ֥חַ תּוֹדָ֗ה יְֽכַ֫בְּדָ֥נְנִי וְשָׂ֥ם דֶּ֑רֶךְ אַ֝רְאֶ֗נּוּ בְּיֵ֣שַׁע אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
He who sacrifices a thank offering honors Me,
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.and to him who improves his way-b
I will show the salvation of God.”

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David,

translations.hebrew: בְּֽבוֹא־אֵ֭לָיו נָתָ֣ן הַנָּבִ֑יא כַּאֲשֶׁר־בָּ֝֗א אֶל־בַּת־שָֽׁבַע׃
translations.english: when Nathan the prophet came to him after he had come to Bathsheba.aCf. 2 Sam. 12.

translations.hebrew: חׇנֵּ֣נִי אֱלֹהִ֣ים כְּחַסְדֶּ֑ךָ כְּרֹ֥ב רַ֝חֲמֶ֗יךָ מְחֵ֣ה פְשָׁעָֽי׃
translations.english:
Have mercy upon me, O God,
as befits Your faithfulness;
in keeping with Your abundant compassion,
blot out my transgressions.

translations.hebrew: (הרבה) [הֶ֭רֶב] כַּבְּסֵ֣נִי מֵעֲוֺנִ֑י וּֽמֵחַטָּאתִ֥י טַהֲרֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Wash me thoroughly of my iniquity,
and purify me of my sin;

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־פְ֭שָׁעַי אֲנִ֣י אֵדָ֑ע וְחַטָּאתִ֖י נֶגְדִּ֣י תָמִֽיד׃
translations.english:
for I recognize my transgressions,
and am ever conscious of my sin.

translations.hebrew: לְךָ֤ לְבַדְּךָ֨ ׀ חָטָאתִי֮ וְהָרַ֥ע בְּעֵינֶ֗יךָ עָ֫שִׂ֥יתִי לְ֭מַעַן תִּצְדַּ֥ק בְּדׇבְרֶ֗ךָ תִּזְכֶּ֥ה בְשׇׁפְטֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Against You alone have I sinned,
and done what is evil in Your sight;
so You are just in Your sentence,
and right in Your judgment.

translations.hebrew: הֵן־בְּעָו֥וֹן חוֹלָ֑לְתִּי וּ֝בְחֵ֗טְא יֶחֱמַ֥תְנִי אִמִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Indeed I was born with iniquity;
with sin my mother conceived me.

translations.hebrew: הֵן־אֱ֭מֶת חָפַ֣צְתָּ בַטֻּח֑וֹת וּ֝בְסָתֻ֗ם חׇכְמָ֥ה תוֹדִיעֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Indeed You desire truth about that which is hidden;
teach me wisdom about secret things.-b

translations.hebrew: תְּחַטְּאֵ֣נִי בְאֵז֣וֹב וְאֶטְהָ֑ר תְּ֝כַבְּסֵ֗נִי וּמִשֶּׁ֥לֶג אַלְבִּֽין׃
translations.english:
Purge me with hyssop till I am pure;
wash me till I am whiter than snow.

translations.hebrew: תַּ֭שְׁמִיעֵנִי שָׂשׂ֣וֹן וְשִׂמְחָ֑ה תָּ֝גֵ֗לְנָה עֲצָמ֥וֹת דִּכִּֽיתָ׃
translations.english:
Let me hear tidings of joy and gladness;
let the bones You have crushed exult.

translations.hebrew: הַסְתֵּ֣ר פָּ֭נֶיךָ מֵחֲטָאָ֑י וְֽכׇל־עֲוֺ֖נֹתַ֣י מְחֵֽה׃
translations.english:
Hide Your face from my sins;
blot out all my iniquities.

translations.hebrew: לֵ֣ב טָ֭הוֹר בְּרָא־לִ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְר֥וּחַ נָ֝כ֗וֹן חַדֵּ֥שׁ בְּקִרְבִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Fashion a pure heart for me, O God;
create in me a steadfast spirit.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּשְׁלִיכֵ֥נִי מִלְּפָנֶ֑יךָ וְר֥וּחַ קׇ֝דְשְׁךָ֗ אַל־תִּקַּ֥ח מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
Do not cast me out of Your presence,
or take Your holy spirit away from me.

translations.hebrew: הָשִׁ֣יבָה לִּ֭י שְׂשׂ֣וֹן יִשְׁעֶ֑ךָ וְר֖וּחַ נְדִיבָ֣ה תִסְמְכֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Let me again rejoice in Your help;
let a vigorous spirit sustain me.

translations.hebrew: אֲלַמְּדָ֣ה פֹשְׁעִ֣ים דְּרָכֶ֑יךָ וְ֝חַטָּאִ֗ים אֵלֶ֥יךָ יָשֽׁוּבוּ׃
translations.english:
I will teach transgressors Your ways,
that sinners may return to You.

translations.hebrew: הַצִּ֘ילֵ֤נִי מִדָּמִ֨ים ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים אֱלֹהֵ֥י תְשׁוּעָתִ֑י תְּרַנֵּ֥ן לְ֝שׁוֹנִ֗י צִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Save me from bloodguilt,
O God, God, my deliverer,
that I may sing forth Your beneficence.

translations.hebrew: אֲ֭דֹנָי שְׂפָתַ֣י תִּפְתָּ֑ח וּ֝פִ֗י יַגִּ֥יד תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
O Lord, open my lips,
and let my mouth declare Your praise.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־תַחְפֹּ֣ץ זֶ֣בַח וְאֶתֵּ֑נָה ע֝וֹלָ֗ה לֹ֣א תִרְצֶֽה׃
translations.english:
You do not want me to bring sacrifices;
You do not desire burnt offerings;

translations.hebrew: זִ֥בְחֵ֣י אֱלֹהִים֮ ר֤וּחַ נִשְׁבָּ֫רָ֥ה לֵב־נִשְׁבָּ֥ר וְנִדְכֶּ֑ה אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לֹ֣א תִבְזֶֽה׃
translations.english:
True sacrifice to God is a contrite spirit;
God, You will not despise
a contrite and crushed heart.

translations.hebrew: הֵיטִ֣יבָה בִ֭רְצוֹנְךָ אֶת־צִיּ֑וֹן תִּ֝בְנֶ֗ה חוֹמ֥וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
translations.english:
May it please You to make Zion prosper;
rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.

translations.hebrew: אָ֤ז תַּחְפֹּ֣ץ זִבְחֵי־צֶ֭דֶק עוֹלָ֣ה וְכָלִ֑יל אָ֤ז יַעֲל֖וּ עַל־מִזְבַּחֲךָ֣ פָרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Then You will want sacrifices offered in righteousness,
burnt and whole offerings;
then bulls will be offered on Your altar.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. A maskil of David,

translations.hebrew: בְּב֤וֹא ׀ דּוֹאֵ֣ג הָאֲדֹמִי֮ וַיַּגֵּ֢ד לְשָׁ֫א֥וּל וַיֹּ֥אמֶר ל֑וֹ בָּ֥א דָ֝וִ֗ד אֶל־בֵּ֥ית אֲחִימֶֽלֶךְ׃
translations.english: when Doeg the Edomite came and informed Saul, telling him, “David came to Ahimelech’s house.”aCf. 1 Sam. 22.9 ff.

translations.hebrew: מַה־תִּתְהַלֵּ֣ל בְּ֭רָעָה הַגִּבּ֑וֹר חֶ֥סֶד אֵ֝֗ל כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
Why do you boast of your evil, brave fellow?
God’s faithfulness bLit. “is all the day.”never ceases.-b

translations.hebrew: הַ֭וּוֹת תַּחְשֹׁ֣ב לְשׁוֹנֶ֑ךָ כְּתַ֥עַר מְ֝לֻטָּ֗שׁ עֹשֵׂ֥ה רְמִיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Your tongue devises mischief,
like a sharpened razor that works treacherously.

translations.hebrew: אָהַ֣בְתָּ רָּ֣ע מִטּ֑וֹב שֶׁ֓קֶר ׀ מִדַּבֵּ֖ר צֶ֣דֶק סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
You prefer evil to good,
the lie, to speaking truthfully. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אָהַ֥בְתָּ כׇֽל־דִּבְרֵי־בָ֗לַע לְשׁ֣וֹן מִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
You love all pernicious words,
treacherous speech.

translations.hebrew: גַּם־אֵל֮ יִתׇּצְךָ֢ לָ֫נֶ֥צַח יַחְתְּךָ֣ וְיִסָּחֲךָ֣ מֵאֹ֑הֶל וְשֵׁרֶשְׁךָ֨ מֵאֶ֖רֶץ חַיִּ֣ים סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
So God will tear you down for good,
will break you and pluck you from your tent,
and root you out of the land of the living. Selah.

translations.hebrew: וְיִרְא֖וּ צַדִּיקִ֥ים וְיִירָ֗אוּ וְעָלָ֥יו יִשְׂחָֽקוּ׃
translations.english:
The righteous, seeing it, will be awestruck;
they will jibe at him, saying,

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה הַגֶּ֗בֶר לֹ֤א יָשִׂ֥ים אֱלֹהִ֗ים מָ֫עוּזּ֥וֹ וַ֭יִּבְטַח בְּרֹ֣ב עׇשְׁר֑וֹ יָ֝עֹ֗ז בְּהַוָּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
“Here was a fellow who did not make God his refuge,
but trusted in his great wealth,
relied upon his mischief.”

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ כְּזַ֣יִת רַ֭עֲנָן בְּבֵ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים בָּטַ֥חְתִּי בְחֶסֶד־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים עוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
translations.english:
But I am like a thriving olive tree in God’s house;
I trust in the faithfulness of God forever and ever.

translations.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ֣ לְ֭עוֹלָם כִּ֣י עָשִׂ֑יתָ וַאֲקַוֶּ֥ה שִׁמְךָ֥ כִי־ט֝֗וֹב נֶ֣גֶד חֲסִידֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I praise You forever, for You have acted;
cMeaning of Heb. uncertain; others “I will wait for Your name for it is good.”I declare that Your name is good-c
in the presence of Your faithful ones.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־מָחֲלַ֗ת מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: aCf. Ps. 14.For the leader; on mahalath.bMeaning of Heb. unknown. A maskil of David.

translations.hebrew: אָ֘מַ֤ר נָבָ֣ל בְּ֭לִבּוֹ אֵ֣ין אֱלֹהִ֑ים הִֽ֝שְׁחִ֗יתוּ וְהִֽתְעִ֥יבוּ עָ֝֗וֶל אֵ֣ין עֹֽשֵׂה־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
The benighted man thinks,
cLit. “There is no God”; cf. Ps. 10.4.“God does not care.”-c
Man’s wrongdoing is corrupt and loathsome;
no one does good.

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים מִשָּׁמַיִם֮ הִשְׁקִ֢יף עַֽל־בְּנֵי־אָ֫דָ֥ם לִ֭רְאוֹת הֲיֵ֣שׁ מַשְׂכִּ֑יל דֹּ֝רֵ֗שׁ אֶת־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
God looks down from heaven on mankind
to find a man of understanding,
a man mindful of God.

translations.hebrew: כֻּלּ֥וֹ סָג֮ יַחְדָּ֢ו נֶ֫אֱלָ֥חוּ אֵ֤ין עֹֽשֵׂה־ט֑וֹב אֵ֝֗ין גַּם־אֶחָֽד׃
translations.english:
Everyone is dross,
altogether foul;
there is none who does good,
not even one.

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹ֥א יָדְעוּ֮ פֹּ֤עֲלֵ֫י אָ֥וֶן אֹכְלֵ֣י עַ֭מִּי אָ֣כְלוּ לֶ֑חֶם אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים לֹ֣א קָרָֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
Are they so witless, those evildoers,
who devour my people as they devour food,
and do not invoke God?

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֤ם ׀ פָּ֥חֲדוּ פַחַד֮ לֹא־הָ֢יָ֫ה פָ֥חַד כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֗ים פִּ֭זַּר עַצְמ֣וֹת חֹנָ֑ךְ הֱ֝בִשֹׁ֗תָה כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים מְאָסָֽם׃
translations.english:
There they will be seized with fright
—dMeaning of Heb. uncertain.never was there such a fright—
for God has scattered the bones of your besiegers;
you have put them to shame,-d
for God has rejected them.

translations.hebrew: מִ֥י־יִתֵּ֣ן מִצִּיּוֹן֮ יְשֻׁע֢וֹת יִשְׂרָ֫אֵ֥ל בְּשׁ֣וּב אֱ֭לֹהִים שְׁב֣וּת עַמּ֑וֹ יָגֵ֥ל יַ֝עֲקֹ֗ב יִשְׂמַ֥ח יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
O that the deliverance of Israel might come from Zion!
When God restores the fortunes of His people,
Jacob will exult, Israel will rejoice.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֗ת מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader; with instrumental music. A maskil of David,

translations.hebrew: בְּבֹ֣א הַ֭זִּיפִים וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ לְשָׁא֑וּל הֲלֹ֥א דָ֝וִ֗ד מִסְתַּתֵּ֥ר עִמָּֽנוּ׃
translations.english: when the Ziphites came and told Saul, “Know, David is in hiding among us.”aCf. 1 Sam. 23.19.

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים בְּשִׁמְךָ֣ הוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי וּבִגְבוּרָתְךָ֥ תְדִינֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
O God, deliver me by Your name;
by Your power vindicate me.

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים שְׁמַ֣ע תְּפִלָּתִ֑י הַ֝אֲזִ֗ינָה לְאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
translations.english:
O God, hear my prayer;
give ear to the words of my mouth.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י זָרִ֨ים ׀ קָ֤מוּ עָלַ֗י וְֽ֭עָרִיצִים בִּקְשׁ֣וּ נַפְשִׁ֑י לֹ֤א שָׂ֨מוּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים לְנֶגְדָּ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
For strangers have risen against me,
and ruthless men seek my life;
they are unmindful of God. Selah.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים עֹזֵ֣ר לִ֑י אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י בְּֽסֹמְכֵ֥י נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
See, God is my helper;
the Lord is my support.

translations.hebrew: (ישוב) [יָשִׁ֣יב] הָ֭רַע לְשֹׁרְרָ֑י בַּ֝אֲמִתְּךָ֗ הַצְמִיתֵֽם׃
translations.english:
He will repay the evil of my watchful foes;
by Your faithfulness, destroy them!

translations.hebrew: בִּנְדָבָ֥ה אֶזְבְּחָה־לָּ֑ךְ א֤וֹדֶה־שִּׁמְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
Then I will offer You a freewill sacrifice;
I will praise Your name, LORD, for it is good,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י מִכׇּל־צָ֭רָה הִצִּילָ֑נִי וּ֝בְאֹיְבַ֗י רָאֲתָ֥ה עֵינִֽי׃
translations.english:
for it has saved me from my foes,
and let me gaze triumphant upon my enemies.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֗ת מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader; with instrumental music. A maskil of David.

translations.hebrew: הַאֲזִ֣ינָה אֱ֭לֹהִים תְּפִלָּתִ֑י וְאַל־תִּ֝תְעַלַּ֗ם מִתְּחִנָּתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Give ear, O God, to my prayer;
do not ignore my plea;

translations.hebrew: הַקְשִׁ֣יבָה לִּ֣י וַעֲנֵ֑נִי אָרִ֖יד בְּשִׂיחִ֣י וְאָהִֽימָה׃
translations.english:
pay heed to me and answer me.
I am tossed about, complaining and moaning

translations.hebrew: מִקּ֤וֹל אוֹיֵ֗ב מִ֭פְּנֵי עָקַ֣ת רָשָׁ֑ע כִּֽי־יָמִ֥יטוּ עָלַ֥י אָ֝֗וֶן וּבְאַ֥ף יִשְׂטְמֽוּנִי׃
translations.english:
at the clamor of the enemy,
because of the oppression of the wicked;
for they bring evil upon me
and furiously harass me.

translations.hebrew: לִ֭בִּי יָחִ֣יל בְּקִרְבִּ֑י וְאֵימ֥וֹת מָ֝֗וֶת נָפְל֥וּ עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
My heart is convulsed within me;
terrors of death assail me.

translations.hebrew: יִרְאָ֣ה וָ֭רַעַד יָ֣בֹא בִ֑י וַ֝תְּכַסֵּ֗נִי פַּלָּצֽוּת׃
translations.english:
Fear and trembling invade me;
I am clothed with horror.

translations.hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר מִֽי־יִתֶּן־לִ֣י אֵ֭בֶר כַּיּוֹנָ֗ה אָע֥וּפָה וְאֶשְׁכֹּֽנָה׃
translations.english:
I said,
“O that I had the wings of a dove!
I would fly away and find rest;

translations.hebrew: הִ֭נֵּה אַרְחִ֣יק נְדֹ֑ד אָלִ֖ין בַּמִּדְבָּ֣ר סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
surely, I would flee far off;
I would lodge in the wilderness; selah

translations.hebrew: אָחִ֣ישָׁה מִפְלָ֣ט לִ֑י מֵר֖וּחַ סֹעָ֣ה מִסָּֽעַר׃
translations.english:
I would soon find me a refuge
from the sweeping wind,
from the tempest.”

translations.hebrew: בַּלַּ֣ע אֲ֭דֹנָי פַּלַּ֣ג לְשׁוֹנָ֑ם כִּֽי־רָאִ֨יתִי חָמָ֖ס וְרִ֣יב בָּעִֽיר׃
translations.english:
O Lord, confound their speech, confuse it!
For I see lawlessness and strife in the city;

translations.hebrew: יוֹמָ֤ם וָלַ֗יְלָה יְסוֹבְבֻ֥הָ עַל־חוֹמֹתֶ֑יהָ וְאָ֖וֶן וְעָמָ֣ל בְּקִרְבָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
day and night they make their rounds on its walls;
evil and mischief are inside it.

translations.hebrew: הַוּ֥וֹת בְּקִרְבָּ֑הּ וְֽלֹא־יָמִ֥ישׁ מֵ֝רְחֹבָ֗הּ תֹּ֣ךְ וּמִרְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
Malice is within it;
fraud and deceit never leave its square.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹֽא־אוֹיֵ֥ב יְחָֽרְפֵ֗נִי וְאֶ֫שָּׂ֥א לֹא־מְ֭שַׂנְאִי עָלַ֣י הִגְדִּ֑יל וְאֶסָּתֵ֥ר מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
It is not an enemy who reviles me
—I could bear that;
it is not my foe who vaunts himself against me
—I could hide from him;

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה אֱנ֣וֹשׁ כְּעֶרְכִּ֑י אַ֝לּוּפִ֗י וּמְיֻדָּעִֽי׃
translations.english:
but it is you, my equal,
my companion, my friend;

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר יַ֭חְדָּו נַמְתִּ֣יק ס֑וֹד בְּבֵ֥ית אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים נְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בְּרָֽגֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
sweet was our fellowship;
we walked together in God’s house.

translations.hebrew: (ישימות) [יַשִּׁ֤י מָ֨וֶת ׀] עָלֵ֗ימוֹ יֵרְד֣וּ שְׁא֣וֹל חַיִּ֑ים כִּֽי־רָע֖וֹת בִּמְגוּרָ֣ם בְּקִרְבָּֽם׃
translations.english:
Let Him incite death against them;
may they go down alive into Sheol!
For where they dwell,
there evil is.

translations.hebrew: אֲ֭נִי אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֶקְרָ֑א וַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה יוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
As for me, I call to God;
the LORD will deliver me.

translations.hebrew: עֶ֤רֶב וָבֹ֣קֶר וְ֭צׇהֳרַיִם אָשִׂ֣יחָה וְאֶהֱמֶ֑ה וַיִּשְׁמַ֥ע קוֹלִֽי׃
translations.english:
Evening, morning, and noon,
I complain and moan,
and He hears my voice.

translations.hebrew: פָּ֘דָ֤ה בְשָׁל֣וֹם נַ֭פְשִׁי מִקְּרׇב־לִ֑י כִּֽי־בְ֝רַבִּ֗ים הָי֥וּ עִמָּדִֽי׃
translations.english:
He redeems me unharmed
from the battle against me;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.it is as though many are on my side.-a

translations.hebrew: יִשְׁמַ֤ע ׀ אֵ֨ל ׀ וְֽיַעֲנֵם֮ וְיֹ֤שֵׁ֥ב קֶ֗דֶם סֶ֥֫לָה אֲשֶׁ֤ר אֵ֣ין חֲלִיפ֣וֹת לָ֑מוֹ וְלֹ֖א יָרְא֣וּ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
God who has reigned from the first,
who will have no successor,
hears and humbles those who have no fear of God. Selah.

translations.hebrew: שָׁלַ֣ח יָ֭דָיו בִּשְׁלֹמָ֗יו חִלֵּ֥ל בְּרִיתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
HebI.e., the friend of v. 14. harmed his ally,
he broke his pact;

translations.hebrew: חָלְק֤וּ ׀ מַחְמָאֹ֣ת פִּיו֮ וּֽקְרָב־לִ֫בּ֥וֹ רַכּ֖וּ דְבָרָ֥יו מִשֶּׁ֗מֶן וְהֵ֣מָּה פְתִחֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
his talk was smoother than butter,
yet his mind was on war;
his words were more soothing than oil,
yet they were drawn swords.

translations.hebrew: הַשְׁלֵ֤ךְ עַל־יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ יְהָבְךָ֮ וְה֢וּא יְכַ֫לְכְּלֶ֥ךָ לֹא־יִתֵּ֖ן לְעוֹלָ֥ם מ֗וֹט לַצַּדִּֽיק׃
translations.english:
Cast your burden on the LORD and He will sustain you;
He will never let the righteous man collapse.

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ תּוֹרִדֵ֬ם ׀ לִבְאֵ֬ר שַׁ֗חַת אַנְשֵׁ֤י דָמִ֣ים וּ֭מִרְמָה לֹא־יֶחֱצ֣וּ יְמֵיהֶ֑ם וַ֝אֲנִ֗י אֶבְטַח־בָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
For You, O God, will bring them down to the nethermost Pit—
those murderous, treacherous men;
they shall not live out half their days;
but I trust in You.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֤חַ ׀ עַל־י֬וֹנַת אֵ֣לֶם רְ֭חֹקִים לְדָוִ֣ד מִכְתָּ֑ם בֶּאֱחֹ֨ז אוֹת֖וֹ פְלִשְׁתִּ֣ים בְּגַֽת׃
translations.english: For the leader; aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.on yonath elem reḥokim.-a Of David. A michtam; when the Philistines seized him in Gath.

translations.hebrew: חׇנֵּ֣נִי אֱ֭לֹהִים כִּֽי־שְׁאָפַ֣נִי אֱנ֑וֹשׁ כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם לֹחֵ֥ם יִלְחָצֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Have mercy on me, O God,
for men persecute me;
all day long my adversary oppresses me.

translations.hebrew: שָׁאֲפ֣וּ שׁ֭וֹרְרַי כׇּל־הַיּ֑וֹם כִּֽי־רַבִּ֨ים לֹחֲמִ֖ים לִ֣י מָרֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
My watchful foes persecute me all day long;
many are my adversaries, O Exalted One.

translations.hebrew: י֥וֹם אִירָ֑א אֲ֝נִ֗י אֵלֶ֥יךָ אֶבְטָֽח׃
translations.english: When I am afraid, I trust in You,

translations.hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִים֮ אֲהַלֵּ֢ל דְּבָ֫ר֥וֹ בֵּאלֹהִ֣ים בָּ֭טַחְתִּי לֹ֣א אִירָ֑א מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בָשָׂ֣ר לִֽי׃
translations.english:
in God, whose word I praise,
in God I trust;
I am not afraid;
what can mortalsbLit. “flesh.” do to me?

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם דְּבָרַ֣י יְעַצֵּ֑בוּ עָלַ֖י כׇּל־מַחְשְׁבֹתָ֣ם לָרָֽע׃
translations.english:
All day long aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.they cause me grief in my affairs,-a
they plan only evil against me.

translations.hebrew: יָג֤וּרוּ ׀ (יצפינו) [יִצְפּ֗וֹנוּ] הֵ֭מָּה עֲקֵבַ֣י יִשְׁמֹ֑רוּ כַּ֝אֲשֶׁ֗ר קִוּ֥וּ נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
They plot, they lie in ambush;
they watch my every move, hoping for my death.

translations.hebrew: עַל־אָ֥וֶן פַּלֶּט־לָ֑מוֹ בְּ֝אַ֗ף עַמִּ֤ים ׀ הוֹרֵ֬ד אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
Cast them out for their evil;
subdue peoples in Your anger, O God.

translations.hebrew: נֹדִי֮ סָפַ֢רְתָּ֫ה אָ֥תָּה שִׂ֣ימָה דִמְעָתִ֣י בְנֹאדֶ֑ךָ הֲ֝לֹ֗א בְּסִפְרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.You keep count of my wanderings;
put my tears into Your flask,
into Your record.-a

translations.hebrew: אָ֨ז יָ֘שׁ֤וּבוּ אוֹיְבַ֣י אָ֭חוֹר בְּי֣וֹם אֶקְרָ֑א זֶֽה־יָ֝דַ֗עְתִּי כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים לִֽי׃
translations.english:
Then my enemies will retreat when I call on You;
this I know, that God is for me.

translations.hebrew: בֵּ֭אלֹהִים אֲהַלֵּ֣ל דָּבָ֑ר בַּ֝יהֹוָ֗ה אֲהַלֵּ֥ל דָּבָֽר׃
translations.english:
In God, whose word I praise,
in the LORD, whose word I praise,

translations.hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִ֣ים בָּ֭טַחְתִּי לֹּ֣א אִירָ֑א מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה אָדָ֣ם לִֽי׃
translations.english:
in God I trust;
I am not afraid;
what can man do to me?

translations.hebrew: עָלַ֣י אֱלֹהִ֣ים נְדָרֶ֑יךָ אֲשַׁלֵּ֖ם תּוֹדֹ֣ת לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
I must pay my vows to You, O God;
I will render thank offerings to You.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י הִצַּ֪לְתָּ נַפְשִׁ֡י מִמָּוֶת֮ הֲלֹ֥א רַגְלַ֗י מִ֫דֶּ֥חִי לְ֭הִֽתְהַלֵּךְ לִפְנֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּ֝א֗וֹר הַחַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
For You have saved me from death,
my foot from stumbling,
that I may walk before God in the light of life.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ אַל־תַּ֭שְׁחֵת לְדָוִ֣ד מִכְתָּ֑ם בְּבׇרְח֥וֹ מִפְּנֵי־שָׁ֝א֗וּל בַּמְּעָרָֽה׃
translations.english: For the leader; aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.al tashḥeth.-a Of David. A michtam; when he fled from Saul into a cave.

translations.hebrew: חׇנֵּ֤נִי אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ חׇנֵּ֗נִי כִּ֥י בְךָ֮ חָסָ֢יָה נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י וּבְצֵֽל־כְּנָפֶ֥יךָ אֶחְסֶ֑ה עַ֝֗ד יַעֲבֹ֥ר הַוּֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
Have mercy on me, O God, have mercy on me,
for I seek refuge in You,
I seek refuge in the shadow of Your wings,
until danger passes.

translations.hebrew: אֶ֭קְרָא לֵאלֹהִ֣ים עֶלְי֑וֹן לָ֝אֵ֗ל גֹּמֵ֥ר עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
I call to God Most High,
to God who is good to me.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׁלַ֤ח מִשָּׁמַ֨יִם ׀ וְֽיוֹשִׁיעֵ֗נִי חֵרֵ֣ף שֹׁאֲפִ֣י סֶ֑לָה יִשְׁלַ֥ח אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים חַסְדּ֥וֹ וַאֲמִתּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He will reach down from heaven and deliver me:
God will send down His steadfast love;
my persecutor reviles. Selah.

translations.hebrew: נַפְשִׁ֤י ׀ בְּת֥וֹךְ לְבָאִם֮ אֶשְׁכְּבָ֢ה לֹ֫הֲטִ֥ים בְּֽנֵי־אָדָ֗ם שִׁ֭נֵּיהֶם חֲנִ֣ית וְחִצִּ֑ים וּ֝לְשׁוֹנָ֗ם חֶ֣רֶב חַדָּֽה׃
translations.english:
As for me, I lie down among man-eating lions
whose teeth are spears and arrows,
whose tongue is a sharp sword.

translations.hebrew: ר֣וּמָה עַל־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם אֱלֹהִ֑ים עַ֖ל כׇּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Exalt Yourself over the heavens, O God,
let Your glory be over all the earth!

translations.hebrew: רֶ֤שֶׁת ׀ הֵכִ֣ינוּ לִפְעָמַי֮ כָּפַ֢ף נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י כָּר֣וּ לְפָנַ֣י שִׁיחָ֑ה נָפְל֖וּ בְתוֹכָ֣הּ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
They prepared a net for my feet bCf. Mishnaic Heb. kefifah, a wicker basket used in fishing.to ensnare me;-b
they dug a pit for me,
but they fell into it. Selah.

translations.hebrew: נָ֘כ֤וֹן לִבִּ֣י אֱ֭לֹהִים נָכ֣וֹן לִבִּ֑י אָ֝שִׁ֗ירָה וַאֲזַמֵּֽרָה׃
translations.english:
cWith vv. 8–12, cf. Ps. 108.2–6.My heart is firm, O God;
my heart is firm;
I will sing, I will chant a hymn.

translations.hebrew: ע֤וּרָה כְבוֹדִ֗י ע֭וּרָֽה הַנֵּ֥בֶל וְכִנּ֗וֹר אָעִ֥ירָה שָּֽׁחַר׃
translations.english:
Awake, O my soul!
Awake, O harp and lyre!
I will wake the dawn.

translations.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ֖ בָעַמִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָ֑י אֲ֝זַמֶּרְךָ֗ בַּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
I will praise You among the peoples, O Lord;
I will sing a hymn to You among the nations;

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־גָדֹ֣ל עַד־שָׁמַ֣יִם חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וְֽעַד־שְׁחָקִ֥ים אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
for Your faithfulness is as high as heaven;
Your steadfastness reaches to the sky.

translations.hebrew: ר֣וּמָה עַל־שָׁמַ֣יִם אֱלֹהִ֑ים עַ֖ל כׇּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Exalt Yourself over the heavens, O God,
let Your glory be over all the earth!

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אַל־תַּשְׁחֵ֗ת לְדָוִ֥ד מִכְתָּֽם׃
translations.english: For the leader; al tashḥeth. Of David. A michtam.

translations.hebrew: הַאֻמְנָ֗ם אֵ֣לֶם צֶ֭דֶק תְּדַבֵּר֑וּן מֵישָׁרִ֥ים תִּ֝שְׁפְּט֗וּ בְּנֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.O mighty ones,-a do you really decree what is just?
Do you judge mankind with equity?

translations.hebrew: אַף־בְּלֵב֮ עוֹלֹ֢ת תִּפְעָ֫ל֥וּן בָּאָ֡רֶץ חֲמַ֥ס יְ֝דֵיכֶ֗ם תְּפַלֵּסֽוּן׃
translations.english:
In your minds you devise wrongdoing in the land;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.with your hands you deal out lawlessness.-a

translations.hebrew: זֹ֣רוּ רְשָׁעִ֣ים מֵרָ֑חֶם תָּע֥וּ מִ֝בֶּ֗טֶן דֹּבְרֵ֥י כָזָֽב׃
translations.english:
The wicked are defiant from birth;
the liars go astray from the womb.

translations.hebrew: חֲמַת־לָ֗מוֹ כִּדְמ֥וּת חֲמַת־נָחָ֑שׁ כְּמוֹ־פֶ֥תֶן חֵ֝רֵ֗שׁ יַאְטֵ֥ם אׇזְנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Their venom is like that of a snake,
a deaf viper that stops its ears

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־יִ֭שְׁמַע לְק֣וֹל מְלַחֲשִׁ֑ים חוֹבֵ֖ר חֲבָרִ֣ים מְחֻכָּֽם׃
translations.english:
so as not to hear the voice of charmers
or the expert mutterer of spells.

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים הֲרׇס־שִׁנֵּ֥ימֽוֹ בְּפִ֑ימוֹ מַלְתְּע֥וֹת כְּ֝פִירִ֗ים נְתֹ֣ץ <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
O God, smash their teeth in their mouth;
shatter the fangs of lions, O LORD;

translations.hebrew: יִמָּאֲס֣וּ כְמוֹ־מַ֭יִם יִתְהַלְּכוּ־לָ֑מוֹ יִדְרֹ֥ךְ חִ֝צָּ֗ו כְּמ֣וֹ יִתְמֹלָֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
let them melt, let them vanish like water;
let Him aim His arrows that they be cut down;

translations.hebrew: כְּמ֣וֹ שַׁ֭בְּלוּל תֶּ֣מֶס יַהֲלֹ֑ךְ נֵ֥פֶל אֵ֝֗שֶׁת בַּל־חָ֥זוּ שָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.like a snail that melts away as it moves;-a
like a woman’s stillbirth, may they never see the sun!

translations.hebrew: בְּטֶ֤רֶם ׀ יָבִ֣ינוּ סִּירֹתֵכֶ֣ם אָטָ֑ד כְּמוֹ־חַ֥י כְּמוֹ־חָ֝ר֗וֹן יִשְׂעָרֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
Before aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.the thorns grow into a bramble,
may He whirl them away alive in fury.-a

translations.hebrew: יִשְׂמַ֣ח צַ֭דִּיק כִּי־חָזָ֣ה נָקָ֑ם פְּעָמָ֥יו יִ֝רְחַ֗ץ בְּדַ֣ם הָרָשָֽׁע׃
translations.english:
The righteous man will rejoice when he sees revenge;
he will bathe his feet in the blood of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: וְיֹאמַ֣ר אָ֭דָם אַךְ־פְּרִ֣י לַצַּדִּ֑יק אַ֥ךְ יֵשׁ־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים שֹׁפְטִ֥ים בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Men will say,
“There is, then, a reward for the righteous;
there is, indeed, divine justice on earth.”

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ אַל־תַּשְׁחֵת֮ לְדָוִ֢ד מִ֫כְתָּ֥ם בִּשְׁלֹ֥חַ שָׁא֑וּל וַֽיִּשְׁמְר֥וּ אֶת־הַ֝בַּ֗יִת לַהֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
translations.english: For the leader; al tashḥeth. Of David. A michtam; when Saul sent men to watch his house in order to put him to death.aCf. 1 Sam. 19.11.

translations.hebrew: הַצִּילֵ֖נִי מֵאֹיְבַ֥י <small>׀</small> אֱלֹהָ֑י מִֽמִּתְקוֹמְמַ֥י תְּשַׂגְּבֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Save me from my enemies, O my God;
secure me against my assailants.

translations.hebrew: הַ֭צִּילֵנִי מִפֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן וּֽמֵאַנְשֵׁ֥י דָ֝מִ֗ים הוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Save me from evildoers;
deliver me from murderers.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י הִנֵּ֪ה אָרְב֡וּ לְנַפְשִׁ֗י יָג֣וּרוּ עָלַ֣י עַזִּ֑ים לֹֽא־פִשְׁעִ֖י וְלֹא־חַטָּאתִ֣י יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
For see, they lie in wait for me;
fierce men plot against me
for no offense of mine,
for no transgression, O LORD;

translations.hebrew: בְּֽלִי־עָ֭וֺן יְרֻצ֣וּן וְיִכּוֹנָ֑נוּ ע֖וּרָה לִקְרָאתִ֣י וּרְאֵֽה׃
translations.english:
for no guilt of mine
do they rush to array themselves against me.
Look, rouse Yourself on my behalf!

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָֽה־אֱלֹהִ֥ים <small>׀</small> צְבָא֡וֹת אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הָקִ֗יצָה לִפְקֹ֥ד כׇּֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֑ם אַל־תָּחֹ֨ן כׇּל־בֹּ֖גְדֵי אָ֣וֶן סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
You, O LORD God of hosts,
God of Israel,
bestir Yourself to bring all nations to account;
have no mercy on any treacherous villain. Selah.

translations.hebrew: יָשׁ֣וּבוּ לָ֭עֶרֶב יֶהֱמ֥וּ כַכָּ֗לֶב וִיס֥וֹבְבוּ עִֽיר׃
translations.english:
They come each evening growling like dogs,
roaming the city.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה ׀ יַבִּ֘יע֤וּן בְּפִיהֶ֗ם חֲ֭רָבוֹת בְּשִׂפְתֽוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם כִּי־מִ֥י שֹׁמֵֽעַ׃
translations.english:
They rave with their mouths,
bLit. “swords.”sharp words-b are on their lips;
[they think,] “Who hears?”

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה תִּשְׂחַק־לָ֑מוֹ תִּ֝לְעַ֗ג לְכׇל־גּוֹיִֽם׃
translations.english:
But You, O LORD, laugh at them;
You mock all the nations.

translations.hebrew: עֻ֭זּוֹ אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֶשְׁמֹ֑רָה כִּֽי־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים מִשְׂגַּבִּֽי׃
translations.english:
O mycWith several mss.; cf. v. 18; lit. “His.” strength, I wait for You;
for God is my haven.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהֵ֣י (חסדו) [חַסְדִּ֣י] יְקַדְּמֵ֑נִי אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים יַרְאֵ֥נִי בְשֹׁרְרָֽי׃
translations.english:
My faithful God will come to aid me;
God will let me gloat over my watchful foes.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּהַרְגֵ֤ם ׀ פֶּֽן־יִשְׁכְּח֬וּ עַמִּ֗י הֲנִיעֵ֣מוֹ בְ֭חֵילְךָ וְהוֹרִידֵ֑מוֹ מָ֖גִנֵּ֣נוּ אֲדֹנָֽי׃
translations.english:
Do not kill them lest my people be unmindful;
with Your power make wanderers of them;
bring them low, O our shield, the Lord,

translations.hebrew: חַטַּאת־פִּ֗ימוֹ דְּֽבַר־שְׂפָ֫תֵ֥ימוֹ וְיִלָּכְד֥וּ בִגְאוֹנָ֑ם וּמֵאָלָ֖ה וּמִכַּ֣חַשׁ יְסַפֵּֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
because of their sinful mouths,
the words on their lips.
Let them be trapped by their pride,
and by the imprecations and lies they utter.

translations.hebrew: כַּלֵּ֥ה בְחֵמָה֮ כַּלֵּ֢ה וְֽאֵ֫ינֵ֥מוֹ וְֽיֵדְע֗וּ כִּֽי־אֱ֭לֹהִים מֹשֵׁ֣ל בְּֽיַעֲקֹ֑ב לְאַפְסֵ֖י הָאָ֣רֶץ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
In Your fury put an end to them;
put an end to them that they be no more;
that it may be known to the ends of the earth
that God does rule over Jacob. Selah.

translations.hebrew: וְיָשֻׁ֣בוּ לָ֭עֶרֶב יֶהֱמ֥וּ כַכָּ֗לֶב וִיס֥וֹבְבוּ עִֽיר׃
translations.english:
They come each evening growling like dogs,
roaming the city.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֭מָּה (ינועון) [יְנִיע֣וּן] לֶאֱכֹ֑ל אִם־לֹ֥א יִ֝שְׂבְּע֗וּ וַיָּלִֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
They wander in search of food;
and whine if they are not satisfied.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ אָשִׁ֣יר עֻזֶּךָ֮ וַאֲרַנֵּ֥ן לַבֹּ֗קֶר חַ֫סְדֶּ֥ךָ כִּֽי־הָיִ֣יתָ מִשְׂגָּ֣ב לִ֑י וּ֝מָנ֗וֹס בְּי֣וֹם צַר־לִֽי׃
translations.english:
But I will sing of Your strength,
extol each morning Your faithfulness;
for You have been my haven,
a refuge in time of trouble.

translations.hebrew: עֻ֭זִּי אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֲזַמֵּ֑רָה כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים מִ֝שְׂגַּבִּ֗י אֱלֹהֵ֥י חַסְדִּֽי׃
translations.english:
O my strength, to You I sing hymns;
for God is my haven, my faithful God.

translations.hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ עַל־שׁוּשַׁ֣ן עֵד֑וּת מִכְתָּ֖ם לְדָוִ֣ד לְלַמֵּֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader; on aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.shushan eduth.-a A michtam of David (to be taught),

translations.hebrew: בְּהַצּוֹת֨וֹ ׀ אֶ֥ת־אֲרַ֣ם נַהֲרַיִם֮ וְאֶת־אֲרַ֢ם צ֫וֹבָ֥ה וַיָּ֤שׇׁב יוֹאָ֗ב וַיַּ֣ךְ אֶת־אֱד֣וֹם בְּגֵיא־מֶ֑לַח שְׁנֵ֖ים עָשָׂ֣ר אָֽלֶף׃
translations.english: when he fought with Aram-Naharaim and Aram-Zobah, and Joab returned and defeated Edom—[an army] of twelve thousand men—in the Valley of Salt.bCf. 2 Sam. 8; 1 Chron. 18.

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים זְנַחְתָּ֣נוּ פְרַצְתָּ֑נוּ אָ֝נַ֗פְתָּ תְּשׁ֣וֹבֵֽב לָֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
O God, You have rejected us,
You have made a breach in us;
You have been angry;
restore us!

translations.hebrew: הִרְעַ֣שְׁתָּה אֶ֣רֶץ פְּצַמְתָּ֑הּ רְפָ֖ה שְׁבָרֶ֣יהָ כִי־מָֽטָה׃
translations.english:
You have made the land quake;
You have torn it open.
Mend its fissures,
for it is collapsing.

translations.hebrew: הִרְאִ֣יתָ עַמְּךָ֣ קָשָׁ֑ה הִ֝שְׁקִיתָ֗נוּ יַ֣יִן תַּרְעֵלָֽה׃
translations.english:
You have made Your people suffer hardship;
cOr “You have sated Your people with a bitter draft.”You have given us wine that makes us reel.-c

translations.hebrew: נָ֘תַ֤תָּה לִּירֵאֶ֣יךָ נֵּ֭ס לְהִתְנוֹסֵ֑ס מִ֝פְּנֵ֗י קֹ֣שֶׁט סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Give those who fear You because of Your truth
a banner for rallying.-a Selah.

translations.hebrew: לְ֭מַעַן יֵחָלְצ֣וּן יְדִידֶ֑יךָ הוֹשִׁ֖יעָה יְמִינְךָ֣ (ועננו) [וַעֲנֵֽנִי]׃
translations.english:
dCf. Ps. 108.7–14.That those whom You love might be rescued,
deliver with Your right hand and answer me.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ דִּבֶּ֥ר בְּקׇדְשׁ֗וֹ אֶ֫עְלֹ֥זָה אֲחַלְּקָ֥ה שְׁכֶ֑ם וְעֵ֖מֶק סֻכּ֣וֹת אֲמַדֵּֽד׃
translations.english:
God promised eOr “by His holiness.”in His sanctuary-e
that I would exultingly divide up Shechem,
and measure the Valley of Sukkoth;

translations.hebrew: לִ֤י גִלְעָ֨ד ׀ וְלִ֬י מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה וְ֭אֶפְרַיִם מָע֣וֹז רֹאשִׁ֑י יְ֝הוּדָ֗ה מְחֹֽקְקִֽי׃
translations.english:
Gilead and Manasseh would be mine,
Ephraim my chief stronghold,
Judah my scepter;

translations.hebrew: מוֹאָ֤ב ׀ סִ֬יר רַחְצִ֗י עַל־אֱ֭דוֹם אַשְׁלִ֣יךְ נַעֲלִ֑י עָ֝לַ֗י פְּלֶ֣שֶׁת הִתְרוֹעָֽעִי׃
translations.english:
Moab would be my washbasin;
on Edom I would cast my shoe;
acclaim me, O Philistia!

translations.hebrew: מִ֣י יֹ֭בִלֵנִי עִ֣יר מָצ֑וֹר מִ֖י נָחַ֣נִי עַד־אֱדֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
Would that I were brought to the bastion!
Would that I were led to Edom!

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־אַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים זְנַחְתָּ֑נוּ וְֽלֹא־תֵצֵ֥א אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים בְּצִבְאוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
But You have rejected us, O God;
God, You do not march with our armies.

translations.hebrew: הָֽבָה־לָּ֣נוּ עֶזְרָ֣ת מִצָּ֑ר וְ֝שָׁ֗וְא תְּשׁוּעַ֥ת אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
Grant us Your aid against the foe,
for the help of man is worthless.

translations.hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִ֥ים נַֽעֲשֶׂה־חָ֑יִל וְ֝ה֗וּא יָב֥וּס צָרֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
With God we shall triumph;
He will trample our foes.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> עַֽל־נְגִינַ֬ת לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader; with instrumental music. Of David.

translations.hebrew: שִׁמְעָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים רִנָּתִ֑י הַ֝קְשִׁ֗יבָה תְּפִלָּתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Hear my cry, O God,
heed my prayer.

translations.hebrew: מִקְצֵ֤ה הָאָ֨רֶץ ׀ אֵלֶ֣יךָ אֶ֭קְרָא בַּעֲטֹ֣ף לִבִּ֑י בְּצוּר־יָר֖וּם מִמֶּ֣נִּי תַנְחֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
From the end of the earth I call to You;
when my heart is faint,
You lead me to a rock that is high above me.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הָיִ֣יתָ מַחְסֶ֣ה לִ֑י מִגְדַּל־עֹ֝֗ז מִפְּנֵ֥י אוֹיֵֽב׃
translations.english:
For You have been my refuge,
a tower of strength against the enemy.

translations.hebrew: אָג֣וּרָה בְ֭אׇהׇלְךָ עוֹלָמִ֑ים אֶ֥חֱסֶ֨ה בְסֵ֖תֶר כְּנָפֶ֣יךָ סֶּֽלָה׃
translations.english:
O that I might dwell in Your tent forever,
take refuge under Your protecting wings. Selah.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים שָׁמַ֣עְתָּ לִנְדָרָ֑י נָתַ֥תָּ יְ֝רֻשַּׁ֗ת יִרְאֵ֥י שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
O God, You have heard my vows;
grant the requestaTaking the noun yr¦t as an alternate form of ’r¦t; cf. Ps. 21.3. of those who fear Your name.

translations.hebrew: יָמִ֣ים עַל־יְמֵי־מֶ֣לֶךְ תּוֹסִ֑יף שְׁ֝נוֹתָ֗יו כְּמוֹ־דֹ֥ר וָדֹֽר׃
translations.english:
Add days to the days of the king;
may his years extend through generations;

translations.hebrew: יֵשֵׁ֣ב ע֭וֹלָם לִפְנֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים חֶ֥סֶד וֶ֝אֱמֶ֗ת מַ֣ן יִנְצְרֻֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
may he dwell in God’s presence forever;
appointbMeaning of Heb. uncertain. steadfast love to guard him.

translations.hebrew: כֵּ֤ן אֲזַמְּרָ֣ה שִׁמְךָ֣ לָעַ֑ד לְֽשַׁלְּמִ֥י נְ֝דָרַ֗י י֣וֹם <small>׀</small> יֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
So I will sing hymns to Your name forever,
as I fulfill my vows day after day.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־יְדוּת֗וּן מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader; on Jeduthun. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: אַ֣ךְ אֶל־אֱ֭לֹהִים דּֽוּמִיָּ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֑י מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ יְשׁוּעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Truly my soul waits quietly for God;
my deliverance comes from Him.

translations.hebrew: אַךְ־ה֣וּא צ֭וּרִי וִישׁוּעָתִ֑י מִ֝שְׂגַּבִּ֗י לֹא־אֶמּ֥וֹט רַבָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Truly He is my rock and deliverance,
my haven; I shall never be shaken.

translations.hebrew: עַד־אָ֤נָה ׀ תְּה֥וֹתְת֣וּ עַל־אִישׁ֮ תְּרָצְּח֢וּ כֻ֫לְּכֶ֥ם כְּקִ֥יר נָט֑וּי גָּ֝דֵ֗ר הַדְּחוּיָֽה׃
translations.english:
How long will all of you attackaMeaning of Heb. uncertain. a man,
to crushaMeaning of Heb. uncertain. him, as though he were
a leaning wall, a tottering fence?

translations.hebrew: אַ֤ךְ מִשְּׂאֵת֨וֹ ׀ יָ֥עֲצ֣וּ לְהַדִּיחַ֮ יִרְצ֢וּ כָ֫זָ֥ב בְּפִ֥יו יְבָרֵ֑כוּ וּ֝בְקִרְבָּ֗ם יְקַֽלְלוּ־סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
They lay plans to topple him from his rank;
they delight in falsehood;
they bless with their mouths,
while inwardly they curse. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אַ֣ךְ לֵ֭אלֹהִים דּ֣וֹמִּי נַפְשִׁ֑י כִּֽי־מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ תִּקְוָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Truly, wait quietly for God, O my soul,
for my hope comes from Him.

translations.hebrew: אַךְ־ה֣וּא צ֭וּרִי וִישׁוּעָתִ֑י מִ֝שְׂגַּבִּ֗י לֹ֣א אֶמּֽוֹט׃
translations.english:
He is my rock and deliverance,
my haven; I shall not be shaken.

translations.hebrew: עַל־אֱ֭לֹהִים יִשְׁעִ֣י וּכְבוֹדִ֑י צוּר־עֻזִּ֥י מַ֝חְסִ֗י בֵּאלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
I rely on God, my deliverance and glory,
my rock of strength;
in God is my refuge.

translations.hebrew: בִּטְח֘וּ־ב֤וֹ בְכׇל־עֵ֨ת ׀ עָ֗ם שִׁפְכֽוּ־לְפָנָ֥יו לְבַבְכֶ֑ם אֱלֹהִ֖ים מַחֲסֶה־לָּ֣נוּ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Trust in Him at all times, O people;
pour out your hearts before Him;
God is our refuge. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אַ֤ךְ ׀ הֶ֥בֶל בְּנֵֽי־אָדָם֮ כָּזָ֢ב בְּנֵ֫י־אִ֥ישׁ בְּמֹאזְנַ֥יִם לַעֲל֑וֹת הֵ֝֗מָּה מֵהֶ֥בֶל יָֽחַד׃
translations.english:
Men are mere breath;
mortals, illusion;
placed on a scale all together,
they weigh even less than a breath.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּבְטְח֣וּ בְעֹשֶׁק֮ וּבְגָזֵ֢ל אַל־תֶּ֫הְבָּ֥לוּ חַ֤יִל ׀ כִּֽי־יָנ֑וּב אַל־תָּשִׁ֥יתוּ לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
Do not trust in violence,
or put false hopes in robbery;
if force bears fruit pay it no mind.

translations.hebrew: אַחַ֤ת ׀ דִּבֶּ֬ר אֱלֹהִ֗ים שְׁתַּֽיִם־ז֥וּ שָׁמָ֑עְתִּי כִּ֥י עֹ֝֗ז לֵֽאלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
One thing God has spoken;
two things have I heard:
that might belongs to God,

translations.hebrew: וּלְךָֽ־אֲדֹנָ֥י חָ֑סֶד כִּֽי־אַתָּ֨ה תְשַׁלֵּ֖ם לְאִ֣ישׁ כְּֽמַעֲשֵֽׂהוּ׃
translations.english:
and faithfulness is Yours, O Lord,
to reward each man according to his deeds.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִ֑ד בִּ֝הְיוֹת֗וֹ בְּמִדְבַּ֥ר יְהוּדָֽה׃
translations.english: A psalm of David, when he was in the Wilderness of Judah.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ אֵלִ֥י אַתָּ֗ה אֲֽשַׁ֫חֲרֶ֥ךָּ צָמְאָ֬ה לְךָ֨ ׀ נַפְשִׁ֗י כָּמַ֣הּ לְךָ֣ בְשָׂרִ֑י בְּאֶרֶץ־צִיָּ֖ה וְעָיֵ֣ף בְּלִי־מָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
God, You are my God;
I search for You,
my soul thirsts for You,
my body yearns for You,
as a parched and thirsty land that has no water.

translations.hebrew: כֵּ֭ן בַּקֹּ֣דֶשׁ חֲזִיתִ֑ךָ לִרְא֥וֹת עֻ֝זְּךָ֗ וּכְבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I shall behold You in the sanctuary,
and see Your might and glory,

translations.hebrew: כִּי־ט֣וֹב חַ֭סְדְּךָ מֵחַיִּ֗ים שְׂפָתַ֥י יְשַׁבְּחֽוּנְךָ׃
translations.english:
Truly Your faithfulness is better than life;
my lips declare Your praise.

I bless You all my life;
I lift up my hands, invoking Your name.

translations.hebrew: כְּמ֤וֹ חֵ֣לֶב וָ֭דֶשֶׁן תִּשְׂבַּ֣ע נַפְשִׁ֑י וְשִׂפְתֵ֥י רְ֝נָנ֗וֹת יְהַלֶּל־פִּֽי׃
translations.english:
I am sated as with a aLit. “suet and fat.”rich feast,-a
I sing praises with joyful lips

translations.hebrew: אִם־זְכַרְתִּ֥יךָ עַל־יְצוּעָ֑י בְּ֝אַשְׁמֻר֗וֹת אֶהְגֶּה־בָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
when I call You to mind upon my bed,
when I think of You in the watches of the night;

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הָיִ֣יתָ עֶזְרָ֣תָה לִּ֑י וּבְצֵ֖ל כְּנָפֶ֣יךָ אֲרַנֵּֽן׃
translations.english:
for You are my help,
and in the shadow of Your wings
I shout for joy.

translations.hebrew: דָּבְקָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֣י אַחֲרֶ֑יךָ בִּ֝֗י תָּמְכָ֥ה יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My soul is attached to You;
Your right hand supports me.

translations.hebrew: וְהֵ֗מָּה לְ֭שׁוֹאָה יְבַקְשׁ֣וּ נַפְשִׁ֑י יָ֝בֹ֗אוּ בְּֽתַחְתִּיּ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
May those who seek to destroy my life
enter the depths of the earth.

translations.hebrew: יַגִּירֻ֥הוּ עַל־יְדֵי־חָ֑רֶב מְנָ֖ת שֻׁעָלִ֣ים יִהְיֽוּ׃
translations.english:
May they be gutted by the sword;
may they be prey to jackals.

translations.hebrew: וְהַמֶּלֶךְ֮ יִשְׂמַ֢ח בֵּאלֹ֫הִ֥ים יִ֭תְהַלֵּל כׇּל־הַנִּשְׁבָּ֣ע בּ֑וֹ כִּ֥י יִ֝סָּכֵ֗ר פִּ֣י דוֹבְרֵי־שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
But the king shall rejoice in God;
all who swear by Him shall exult,
when the mouth of liars is stopped.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: שְׁמַע־אֱלֹהִ֣ים קוֹלִ֣י בְשִׂיחִ֑י מִפַּ֥חַד א֝וֹיֵ֗ב תִּצֹּ֥ר חַיָּֽי׃
translations.english:
Hear my voice, O God, when I plead;
guard my life from the enemy’s terror.

translations.hebrew: תַּ֭סְתִּירֵנִי מִסּ֣וֹד מְרֵעִ֑ים מֵ֝רִגְשַׁ֗ת פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Hide me from a band of evil men,
from a crowd of evildoers,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר שָׁנְנ֣וּ כַחֶ֣רֶב לְשׁוֹנָ֑ם דָּרְכ֥וּ חִ֝צָּ֗ם דָּבָ֥ר מָֽר׃
translations.english:
who whet their tongues like swords;
they aim their arrows—cruel words—

translations.hebrew: לִירֹ֣ת בַּמִּסְתָּרִ֣ים תָּ֑ם פִּתְאֹ֥ם יֹ֝רֻ֗הוּ וְלֹ֣א יִירָֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
to shoot from hiding at the blameless man;
they shoot him suddenly and without fear.

translations.hebrew: יְחַזְּקוּ־לָ֨מוֹ ׀ דָּ֘בָ֤ר רָ֗ע יְֽ֭סַפְּרוּ לִטְמ֣וֹן מוֹקְשִׁ֑ים אָ֝מְר֗וּ מִ֣י יִרְאֶה־לָּֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.They arm themselves with an evil word;
when they speak, it is to conceal traps;-a
they think, “Who will see them?”

translations.hebrew: יַ֥חְפְּֽשׂוּ־עוֹלֹ֗ת תַּ֭מְנוּ חֵ֣פֶשׂ מְחֻפָּ֑שׂ וְקֶ֥רֶב אִ֝֗ישׁ וְלֵ֣ב עָמֹֽק׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of verse uncertain.Let the wrongdoings cReading t·amnu with some mss. (cf. Minh·at Shai) and Rashi; most printed editions tamnu, traditionally rendered “they have accom-plished.”they have concealed,-c
each one inside him, his secret thoughts,
be wholly exposed.

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּרֵ֗ם אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים חֵ֥ץ פִּתְא֑וֹם הָ֝י֗וּ מַכּוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
God shall shoot them with arrows;
they shall be struck down suddenly.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּכְשִׁיל֣וּהוּ עָלֵ֣ימוֹ לְשׁוֹנָ֑ם יִ֝תְנֹדְד֗וּ כׇּל־רֹ֥אֵה בָֽם׃
translations.english:
Their tongue shall be their downfall;
all who see them shall recoil in horror;

translations.hebrew: וַיִּֽירְא֗וּ כׇּל־אָ֫דָ֥ם וַ֭יַּגִּידוּ פֹּ֥עַל אֱלֹהִ֗ים וּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֥הוּ הִשְׂכִּֽילוּ׃
translations.english:
all men shall stand in awe;
they shall proclaim the work of God
and His deed which they perceived.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׂמַ֬ח צַדִּ֣יק בַּ֭יהֹוָה וְחָ֣סָה ב֑וֹ וְ֝יִתְהַלְל֗וּ כׇּל־יִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
The righteous shall rejoice in the LORD,
and take refuge in Him;
all the upright shall exult.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָוִ֥ד שִֽׁיר׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David. A song.

translations.hebrew: לְךָ֤ דֻֽמִיָּ֬ה תְהִלָּ֓ה אֱלֹ֘הִ֥ים בְּצִיּ֑וֹן וּ֝לְךָ֗ יְשֻׁלַּם־נֶֽדֶר׃
translations.english:
Praise befits You in Zion, O God;
vows are paid to You;

translations.hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֥עַ תְּפִלָּ֑ה עָ֝דֶ֗יךָ כׇּל־בָּשָׂ֥ר יָבֹֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
all mankindaLit. “flesh.” comes to You,
You who hear prayer.

translations.hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֣י עֲ֭וֺנֹת גָּ֣בְרוּ מֶ֑נִּי פְּ֝שָׁעֵ֗ינוּ אַתָּ֥ה תְכַפְּרֵֽם׃
translations.english:
When all manner of sins overwhelm me,
it is You who forgive our iniquities.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֤י ׀ תִּ֥בְחַ֣ר וּתְקָרֵב֮ יִשְׁכֹּ֢ן חֲצֵ֫רֶ֥יךָ נִ֭שְׂבְּעָה בְּט֣וּב בֵּיתֶ֑ךָ קְ֝דֹ֗שׁ הֵיכָלֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Happy is the man You choose and bring near
to dwell in Your courts;
may we be sated with the blessings of Your house,
Your holy temple.

translations.hebrew: נ֤וֹרָא֨וֹת ׀ בְּצֶ֣דֶק תַּ֭עֲנֵנוּ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעֵ֑נוּ מִבְטָ֥ח כׇּל־קַצְוֵי־אֶ֝֗רֶץ וְיָ֣ם רְחֹקִֽים׃
translations.english:
Answer us with victory through awesome deeds,
O God, our deliverer,
in whom all the ends of the earth
and the distant seas
put their trust;

translations.hebrew: מֵכִ֣ין הָרִ֣ים בְּכֹח֑וֹ נֶ֝אְזָ֗ר בִּגְבוּרָֽה׃
translations.english:
who by His power fixed the mountains firmly,
who is girded with might,

translations.hebrew: מַשְׁבִּ֤יחַ ׀ שְׁא֣וֹן יַ֭מִּים שְׁא֥וֹן גַּלֵּיהֶ֗ם וַהֲמ֥וֹן לְאֻמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
who stills the raging seas,
the raging waves,
and tumultuous peoples.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּ֤ירְא֨וּ ׀ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י קְ֭צָוֺת מֵאוֹתֹתֶ֑יךָ מ֤וֹצָֽאֵי־בֹ֖קֶר וָעֶ֣רֶב תַּרְנִֽין׃
translations.english:
Those who live at the ends of the earth are awed by Your signs;
You make the lands of sunrise and sunset shout for joy.

translations.hebrew: פָּ֤קַֽדְתָּ־הָאָ֨רֶץ וַתְּשֹׁ֪קְקֶ֡הָ רַבַּ֬ת תַּעְשְׁרֶ֗נָּה פֶּ֣לֶג אֱ֭לֹהִים מָ֣לֵא מָ֑יִם תָּכִ֥ין דְּ֝גָנָ֗ם כִּי־כֵ֥ן תְּכִינֶֽהָ׃
translations.english:
You take care of the earth and irrigate it;
You enrich it greatly,
with the channel of God full of water;
You provide grain for men;
for so do You prepare it.

translations.hebrew: תְּלָמֶ֣יהָ רַ֭וֵּה נַחֵ֣ת גְּדוּדֶ֑הָ בִּרְבִיבִ֥ים תְּ֝מֹגְגֶ֗נָּה צִמְחָ֥הּ תְּבָרֵֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Saturating its furrows,
leveling its ridges,
You soften it with showers,
You bless its growth.

translations.hebrew: עִ֭טַּרְתָּ שְׁנַ֣ת טוֹבָתֶ֑ךָ וּ֝מַעְגָּלֶ֗יךָ יִרְעֲפ֥וּן דָּֽשֶׁן׃
translations.english:
You crown the year with Your bounty;
fatness is distilled in Your paths;

translations.hebrew: יִ֭רְעֲפוּ נְא֣וֹת מִדְבָּ֑ר וְ֝גִ֗יל גְּבָע֥וֹת תַּחְגֹּֽרְנָה׃
translations.english:
the pasturelands distill it;
the hills are girded with joy.

translations.hebrew: לָבְשׁ֬וּ כָרִ֨ים ׀ הַצֹּ֗אן וַעֲמָקִ֥ים יַֽעַטְפוּ־בָ֑ר יִ֝תְרוֹעֲע֗וּ אַף־יָשִֽׁירוּ׃
translations.english:
The meadows are clothed with flocks,
the valleys mantled with grain;
they raise a shout, they break into song.

translations.hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ שִׁ֣יר מִזְמ֑וֹר הָרִ֥יעוּ לֵ֝אלֹהִ֗ים כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
For the leader. A song. A psalm.

Raise a shout for God, all the earth;

translations.hebrew: זַמְּר֥וּ כְבֽוֹד־שְׁמ֑וֹ שִׂ֥ימוּ כָ֝ב֗וֹד תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
sing the glory of His name,
make glorious His praise.

translations.hebrew: אִמְר֣וּ לֵ֭אלֹהִים מַה־נּוֹרָ֣א מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ בְּרֹ֥ב עֻ֝זְּךָ֗ יְֽכַחֲשׁ֖וּ לְךָ֣ אֹיְבֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Say to God,
“How awesome are Your deeds,
Your enemies cower before Your great strength;

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־הָאָ֤רֶץ ׀ יִשְׁתַּחֲו֣וּ לְ֭ךָ וִיזַמְּרוּ־לָ֑ךְ יְזַמְּר֖וּ שִׁמְךָ֣ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
all the earth bows to You,
and sings hymns to You;
all sing hymns to Your name.” Selah.

translations.hebrew: לְכ֣וּ וּ֭רְאוּ מִפְעֲל֣וֹת אֱלֹהִ֑ים נוֹרָ֥א עֲ֝לִילָ֗ה עַל־בְּנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
Come and see the works of God,
who is held in awe by men for His acts.

translations.hebrew: הָ֤פַךְ יָ֨ם ׀ לְֽיַבָּשָׁ֗ה בַּ֭נָּהָר יַעַבְר֣וּ בְרָ֑גֶל שָׁ֝֗ם נִשְׂמְחָה־בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He turned the sea into dry land;
they crossed the river on foot;
we therefore rejoice in Him.

translations.hebrew: מֹ֘שֵׁ֤ל בִּגְבוּרָת֨וֹ ׀ עוֹלָ֗ם עֵ֭ינָיו בַּגּוֹיִ֣ם תִּצְפֶּ֑ינָה הַסּוֹרְרִ֓ים ׀ אַל־[יָר֖וּמוּ] (ירימו) לָ֣מוֹ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
He rules forever in His might;
His eyes scan the nations;
let the rebellious not assert themselves. Selah.

translations.hebrew: בָּרְכ֖וּ עַמִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ וְ֝הַשְׁמִ֗יעוּ ק֣וֹל תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
O peoples, bless our God,
celebrate His praises;

translations.hebrew: הַשָּׂ֣ם נַ֭פְשֵׁנוּ בַּחַיִּ֑ים וְלֹֽא־נָתַ֖ן לַמּ֣וֹט רַגְלֵֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
who has granted us life,
and has not let our feet slip.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־בְחַנְתָּ֥נוּ אֱלֹהִ֑ים צְ֝רַפְתָּ֗נוּ כִּצְרׇף־כָּֽסֶף׃
translations.english:
You have tried us, O God,
refining us, as one refines silver.

translations.hebrew: הֲבֵאתָ֥נוּ בַמְּצוּדָ֑ה שַׂ֖מְתָּ מוּעָקָ֣ה בְמׇתְנֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
You have caught us in a net,
aLit. “put a trammel on our loins.”caught us in trammels.-a

translations.hebrew: הִרְכַּ֥בְתָּֽ אֱנ֗וֹשׁ לְרֹ֫אשֵׁ֥נוּ בָּֽאנוּ־בָאֵ֥שׁ וּבַמַּ֑יִם וַ֝תּוֹצִיאֵ֗נוּ לָרְוָיָֽה׃
translations.english:
You have let men ride over us;
we have endured fire and water,
and You have brought us through to prosperity.

translations.hebrew: אָב֣וֹא בֵיתְךָ֣ בְעוֹל֑וֹת אֲשַׁלֵּ֖ם לְךָ֣ נְדָרָֽי׃
translations.english:
I enter Your house with burnt offerings,
I pay my vows to You,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־פָּצ֥וּ שְׂפָתָ֑י וְדִבֶּר־פִּ֝֗י בַּצַּר־לִֽי׃
translations.english:
[vows] that my lips pronounced,
that my mouth uttered in my distress.

translations.hebrew: עֹ֘ל֤וֹת מֵיחִ֣ים אַֽעֲלֶה־לָּ֭ךְ עִם־קְטֹ֣רֶת אֵילִ֑ים אֶ֥עֱשֶֽׂה־בָקָ֖ר עִם־עַתּוּדִ֣ים סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
I offer up fatlings to You,
with the odor of burning rams;
I sacrifice bulls and he-goats. Selah.

translations.hebrew: לְכוּ־שִׁמְע֣וּ וַ֭אֲסַפְּרָה כׇּל־יִרְאֵ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֖ר עָשָׂ֣ה לְנַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
Come and hear, all God-fearing men,
as I tell what He did for me.

translations.hebrew: אֵלָ֥יו פִּֽי־קָרָ֑אתִי וְ֝רוֹמַ֗ם תַּ֣חַת לְשׁוֹנִֽי׃
translations.english:
I called aloud to Him,
glorification on my tongue.

translations.hebrew: אָ֭וֶן אִם־רָאִ֣יתִי בְלִבִּ֑י לֹ֖א יִשְׁמַ֣ע <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָֽי׃
translations.english:
Had I an evil thought in my mind,
the Lord would not have listened.

translations.hebrew: אָ֭כֵן שָׁמַ֣ע אֱלֹהִ֑ים הִ֝קְשִׁ֗יב בְּק֣וֹל תְּפִלָּתִֽי׃
translations.english:
But God did listen;
He paid heed to my prayer.

translations.hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־הֵסִ֘יר־תְּפִלָּתִ֥י וְ֝חַסְדּ֗וֹ מֵאִתִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Blessed is God who has not turned away my prayer,
or His faithful care from me.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֗ת מִזְמ֥וֹר שִֽׁיר׃
translations.english: For the leader; with instrumental music. A psalm. A song.

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים יְחׇנֵּ֥נוּ וִיבָרְכֵ֑נוּ יָ֤אֵֽר־פָּנָ֖יו אִתָּ֣נוּ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
May God be gracious to us and bless us;
may He show us favor, selah

translations.hebrew: לָדַ֣עַת בָּאָ֣רֶץ דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ בְּכׇל־גּ֝וֹיִ֗ם יְשׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
that Your way be known on earth,
Your deliverance among all nations.

translations.hebrew: יוֹד֖וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֱלֹהִ֑ים י֝וֹד֗וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים כֻּלָּֽם׃
translations.english:
Peoples will praise You, O God;
all peoples will praise You.

translations.hebrew: יִ֥שְׂמְח֥וּ וִירַנְּנ֗וּ לְאֻ֫מִּ֥ים כִּֽי־תִשְׁפֹּ֣ט עַמִּ֣ים מִישֹׁ֑ר וּלְאֻמִּ֓ים ׀ בָּאָ֖רֶץ תַּנְחֵ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Nations will exult and shout for joy,
for You rule the peoples with equity,
You guide the nations of the earth. Selah.

translations.hebrew: יוֹד֖וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֱלֹהִ֑ים י֝וֹד֗וּךָ עַמִּ֥ים כֻּלָּֽם׃
translations.english:
The peoples will praise You, O God;
all peoples will praise You.

translations.hebrew: אֶ֭רֶץ נָתְנָ֣ה יְבוּלָ֑הּ יְ֝בָרְכֵ֗נוּ אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
May the earth yield its produce;
may God, our God, bless us.

translations.hebrew: יְבָרְכֵ֥נוּ אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְיִֽירְא֥וּ א֝וֹת֗וֹ כׇּל־אַפְסֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
May God bless us,
and be revered to the ends of the earth.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ לְדָוִ֗ד מִזְמ֥וֹר שִֽׁיר׃
translations.english: aThe coherence of this psalm and the meaning of many of its passages are uncertain.For the leader. Of David. A psalm. A song.

translations.hebrew: יָק֣וּם אֱ֭לֹהִים יָפ֣וּצוּ אוֹיְבָ֑יו וְיָנ֥וּסוּ מְ֝שַׂנְאָ֗יו מִפָּנָֽיו׃
translations.english:
God will arise,
His enemies shall be scattered,
His foes shall flee before Him.

translations.hebrew: כְּהִנְדֹּ֥ף עָשָׁ֗ן תִּ֫נְדֹּ֥ף כְּהִמֵּ֣ס דּ֭וֹנַג מִפְּנֵי־אֵ֑שׁ יֹאבְד֥וּ רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים מִפְּנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
Disperse them as smoke is dispersed;
as wax melts at fire,
so the wicked shall perish before God.

translations.hebrew: וְֽצַדִּיקִ֗ים יִשְׂמְח֣וּ יַ֭עַלְצוּ לִפְנֵ֥י אֱלֹהִ֗ים וְיָשִׂ֥ישׂוּ בְשִׂמְחָֽה׃
translations.english:
But the righteous shall rejoice;
they shall exult in the presence of God;
they shall be exceedingly joyful.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֤ירוּ ׀ לֵאלֹהִים֮ זַמְּר֢וּ שְׁ֫מ֥וֹ סֹ֡לּוּ לָרֹכֵ֣ב בָּ֭עֲרָבוֹת בְּיָ֥הּ שְׁמ֗וֹ וְעִלְז֥וּ לְפָנָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Sing to God, chant hymns to His name;
extol Him who rides the clouds;
the LORD is His name.
Exult in His presence—

translations.hebrew: אֲבִ֣י יְ֭תוֹמִים וְדַיַּ֣ן אַלְמָנ֑וֹת אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים בִּמְע֥וֹן קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
the father of orphans, the champion of widows,
God, in His holy habitation.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ מ֘וֹשִׁ֤יב יְחִידִ֨ים ׀ בַּ֗יְתָה מוֹצִ֣יא אֲ֭סִירִים בַּכּוֹשָׁר֑וֹת אַ֥ךְ ס֝וֹרְרִ֗ים שָׁכְנ֥וּ צְחִיחָֽה׃
translations.english:
God restores the lonely to their homes,
sets free the imprisoned, safe and sound,
while the rebellious must live in a parched land.

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים בְּ֭צֵאתְךָ לִפְנֵ֣י עַמֶּ֑ךָ בְּצַעְדְּךָ֖ בִישִׁימ֣וֹן סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
O God, when You went at the head of Your army,
when You marched through the desert, selah

translations.hebrew: אֶ֤רֶץ רָעָ֨שָׁה ׀ אַף־שָׁמַ֣יִם נָטְפוּ֮ מִפְּנֵ֢י אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים זֶ֥ה סִינַ֑י מִפְּנֵ֥י אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
the earth trembled, the sky rained because of God,
yon Sinai, because of God, the God of Israel.

translations.hebrew: גֶּ֣שֶׁם נְ֭דָבוֹת תָּנִ֣יף אֱלֹהִ֑ים נַחֲלָתְךָ֥ וְ֝נִלְאָ֗ה אַתָּ֥ה כוֹנַנְתָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
You released a bountiful rain, O God;
when Your own land languished, You sustained it.

translations.hebrew: חַיָּתְךָ֥ יָשְׁבוּ־בָ֑הּ תָּ֤כִֽין־בְּטוֹבָתְךָ֖ לֶֽעָנִ֣י אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
Your tribe dwells there;
O God, in Your goodness You provide for the needy.

translations.hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֥י יִתֶּן־אֹ֑מֶר הַֽ֝מְבַשְּׂר֗וֹת צָבָ֥א רָֽב׃
translations.english:
The Lord gives a command;
the women who bring the news are a great host:

translations.hebrew: מַלְכֵ֣י צְ֭בָאוֹת יִדֹּד֣וּן יִדֹּד֑וּן וּנְוַת־בַּ֝֗יִת תְּחַלֵּ֥ק שָׁלָֽל׃
translations.english:
“The kings and their armies are in headlong flight;
housewives are sharing in the spoils;

translations.hebrew: אִֽם־תִּשְׁכְּבוּן֮ בֵּ֤ין שְׁפַ֫תָּ֥יִם כַּנְפֵ֣י י֭וֹנָה נֶחְפָּ֣ה בַכֶּ֑סֶף וְ֝אֶבְרוֹתֶ֗יהָ בִּירַקְרַ֥ק חָרֽוּץ׃
translations.english:
even for those of you who lie among the sheepfolds
there are wings of a dove sheathed in silver,
its pinions in fine gold.”

translations.hebrew: בְּפָ֘רֵ֤שׂ שַׁדַּ֓י מְלָ֘כִ֤ים בָּ֗הּ תַּשְׁלֵ֥ג בְּצַלְמֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
When Shaddai scattered the kings,
it seemed like a snowstorm in Zalmon.

translations.hebrew: הַר־אֱ֭לֹהִים הַר־בָּשָׁ֑ן הַ֥ר גַּ֝בְנֻנִּ֗ים הַר־בָּשָֽׁן׃
translations.english:
O majestic mountain, Mount Bashan;
O jagged mountain, Mount Bashan;

translations.hebrew: לָ֤מָּה ׀ תְּֽרַצְּדוּן֮ הָרִ֢ים גַּבְנֻ֫נִּ֥ים הָהָ֗ר חָמַ֣ד אֱלֹהִ֣ים לְשִׁבְתּ֑וֹ אַף־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יִשְׁכֹּ֥ן לָנֶֽצַח׃
translations.english:
why so hostile, O jagged mountains,
toward the mountain God desired as His dwelling?
The LORD shall abide there forever.

translations.hebrew: רֶ֤כֶב אֱלֹהִ֗ים רִבֹּתַ֣יִם אַלְפֵ֣י שִׁנְאָ֑ן אֲדֹנָ֥י בָֿ֝֗ם סִינַ֥י בַּקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
God’s chariots are myriads upon myriads,
thousands upon thousands;
the Lord is among them as in Sinai in holiness.

translations.hebrew: עָ֘לִ֤יתָ לַמָּר֨וֹם ׀ שָׁ֘בִ֤יתָ שֶּׁ֗בִי לָקַ֣חְתָּ מַ֭תָּנוֹת בָּאָדָ֑ם וְאַ֥ף ס֝וֹרְרִ֗ים לִשְׁכֹּ֤ן ׀ יָ֬הּ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
You went up to the heights, having taken captives,
having received tribute of men,
even of those who rebel
against the LORD God’s abiding there.

translations.hebrew: בָּ֤ר֣וּךְ אֲדֹנָי֮ י֤וֹם ׀ י֥֫וֹם יַעֲמׇס־לָ֗נוּ הָ֘אֵ֤ל יְֽשׁוּעָתֵ֬נוּ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Blessed is the Lord.
Day by day He supports us,
God, our deliverance. Selah.

translations.hebrew: הָ֤אֵ֣ל <small>׀</small> לָנוּ֮ אֵ֤ל לְֽמ֫וֹשָׁע֥וֹת וְלֵיהֹוִ֥ה אֲדֹנָ֑י לַ֝מָּ֗וֶת תֹּצָאֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
God is for us a God of deliverance;
GOD the Lord provides an escape from death.

translations.hebrew: אַךְ־אֱלֹהִ֗ים יִמְחַץ֮ רֹ֤אשׁ אֹ֫יְבָ֥יו קׇדְקֹ֥ד שֵׂעָ֑ר מִ֝תְהַלֵּ֗ךְ בַּאֲשָׁמָֽיו׃
translations.english:
God will smash the heads of His enemies,
the hairy crown of him who walks about in his guilt.

translations.hebrew: אָמַ֣ר אֲ֭דֹנָי מִבָּשָׁ֣ן אָשִׁ֑יב אָ֝שִׁ֗יב מִֽמְּצֻל֥וֹת יָֽם׃
translations.english:
The Lord said, “I will retrieve from Bashan,
I will retrieve from the depths of the sea;

translations.hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן ׀ תִּ֥מְחַ֥ץ רַגְלְךָ֗ בְּ֫דָ֥ם לְשׁ֥וֹן כְּלָבֶ֑יךָ מֵאֹיְבִ֥ים מִנֵּֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
that your feet may wade through blood;
that the tongue of your dogs may have its portion of your enemies.”

translations.hebrew: רָא֣וּ הֲלִיכוֹתֶ֣יךָ אֱלֹהִ֑ים הֲלִ֘יכ֤וֹת אֵלִ֖י מַלְכִּ֣י בַקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
Men see Your processions, O God,
the processions of my God, my king,
into the sanctuary.

translations.hebrew: קִדְּמ֣וּ שָׁ֭רִים אַחַ֣ר נֹגְנִ֑ים בְּת֥וֹךְ עֲ֝לָמ֗וֹת תּוֹפֵפֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
First come singers, then musicians,
amidst maidens playing timbrels.

translations.hebrew: בְּֽ֭מַקְהֵלוֹת בָּרְכ֣וּ אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י מִמְּק֥וֹר יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
In assemblies bless God,
the LORD, O you who are from the fountain of Israel.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֤ם בִּנְיָמִ֨ן ׀ צָעִ֡יר רֹדֵ֗ם שָׂרֵ֣י יְ֭הוּדָה רִגְמָתָ֑ם שָׂרֵ֥י זְ֝בֻל֗וּן שָׂרֵ֥י נַפְתָּלִֽי׃
translations.english:
There is little Benjamin who rules them,
the princes of Judah who command them,
the princes of Zebulun and Naphtali.

translations.hebrew: צִוָּ֥ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ עֻ֫זֶּ֥ךָ עוּזָּ֥ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים ז֝֗וּ פָּעַ֥לְתָּ לָּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Your God has ordained strength for you,
the strength, O God,
which You displayed for us

translations.hebrew: מֵ֭הֵיכָלֶךָ עַל־יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם לְךָ֤ יוֹבִ֖ילוּ מְלָכִ֣ים שָֽׁי׃
translations.english:
from Your temple above Jerusalem.
The kings bring You tribute.

translations.hebrew: גְּעַ֨ר חַיַּ֪ת קָנֶ֡ה עֲדַ֤ת אַבִּירִ֨ים ׀ בְּעֶגְלֵ֬י עַמִּ֗ים מִתְרַפֵּ֥ס בְּרַצֵּי־כָ֑סֶף בִּזַּ֥ר עַ֝מִּ֗ים קְרָב֥וֹת יֶחְפָּֽצוּ׃
translations.english:
Blast the beast of the marsh,
the herd of bulls among the peoples, the calves,
till they come cringing with pieces of silver.
Scatter the peoples who delight in wars!

translations.hebrew: יֶאֱתָ֣יוּ חַ֭שְׁמַנִּים מִנִּ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם כּ֥וּשׁ תָּרִ֥יץ יָ֝דָ֗יו לֵאלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
Tribute-bearers shall come from Egypt;
Cush shall hasten its gifts to God.

translations.hebrew: מַמְלְכ֣וֹת הָ֭אָרֶץ שִׁ֣ירוּ לֵאלֹהִ֑ים זַמְּר֖וּ אֲדֹנָ֣י סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
O kingdoms of the earth,
sing to God;
chant hymns to the Lord, selah

translations.hebrew: לָ֭רֹכֵב בִּשְׁמֵ֣י שְׁמֵי־קֶ֑דֶם הֵ֥ן יִתֵּ֥ן בְּ֝קוֹל֗וֹ ק֣וֹל עֹֽז׃
translations.english:
to Him who rides the ancient highest heavens,
who thunders forth with His mighty voice.

translations.hebrew: תְּנ֥וּ עֹ֗ז לֵאלֹ֫הִ֥ים עַֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל גַּאֲוָת֑וֹ וְ֝עֻזּ֗וֹ בַּשְּׁחָקִֽים׃
translations.english:
Ascribe might to God,
whose majesty is over Israel,
whose might is in the skies.

translations.hebrew: נ֤וֹרָ֥א אֱלֹהִ֗ים מִֽמִּקְדָּ֫שֶׁ֥יךָ אֵ֤ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל ה֤וּא נֹתֵ֨ן ׀ עֹ֖ז וְתַעֲצֻמ֥וֹת לָעָ֗ם בָּר֥וּךְ אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
You are awesome, O God, in Your holy places;
it is the God of Israel who gives might and power to the people.
Blessed is God.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> עַֽל־שׁוֹשַׁנִּ֬ים לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. On shoshannim.aMeaning of Heb. uncertain. Of David.

translations.hebrew: הוֹשִׁיעֵ֥נִי אֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֤י בָ֖אוּ מַ֣יִם עַד־נָֽפֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
Deliver me, O God,
for the waters have reached my neck;

translations.hebrew: טָבַ֤עְתִּי ׀ בִּיוֵ֣ן מְ֭צוּלָה וְאֵ֣ין מׇעֳמָ֑ד בָּ֥אתִי בְמַעֲמַקֵּי־מַ֝֗יִם וְשִׁבֹּ֥לֶת שְׁטָפָֽתְנִי׃
translations.english:
I am sinking into the slimy deep
and find no foothold;
I have come into the watery depths;
the flood sweeps me away.

translations.hebrew: יָגַ֣עְתִּי בְקׇרְאִי֮ נִחַ֢ר גְּר֫וֹנִ֥י כָּל֥וּ עֵינַ֑י מְ֝יַחֵ֗ל לֵאלֹהָֽי׃
translations.english:
I am weary with calling;
my throat is dry;
my eyes fail
while I wait for God.

translations.hebrew: רַבּ֤וּ ׀ מִשַּׂעֲר֣וֹת רֹאשִׁי֮ שֹׂנְאַ֢י חִ֫נָּ֥ם עָצְמ֣וּ מַ֭צְמִיתַי אֹיְבַ֣י שֶׁ֑קֶר אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־גָ֝זַ֗לְתִּי אָ֣ז אָשִֽׁיב׃
translations.english:
More numerous than the hairs of my head
are those who hate me without reason;
many are those who would destroy me,
my treacherous enemies.
Must I restore what I have not stolen?

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים אַתָּ֣ה יָ֭דַעְתָּ לְאִוַּלְתִּ֑י וְ֝אַשְׁמוֹתַ֗י מִמְּךָ֥ לֹֽא־נִכְחָֽדוּ׃
translations.english:
God, You know my folly;
my guilty deeds are not hidden from You.

translations.hebrew: אַל־יֵ֘בֹ֤שׁוּ בִ֨י ׀ קֹוֶיךָ֮ אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֗ה צְבָ֫א֥וֹת אַל־יִכָּ֣לְמֽוּ בִ֣י מְבַקְשֶׁ֑יךָ אֱ֝לֹהֵ֗י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
Let those who look to You,
O Lord, GOD of hosts,
not be disappointed on my account;
let those who seek You,
O God of Israel,
not be shamed because of me.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־עָ֭לֶיךָ נָשָׂ֣אתִי חֶרְפָּ֑ה כִּסְּתָ֖ה כְלִמָּ֣ה פָנָֽי׃
translations.english:
It is for Your sake that I have been reviled,
that shame covers my face;

translations.hebrew: מ֭וּזָר הָיִ֣יתִי לְאֶחָ֑י וְ֝נׇכְרִ֗י לִבְנֵ֥י אִמִּֽי׃
translations.english:
I am a stranger to my brothers,
an alien to my kin.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־קִנְאַ֣ת בֵּיתְךָ֣ אֲכָלָ֑תְנִי וְחֶרְפּ֥וֹת ח֝וֹרְפֶ֗יךָ נָפְל֥וּ עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
My zeal for Your house has been my undoing;
the reproaches of those who revile You have fallen upon me.

translations.hebrew: וָאֶבְכֶּ֣ה בַצּ֣וֹם נַפְשִׁ֑י וַתְּהִ֖י לַחֲרָפ֣וֹת לִֽי׃
translations.english:
When I wept and fasted,
I was reviled for it.

translations.hebrew: וָאֶתְּנָ֣ה לְבוּשִׁ֣י שָׂ֑ק וָאֱהִ֖י לָהֶ֣ם לְמָשָֽׁל׃
translations.english:
I made sackcloth my garment;
I became a byword among them.

translations.hebrew: יָשִׂ֣יחוּ בִ֭י יֹ֣שְׁבֵי שָׁ֑עַר וּ֝נְגִינ֗וֹת שׁוֹתֵ֥י שֵׁכָֽר׃
translations.english:
Those who sit in the gate talk about me;
I am the taunt of drunkards.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י תְפִלָּֽתִי־לְךָ֨ ׀ יְהֹוָ֡ה עֵ֤ת רָצ֗וֹן אֱלֹהִ֥ים בְּרׇב־חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ עֲ֝נֵ֗נִי בֶּאֱמֶ֥ת יִשְׁעֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
As for me, may my prayer come to You, O LORD,
at a favorable moment;
O God, in Your abundant faithfulness,
answer me with Your sure deliverance.

translations.hebrew: הַצִּילֵ֣נִי מִ֭טִּיט וְאַל־אֶטְבָּ֑עָה אִנָּצְלָ֥ה מִ֝שֹּׂנְאַ֗י וּמִמַּ֖עֲמַקֵּי־מָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
Rescue me from the mire;
let me not sink;
let me be rescued from my enemies,
and from the watery depths.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּשְׁטְפֵ֤נִי ׀ שִׁבֹּ֣לֶת מַ֭יִם וְאַל־תִּבְלָעֵ֣נִי מְצוּלָ֑ה וְאַל־תֶּאְטַר־עָלַ֖י בְּאֵ֣ר פִּֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
Let the floodwaters not sweep me away;
let the deep not swallow me;
let the mouth of the Pit not close over me.

translations.hebrew: עֲנֵ֣נִי יְ֭הֹוָה כִּי־ט֣וֹב חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ כְּרֹ֥ב רַ֝חֲמֶ֗יךָ פְּנֵ֣ה אֵלָֽי׃
translations.english:
Answer me, O LORD,
according to Your great steadfastness;
in accordance with Your abundant mercy
turn to me;

translations.hebrew: וְאַל־תַּסְתֵּ֣ר פָּ֭נֶיךָ מֵעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּי־צַר־לִ֝֗י מַהֵ֥ר עֲנֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
do not hide Your face from Your servant,
for I am in distress;
answer me quickly.

translations.hebrew: קׇרְבָ֣ה אֶל־נַפְשִׁ֣י גְאָלָ֑הּ לְמַ֖עַן אֹיְבַ֣י פְּדֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Come near to me and redeem me;
free me from my enemies.

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה יָדַ֗עְתָּ חֶרְפָּתִ֣י וּ֭בׇשְׁתִּי וּכְלִמָּתִ֑י נֶ֝גְדְּךָ֗ כׇּל־צוֹרְרָֽי׃
translations.english:
You know my reproach,
my shame, my disgrace;
You are aware of all my foes.

translations.hebrew: חֶרְפָּ֤ה ׀ שָׁ֥בְרָ֥ה לִבִּ֗י וָאָ֫נ֥וּשָׁה וָאֲקַוֶּ֣ה לָנ֣וּד וָאַ֑יִן וְ֝לַמְנַחֲמִ֗ים וְלֹ֣א מָצָֽאתִי׃
translations.english:
Reproach breaks my heart,
I am in despair;aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.
I hope for consolation, but there is none,
for comforters, but find none.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֣וּ בְּבָרוּתִ֣י רֹ֑אשׁ וְ֝לִצְמָאִ֗י יַשְׁק֥וּנִי חֹֽמֶץ׃
translations.english:
They give me gall for food,
vinegar to quench my thirst.

translations.hebrew: יְהִי־שֻׁלְחָנָ֣ם לִפְנֵיהֶ֣ם לְפָ֑ח וְלִשְׁלוֹמִ֥ים לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
May their table be a trap for them,
a snare for their allies.

translations.hebrew: תֶּחְשַׁ֣כְנָה עֵ֭ינֵיהֶם מֵרְא֑וֹת וּ֝מׇתְנֵיהֶ֗ם תָּמִ֥יד הַמְעַֽד׃
translations.english:
May their eyes grow dim so that they cannot see;
may their loins collapse continually.

translations.hebrew: שְׁפׇךְ־עֲלֵיהֶ֥ם זַעְמֶ֑ךָ וַחֲר֥וֹן אַ֝פְּךָ֗ יַשִּׂיגֵֽם׃
translations.english:
Pour out Your wrath on them;
may Your blazing anger overtake them;

translations.hebrew: תְּהִי־טִירָתָ֥ם נְשַׁמָּ֑ה בְּ֝אׇהֳלֵיהֶ֗ם אַל־יְהִ֥י יֹשֵֽׁב׃
translations.english:
may their encampments be desolate;
may their tents stand empty.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־אַתָּ֣ה אֲשֶׁר־הִכִּ֣יתָ רָדָ֑פוּ וְאֶל־מַכְא֖וֹב חֲלָלֶ֣יךָ יְסַפֵּֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
For they persecute those You have struck;
they talk about the pain of those You have felled.

translations.hebrew: תְּֽנָה־עָ֭וֺן עַל־עֲוֺנָ֑ם וְאַל־יָ֝בֹ֗אוּ בְּצִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Add that to their guilt;
let them have no share of Your beneficence;

translations.hebrew: יִ֭מָּחֽוּ מִסֵּ֣פֶר חַיִּ֑ים וְעִ֥ם צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים אַל־יִכָּתֵֽבוּ׃
translations.english:
may they be erased from the book of life,
and not be inscribed with the righteous.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי עָנִ֣י וְכוֹאֵ֑ב יְשׁוּעָתְךָ֖ אֱלֹהִ֣ים תְּשַׂגְּבֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
But I am lowly and in pain;
Your help, O God, keeps me safe.

translations.hebrew: אֲהַלְלָ֣ה שֵׁם־אֱלֹהִ֣ים בְּשִׁ֑יר וַאֲגַדְּלֶ֥נּוּ בְתוֹדָֽה׃
translations.english:
I will extol God’s name with song,
and exalt Him with praise.

translations.hebrew: וְתִיטַ֣ב לַ֭יהֹוָה מִשּׁ֥וֹר פָּ֗ר מַקְרִ֥ן מַפְרִֽיס׃
translations.english:
That will please the LORD more than oxen,
than bulls with horns and hooves.

translations.hebrew: רָא֣וּ עֲנָוִ֣ים יִשְׂמָ֑חוּ דֹּרְשֵׁ֥י אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים וִיחִ֥י לְבַבְכֶֽם׃
translations.english:
The lowly will see and rejoice;
you who are mindful of God, take heart!

translations.hebrew: כִּי־שֹׁמֵ֣עַ אֶל־אֶבְיוֹנִ֣ים יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאֶת־אֲ֝סִירָ֗יו לֹ֣א בָזָֽה׃
translations.english:
For the LORD listens to the needy,
and does not spurn His captives.

translations.hebrew: יְֽ֭הַלְלוּהוּ שָׁמַ֣יִם וָאָ֑רֶץ יַ֝מִּ֗ים וְֽכׇל־רֹמֵ֥שׂ בָּֽם׃
translations.english:
Heaven and earth shall extol Him,
the seas, and all that moves in them.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ י֘וֹשִׁ֤יעַ צִיּ֗וֹן וְ֭יִבְנֶה עָרֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה וְיָ֥שְׁבוּ שָׁ֝֗ם וִירֵשֽׁוּהָ׃
translations.english:
For God will deliver Zion
and rebuild the cities of Judah;
they shall live there and inherit it;

translations.hebrew: וְזֶ֣רַע עֲ֭בָדָיו יִנְחָל֑וּהָ וְאֹהֲבֵ֥י שְׁ֝מ֗וֹ יִשְׁכְּנוּ־בָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
the offspring of His servants shall possess it;
those who cherish His name shall dwell there.

translations.hebrew: לַ֝מְנַצֵּ֗חַ לְדָוִ֥ד לְהַזְכִּֽיר׃
translations.english: For the leader. Of David. Lehazkir.aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֥ים לְהַצִּילֵ֑נִי יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי חֽוּשָׁה׃
translations.english:
bCf. Ps. 40.14–18.Hasten, O God, to save me;
O LORD, to aid me!

translations.hebrew: יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ וְיַחְפְּרוּ֮ מְבַקְשֵׁ֢י נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י יִסֹּ֣גוּ אָ֭חוֹר וְיִכָּלְמ֑וּ חֲ֝פֵצֵ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Let those who seek my life
be frustrated and disgraced;
let those who wish me harm,
fall back in shame.

translations.hebrew: יָ֭שׁוּבוּ עַל־עֵ֣קֶב בׇּשְׁתָּ֑ם הָ֝אֹמְרִ֗ים הֶ֘אָ֥ח <small>׀</small> הֶאָֽח׃
translations.english:
Let those who say, “Aha! Aha!”
turn back because of their frustration.

translations.hebrew: יָ֘שִׂ֤ישׂוּ וְיִשְׂמְח֨וּ ׀ בְּךָ֗ כׇּֽל־מְבַ֫קְשֶׁ֥יךָ וְיֹאמְר֣וּ תָ֭מִיד יִגְדַּ֣ל אֱלֹהִ֑ים אֹ֝הֲבֵ֗י יְשׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
But let all who seek You be glad and rejoice in You;
let those who are eager for Your deliverance always say,
“Extolled be God!”

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְיוֹן֮ אֱלֹהִ֢ים ח֫וּשָׁה־לִּ֥י עֶזְרִ֣י וּמְפַלְטִ֣י אַ֑תָּה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אַל־תְּאַחַֽר׃
translations.english:
But I am poor and needy;
O God, hasten to me!
You are my help and my rescuer;
O LORD, do not delay.

translations.hebrew: בְּךָֽ־יְהֹוָ֥ה חָסִ֑יתִי אַל־אֵב֥וֹשָׁה לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
I seek refuge in You, O LORD;
may I never be disappointed.

translations.hebrew: בְּצִדְקָתְךָ֗ תַּצִּילֵ֥נִי וּֽתְפַלְּטֵ֑נִי הַטֵּֽה־אֵלַ֥י אׇ֝זְנְךָ֗ וְהוֹשִׁיעֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
As You are beneficent, save me and rescue me;
incline Your ear to me and deliver me.

translations.hebrew: הֱיֵ֤ה לִ֨י ׀ לְצ֥וּר מָע֡וֹן לָב֗וֹא תָּמִ֗יד צִוִּ֥יתָ לְהוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי כִּֽי־סַלְעִ֖י וּמְצוּדָתִ֣י אָֽתָּה׃
translations.english:
Be a sheltering rock for me to which I may always repair;
decree my deliverance,
for You are my rock and my fortress.

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהַ֗י פַּ֭לְּטֵנִי מִיַּ֣ד רָשָׁ֑ע מִכַּ֖ף מְעַוֵּ֣ל וְחוֹמֵֽץ׃
translations.english:
My God, rescue me from the hand of the wicked,
from the grasp of the unjust and the lawless.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה תִקְוָתִ֑י אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱ֝הֹוִ֗ה מִבְטַחִ֥י מִנְּעוּרָֽי׃
translations.english:
For You are my hope,
O Lord GOD,
my trust from my youth.

translations.hebrew: עָלֶ֤יךָ ׀ נִסְמַ֬כְתִּי מִבֶּ֗טֶן מִמְּעֵ֣י אִ֭מִּי אַתָּ֣ה גוֹזִ֑י בְּךָ֖ תְהִלָּתִ֣י תָמִֽיד׃
translations.english:
While yet unborn, I depended on You;
in the womb of my mother, You were my support;aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.
I sing Your praises always.

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭מוֹפֵת הָיִ֣יתִי לְרַבִּ֑ים וְ֝אַתָּ֗ה מַֽחֲסִי־עֹֽז׃
translations.english:
I have become an example for many,
since You are my mighty refuge.

translations.hebrew: יִמָּ֣לֵא פִ֭י תְּהִלָּתֶ֑ךָ כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם תִּפְאַרְתֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My mouth is full of praise to You,
glorifying You all day long.

translations.hebrew: אַֽל־תַּ֭שְׁלִיכֵנִי לְעֵ֣ת זִקְנָ֑ה כִּכְל֥וֹת כֹּ֝חִ֗י אַֽל־תַּעַזְבֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Do not cast me off in old age;
when my strength fails, do not forsake me!

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אָמְר֣וּ אוֹיְבַ֣י לִ֑י וְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י נוֹעֲצ֥וּ יַחְדָּֽו׃
translations.english:
For my enemies talk against me;
those who wait for me are of one mind,

translations.hebrew: לֵ֭אמֹר אֱלֹהִ֣ים עֲזָב֑וֹ רִֽדְפ֥וּ וְ֝תִפְשׂ֗וּהוּ כִּי־אֵ֥ין מַצִּֽיל׃
translations.english:
saying, “God has forsaken him;
chase him and catch him,
for no one will save him!”

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים אַל־תִּרְחַ֣ק מִמֶּ֑נִּי אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י לְעֶזְרָ֥תִי (חישה) [חֽוּשָׁה]׃
translations.english:
O God, be not far from me;
my God, hasten to my aid!

translations.hebrew: יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ יִכְלוּ֮ שֹׂטְנֵ֢י נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י יַעֲט֣וּ חֶ֭רְפָּה וּכְלִמָּ֑ה מְ֝בַקְשֵׁ֗י רָעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Let my accusers perish in frustration;
let those who seek my ruin be clothed in reproach and disgrace!

translations.hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי תָּמִ֣יד אֲיַחֵ֑ל וְ֝הוֹסַפְתִּ֗י עַל־כׇּל־תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
As for me, I will hope always,
and add to the many praises of You.

translations.hebrew: פִּ֤י ׀ יְסַפֵּ֬ר צִדְקָתֶ֗ךָ כׇּל־הַיּ֥וֹם תְּשׁוּעָתֶ֑ךָ כִּ֤י לֹ֖א יָדַ֣עְתִּי סְפֹרֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
My mouth tells of Your beneficence,
of Your deliverance all day long,
though I know not how to tell it.

translations.hebrew: אָב֗וֹא בִּ֭גְבֻרוֹת אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה אַזְכִּ֖יר צִדְקָתְךָ֣ לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I come with praise of Your mighty acts, O Lord GOD;
I celebrate Your beneficence, Yours alone.

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים לִמַּדְתַּ֥נִי מִנְּעוּרָ֑י וְעַד־הֵ֝֗נָּה אַגִּ֥יד נִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
You have let me experience it, God, from my youth;
until now I have proclaimed Your wondrous deeds,

translations.hebrew: וְגַ֤ם עַד־זִקְנָ֨ה ׀ וְשֵׂיבָה֮ אֱלֹהִ֢ים אַֽל־תַּ֫עַזְבֵ֥נִי עַד־אַגִּ֣יד זְרוֹעֲךָ֣ לְד֑וֹר לְכׇל־יָ֝ב֗וֹא גְּבוּרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
and even in hoary old age do not forsake me, God,
until I proclaim Your strength to the next generation,
Your mighty acts, to all who are to come,

translations.hebrew: וְצִדְקָתְךָ֥ אֱלֹהִ֗ים עַד־מָ֫ר֥וֹם אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֥יתָ גְדֹל֑וֹת אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים מִ֣י כָמֽוֹךָ׃
translations.english:
Your beneficence, high as the heavens, O God,
You who have done great things;
O God, who is Your peer!

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר (הראיתנו) [הִרְאִיתַ֨נִי ׀] צָר֥וֹת רַבּ֗וֹת וְרָ֫ע֥וֹת תָּשׁ֥וּב (תחינו) [תְּחַיֵּ֑נִי] וּֽמִתְּהֹמ֥וֹת הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ תָּשׁ֥וּב תַּעֲלֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
You who have made me undergo many troubles and misfortunes
will revive me again,
and raise me up from the depths of the earth.

translations.hebrew: תֶּ֤רֶב ׀ גְּֽדֻלָּתִ֗י וְתִסֹּ֥ב תְּֽנַחֲמֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
You will grant me much greatness,
You will turn and comfort me.

translations.hebrew: גַּם־אֲנִ֤י ׀ אוֹדְךָ֣ בִכְלִי־נֶבֶל֮ אֲמִתְּךָ֢ אֱלֹ֫הָ֥י אֲזַמְּרָ֣ה לְךָ֣ בְכִנּ֑וֹר קְ֝ד֗וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
Then I will acclaim You to the music of the lyre
for Your faithfulness, O my God;
I will sing a hymn to You with a harp,
O Holy One of Israel.

translations.hebrew: תְּרַנֵּ֣נָּה שְׂ֭פָתַי כִּ֣י אֲזַמְּרָה־לָּ֑ךְ וְ֝נַפְשִׁ֗י אֲשֶׁ֣ר פָּדִֽיתָ׃
translations.english:
My lips shall be jubilant, as I sing a hymn to You,
my whole being, which You have redeemed.

translations.hebrew: גַּם־לְשׁוֹנִ֗י כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם תֶּהְגֶּ֣ה צִדְקָתֶ֑ךָ כִּי־בֹ֥שׁוּ כִי־חָ֝פְר֗וּ מְבַקְשֵׁ֥י רָעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
All day long my tongue shall recite Your beneficent acts,
how those who sought my ruin were frustrated and disgraced.

translations.hebrew: לִשְׁלֹמֹ֨ה ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים מִ֭שְׁפָּטֶיךָ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ תֵּ֑ן וְצִדְקָתְךָ֥ לְבֶן־מֶֽלֶךְ׃
translations.english:
Of Solomon.

O God, endow the king with Your judgments,
the king’s son with Your righteousness;
