translations.hebrew: יָדִ֣ין עַמְּךָ֣ בְצֶ֑דֶק וַעֲנִיֶּ֥יךָ בְמִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
that he may judge Your people rightly,
Your lowly ones, justly.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׂא֤וּ הָרִ֓ים שָׁ֘ל֥וֹם לָעָ֑ם וּ֝גְבָע֗וֹת בִּצְדָקָֽה׃
translations.english:
Let the mountains produce well-being for the people,
the hills, the reward of justice.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׁפֹּ֤ט ׀ עֲֽנִיֵּי־עָ֗ם י֭וֹשִׁיעַ לִבְנֵ֣י אֶבְי֑וֹן וִ֖ידַכֵּ֣א עוֹשֵֽׁק׃
translations.english:
Let him champion the lowly among the people,
deliver the needy folk,
and crush those who wrong them.

translations.hebrew: יִירָא֥וּךָ עִם־שָׁ֑מֶשׁ וְלִפְנֵ֥י יָ֝רֵ֗חַ דּ֣וֹר דּוֹרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Let them fear You as long as the sun shines,
while the moon lasts, generations on end.

translations.hebrew: יֵ֭רֵד כְּמָטָ֣ר עַל־גֵּ֑ז כִּ֝רְבִיבִ֗ים זַרְזִ֥יף אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Let him be like rain that falls on a mown field,
like a downpour of rain on the ground,

translations.hebrew: יִֽפְרַח־בְּיָמָ֥יו צַדִּ֑יק וְרֹ֥ב שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם עַד־בְּלִ֥י יָרֵֽחַ׃
translations.english:
that the righteous may flourish in his time,
and well-being abound, till the moon is no more.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭יֵרְדְּ מִיָּ֣ם עַד־יָ֑ם וּ֝מִנָּהָ֗ר עַד־אַפְסֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Let him rule from sea to sea,
from the river to the ends of the earth.

translations.hebrew: לְ֭פָנָיו יִכְרְע֣וּ צִיִּ֑ים וְ֝אֹיְבָ֗יו עָפָ֥ר יְלַחֵֽכוּ׃
translations.english:
Let desert-dwellers kneel before him,
and his enemies lick the dust.

translations.hebrew: מַלְכֵ֬י תַרְשִׁ֣ישׁ וְ֭אִיִּים מִנְחָ֣ה יָשִׁ֑יבוּ מַלְכֵ֥י שְׁבָ֥א וּ֝סְבָ֗א אֶשְׁכָּ֥ר יַקְרִֽיבוּ׃
translations.english:
Let kings of Tarshish and the islands pay tribute,
kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.

translations.hebrew: וְיִשְׁתַּחֲווּ־ל֥וֹ כׇל־מְלָכִ֑ים כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֥ם יַעַבְדֽוּהוּ׃
translations.english:
Let all kings bow to him,
and all nations serve him.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יַ֭צִּיל אֶבְי֣וֹן מְשַׁוֵּ֑עַ וְ֝עָנִ֗י וְֽאֵין־עֹזֵ֥ר לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
For he saves the needy who cry out,
the lowly who have no helper.

translations.hebrew: יָ֭חֹס עַל־דַּ֣ל וְאֶבְי֑וֹן וְנַפְשׁ֖וֹת אֶבְיוֹנִ֣ים יוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
translations.english:
He cares about the poor and the needy;
He brings the needy deliverance.

translations.hebrew: מִתּ֣וֹךְ וּ֭מֵחָמָס יִגְאַ֣ל נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְיֵיקַ֖ר דָּמָ֣ם בְּעֵינָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He redeems them from fraud and lawlessness;
aOr “their life is precious in his sight.”the shedding of their blood weighs heavily upon him.-a

translations.hebrew: וִיחִ֗י וְיִתֶּן־לוֹ֮ מִזְּהַ֢ב שְׁ֫בָ֥א וְיִתְפַּלֵּ֣ל בַּעֲד֣וֹ תָמִ֑יד כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם יְבָרְכֶֽנְהוּ׃
translations.english:
So let him live, and receive gold of Sheba;
let prayers for him be said always,
blessings on him invoked at all times.

translations.hebrew: יְהִ֤י פִסַּת־בַּ֨ר ׀ בָּאָרֶץ֮ בְּרֹ֢אשׁ הָ֫רִ֥ים יִרְעַ֣שׁ כַּלְּבָנ֣וֹן פִּרְי֑וֹ וְיָצִ֥יצוּ מֵ֝עִ֗יר כְּעֵ֣שֶׂב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of some Heb. phrases in these verses uncertain.Let abundant grain be in the land, to the tops of the mountains;
let his crops thrive like the forest of Lebanon;
and let men sprout up in towns like country grass.

translations.hebrew: יְהִ֤י שְׁמ֨וֹ ׀ לְֽעוֹלָ֗ם לִפְנֵי־שֶׁמֶשׁ֮ (ינין) [יִנּ֢וֹן] שְׁ֫מ֥וֹ וְיִתְבָּ֥רְכוּ ב֑וֹ כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֥ם יְאַשְּׁרֽוּהוּ׃
translations.english:
May his name be eternal;
while the sun lasts, may his name endure;-b
let men invoke his blessedness upon themselves;
let all nations count him happy.

translations.hebrew: בָּר֤וּךְ ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עֹשֵׂ֖ה נִפְלָא֣וֹת לְבַדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Blessed is the LORD God, God of Israel,
who alone does wondrous things;

translations.hebrew: וּבָר֤וּךְ ׀ שֵׁ֥ם כְּבוֹד֗וֹ לְע֫וֹלָ֥ם וְיִמָּלֵ֣א כְ֭בוֹדוֹ אֶת־כֹּ֥ל הָאָ֗רֶץ אָ֘מֵ֥ן ׀ וְאָמֵֽן׃
translations.english:
Blessed is His glorious name forever;
His glory fills the whole world.
Amen and Amen.

translations.hebrew: כׇּלּ֥וּ תְפִלּ֑וֹת דָּ֝וִ֗ד בֶּן־יִשָֽׁי׃
translations.english: End of the prayers of David son of Jesse.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אַ֤ךְ ט֖וֹב לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל אֱלֹהִ֗ים לְבָרֵ֥י לֵבָֽב׃
translations.english:
A psalm of Asaph.

God is truly good to Israel,
to those whose heart is pure.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י כִּ֭מְעַט (נטוי) [נָטָ֣יוּ] רַגְלָ֑י כְּ֝אַ֗יִן (שפכה) [שֻׁפְּכ֥וּ] אֲשֻׁרָֽי׃
translations.english:
As for me, my feet had almost strayed,
my steps were nearly led off course,

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־קִ֭נֵּאתִי בַּהוֹלְלִ֑ים שְׁל֖וֹם רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֶרְאֶֽה׃
translations.english:
for I envied the wanton;
I saw the wicked at ease.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֖ין חַרְצֻבּ֥וֹת לְמוֹתָ֗ם וּבָרִ֥יא אוּלָֽם׃
translations.english:
Death has no pangs for them;
their body is healthy.

translations.hebrew: בַּעֲמַ֣ל אֱנ֣וֹשׁ אֵינֵ֑מוֹ וְעִם־אָ֝דָ֗ם לֹ֣א יְנֻגָּֽעוּ׃
translations.english:
They have no part in the travail of men;
they are not afflicted like the rest of mankind.

translations.hebrew: לָ֭כֵן עֲנָקַ֣תְמוֹ גַאֲוָ֑ה יַעֲטָף־שִׁ֝֗ית חָמָ֥ס לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
So pride adorns their necks,
lawlessness enwraps them as a mantle.

translations.hebrew: יָ֭צָא מֵחֵ֣לֶב עֵינֵ֑מוֹ עָ֝בְר֗וּ מַשְׂכִּיּ֥וֹת לֵבָֽב׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Fat shuts out their eyes;
their fancies are extravagant.-a

translations.hebrew: יָמִ֤יקוּ ׀ וִידַבְּר֣וּ בְרָ֣ע עֹ֑שֶׁק מִמָּר֥וֹם יְדַבֵּֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
They scoff and plan evil;
from their eminence they plan wrongdoing.

translations.hebrew: שַׁתּ֣וּ בַשָּׁמַ֣יִם פִּיהֶ֑ם וּ֝לְשׁוֹנָ֗ם תִּהֲלַ֥ךְ בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
They set their mouths against heaven,
and their tongues range over the earth.

translations.hebrew: לָכֵ֤ן ׀ (ישיב) [יָשׁ֣וּב] עַמּ֣וֹ הֲלֹ֑ם וּמֵ֥י מָ֝לֵ֗א יִמָּ֥צוּ לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.So they pound His people again and again,
until they are drained of their very last tear.-a

translations.hebrew: וְֽאָמְר֗וּ אֵיכָ֥ה יָדַֽע־אֵ֑ל וְיֵ֖שׁ דֵּעָ֣ה בְעֶלְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Then they say, “How could God know?
Is there knowledge with the Most High?”

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּה־אֵ֥לֶּה רְשָׁעִ֑ים וְשַׁלְוֵ֥י ע֝וֹלָ֗ם הִשְׂגּוּ־חָֽיִל׃
translations.english:
Such are the wicked;
ever tranquil, they amass wealth.

translations.hebrew: אַךְ־רִ֭יק זִכִּ֣יתִי לְבָבִ֑י וָאֶרְחַ֖ץ בְּנִקָּי֣וֹן כַּפָּֽי׃
translations.english:
It was for nothing that I kept my heart pure
and washed my hands in innocence,

translations.hebrew: וָאֱהִ֣י נָ֭גוּעַ כׇּל־הַיּ֑וֹם וְ֝תוֹכַחְתִּ֗י לַבְּקָרִֽים׃
translations.english:
seeing that I have been constantly afflicted,
that each morning brings new punishments.

translations.hebrew: אִם־אָ֭מַרְתִּי אֲסַפְּרָ֥ה כְמ֑וֹ הִנֵּ֤ה ד֖וֹר בָּנֶ֣יךָ בָגָֽדְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Had I decided to say these things,
I should have been false to the circle of Your disciples.

translations.hebrew: וָ֭אֲחַשְּׁבָה לָדַ֣עַת זֹ֑את עָמָ֖ל (היא) [ה֣וּא] בְעֵינָֽי׃
translations.english:
So I applied myself to understand this,
but it seemed a hopeless task

translations.hebrew: עַד־אָ֭בוֹא אֶל־מִקְדְּשֵׁי־אֵ֑ל אָ֝בִ֗ינָה לְאַחֲרִיתָֽם׃
translations.english:
till I entered God’s sanctuary
and reflected on their fate.

translations.hebrew: אַ֣ךְ בַּ֭חֲלָקוֹת תָּשִׁ֣ית לָ֑מוֹ הִ֝פַּלְתָּ֗ם לְמַשּׁוּאֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
You surround them with flattery;
You make them fall through blandishments.

translations.hebrew: אֵ֤יךְ הָי֣וּ לְשַׁמָּ֣ה כְרָ֑גַע סָ֥פוּ תַ֝֗מּוּ מִן־בַּלָּהֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
How suddenly are they ruined,
wholly swept away by terrors.

translations.hebrew: כַּחֲל֥וֹם מֵהָקִ֑יץ אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י בָּעִ֤יר ׀ צַלְמָ֬ם תִּבְזֶֽה׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.When You are aroused You despise their image,
as one does a dream after waking, O Lord.-a

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭י יִתְחַמֵּ֣ץ לְבָבִ֑י וְ֝כִלְיוֹתַ֗י אֶשְׁתּוֹנָֽן׃
translations.english:
My mind was stripped of its reason,
bLit. “I was pierced through in my kidneys.”my feelings were numbed.-b

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִי־בַ֭עַר וְלֹ֣א אֵדָ֑ע בְּ֝הֵמ֗וֹת הָיִ֥יתִי עִמָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
I was a dolt, without knowledge;
I was brutish toward You.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֣י תָמִ֣יד עִמָּ֑ךְ אָ֝חַ֗זְתָּ בְּיַד־יְמִינִֽי׃
translations.english:
Yet I was always with You,
You held my right hand;

translations.hebrew: בַּעֲצָתְךָ֥ תַנְחֵ֑נִי וְ֝אַחַ֗ר כָּב֥וֹד תִּקָּחֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
You guided me by Your counsel
cMeaning of Heb. uncertain; others “And afterward receive me with glory.”and led me toward honor.-c

translations.hebrew: מִי־לִ֥י בַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְ֝עִמְּךָ֗ לֹא־חָפַ֥צְתִּי בָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Whom else have I in heaven?
And having You, I want no one on earth.

translations.hebrew: כָּלָ֥ה שְׁאֵרִ֗י וּלְבָ֫בִ֥י צוּר־לְבָבִ֥י וְחֶלְקִ֗י אֱלֹהִ֥ים לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
My body and mind fail;
but God is the staydLit. “rock.” of my mind, my portion forever.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֣ה רְחֵקֶ֣יךָ יֹאבֵ֑דוּ הִ֝צְמַ֗תָּה כׇּל־זוֹנֶ֥ה מִמֶּֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Those who keep far from You perish;
You annihilate all who are untrue to You.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ קִ֥רְבַ֥ת אֱלֹהִ֗ים לִ֫י־ט֥וֹב שַׁתִּ֤י ׀ בַּאדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֣ה מַחְסִ֑י לְ֝סַפֵּ֗ר כׇּל־מַלְאֲכוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
As for me, nearness to God is good;
I have made the Lord GOD my refuge,
that I may recount all Your works.

translations.hebrew: מַשְׂכִּ֗יל לְאָ֫סָ֥ף לָמָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים זָנַ֣חְתָּ לָנֶ֑צַח יֶעְשַׁ֥ן אַ֝פְּךָ֗ בְּצֹ֣אן מַרְעִיתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
A maskil of Asaph.

Why, O God, do You forever reject us,
do You fume in anger at the flock that You tend?

translations.hebrew: זְכֹ֤ר עֲדָתְךָ֨ ׀ קָ֘נִ֤יתָ קֶּ֗דֶם גָּ֭אַלְתָּ שֵׁ֣בֶט נַחֲלָתֶ֑ךָ הַר־צִ֝יּ֗וֹן זֶ֤ה ׀ שָׁכַ֬נְתָּ בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Remember the community You made Yours long ago,
Your very own tribe that You redeemed,
Mount Zion, where You dwell.

translations.hebrew: הָרִ֣ימָה פְ֭עָמֶיךָ לְמַשֻּׁא֣וֹת נֶ֑צַח כׇּל־הֵרַ֖ע אוֹיֵ֣ב בַּקֹּֽדֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
aLit. “Lift up Your feet.”Bestir Yourself-a because of the bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.perpetual tumult,-b
all the outrages of the enemy in the sanctuary.

translations.hebrew: שָׁאֲג֣וּ צֹ֭רְרֶיךָ בְּקֶ֣רֶב מוֹעֲדֶ֑ךָ שָׂ֖מוּ אוֹתֹתָ֣ם אֹתֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
Your foes roar inside Your meeting-place;
they take their signs for true signs.

translations.hebrew: יִ֭וָּדַע כְּמֵבִ֣יא לְמָ֑עְלָה בִּסְבׇךְ־עֵ֝֗ץ קַרְדֻּמּֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.It is like men wielding axes
against a gnarled tree;

translations.hebrew: (ועת) [וְ֭עַתָּה] פִּתּוּחֶ֣יהָ יָּ֑חַד בְּכַשִּׁ֥יל וְ֝כֵילַפּ֗וֹת יַהֲלֹמֽוּן׃
translations.english:
with hatchet and pike
they hacked away at its carved work.-b

translations.hebrew: שִׁלְח֣וּ בָ֭אֵשׁ מִקְדָּשֶׁ֑ךָ לָ֝אָ֗רֶץ חִלְּל֥וּ מִֽשְׁכַּן־שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
They made Your sanctuary go up in flames;
they brought low in dishonor the dwelling-place of Your presence.

translations.hebrew: אָמְר֣וּ בְ֭לִבָּם נִינָ֣ם יָ֑חַד שָׂרְפ֖וּ כׇל־מוֹעֲדֵי־אֵ֣ל בָּאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
They resolved, “Let us destroy them altogether!”
They burned all God’s tabernacles in the land.

translations.hebrew: אֽוֹתֹתֵ֗ינוּ לֹ֥א־רָ֫אִ֥ינוּ אֵֽין־ע֥וֹד נָבִ֑יא וְלֹֽא־אִ֝תָּ֗נוּ יֹדֵ֥עַ עַד־מָֽה׃
translations.english:
No signs appear for us;
there is no longer any prophet;
no one among us knows for how long.

translations.hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֣י אֱ֭לֹהִים יְחָ֣רֶף צָ֑ר יְנָ֘אֵ֤ץ אוֹיֵ֖ב שִׁמְךָ֣ לָנֶֽצַח׃
translations.english:
Till when, O God, will the foe blaspheme,
will the enemy forever revile Your name?

translations.hebrew: לָ֤מָּה תָשִׁ֣יב יָ֭דְךָ וִימִינֶ֑ךָ מִקֶּ֖רֶב (חוקך) [חֵיקְךָ֣] כַלֵּֽה׃
translations.english:
Why do You hold back Your hand, Your right hand?
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Draw it out of Your bosom!-b

translations.hebrew: וֵ֭אלֹהִים מַלְכִּ֣י מִקֶּ֑דֶם פֹּעֵ֥ל יְ֝שׁוּע֗וֹת בְּקֶ֣רֶב הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
O God, my King from of old,
who brings deliverance throughout the land;

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה פוֹרַ֣רְתָּ בְעׇזְּךָ֣ יָ֑ם שִׁבַּ֥רְתָּ רָאשֵׁ֥י תַ֝נִּינִ֗ים עַל־הַמָּֽיִם׃
translations.english:
it was You who drove back the sea with Your might,
who smashed the heads of the monsters in the waters;

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה רִ֭צַּצְתָּ רָאשֵׁ֣י לִוְיָתָ֑ן תִּתְּנֶ֥נּוּ מַ֝אֲכָ֗ל לְעָ֣ם לְצִיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
it was You who crushed the heads of Leviathan,
who left him as food for cOr “seafaring men”; meaning of Heb. uncertain.the denizens of the desert;-c

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה בָ֭קַעְתָּ מַעְיָ֣ן וָנָ֑חַל אַתָּ֥ה ה֝וֹבַ֗שְׁתָּ נַהֲר֥וֹת אֵיתָֽן׃
translations.english:
it was You who released springs and torrents,
who made mighty rivers run dry;

translations.hebrew: לְךָ֣ י֭וֹם אַף־לְךָ֥ לָ֑יְלָה אַתָּ֥ה הֲ֝כִינ֗וֹתָ מָא֥וֹר וָשָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
translations.english:
the day is Yours, the night also;
it was You who set in place the orb of the sun;

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה הִ֭צַּבְתָּ כׇּל־גְּבוּל֣וֹת אָ֑רֶץ קַ֥יִץ וָ֝חֹ֗רֶף אַתָּ֥ה יְצַרְתָּֽם׃
translations.english:
You fixed all the boundaries of the earth;
summer and winter—You made them.

translations.hebrew: זְכׇר־זֹ֗את א֭וֹיֵב חֵרֵ֣ף <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה וְעַ֥ם נָ֝בָ֗ל נִאֲצ֥וּ שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Be mindful of how the enemy blasphemes the LORD,
how base people revile Your name.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן לְ֭חַיַּת נֶ֣פֶשׁ תּוֹרֶ֑ךָ חַיַּ֥ת עֲ֝נִיֶּ֗יךָ אַל־תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח לָנֶֽצַח׃
translations.english:
Do not deliver Your dove to the wild beast;
do not ignore forever the band of Your lowly ones.

translations.hebrew: הַבֵּ֥ט לַבְּרִ֑ית כִּ֥י מָלְא֥וּ מַחֲשַׁכֵּי־אֶ֝֗רֶץ נְא֣וֹת חָמָֽס׃
translations.english:
Look to the covenant!
For the dark places of the land are full of the haunts of lawlessness.

translations.hebrew: אַל־יָשֹׁ֣ב דַּ֣ךְ נִכְלָ֑ם עָנִ֥י וְ֝אֶבְי֗וֹן יְֽהַלְל֥וּ שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Let not the downtrodden turn away disappointed;
let the poor and needy praise Your name.

translations.hebrew: קוּמָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים רִיבָ֣ה רִיבֶ֑ךָ זְכֹ֥ר חֶרְפָּתְךָ֥ מִנִּי־נָ֝בָ֗ל כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
Rise, O God, champion Your cause;
be mindful that You are blasphemed by base men all day long.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּ֭שְׁכַּח ק֣וֹל צֹרְרֶ֑יךָ שְׁא֥וֹן קָ֝מֶ֗יךָ עֹלֶ֥ה תָמִֽיד׃
translations.english:
Do not ignore the shouts of Your foes,
the din of Your adversaries that ascends all the time.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אַל־תַּשְׁחֵ֑ת מִזְמ֖וֹר לְאָסָ֣ף שִֽׁיר׃
translations.english:
For the leader; al tashḥeth.
A psalm of Asaph, a song.

translations.hebrew: ה֘וֹדִ֤ינוּ לְּךָ֨ ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים ה֭וֹדִינוּ וְקָר֣וֹב שְׁמֶ֑ךָ סִ֝פְּר֗וּ נִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
We praise You, O God;
we praise You;
Your presence is near;
men tell of Your wondrous deeds.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭י אֶקַּ֣ח מוֹעֵ֑ד אֲ֝נִ֗י מֵישָׁרִ֥ים אֶשְׁפֹּֽט׃
translations.english:
“At the time I choose,
I will give judgment equitably.

translations.hebrew: נְֽמֹגִ֗ים אֶ֥רֶץ וְכׇל־יֹשְׁבֶ֑יהָ אָנֹכִ֨י תִכַּ֖נְתִּי עַמּוּדֶ֣יהָ סֶּֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Earth and all its inhabitants dissolve;
it is I who keep its pillars firm. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אָמַ֣רְתִּי לַ֭הוֹלְלִים אַל־תָּהֹ֑לּוּ וְ֝לָרְשָׁעִ֗ים אַל־תָּרִ֥ימוּ קָֽרֶן׃
translations.english:
To wanton men I say, ‘Do not be wanton!’
to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horns!’”

translations.hebrew: אַל־תָּרִ֣ימוּ לַמָּר֣וֹם קַרְנְכֶ֑ם תְּדַבְּר֖וּ בְצַוָּ֣אר עָתָֽק׃
translations.english:
Do not lift your horns up high
aLit. “with arrogant neck you speak.”in vainglorious bluster.-a

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א מִ֭מּוֹצָא וּמִֽמַּעֲרָ֑ב וְ֝לֹ֗א מִמִּדְבַּ֥ר הָרִֽים׃
translations.english:
For what lifts a man comes not from the east
or the west or the wilderness;bReading midba¯r with many mss.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים שֹׁפֵ֑ט זֶ֥ה יַ֝שְׁפִּ֗יל וְזֶ֣ה יָרִֽים׃
translations.english:
for God it is who gives judgment;
He brings down one man, He lifts up another.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י כ֪וֹס בְּֽיַד־יְהֹוָ֡ה וְיַ֤יִן חָמַ֨ר ׀ מָ֥לֵא מֶסֶךְ֮ וַיַּגֵּ֢ר מִ֫זֶּ֥ה אַךְ־שְׁ֭מָרֶיהָ יִמְצ֣וּ יִשְׁתּ֑וּ כֹּ֝֗ל רִשְׁעֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
There is a cup in the LORD’s hand
with foaming wine fully mixed;
from this He pours;
all the wicked of the earth drink,
draining it to the very dregs.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭אֲנִי אַגִּ֣יד לְעֹלָ֑ם אֲ֝זַמְּרָ֗ה לֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
As for me, I will declare forever,
I will sing a hymn to the God of Jacob.

translations.hebrew: וְכׇל־קַרְנֵ֣י רְשָׁעִ֣ים אֲגַדֵּ֑עַ תְּ֝רוֹמַ֗מְנָה קַֽרְנ֥וֹת צַדִּֽיק׃
translations.english:
“All the horns of the wicked I will cut;
but the horns of the righteous shall be lifted up.”

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ בִּנְגִינֹ֑ת מִזְמ֖וֹר לְאָסָ֣ף שִֽׁיר׃
translations.english:
For the leader; with instrumental music.
A psalm of Asaph, a song.

translations.hebrew: נוֹדָ֣ע בִּיהוּדָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים בְּ֝יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל גָּד֥וֹל שְׁמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
God has made Himself known in Judah,
His name is great in Israel;

translations.hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י בְשָׁלֵ֣ם סוּכּ֑וֹ וּמְע֖וֹנָת֣וֹ בְצִיּֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Salem became His abode;
Zion, His den.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֭מָּה שִׁבַּ֣ר רִשְׁפֵי־קָ֑שֶׁת מָגֵ֬ן וְחֶ֖רֶב וּמִלְחָמָ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
There He broke the fiery arrows of the bow,
the shield and the sword of war. Selah.

translations.hebrew: נָ֭אוֹר אַתָּ֥ה אַדִּ֗יר מֵֽהַרְרֵי־טָֽרֶף׃
translations.english:
You were resplendent,
glorious, on the mountains of prey.

translations.hebrew: אֶשְׁתּֽוֹלְל֨וּ ׀ אַבִּ֣ירֵי לֵ֭ב נָמ֣וּ שְׁנָתָ֑ם וְלֹֽא־מָצְא֖וּ כׇל־אַנְשֵׁי־חַ֣יִל יְדֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
The stout-hearted were despoiled;
they were in a stupor;
the bravest of men could not lift a hand.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭גַּעֲרָ֣תְךָ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יַעֲקֹ֑ב נִ֝רְדָּ֗ם וְרֶ֣כֶב וָסֽוּס׃
translations.english:
At Your blast, O God of Jacob,
horse and chariot lay stunned.

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה ׀ נ֥וֹרָא אַ֗תָּה וּמִֽי־יַעֲמֹ֥ד לְפָנֶ֗יךָ מֵאָ֥ז אַפֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
O You! You are awesome!
Who can withstand You
when You are enraged?

translations.hebrew: מִ֭שָּׁמַיִם הִשְׁמַ֣עְתָּ דִּ֑ין אֶ֖רֶץ יָֽרְאָ֣ה וְשָׁקָֽטָה׃
translations.english:
In heaven You pronounced sentence;
the earth was numbed with fright

translations.hebrew: בְּקוּם־לַמִּשְׁפָּ֥ט אֱלֹהִ֑ים לְהוֹשִׁ֖יעַ כׇּל־עַנְוֵי־אֶ֣רֶץ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
as God rose to execute judgment,
to deliver all the lowly of the earth. Selah.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־חֲמַ֣ת אָדָ֣ם תּוֹדֶ֑ךָּ שְׁאֵרִ֖ית חֵמֹ֣ת תַּחְגֹּֽר׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.The fiercest of men shall acknowledge You,
when You gird on the last bit of fury.-a

translations.hebrew: נִ֥דְר֣וּ וְשַׁלְּמוּ֮ לַיהֹוָ֢ה אֱֽלֹהֵ֫יכֶ֥ם כׇּל־סְבִיבָ֑יו יֹבִ֥ילוּ שַׁ֝֗י לַמּוֹרָֽא׃
translations.english:
Make vows and pay them to the LORD your God;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.all who are around Him shall bring tribute to the Awesome One.-a

translations.hebrew: יִ֭בְצֹר ר֣וּחַ נְגִידִ֑ים נ֝וֹרָ֗א לְמַלְכֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
He curbs the spirit of princes,
inspires awe in the kings of the earth.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־[יְדוּת֗וּן] (ידיתון) לְאָסָ֥ף מִזְמֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
For the leader; on Jeduthun.
Of Asaph. A psalm.

translations.hebrew: קוֹלִ֣י אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֣ים וְאֶצְעָ֑קָה קוֹלִ֥י אֶל־אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים וְהַאֲזִ֥ין אֵלָֽי׃
translations.english:
I cry aloud to God;
I cry to God that He may give ear to me.

translations.hebrew: בְּי֥וֹם צָרָתִי֮ אֲדֹנָ֢י דָּ֫רָ֥שְׁתִּי יָדִ֤י ׀ לַ֣יְלָה נִ֭גְּרָה וְלֹ֣א תָפ֑וּג מֵאֲנָ֖ה הִנָּחֵ֣ם נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
In my time of distress I turn to the Lord,
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.with my hand [uplifted];
[my eyes] flow all night without respite;-a

I will not be comforted.

translations.hebrew: אֶזְכְּרָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים וְאֶהֱמָ֑יָה אָשִׂ֓יחָה ׀ וְתִתְעַטֵּ֖ף רוּחִ֣י סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
I call God to mind, I moan,
I complain, my spirit fails. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אָ֭חַזְתָּ שְׁמֻר֣וֹת עֵינָ֑י נִ֝פְעַ֗מְתִּי וְלֹ֣א אֲדַבֵּֽר׃
translations.english:
You have held my eyelids open;
I am overwrought, I cannot speak.

translations.hebrew: חִשַּׁ֣בְתִּי יָמִ֣ים מִקֶּ֑דֶם שְׁ֝נ֗וֹת עוֹלָמִֽים׃
translations.english:
My thoughts turn to days of old,
to years long past.

translations.hebrew: אֶ֥זְכְּרָ֥ה נְגִינָתִ֗י בַּ֫לָּ֥יְלָה עִם־לְבָבִ֥י אָשִׂ֑יחָה וַיְחַפֵּ֥שׂ רוּחִֽי׃
translations.english:
I recall at night their jibes at me;
I commune with myself;
my spirit inquires,

translations.hebrew: הַֽ֭לְעוֹלָמִים יִזְנַ֥ח <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָ֑י וְלֹא־יֹסִ֖יף לִרְצ֣וֹת עֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
“Will the Lord reject forever
and never again show favor?

translations.hebrew: הֶאָפֵ֣ס לָנֶ֣צַח חַסְדּ֑וֹ גָּ֥מַר אֹ֝֗מֶר לְדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃
translations.english:
Has His faithfulness disappeared forever?
Will His promise be unfulfilled for all time?

translations.hebrew: הֲשָׁכַ֣ח חַנּ֣וֹת אֵ֑ל אִם־קָפַ֥ץ בְּ֝אַ֗ף רַחֲמָ֥יו סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Has God forgotten how to pity?
Has He in anger stifled His compassion?” Selah.

translations.hebrew: וָ֭אֹמַר חַלּ֣וֹתִי הִ֑יא שְׁ֝נ֗וֹת יְמִ֣ין עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
And I said, aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.“It is my fault
that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”-a

translations.hebrew: (אזכיר) [אֶזְכּ֥וֹר] מַעַלְלֵי־יָ֑הּ כִּֽי־אֶזְכְּרָ֖ה מִקֶּ֣דֶם פִּלְאֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I recall the deeds of the LORD;
yes, I recall Your wonders of old;

translations.hebrew: וְהָגִ֥יתִי בְכׇל־פׇּעֳלֶ֑ךָ וּֽבַעֲלִ֖ילוֹתֶ֣יךָ אָשִֽׂיחָה׃
translations.english:
I recount all Your works;
I speak of Your acts.

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭לֹהִים בַּקֹּ֣דֶשׁ דַּרְכֶּ֑ךָ מִי־אֵ֥ל גָּ֝ד֗וֹל כֵּאלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
O God, Your ways are holiness;
what god is as great as God?

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה הָ֭אֵל עֹ֣שֵׂה פֶ֑לֶא הוֹדַ֖עְתָּ בָעַמִּ֣ים עֻזֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
You are the God who works wonders;
You have manifested Your strength among the peoples.

translations.hebrew: גָּאַ֣לְתָּ בִּזְר֣וֹעַ עַמֶּ֑ךָ בְּנֵֽי־יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְיוֹסֵ֣ף סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
By Your arm You redeemed Your people,
the children of Jacob and Joseph. Selah.

translations.hebrew: רָ֘א֤וּךָ מַּ֨יִם ׀ אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים רָא֣וּךָ מַּ֣יִם יָחִ֑ילוּ אַ֝֗ף יִרְגְּז֥וּ תְהֹמֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
The waters saw You, O God,
the waters saw You and were convulsed;
the very deep quaked as well.

translations.hebrew: זֹ֤רְמוּ מַ֨יִם ׀ עָב֗וֹת ק֭וֹל נָתְנ֣וּ שְׁחָקִ֑ים אַף־חֲ֝צָצֶ֗יךָ יִתְהַלָּֽכוּ׃
translations.english:
Clouds streamed water;
the heavens rumbled;
Your arrows flew about;

translations.hebrew: ק֤וֹל רַעַמְךָ֨ ׀ בַּגַּלְגַּ֗ל הֵאִ֣ירוּ בְרָקִ֣ים תֵּבֵ֑ל רָגְזָ֖ה וַתִּרְעַ֣שׁ הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Your thunder rumbled like wheels;
lightning lit up the world;
the earth quaked and trembled.

translations.hebrew: בַּיָּ֤ם דַּרְכֶּ֗ךָ (ושביליך) [וּֽ֭שְׁבִילְךָ] בְּמַ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים וְ֝עִקְּבוֹתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א נֹדָֽעוּ׃
translations.english:
Your way was through the sea,
Your path, through the mighty waters;
Your tracks could not be seen.

translations.hebrew: נָחִ֣יתָ כַצֹּ֣אן עַמֶּ֑ךָ בְּֽיַד־מֹשֶׁ֥ה וְאַהֲרֹֽן׃
translations.english:
You led Your people like a flock
in the care of Moses and Aaron.

translations.hebrew: מַשְׂכִּ֗יל לְאָ֫סָ֥ף הַאֲזִ֣ינָה עַ֭מִּי תּוֹרָתִ֑י הַטּ֥וּ אׇ֝זְנְכֶ֗ם לְאִמְרֵי־פִֽי׃
translations.english:
A maskil of Asaph.

Give ear, my people, to my teaching,
turn your ear to what I say.

translations.hebrew: אֶפְתְּחָ֣ה בְמָשָׁ֣ל פִּ֑י אַבִּ֥יעָה חִ֝יד֗וֹת מִנִּי־קֶֽדֶם׃
translations.english:
I will expound a theme,
hold forth on the lessons of the past,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁ֭מַעְנוּ וַנֵּדָעֵ֑ם וַ֝אֲבוֹתֵ֗ינוּ סִפְּרוּ־לָֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
things we have heard and known,
that our fathers have told us.

translations.hebrew: לֹ֤א נְכַחֵ֨ד ׀ מִבְּנֵיהֶ֗ם לְד֥וֹר אַחֲר֗וֹן מְֽ֭סַפְּרִים תְּהִלּ֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה וֶעֱזוּז֥וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאֹתָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָֽׂה׃
translations.english:
We will not withhold them from their children,
telling the coming generation
the praises of the LORD and His might,
and the wonders He performed.

translations.hebrew: וַיָּ֤קֶם עֵד֨וּת ׀ בְּֽיַעֲקֹ֗ב וְתוֹרָה֮ שָׂ֤ם בְּיִשְׂרָ֫אֵ֥ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִ֭וָּה אֶת־אֲבוֹתֵ֑ינוּ לְ֝הוֹדִיעָ֗ם לִבְנֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
He established a decree in Jacob,
ordained a teaching in Israel,
charging our fathers
to make them known to their children,

translations.hebrew: לְמַ֤עַן יֵדְע֨וּ ׀ דּ֣וֹר אַ֭חֲרוֹן בָּנִ֣ים יִוָּלֵ֑דוּ יָ֝קֻ֗מוּ וִיסַפְּר֥וּ לִבְנֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
that a future generation might know
—children yet to be born—
and in turn tell their children

translations.hebrew: וְיָשִׂ֥ימוּ בֵאלֹהִ֗ים כִּ֫סְלָ֥ם וְלֹ֣א יִ֭שְׁכְּחוּ מַ֥עַלְלֵי־אֵ֑ל וּמִצְוֺתָ֥יו יִנְצֹֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
that they might put their confidence in God,
and not forget God’s great deeds,
but observe His commandments,

translations.hebrew: וְלֹ֤א יִהְי֨וּ ׀ כַּאֲבוֹתָ֗ם דּוֹר֮ סוֹרֵ֢ר וּמֹ֫רֶ֥ה דּ֭וֹר לֹא־הֵכִ֣ין לִבּ֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־נֶאֶמְנָ֖ה אֶת־אֵ֣ל רוּחֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
and not be like their fathers,
a wayward and defiant generation,
a generation whose heart was inconstant,
whose spirit was not true to God.

translations.hebrew: בְּֽנֵי־אֶפְרַ֗יִם נוֹשְׁקֵ֥י רֽוֹמֵי־קָ֑שֶׁת הָ֝פְכ֗וּ בְּי֣וֹם קְרָֽב׃
translations.english:
Like the Ephraimite bowmen
who played false in the day of battle,

translations.hebrew: לֹ֣א שָׁ֭מְרוּ בְּרִ֣ית אֱלֹהִ֑ים וּ֝בְתוֹרָת֗וֹ מֵאֲנ֥וּ לָלֶֽכֶת׃
translations.english:
they did not keep God’s covenant,
they refused to follow His instruction;

translations.hebrew: וַיִּשְׁכְּח֥וּ עֲלִילוֹתָ֑יו וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶרְאָֽם׃
translations.english:
they forgot His deeds
and the wonders that He showed them.

translations.hebrew: נֶ֣גֶד אֲ֭בוֹתָם עָ֣שָׂה פֶ֑לֶא בְּאֶ֖רֶץ מִצְרַ֣יִם שְׂדֵה־צֹֽעַן׃
translations.english:
He performed marvels in the sight of their fathers,
in the land of Egypt, the plain of Zoan.

translations.hebrew: בָּ֣קַע יָ֭ם וַיַּעֲבִירֵ֑ם וַֽיַּצֶּב־מַ֥יִם כְּמוֹ־נֵֽד׃
translations.english:
He split the sea and took them through it;
He made the waters stand like a wall.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּנְחֵ֣ם בֶּעָנָ֣ן יוֹמָ֑ם וְכׇל־הַ֝לַּ֗יְלָה בְּא֣וֹר אֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
He led them with a cloud by day,
and throughout the night by the light of fire.

translations.hebrew: יְבַקַּ֣ע צֻ֭רִים בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַ֝יַּ֗שְׁקְ כִּתְהֹמ֥וֹת רַבָּֽה׃
translations.english:
He split rocks in the wilderness
and gave them drink as if from the great deep.

translations.hebrew: וַיּוֹצִ֣א נוֹזְלִ֣ים מִסָּ֑לַע וַיּ֖וֹרֶד כַּנְּהָר֣וֹת מָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
He brought forth streams from a rock
and made them flow down like a river.

translations.hebrew: וַיּוֹסִ֣יפוּ ע֭וֹד לַחֲטֹא־ל֑וֹ לַֽמְר֥וֹת עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן בַּצִּיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
But they went on sinning against Him,
defying the Most High in the parched land.

translations.hebrew: וַיְנַסּוּ־אֵ֥ל בִּלְבָבָ֑ם לִֽשְׁאׇל־אֹ֥כֶל לְנַפְשָֽׁם׃
translations.english:
To test God was in their mind
when they demanded food for themselves.

translations.hebrew: וַֽיְדַבְּר֗וּ בֵּאלֹ֫הִ֥ים אָ֭מְרוּ הֲי֣וּכַל אֵ֑ל לַעֲרֹ֥ךְ שֻׁ֝לְחָ֗ן בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
translations.english:
They spoke against God, saying,
“Can God spread a feast in the wilderness?

translations.hebrew: הֵ֤ן הִכָּה־צ֨וּר ׀ וַיָּז֣וּבוּ מַיִם֮ וּנְחָלִ֢ים יִ֫שְׁטֹ֥פוּ הֲגַם־לֶ֭חֶם י֣וּכַל תֵּ֑ת אִם־יָכִ֖ין שְׁאֵ֣ר לְעַמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
True, He struck the rock and waters flowed,
streams gushed forth;
but can He provide bread?
Can He supply His people with meat?”

translations.hebrew: לָכֵ֤ן ׀ שָׁמַ֥ע יְהֹוָ֗ה וַֽיִּתְעַ֫בָּ֥ר וְ֭אֵשׁ נִשְּׂקָ֣ה בְיַעֲקֹ֑ב וְגַם־אַ֝֗ף עָלָ֥ה בְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
The LORD heard and He raged;
fire broke out against Jacob,
anger flared up at Israel,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֣א הֶ֭אֱמִינוּ בֵּאלֹהִ֑ים וְלֹ֥א בָ֝טְח֗וּ בִּישׁוּעָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
because they did not put their trust in God,
did not rely on His deliverance.

translations.hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו שְׁחָקִ֣ים מִמָּ֑עַל וְדַלְתֵ֖י שָׁמַ֣יִם פָּתָֽח׃
translations.english:
So He commanded the skies above,
He opened the doors of heaven

translations.hebrew: וַיַּמְטֵ֬ר עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם מָ֣ן לֶאֱכֹ֑ל וּדְגַן־שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם נָ֣תַן לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
and rained manna upon them for food,
giving them heavenly grain.

translations.hebrew: לֶ֣חֶם אַ֭בִּירִים אָ֣כַל אִ֑ישׁ צֵידָ֬ה שָׁלַ֖ח לָהֶ֣ם לָשֹֽׂבַע׃
translations.english:
Each man ate a hero’s meal;
He sent them provision in plenty.

translations.hebrew: יַסַּ֣ע קָ֭דִים בַּשָּׁמָ֑יִם וַיְנַהֵ֖ג בְּעֻזּ֣וֹ תֵימָֽן׃
translations.english:
He set the east wind moving in heaven,
and drove the south wind by His might.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּמְטֵ֬ר עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם כֶּעָפָ֣ר שְׁאֵ֑ר וּֽכְח֥וֹל יַ֝מִּ֗ים ע֣וֹף כָּנָֽף׃
translations.english:
He rained meat on them like dust,
winged birds like the sands of the sea,

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יַּפֵּל בְּקֶ֣רֶב מַחֲנֵ֑הוּ סָ֝בִ֗יב לְמִשְׁכְּנֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
making them come down inside His camp,
around His dwelling-place.

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּאכְל֣וּ וַיִּשְׂבְּע֣וּ מְאֹ֑ד וְ֝תַאֲוָתָ֗ם יָבִ֥א לָהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
They ate till they were sated;
He gave them what they craved.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־זָ֥רוּ מִתַּאֲוָתָ֑ם ע֝֗וֹד אׇכְלָ֥ם בְּפִיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
They had not yet wearied of what they craved,
the food was still in their mouths

translations.hebrew: וְאַ֤ף אֱלֹהִ֨ים ׀ עָ֘לָ֤ה בָהֶ֗ם וַֽ֭יַּהֲרֹג בְּמִשְׁמַנֵּיהֶ֑ם וּבַחוּרֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל הִכְרִֽיעַ׃
translations.english:
when God’s anger flared up at them.
He slew their sturdiest,
struck down the youth of Israel.

translations.hebrew: בְּכׇל־זֹ֥את חָֽטְאוּ־ע֑וֹד וְלֹֽא־הֶ֝אֱמִ֗ינוּ בְּנִפְלְאוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Nonetheless, they went on sinning
and had no faith in His wonders.

translations.hebrew: וַיְכַל־בַּהֶ֥בֶל יְמֵיהֶ֑ם וּ֝שְׁנוֹתָ֗ם בַּבֶּהָלָֽה׃
translations.english:
He made their days end in futility,
their years in sudden death.

translations.hebrew: אִם־הֲרָגָ֥ם וּדְרָשׁ֑וּהוּ וְ֝שָׁ֗בוּ וְשִֽׁחֲרוּ־אֵֽל׃
translations.english:
When He struckaLit. “killed.” them, they turned to Him
and sought God once again.

translations.hebrew: וַֽ֭יִּזְכְּרוּ כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֣ים צוּרָ֑ם וְאֵ֥ל עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן גֹּאֲלָֽם׃
translations.english:
They remembered that God was their rock,
God Most High, their Redeemer.

translations.hebrew: וַיְפַתּ֥וּהוּ בְּפִיהֶ֑ם וּ֝בִלְשׁוֹנָ֗ם יְכַזְּבוּ־לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Yet they deceived Him with their speech,
lied to Him with their words;

translations.hebrew: וְ֭לִבָּם לֹא־נָכ֣וֹן עִמּ֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א נֶ֝אֶמְנ֗וּ בִּבְרִיתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
their hearts were inconstant toward Him;
they were untrue to His covenant.

translations.hebrew: וְה֤וּא רַח֨וּם ׀ יְכַפֵּ֥ר עָוֺן֮ וְֽלֹא־יַֽ֫שְׁחִ֥ית וְ֭הִרְבָּה לְהָשִׁ֣יב אַפּ֑וֹ וְלֹא־יָ֝עִ֗יר כׇּל־חֲמָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
But He, being merciful, forgave iniquity
and would not destroy;
He restrained His wrath time and again
and did not give full vent to His fury;

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יִּזְכֹּר כִּֽי־בָשָׂ֣ר הֵ֑מָּה ר֥וּחַ ה֝וֹלֵ֗ךְ וְלֹ֣א יָשֽׁוּב׃
translations.english:
for He remembered that they were but flesh,
a passing breath that does not return.

translations.hebrew: כַּ֭מָּה יַמְר֣וּהוּ בַמִּדְבָּ֑ר יַ֝עֲצִיב֗וּהוּ בִּישִׁימֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
How often did they defy Him in the wilderness,
did they grieve Him in the wasteland!

translations.hebrew: וַיָּשׁ֣וּבוּ וַיְנַסּ֣וּ אֵ֑ל וּקְד֖וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל הִתְוֽוּ׃
translations.english:
Again and again they tested God,
vexedbOr “set a limit to.” the Holy One of Israel.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־זָכְר֥וּ אֶת־יָד֑וֹ י֝֗וֹם אֲֽשֶׁר־פָּדָ֥ם מִנִּי־צָֽר׃
translations.english:
They did not remember His strength,
or the day He redeemed them from the foe;

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־שָׂ֣ם בְּ֭מִצְרַיִם אֹתוֹתָ֑יו וּ֝מוֹפְתָ֗יו בִּשְׂדֵה־צֹֽעַן׃
translations.english:
how He displayed His signs in Egypt,
His wonders in the plain of Zoan.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּהֲפֹ֣ךְ לְ֭דָם יְאֹרֵיהֶ֑ם וְ֝נֹזְלֵיהֶ֗ם בַּל־יִשְׁתָּיֽוּן׃
translations.english:
He turned their rivers into blood;
He made their waters undrinkable.

translations.hebrew: יְשַׁלַּ֬ח בָּהֶ֣ם עָ֭רֹב וַיֹּאכְלֵ֑ם וּ֝צְפַרְדֵּ֗עַ וַתַּשְׁחִיתֵֽם׃
translations.english:
He inflicted upon them swarms of insects to devour them,
frogs to destroy them.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לֶחָסִ֣יל יְבוּלָ֑ם וִ֝יגִיעָ֗ם לָאַרְבֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
He gave their crops over to grubs,
their produce to locusts.

translations.hebrew: יַהֲרֹ֣ג בַּבָּרָ֣ד גַּפְנָ֑ם וְ֝שִׁקְמוֹתָ֗ם בַּחֲנָמַֽל׃
translations.english:
He killed their vines with hail,
their sycamores cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.with frost.-c

translations.hebrew: וַיַּסְגֵּ֣ר לַבָּרָ֣ד בְּעִירָ֑ם וּ֝מִקְנֵיהֶ֗ם לָרְשָׁפִֽים׃
translations.english:
He gave their beasts over to hail,
their cattle to lightning bolts.

translations.hebrew: יְשַׁלַּח־בָּ֨ם ׀ חֲר֬וֹן אַפּ֗וֹ עֶבְרָ֣ה וָזַ֣עַם וְצָרָ֑ה מִ֝שְׁלַ֗חַת מַלְאֲכֵ֥י רָעִֽים׃
translations.english:
He inflicted His burning anger upon them,
wrath, indignation, trouble,
a band of deadly messengers.

translations.hebrew: יְפַלֵּ֥ס נָתִ֗יב לְאַ֫פּ֥וֹ לֹא־חָשַׂ֣ךְ מִמָּ֣וֶת נַפְשָׁ֑ם וְ֝חַיָּתָ֗ם לַדֶּ֥בֶר הִסְגִּֽיר׃
translations.english:
He cleared a path for His anger;
He did not stop short of slaying them,
but gave them over to pestilence.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ כׇּל־בְּכ֣וֹר בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם רֵאשִׁ֥ית א֝וֹנִ֗ים בְּאׇהֳלֵי־חָֽם׃
translations.english:
He struck every first-born in Egypt,
the first fruits of their vigor in the tents of Ham.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּסַּ֣ע כַּצֹּ֣אן עַמּ֑וֹ וַֽיְנַהֲגֵ֥ם כַּ֝עֵ֗דֶר בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
translations.english:
He set His people moving like sheep,
drove them like a flock in the wilderness.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּנְחֵ֣ם לָ֭בֶטַח וְלֹ֣א פָחָ֑דוּ וְאֶת־א֝וֹיְבֵיהֶ֗ם כִּסָּ֥ה הַיָּֽם׃
translations.english:
He led them in safety; they were unafraid;
as for their enemies, the sea covered them.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יְבִיאֵם אֶל־גְּב֣וּל קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ הַר־זֶ֝֗ה קָנְתָ֥ה יְמִינֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He brought them to His holy realm,dOr “hill” with Septuagint and Saadia.
the mountain His right hand had acquired.

translations.hebrew: וַיְגָ֤רֶשׁ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֨ם ׀ גּוֹיִ֗ם וַֽ֭יַּפִּילֵם בְּחֶ֣בֶל נַחֲלָ֑ה וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֥ן בְּ֝אׇהֳלֵיהֶ֗ם שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
He expelled nations before them,
eInverted for clarity.settled the tribes of Israel in their tents,
allotting them their portion by the line.-e

translations.hebrew: וַיְנַסּ֣וּ וַ֭יַּמְרוּ אֶת־אֱלֹהִ֣ים עֶלְי֑וֹן וְ֝עֵדוֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א שָׁמָֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
Yet they defiantly tested God Most High,
and did not observe His decrees.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּסֹּ֣גוּ וַֽ֭יִּבְגְּדוּ כַּאֲבוֹתָ֑ם נֶ֝הְפְּכ֗וּ כְּקֶ֣שֶׁת רְמִיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
They fell away, disloyal like their fathers;
they played false like a treacherous bow.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּכְעִיס֥וּהוּ בְּבָמוֹתָ֑ם וּ֝בִפְסִילֵיהֶ֗ם יַקְנִיאֽוּהוּ׃
translations.english:
They vexed Him with their high places;
they incensed Him with their idols.

translations.hebrew: שָׁמַ֣ע אֱ֭לֹהִים וַֽיִּתְעַבָּ֑ר וַיִּמְאַ֥ס מְ֝אֹ֗ד בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
God heard it and was enraged;
He utterly rejected Israel.

He forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh,
the tent He had set among men.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לַשְּׁבִ֣י עֻזּ֑וֹ וְֽתִפְאַרְתּ֥וֹ בְיַד־צָֽר׃
translations.english:
He let His mightfI.e., the Ark; cf. Ps. 132.8. go into captivity,
His glory into the hands of the foe.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּסְגֵּ֣ר לַחֶ֣רֶב עַמּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְנַחֲלָת֗וֹ הִתְעַבָּֽר׃
translations.english:
He gave His people over to the sword;
He was enraged at His very own.

translations.hebrew: בַּחוּרָ֥יו אָכְלָה־אֵ֑שׁ וּ֝בְתוּלֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א הוּלָּֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
Fire consumed their young men,
and their maidens gLit. “had no nuptial song.”remained unwed.-g

translations.hebrew: כֹּ֭הֲנָיו בַּחֶ֣רֶב נָפָ֑לוּ וְ֝אַלְמְנֹתָ֗יו לֹ֣א תִבְכֶּֽינָה׃
translations.english:
Their priests fell by the sword,
and their widows could not weep.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּקַ֖ץ כְּיָשֵׁ֥ן <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָ֑י כְּ֝גִבּ֗וֹר מִתְרוֹנֵ֥ן מִיָּֽיִן׃
translations.english:
The Lord awoke as from sleep,
like a warrior cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.shaking off-c wine.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּךְ־צָרָ֥יו אָח֑וֹר חֶרְפַּ֥ת ע֝וֹלָ֗ם נָ֣תַן לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
He beat back His foes,
dealing them lasting disgrace.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יִּמְאַס בְּאֹ֣הֶל יוֹסֵ֑ף וּֽבְשֵׁ֥בֶט אֶ֝פְרַ֗יִם לֹ֣א בָחָֽר׃
translations.english:
He rejected the clan of Joseph;
He did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יִּבְחַר אֶת־שֵׁ֣בֶט יְהוּדָ֑ה אֶֽת־הַ֥ר צִ֝יּ֗וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָהֵֽב׃
translations.english:
He did choose the tribe of Judah,
Mount Zion, which He loved.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּ֣בֶן כְּמֽוֹ־רָ֭מִים מִקְדָּשׁ֑וֹ כְּ֝אֶ֗רֶץ יְסָדָ֥הּ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
He built His Sanctuary like the heavens,
like the earth that He established forever.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יִּבְחַר בְּדָוִ֣ד עַבְדּ֑וֹ וַ֝יִּקָּחֵ֗הוּ מִֽמִּכְלְאֹ֥ת צֹֽאן׃
translations.english:
He chose David, His servant,
and took him from the sheepfolds.

translations.hebrew: מֵאַחַ֥ר עָל֗וֹת הֱבִ֫יא֥וֹ לִ֭רְעוֹת בְּיַעֲקֹ֣ב עַמּ֑וֹ וּ֝בְיִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He brought him from minding the nursing ewes
to tend His people Jacob, Israel, His very own.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יִּרְעֵם כְּתֹ֣ם לְבָב֑וֹ וּבִתְבוּנ֖וֹת כַּפָּ֣יו יַנְחֵֽם׃
translations.english:
He tended them with blameless heart;
with skillful hands he led them.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אֱֽלֹהִ֡ים בָּ֤אוּ גוֹיִ֨ם ׀ בְּֽנַחֲלָתֶ֗ךָ טִ֭מְּאוּ אֶת־הֵיכַ֣ל קׇדְשֶׁ֑ךָ שָׂ֖מוּ אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֣͏ִם לְעִיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
A psalm of Asaph.

O God, heathens have entered Your domain,
defiled Your holy temple,
and turned Jerusalem into ruins.

translations.hebrew: נָתְנ֡וּ אֶת־נִבְלַ֬ת עֲבָדֶ֗יךָ מַ֭אֲכָל לְע֣וֹף הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם בְּשַׂ֥ר חֲ֝סִידֶ֗יךָ לְחַיְתוֹ־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
They have left Your servants’ corpses
as food for the fowl of heaven,
and the flesh of Your faithful for the wild beasts.

translations.hebrew: שָׁפְכ֬וּ דָמָ֨ם ׀ כַּמַּ֗יִם סְֽבִ֘יב֤וֹת יְֽרוּשָׁלָ֗͏ִם וְאֵ֣ין קוֹבֵֽר׃
translations.english:
Their blood was shed like water around Jerusalem,
with none to bury them.

translations.hebrew: הָיִ֣ינוּ חֶ֭רְפָּה לִשְׁכֵנֵ֑ינוּ לַ֥עַג וָ֝קֶ֗לֶס לִסְבִיבוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
We have become the butt of our neighbors,
the scorn and derision of those around us.

translations.hebrew: עַד־מָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה תֶּאֱנַ֣ף לָנֶ֑צַח תִּֽבְעַ֥ר כְּמוֹ־אֵ֝֗שׁ קִנְאָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
How long, O LORD, will You be angry forever,
will Your indignation blaze like fire?

translations.hebrew: שְׁפֹ֤ךְ חֲמָתְךָ֗ אֶֽל־הַגּוֹיִם֮ אֲשֶׁ֢ר לֹא־יְדָ֫ע֥וּךָ וְעַ֥ל מַמְלָכ֑וֹת אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּ֝שִׁמְךָ֗ לֹ֣א קָרָֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
Pour out Your fury on the nations that do not know You,
upon the kingdoms that do not invoke Your name,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭י אָכַ֣ל אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֑ב וְֽאֶת־נָוֵ֥הוּ הֵשַֽׁמּוּ׃
translations.english:
for they have devoured Jacob
and desolated his home.

translations.hebrew: אַֽל־תִּזְכׇּר־לָנוּ֮ עֲוֺנֹ֢ת רִאשֹׁ֫נִ֥ים מַ֭הֵר יְקַדְּמ֣וּנוּ רַחֲמֶ֑יךָ כִּ֖י דַלּ֣וֹנוּ מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
Do not hold our former iniquities against us;
let Your compassion come swiftly toward us,
for we have sunk very low.

translations.hebrew: עׇזְרֵ֤נוּ ׀ אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י יִשְׁעֵ֗נוּ עַֽל־דְּבַ֥ר כְּבֽוֹד־שְׁמֶ֑ךָ וְהַצִּילֵ֥נוּ וְכַפֵּ֥ר עַל־חַ֝טֹּאתֵ֗ינוּ לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Help us, O God, our deliverer,
for the sake of the glory of Your name.
Save us and forgive our sin,
for the sake of Your name.

translations.hebrew: לָ֤מָּה ׀ יֹאמְר֣וּ הַגּוֹיִם֮ אַיֵּ֢ה אֱֽלֹהֵ֫יהֶ֥ם יִוָּדַ֣ע (בגיים) [בַּגּוֹיִ֣ם] לְעֵינֵ֑ינוּ נִ֝קְמַ֗ת דַּֽם־עֲבָדֶ֥יךָ הַשָּׁפֽוּךְ׃
translations.english:
Let the nations not say, “Where is their God?”
Before our eyes let it be known among the nations
that You avenge the spilled blood of Your servants.

translations.hebrew: תָּ֤ב֣וֹא לְפָנֶיךָ֮ אֶנְקַ֢ת אָ֫סִ֥יר כְּגֹ֥דֶל זְרוֹעֲךָ֑ ה֝וֹתֵ֗ר בְּנֵ֣י תְמוּתָֽה׃
translations.english:
Let the groans of the prisoners reach You;
reprieve those condemned to death,
as befits Your great strength.

translations.hebrew: וְהָ֘שֵׁ֤ב לִשְׁכֵנֵ֣ינוּ שִׁ֭בְעָתַיִם אֶל־חֵיקָ֑ם חֶרְפָּ֘תָ֤ם אֲשֶׁ֖ר חֵרְפ֣וּךָ אֲדֹנָֽי׃
translations.english:
Pay back our neighbors sevenfold
for the abuse they have flung at You, O Lord.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנַ֤חְנוּ עַמְּךָ֨ ׀ וְצֹ֥אן מַרְעִיתֶךָ֮ נ֤וֹדֶ֥ה לְּךָ֗ לְע֫וֹלָ֥ם לְד֥וֹר וָדֹ֑ר נְ֝סַפֵּ֗ר תְּהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Then we, Your people,
the flock You shepherd,
shall glorify You forever;
for all time we shall tell Your praises.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ אֶל־שֹׁשַׁנִּ֑ים עֵד֖וּת לְאָסָ֣ף מִזְמֽוֹר׃
translations.english: For the leader; on shoshannim, eduth. Of Asaph. A psalm.

translations.hebrew: רֹ֘עֵ֤ה יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל ׀ הַאֲזִ֗ינָה נֹהֵ֣ג כַּצֹּ֣אן יוֹסֵ֑ף יֹשֵׁ֖ב הַכְּרוּבִ֣ים הוֹפִֽיעָה׃
translations.english:
Give ear, O shepherd of Israel
who leads Joseph like a flock!
Appear, You who are enthroned on the cherubim,

translations.hebrew: לִפְנֵ֤י אֶפְרַ֨יִם ׀ וּבִנְיָ֘מִ֤ן וּמְנַשֶּׁ֗ה עוֹרְרָ֥ה אֶת־גְּבוּרָתֶ֑ךָ וּלְכָ֖ה לִישֻׁעָ֣תָה לָּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
at the head of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh!
Rouse Your might and come to our help!

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֥ים הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נוּ וְהָאֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וְנִוָּשֵֽׁעָה׃
translations.english:
Restore us, O God;
show Your favor that we may be delivered.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְבָא֑וֹת עַד־מָתַ֥י עָ֝שַׁ֗נְתָּ בִּתְפִלַּ֥ת עַמֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
O LORD, God of hosts,
how long will You be wrathful
toward the prayers of Your people?

translations.hebrew: הֶ֭אֱכַלְתָּם לֶ֣חֶם דִּמְעָ֑ה וַ֝תַּשְׁקֵ֗מוֹ בִּדְמָע֥וֹת שָׁלִֽישׁ׃
translations.english:
You have fed them tears as their daily bread,
made them drink great measures of tears.

translations.hebrew: תְּשִׂימֵ֣נוּ מָ֭דוֹן לִשְׁכֵנֵ֑ינוּ וְ֝אֹיְבֵ֗ינוּ יִלְעֲגוּ־לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
You set us at strife with our neighbors;
our enemies mock us at will.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְבָא֣וֹת הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נוּ וְהָאֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וְנִוָּשֵֽׁעָה׃
translations.english:
O God of hosts, restore us;
show Your favor that we may be delivered.

translations.hebrew: גֶּ֭פֶן מִמִּצְרַ֣יִם תַּסִּ֑יעַ תְּגָרֵ֥שׁ גּ֝וֹיִ֗ם וַתִּטָּעֶֽהָ׃
translations.english:
You plucked up a vine from Egypt;
You expelled nations and planted it.

translations.hebrew: פִּנִּ֥יתָ לְפָנֶ֑יהָ וַתַּשְׁרֵ֥שׁ שׇׁ֝רָשֶׁ֗יהָ וַתְּמַלֵּא־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
You cleared a place for it;
it took deep root and filled the land.

translations.hebrew: כׇּסּ֣וּ הָרִ֣ים צִלָּ֑הּ וַ֝עֲנָפֶ֗יהָ אַֽרְזֵי־אֵֽל׃
translations.english:
The mountains were covered by its shade,
mighty cedars by its boughs.

translations.hebrew: תְּשַׁלַּ֣ח קְצִירֶ֣הָ עַד־יָ֑ם וְאֶל־נָ֝הָ֗ר יוֹנְקוֹתֶֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
Its branches reached the sea,
its shoots, the river.

translations.hebrew: לָ֭מָּה פָּרַ֣צְתָּ גְדֵרֶ֑יהָ וְ֝אָר֗וּהָ כׇּל־עֹ֥בְרֵי דָֽרֶךְ׃
translations.english:
Why did You breach its wall
so that every passerby plucks its fruit,

translations.hebrew: יְכַרְסְמֶ֣נָּֽה חֲזִ֣יר מִיָּ֑<sup>עַ</sup>ר וְזִ֖יז שָׂדַ֣י יִרְעֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
wild boars gnaw at it,
and creatures of the field feed on it?

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְבָאוֹת֮ שֽׁ֫וּב־נָ֥א הַבֵּ֣ט מִשָּׁמַ֣יִם וּרְאֵ֑ה וּ֝פְקֹ֗ד גֶּ֣פֶן זֹֽאת׃
translations.english:
O God of hosts, turn again,
look down from heaven and see;
take note of that vine,

translations.hebrew: וְ֭<big>כַ</big>נָּה אֲשֶׁר־נָטְעָ֣ה יְמִינֶ֑ךָ וְעַל־בֵּ֝֗ן אִמַּ֥צְתָּה לָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
the stock planted by Your right hand,
the stemaLit. “son.” you have taken as Your own.

translations.hebrew: שְׂרֻפָ֣ה בָאֵ֣שׁ כְּסוּחָ֑ה מִגַּעֲרַ֖ת פָּנֶ֣יךָ יֹאבֵֽדוּ׃
translations.english:
For it is burned by fire and cut down,
perishing before Your angry blast.

translations.hebrew: תְּֽהִי־יָ֭דְךָ עַל־אִ֣ישׁ יְמִינֶ֑ךָ עַל־בֶּן־אָ֝דָ֗ם אִמַּ֥צְתָּ לָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Grant Your helpbLit. “hand.” to the man at Your right hand,
the one You have taken as Your own.

translations.hebrew: וְלֹא־נָס֥וֹג מִמֶּ֑ךָּ תְּ֝חַיֵּ֗נוּ וּבְשִׁמְךָ֥ נִקְרָֽא׃
translations.english:
We will not turn away from You;
preserve our life that we may invoke Your name.

translations.hebrew: יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְבָא֣וֹת הֲשִׁיבֵ֑נוּ הָאֵ֥ר פָּ֝נֶ֗יךָ וְנִוָּשֵֽׁעָה׃
translations.english:
O LORD, God of hosts, restore us;
show Your favor that we may be delivered.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> עַֽל־הַגִּתִּ֬ית לְאָסָֽף׃
translations.english: For the leader; on the gittith. Of Asaph.

translations.hebrew: הַ֭רְנִינוּ לֵאלֹהִ֣ים עוּזֵּ֑נוּ הָ֝רִ֗יעוּ לֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
Sing joyously to God, our strength;
raise a shout for the God of Jacob.

translations.hebrew: שְֽׂאוּ־זִ֭מְרָה וּתְנוּ־תֹ֑ף כִּנּ֖וֹר נָעִ֣ים עִם־נָֽבֶל׃
translations.english:
Take up the song,
sound the timbrel,
the melodious lyre and harp.

translations.hebrew: תִּקְע֣וּ בַחֹ֣דֶשׁ שׁוֹפָ֑ר בַּ֝כֵּ֗סֶה לְי֣וֹם חַגֵּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Blow the horn on the new moon,
on the full moon for our feast day.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י חֹ֣ק לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל ה֑וּא מִ֝שְׁפָּ֗ט לֵאלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
For it is a law for Israel,
a ruling of the God of Jacob;

translations.hebrew: עֵד֤וּת ׀ בִּיה֘וֹסֵ֤ף שָׂמ֗וֹ בְּ֭צֵאתוֹ עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם שְׂפַ֖ת לֹא־יָדַ֣עְתִּי אֶשְׁמָֽע׃
translations.english:
He imposed it as a decree upon Joseph
when aOr “He went forth against.”he went forth from-a the land of Egypt;
I heard a language that I knew not.

translations.hebrew: הֲסִיר֣וֹתִי מִסֵּ֣בֶל שִׁכְמ֑וֹ כַּ֝פָּ֗יו מִדּ֥וּד תַּעֲבֹֽרְנָה׃
translations.english:
I relieved his shoulder of the burden,
his hands were freed from the basket.

translations.hebrew: בַּצָּרָ֥ה קָרָ֗אתָ וָאֲחַ֫לְּצֶ֥ךָּ אֶ֭עֶנְךָ בְּסֵ֣תֶר רַ֑עַם אֶבְחׇנְךָ֨ עַל־מֵ֖י מְרִיבָ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
In distress you called and I rescued you;
I answered you from the bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.secret place of thunder-b
I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah.

translations.hebrew: שְׁמַ֣ע עַ֭מִּי וְאָעִ֣ידָה בָּ֑ךְ יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל אִם־תִּֽשְׁמַֽע־לִֽי׃
translations.english:
Hear, My people, and I will admonish you;
Israel, if you would but listen to Me!

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יִהְיֶ֣ה בְ֭ךָ אֵ֣ל זָ֑ר וְלֹ֥א תִ֝שְׁתַּחֲוֶ֗ה לְאֵ֣ל נֵכָֽר׃
translations.english:
You shall have no foreign god,
you shall not bow to an alien god.

translations.hebrew: אָֽנֹכִ֨י ׀ יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֗יךָ הַֽ֭מַּעַלְךָ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם הַרְחֶב־פִּ֝֗יךָ וַאֲמַלְאֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
I the LORD am your God
who brought you out of the land of Egypt;
open your mouth wide and I will fill it.

translations.hebrew: וְלֹא־שָׁמַ֣ע עַמִּ֣י לְקוֹלִ֑י וְ֝יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לֹא־אָ֥בָה לִֽי׃
translations.english:
But My people would not listen to Me,
Israel would not obey Me.

translations.hebrew: וָ֭אֲשַׁלְּחֵהוּ בִּשְׁרִיר֣וּת לִבָּ֑ם יֵ֝לְכ֗וּ בְּֽמוֹעֲצ֖וֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
So I let them go after their willful heart
that they might follow their own devices.

translations.hebrew: ל֗וּ עַ֭מִּי שֹׁמֵ֣עַֽ לִ֑י יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל בִּדְרָכַ֥י יְהַלֵּֽכוּ׃
translations.english:
If only My people would listen to Me,
if Israel would follow My paths,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭מְעַט אוֹיְבֵיהֶ֣ם אַכְנִ֑יעַ וְעַ֥ל צָ֝רֵיהֶ֗ם אָשִׁ֥יב יָדִֽי׃
translations.english:
then would I subdue their enemies at once,
strike their foes again and again.

translations.hebrew: מְשַׂנְאֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה יְכַחֲשׁוּ־ל֑וֹ וִיהִ֖י עִתָּ֣ם לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
Those who hate the LORD shall cower before Him;
their doom shall be eternal.

translations.hebrew: וַֽ֭יַּאֲכִילֵהוּ מֵחֵ֣לֶב חִטָּ֑ה וּ֝מִצּ֗וּר דְּבַ֣שׁ אַשְׂבִּיעֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
He fed themcLit. “him,” i.e., Israel. the finest wheat;
I sated you with honey from the rock.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְאָ֫סָ֥ף אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים נִצָּ֥ב בַּעֲדַת־אֵ֑ל בְּקֶ֖רֶב אֱלֹהִ֣ים יִשְׁפֹּֽט׃
translations.english:
A psalm of Asaph.

God stands in the divine assembly;
among the divine beings He pronounces judgment.

translations.hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֥י תִּשְׁפְּטוּ־עָ֑וֶל וּפְנֵ֥י רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים תִּשְׂאוּ־סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
How long will you judge perversely,
showing favor to the wicked? Selah.

translations.hebrew: שִׁפְטוּ־דַ֥ל וְיָת֑וֹם עָנִ֖י וָרָ֣שׁ הַצְדִּֽיקוּ׃
translations.english:
Judge the wretched and the orphan,
vindicate the lowly and the poor,

translations.hebrew: פַּלְּטוּ־דַ֥ל וְאֶבְי֑וֹן מִיַּ֖ד רְשָׁעִ֣ים הַצִּֽילוּ׃
translations.english:
rescue the wretched and the needy;
save them from the hand of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: לֹ֤א יָדְע֨וּ ׀ וְלֹ֥א יָבִ֗ינוּ בַּחֲשֵׁכָ֥ה יִתְהַלָּ֑כוּ יִ֝מּ֗וֹטוּ כׇּל־מ֥וֹסְדֵי אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
They neither know nor understand,
they go about in darkness;
all the foundations of the earth totter.

translations.hebrew: אֲֽנִי־אָ֭מַרְתִּי אֱלֹהִ֣ים אַתֶּ֑ם וּבְנֵ֖י עֶלְי֣וֹן כֻּלְּכֶֽם׃
translations.english:
I had taken you for divine beings,
sons of the Most High, all of you;

translations.hebrew: אָ֭כֵן כְּאָדָ֣ם תְּמוּת֑וּן וּכְאַחַ֖ד הַשָּׂרִ֣ים תִּפֹּֽלוּ׃
translations.english:
but you shall die as men do,
fall like any prince.

translations.hebrew: קוּמָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהִים שׇׁפְטָ֣ה הָאָ֑רֶץ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה תִ֝נְחַ֗ל בְּכׇל־הַגּוֹיִֽם׃
translations.english:
Arise, O God, judge the earth,
for all the nations are Your possession.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֖יר מִזְמ֣וֹר לְאָסָֽף׃
translations.english: A song, a psalm of Asaph.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֥ים אַל־דֳּמִי־לָ֑ךְ אַל־תֶּחֱרַ֖שׁ וְאַל־תִּשְׁקֹ֣ט אֵֽל׃
translations.english:
O God, do not be silent;
do not hold aloof;
do not be quiet, O God!

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֣ה א֭וֹיְבֶיךָ יֶהֱמָי֑וּן וּ֝מְשַׂנְאֶ֗יךָ נָ֣שְׂאוּ רֹֽאשׁ׃
translations.english:
For Your enemies rage,
Your foes aLit. “lift up the head.”assert themselves.-a

translations.hebrew: עַֽל־עַ֭מְּךָ יַעֲרִ֣ימוּ ס֑וֹד וְ֝יִתְיָעֲצ֗וּ עַל־צְפוּנֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
They plot craftily against Your people,
take counsel against Your treasured ones.

translations.hebrew: אָמְר֗וּ לְ֭כוּ וְנַכְחִידֵ֣ם מִגּ֑וֹי וְלֹֽא־יִזָּכֵ֖ר שֵֽׁם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
They say, “Let us wipe them out as a nation;
Israel’s name will be mentioned no more.”

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י נוֹעֲצ֣וּ לֵ֣ב יַחְדָּ֑ו עָ֝לֶ֗יךָ בְּרִ֣ית יִכְרֹֽתוּ׃
translations.english:
Unanimous in their counsel
they have made an alliance against You—

translations.hebrew: אׇהֳלֵ֣י אֱ֭דוֹם וְיִשְׁמְעֵאלִ֗ים מוֹאָ֥ב וְהַגְרִֽים׃
translations.english:
the clans of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
Moab and the Hagrites,

translations.hebrew: גְּבָ֣ל וְ֭עַמּוֹן וַעֲמָלֵ֑ק פְּ֝לֶ֗שֶׁת עִם־יֹ֥שְׁבֵי צֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek,
Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;

translations.hebrew: גַּם־אַ֭שּׁוּר נִלְוָ֣ה עִמָּ֑ם הָ֤יֽוּ־זְר֖וֹעַ לִבְנֵי־ל֣וֹט סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Assyria too joins forces with them;
they give support to the sons of Lot. Selah.

translations.hebrew: עֲשֵֽׂה־לָהֶ֥ם כְּמִדְיָ֑ן כְּֽסִיסְרָ֥א כְ֝יָבִ֗ין בְּנַ֣חַל קִישֽׁוֹן׃
translations.english:
Deal with them as You did with Midian,
with Sisera, with Jabin,
at the brook Kishon—

translations.hebrew: נִשְׁמְד֥וּ בְֽעֵין־דֹּ֑אר הָ֥יוּ דֹ֝֗מֶן לָאֲדָמָֽה׃
translations.english:
who were destroyed at En-dor,
who became dung for the field.

translations.hebrew: שִׁיתֵ֣מוֹ נְ֭דִיבֵימוֹ כְּעֹרֵ֣ב וְכִזְאֵ֑ב וּֽכְזֶ֥בַח וּ֝כְצַלְמֻנָּ֗ע כׇּל־נְסִיכֵֽימוֹ׃
translations.english:
Treat their great men like Oreb and Zeeb,
all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָ֭מְרוּ נִ֣ירְשָׁה לָּ֑נוּ אֵ֝֗ת נְא֣וֹת אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english: who said, “Let us take the meadows of God as our possession.”

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהַ֗י שִׁיתֵ֥מוֹ כַגַּלְגַּ֑ל כְּ֝קַ֗שׁ לִפְנֵי־רֽוּחַ׃
translations.english:
O my God, make them like thistledown,
like stubble driven by the wind.

translations.hebrew: כְּאֵ֥שׁ תִּבְעַר־יָ֑עַר וּ֝כְלֶהָבָ֗ה תְּלַהֵ֥ט הָרִֽים׃
translations.english:
As a fire burns a forest,
as flames scorch the hills,

translations.hebrew: כֵּ֭ן תִּרְדְּפֵ֣ם בְּסַעֲרֶ֑ךָ וּבְסוּפָתְךָ֥ תְבַהֲלֵֽם׃
translations.english:
pursue them with Your tempest,
terrify them with Your storm.

translations.hebrew: מַלֵּ֣א פְנֵיהֶ֣ם קָל֑וֹן וִיבַקְשׁ֖וּ שִׁמְךָ֣ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
CoverbLit. “Fill.” their faces with shame
so that they seek Your name, O LORD.

translations.hebrew: יֵבֹ֖שׁוּ וְיִבָּהֲל֥וּ עֲדֵי־עַ֗ד וְֽיַחְפְּר֥וּ וְיֹאבֵֽדוּ׃
translations.english:
May they be frustrated and terrified,
disgraced and doomed forever.

translations.hebrew: וְֽיֵדְע֗וּ כִּי־אַתָּ֬ה שִׁמְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֣ה לְבַדֶּ֑ךָ עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן עַל־כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
May they know
that Your name, Yours alone, is the LORD,
supreme over all the earth.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֥חַ עַֽל־הַגִּתִּ֑ית לִבְנֵי־קֹ֥רַח מִזְמֽוֹר׃
translations.english: For the leader; on the gittith. Of the Korahites. A psalm.

translations.hebrew: מַה־יְּדִיד֥וֹת מִשְׁכְּנוֹתֶ֗יךָ יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָאֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
How lovely is Your dwelling-place,
O LORD of hosts.

translations.hebrew: נִכְסְפָ֬ה וְגַם־כָּלְתָ֨ה ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ לְחַצְר֢וֹת יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה לִבִּ֥י וּבְשָׂרִ֑י יְ֝רַנְּנ֗וּ אֶ֣ל אֵֽל־חָֽי׃
translations.english:
I long, I yearn for the courts of the LORD;
my body and soul shout for joy to the living God.

translations.hebrew: גַּם־צִפּ֨וֹר מָ֪צְאָה בַ֡יִת וּדְר֤וֹר ׀ קֵ֥ן לָהּ֮ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֢תָה אֶפְרֹ֫חֶ֥יהָ אֶֽת־מִ֭זְבְּחוֹתֶיךָ יְהֹוָ֣ה צְבָא֑וֹת מַ֝לְכִּ֗י וֵאלֹהָֽי׃
translations.english:
Even the sparrow has found a home,
and the swallow a nest for herself
in which to set her young,
near Your altar, O LORD of hosts,
my king and my God.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭שְׁרֵי יוֹשְׁבֵ֣י בֵיתֶ֑ךָ ע֝֗וֹד יְֽהַלְל֥וּךָ סֶּֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Happy are those who dwell in Your house;
they forever praise You. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י אָ֭דָם עֽוֹז־ל֥וֹ בָ֑ךְ מְ֝סִלּ֗וֹת בִּלְבָבָֽם׃
translations.english:
Happy is the man who finds refuge in You,
whose mind is on the [pilgrim] highways.

translations.hebrew: עֹבְרֵ֤י ׀ בְּעֵ֣מֶק הַ֭בָּכָא מַעְיָ֣ן יְשִׁית֑וּהוּ גַּם־בְּ֝רָכ֗וֹת יַעְטֶ֥ה מוֹרֶֽה׃
translations.english:
They pass through the Valley of Baca,
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.regarding it as a place of springs,
as if the early rain had covered it with blessing.-a

translations.hebrew: יֵ֭לְכוּ מֵחַ֣יִל אֶל־חָ֑יִל יֵרָאֶ֖ה אֶל־אֱלֹהִ֣ים בְּצִיּֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
They go from bOthers “strength to strength.”rampart to rampart,-b
appearing before God in Zion.

translations.hebrew: יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים צְ֭בָאוֹת שִׁמְעָ֣ה תְפִלָּתִ֑י הַאֲזִ֨ינָה אֱלֹהֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֣ב סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
O LORD, God of hosts,
hear my prayer;
give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah.

translations.hebrew: מָ֭גִנֵּנוּ רְאֵ֣ה אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְ֝הַבֵּ֗ט פְּנֵ֣י מְשִׁיחֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
O God, behold our shield,
look upon the face of Your anointed.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י טֽוֹב־י֥וֹם בַּחֲצֵרֶ֗יךָ מֵ֫אָ֥לֶף בָּחַ֗רְתִּי הִ֭סְתּוֹפֵף בְּבֵ֣ית אֱלֹהַ֑י מִ֝דּ֗וּר בְּאׇהֳלֵי־רֶֽשַׁע׃
translations.english:
Better one day in Your courts than a thousand [anywhere else];
I would rather stand at the threshold of God’s house
than dwell in the tents of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י שֶׁ֨מֶשׁ ׀ וּמָגֵן֮ יְהֹוָ֢ה אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים חֵ֣ן וְ֭כָבוֹד יִתֵּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֑ה לֹ֥א יִמְנַע־ט֝֗וֹב לַֽהֹלְכִ֥ים בְּתָמִֽים׃
translations.english:
For the LORD God is suncOr “bulwark,” with Targum; cf. Isa. 54.12. and shield;
the LORD bestows grace and glory;
He does not withhold His bounty from those who live without blame.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה צְבָא֑וֹת אַֽשְׁרֵ֥י אָ֝דָ֗ם בֹּטֵ֥חַ בָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
O LORD of hosts,
happy is the man who trusts in You.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֬חַ <small>׀</small> לִבְנֵי־קֹ֬רַח מִזְמֽוֹר׃
translations.english: For the leader. Of the Korahites. A psalm.

translations.hebrew: רָצִ֣יתָ יְהֹוָ֣ה אַרְצֶ֑ךָ שַׁ֝֗בְתָּ (שבות) [שְׁבִ֣ית] יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
O LORD, You aOr “have favored.”will favor-a Your land,
restorebOr “have restored.” Jacob’s fortune;

translations.hebrew: נָ֭שָׂאתָ עֲוֺ֣ן עַמֶּ֑ךָ כִּסִּ֖יתָ כׇל־חַטָּאתָ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
You cOr “have forgiven.”will forgive-c Your people’s iniquity,
pardondOr “have pardoned.” all their sins; selah

translations.hebrew: אָסַ֥פְתָּ כׇל־עֶבְרָתֶ֑ךָ הֱ֝שִׁיב֗וֹתָ מֵחֲר֥וֹן אַפֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
You eOr “have withdrawn.”will withdraw-e all Your anger,
turnfOr “have turned.” away from Your rage.

translations.hebrew: שׁ֭וּבֵנוּ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׁעֵ֑נוּ וְהָפֵ֖ר כַּעַסְךָ֣ עִמָּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Turn again, O God, our helper,
revoke Your displeasure with us.

translations.hebrew: הַלְעוֹלָ֥ם תֶּאֱנַף־בָּ֑נוּ תִּמְשֹׁ֥ךְ אַ֝פְּךָ֗ לְדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃
translations.english:
Will You be angry with us forever,
prolong Your wrath for all generations?

translations.hebrew: הֲֽלֹא־אַ֭תָּה תָּשׁ֣וּב תְּחַיֵּ֑נוּ וְ֝עַמְּךָ֗ יִשְׂמְחוּ־בָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Surely You will revive us again,
so that Your people may rejoice in You.

translations.hebrew: הַרְאֵ֣נוּ יְהֹוָ֣ה חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝יֶשְׁעֲךָ֗ תִּתֶּן־לָֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Show us, O LORD, Your faithfulness;
grant us Your deliverance.

translations.hebrew: אֶשְׁמְעָ֗ה מַה־יְדַבֵּר֮ הָאֵ֢ל ׀ יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה כִּ֤י ׀ יְדַבֵּ֬ר שָׁל֗וֹם אֶל־עַמּ֥וֹ וְאֶל־חֲסִידָ֑יו וְאַל־יָשׁ֥וּבוּ לְכִסְלָֽה׃
translations.english:
Let me hear what God, the LORD, will speak;
He will promise well-being to His people, His faithful ones;
may they not turn to folly.

translations.hebrew: אַ֤ךְ קָר֣וֹב לִירֵאָ֣יו יִשְׁע֑וֹ לִשְׁכֹּ֖ן כָּב֣וֹד בְּאַרְצֵֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
His help is very near those who fear Him,
to make His glory dwell in our land.

translations.hebrew: חֶסֶד־וֶאֱמֶ֥ת נִפְגָּ֑שׁוּ צֶ֖דֶק וְשָׁל֣וֹם נָשָֽׁקוּ׃
translations.english:
Faithfulness and truth meet;
justice and well-being kiss.

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭מֶת מֵאֶ֣רֶץ תִּצְמָ֑ח וְ֝צֶ֗דֶק מִשָּׁמַ֥יִם נִשְׁקָֽף׃
translations.english:
Truth springs up from the earth;
justice looks down from heaven.

translations.hebrew: גַּם־יְ֭הֹוָה יִתֵּ֣ן הַטּ֑וֹב וְ֝אַרְצֵ֗נוּ תִּתֵּ֥ן יְבוּלָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
The LORD also bestows His bounty;
our land yields its produce.

translations.hebrew: צֶ֭דֶק לְפָנָ֣יו יְהַלֵּ֑ךְ וְיָשֵׂ֖ם לְדֶ֣רֶךְ פְּעָמָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Justice goes before Him
as He sets out on His way.

translations.hebrew: תְּפִלָּ֗ה לְדָ֫וִ֥ד הַטֵּֽה־יְהֹוָ֣ה אׇזְנְךָ֣ עֲנֵ֑נִי כִּֽי־עָנִ֖י וְאֶבְי֣וֹן אָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
A prayer of David.

Incline Your ear, O LORD,
answer me,
for I am poor and needy.

translations.hebrew: שׇׁ֥מְרָ֣ה נַפְשִׁי֮ כִּֽי־חָסִ֢יד אָ֥֫נִי הוֹשַׁ֣ע עַ֭בְדְּךָ אַתָּ֣ה אֱלֹהַ֑י הַבּוֹטֵ֥חַ אֵלֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Preserve my life, for I am steadfast;
O You, my God,
deliver Your servant who trusts in You.

translations.hebrew: חׇנֵּ֥נִי אֲדֹנָ֑י כִּ֥י אֵלֶ֥יךָ אֶ֝קְרָ֗א כׇּל־הַיּֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
Have mercy on me, O Lord,
for I call to You all day long;

translations.hebrew: שַׂ֭מֵּחַ נֶ֣פֶשׁ עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י אֵלֶ֥יךָ אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י נַפְשִׁ֥י אֶשָּֽׂא׃
translations.english:
bring joy to Your servant’s life,
for on You, Lord, I set my hope.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה אֲ֭דֹנָי ט֣וֹב וְסַלָּ֑ח וְרַב־חֶ֝֗סֶד לְכׇל־קֹֽרְאֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
For You, Lord, are good and forgiving,
abounding in steadfast love to all who call on You.

translations.hebrew: הַאֲזִ֣ינָה יְ֭הֹוָה תְּפִלָּתִ֑י וְ֝הַקְשִׁ֗יבָה בְּק֣וֹל תַּחֲנוּנוֹתָֽי׃
translations.english:
Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer;
heed my plea for mercy.

translations.hebrew: בְּי֣וֹם צָ֭רָתִֽי אֶקְרָאֶ֗ךָּ כִּ֣י תַעֲנֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
In my time of trouble I call You,
for You will answer me.

translations.hebrew: אֵין־כָּמ֖וֹךָ בָאֱלֹהִ֥ים <small>׀</small> אֲדֹנָ֗י וְאֵ֣ין כְּֽמַעֲשֶֽׂיךָ׃
translations.english:
There is none like You among the gods, O Lord,
and there are no deeds like Yours.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֤ם ׀ אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֗יתָ יָב֤וֹאוּ ׀ וְיִשְׁתַּחֲו֣וּ לְפָנֶ֣יךָ אֲדֹנָ֑י וִ֖יכַבְּד֣וּ לִשְׁמֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
All the nations You have made
will come to bow down before You, O Lord,
and they will pay honor to Your name.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־גָד֣וֹל אַ֭תָּה וְעֹשֵׂ֣ה נִפְלָא֑וֹת אַתָּ֖ה אֱלֹהִ֣ים לְבַדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
For You are great and perform wonders;
You alone are God.

translations.hebrew: ה֘וֹרֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ דַּרְכֶּ֗ךָ אֲהַלֵּ֥ךְ בַּאֲמִתֶּ֑ךָ יַחֵ֥ד לְ֝בָבִ֗י לְיִרְאָ֥ה שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Teach me Your way, O LORD;
I will walk in Your truth;
let my heart be undivided in reverence for Your name.

translations.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ֤ ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י אֱ֭לֹהַי בְּכׇל־לְבָבִ֑י וַאֲכַבְּדָ֖ה שִׁמְךָ֣ לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
I will praise You, O Lord, my God, with all my heart
and pay honor to Your name forever.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־חַ֭סְדְּךָ גָּד֣וֹל עָלָ֑י וְהִצַּ֥לְתָּ נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י מִשְּׁא֥וֹל תַּחְתִּיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
For Your steadfast love toward me is great;
You have saved me from the depths of Sheol.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ זֵ֘דִ֤ים קָמוּ־עָלַ֗י וַעֲדַ֣ת עָ֭רִיצִים בִּקְשׁ֣וּ נַפְשִׁ֑י וְלֹ֖א שָׂמ֣וּךָ לְנֶגְדָּֽם׃
translations.english:
O God, arrogant men have risen against me;
a band of ruthless men seek my life;
they are not mindful of You.

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה אֲ֭דֹנָי אֵל־רַח֣וּם וְחַנּ֑וּן אֶ֥רֶךְ אַ֝פַּ֗יִם וְרַב־חֶ֥סֶד וֶאֱמֶֽת׃
translations.english:
But You, O Lord, are a God
compassionate and merciful,
slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness.

translations.hebrew: פְּנֵ֥ה אֵלַ֗י וְחׇ֫נֵּ֥נִי תְּנָֽה־עֻזְּךָ֥ לְעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝הוֹשִׁ֗יעָה לְבֶן־אֲמָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Turn to me and have mercy on me;
grant Your strength to Your servant
and deliver the son of Your maidservant.

translations.hebrew: עֲשֵֽׂה־עִמִּ֥י א֗וֹת לְט֫וֹבָ֥ה וְיִרְא֣וּ שֹׂנְאַ֣י וְיֵבֹ֑שׁוּ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֥ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עֲזַרְתַּ֥נִי וְנִחַמְתָּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Show me a sign of Your favor,
that my enemies may see and be frustrated
because You, O LORD, have given me aid and comfort.

translations.hebrew: לִבְנֵי־קֹ֭רַח מִזְמ֣וֹר שִׁ֑יר יְ֝סוּדָת֗וֹ בְּהַרְרֵי־קֹֽדֶשׁ׃
translations.english: aThe meaning of many passages in this psalm is uncertain.Of the Korahites. A psalm. A song.

translations.hebrew: אֹהֵ֣ב יְ֭הֹוָה שַׁעֲרֵ֣י צִיּ֑וֹן מִ֝כֹּ֗ל מִשְׁכְּנ֥וֹת יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
bOrder of lines inverted for clarity.The LORD loves the gates of Zion,
His foundation on the holy mountains,-b
more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

translations.hebrew: נִ֭כְבָּדוֹת מְדֻבָּ֣ר בָּ֑ךְ עִ֖יר הָאֱלֹהִ֣ים סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Glorious things are spoken of you,
O city of God. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אַזְכִּ֤יר ׀ רַ֥הַב וּבָבֶ֗ל לְֽיֹ֫דְעָ֥י הִנֵּ֤ה פְלֶ֣שֶׁת וְצֹ֣ר עִם־כּ֑וּשׁ זֶ֝֗ה יֻלַּד־שָֽׁם׃
translations.english:
I mention RahabcA primeval monster; here, a poetic term for Egypt; cf. Isa. 30.7. and Babylon among those who acknowledge Me;
Philistia, and Tyre, and Cush—each was born there.

translations.hebrew: וּ֥לְצִיּ֨וֹן ׀ יֵאָמַ֗ר אִ֣ישׁ וְ֭אִישׁ יֻלַּד־בָּ֑הּ וְה֖וּא יְכוֹנְנֶ֣הָ עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Indeed, it shall be said of Zion,
“Every man was born there.”
dOr “He will preserve it supreme.”He, the Most High, will preserve it.-d

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה יִ֭סְפֹּר בִּכְת֣וֹב עַמִּ֑ים זֶ֖ה יֻלַּד־שָׁ֣ם סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
The LORD will inscribe in the register of peoples
that each was born there. Selah.

translations.hebrew: וְשָׁרִ֥ים כְּחֹלְלִ֑ים כׇּֽל־מַעְיָנַ֥י בָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
Singers and dancers alike [will say]:
“All my rootseLit. “sources.” are in You.”

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֥יר מִזְמ֗וֹר לִבְנֵ֫י־קֹ֥רַח לַמְנַצֵּ֣חַ עַל־מָחֲלַ֣ת לְעַנּ֑וֹת מַ֝שְׂכִּ֗יל לְהֵימָ֥ן הָאֶזְרָחִֽי׃
translations.english: A song. A psalm of the Korahites. For the leader; aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.on maḥalath leannoth.-a A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite.

translations.hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יְשׁוּעָתִ֑י יוֹם־צָעַ֖קְתִּי בַלַּ֣יְלָה נֶגְדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
O LORD, God of my deliverance,
bOr “by day I cry out [and] by night.”when I cry out in the night-b before You,

translations.hebrew: תָּב֣וֹא לְ֭פָנֶיךָ תְּפִלָּתִ֑י הַטֵּ֥ה אׇ֝זְנְךָ֗ לְרִנָּתִֽי׃
translations.english:
let my prayer reach You;
incline Your ear to my cry.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־שָׂבְעָ֣ה בְרָע֣וֹת נַפְשִׁ֑י וְ֝חַיַּ֗י לִשְׁא֥וֹל הִגִּֽיעוּ׃
translations.english:
For I am sated with misfortune;
I am at the brink of Sheol.

translations.hebrew: נֶ֭חְשַׁבְתִּי עִם־י֣וֹרְדֵי ב֑וֹר הָ֝יִ֗יתִי כְּגֶ֣בֶר אֵֽין־אֱיָֽל׃
translations.english:
I am numbered with those who go down to the Pit;
I am a helpless man

translations.hebrew: בַּמֵּתִ֗ים חׇ֫פְשִׁ֥י כְּמ֤וֹ חֲלָלִ֨ים ׀ שֹׁ֥כְבֵי קֶ֗בֶר אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹ֣א זְכַרְתָּ֣ם ע֑וֹד וְ֝הֵ֗מָּה מִיָּדְךָ֥ נִגְזָֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
abandonedcLit. “released.” among the dead,
like bodies lying in the grave
of whom You are mindful no more,
and who are cut off from Your care.

translations.hebrew: שַׁ֭תַּנִי בְּב֣וֹר תַּחְתִּיּ֑וֹת בְּ֝מַחֲשַׁכִּ֗ים בִּמְצֹלֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
You have put me at the bottom of the Pit,
in the darkest places, in the depths.

translations.hebrew: עָ֭לַי סָמְכָ֣ה חֲמָתֶ֑ךָ וְכׇל־מִ֝שְׁבָּרֶ֗יךָ עִנִּ֥יתָ סֶּֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Your fury lies heavy upon me;
You afflict me with all Your breakers. Selah.

translations.hebrew: הִרְחַ֥קְתָּ מְיֻדָּעַ֗י מִ֫מֶּ֥נִּי שַׁתַּ֣נִי תוֹעֵב֣וֹת לָ֑מוֹ כָּ֝לֻ֗א וְלֹ֣א אֵצֵֽא׃
translations.english:
You make my companions shun me;
You make me abhorrent to them;
I am shut in and do not go out.

translations.hebrew: עֵינִ֥י דָאֲבָ֗ה מִנִּ֫י־עֹ֥נִי קְרָאתִ֣יךָ יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּכׇל־י֑וֹם שִׁטַּ֖חְתִּי אֵלֶ֣יךָ כַפָּֽי׃
translations.english:
My eyes pine away from affliction;
I call to You, O LORD, each day;
I stretch out my hands to You.

translations.hebrew: הֲלַמֵּתִ֥ים תַּעֲשֶׂה־פֶּ֑לֶא אִם־רְ֝פָאִ֗ים יָק֤וּמוּ ׀ יוֹד֬וּךָ סֶּֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Do You work wonders for the dead?
Do the shades rise to praise You? Selah.

translations.hebrew: הַיְסֻפַּ֣ר בַּקֶּ֣בֶר חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ אֱ֝מ֥וּנָתְךָ֗ בָּאֲבַדּֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Is Your faithful care recounted in the grave,
Your constancy in the place of perdition?

translations.hebrew: הֲיִוָּדַ֣ע בַּחֹ֣שֶׁךְ פִּלְאֶ֑ךָ וְ֝צִדְקָתְךָ֗ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ נְשִׁיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Are Your wonders made known in the netherworld,dLit. “darkness.”
Your beneficent deeds in the land of oblivion?

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ אֵלֶ֣יךָ יְהֹוָ֣ה שִׁוַּ֑עְתִּי וּ֝בַבֹּ֗קֶר תְּֽפִלָּתִ֥י תְקַדְּמֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
As for me, I cry out to You, O LORD;
each morning my prayer greets You.

translations.hebrew: לָמָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה תִּזְנַ֣ח נַפְשִׁ֑י תַּסְתִּ֖יר פָּנֶ֣יךָ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
Why, O LORD, do You reject me,
do You hide Your face from me?

translations.hebrew: עָ֘נִ֤י אֲנִ֣י וְגֹוֵ֣עַ מִנֹּ֑עַר נָשָׂ֖אתִי אֵמֶ֣יךָ אָפֽוּנָה׃
translations.english:
From my youth I have been afflicted
and near death;
I suffer Your terrors eFollowing Saadia; meaning of Heb. uncertain.wherever I turn.-e

translations.hebrew: עָ֭לַי עָבְר֣וּ חֲרוֹנֶ֑יךָ בִּ֝עוּתֶ֗יךָ צִמְּתוּתֻֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Your fury overwhelms me;
Your terrors destroy me.

translations.hebrew: סַבּ֣וּנִי כַ֭מַּיִם כׇּל־הַיּ֑וֹם הִקִּ֖יפוּ עָלַ֣י יָֽחַד׃
translations.english:
They swirl about me like water all day long;
they encircle me on every side.

translations.hebrew: הִרְחַ֣קְתָּ מִ֭מֶּנִּי אֹהֵ֣ב וָרֵ֑עַ מְֽיֻדָּעַ֥י מַחְשָֽׁךְ׃
translations.english:
You have put friend and neighbor far from me
and my companions out of my sight.fLit. “into darkness.”

translations.hebrew: מַ֝שְׂכִּ֗יל לְאֵיתָ֥ן הָאֶזְרָחִֽי׃
translations.english: A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite.

translations.hebrew: חַֽסְדֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה עוֹלָ֣ם אָשִׁ֑ירָה לְדֹ֥ר וָדֹ֓ר ׀ אוֹדִ֖יעַ אֱמוּנָתְךָ֣ בְּפִֽי׃
translations.english:
I will sing of the LORD’s steadfast love forever;
to all generations I will proclaim Your faithfulness with my mouth.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אָמַ֗רְתִּי ע֭וֹלָם חֶ֣סֶד יִבָּנֶ֑ה שָׁמַ֓יִם ׀ תָּכִ֖ן אֱמוּנָתְךָ֣ בָהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
I declare, “Your steadfast love is confirmed forever;
there in the heavens You establish Your faithfulness.”

translations.hebrew: כָּרַ֣תִּי בְ֭רִית לִבְחִירִ֑י נִ֝שְׁבַּ֗עְתִּי לְדָוִ֥ד עַבְדִּֽי׃
translations.english:
“I have made a covenant with My chosen one;
I have sworn to My servant David:

translations.hebrew: עַד־ע֭וֹלָם אָכִ֣ין זַרְעֶ֑ךָ וּבָנִ֨יתִי לְדֹר־וָד֖וֹר כִּסְאֲךָ֣ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
I will establish your offspring forever,
I will confirm your throne for all generations.” Selah.

translations.hebrew: וְי֘וֹד֤וּ שָׁמַ֣יִם פִּלְאֲךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֑ה אַף־אֱ֝מ֥וּנָתְךָ֗ בִּקְהַ֥ל קְדֹשִֽׁים׃
translations.english:
Your wonders, O LORD, are praised by the heavens,
Your faithfulness, too, in the assembly of holy beings.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י מִ֣י בַ֭שַּׁחַק יַעֲרֹ֣ךְ לַיהֹוָ֑ה יִדְמֶ֥ה לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה בִּבְנֵ֥י אֵלִֽים׃
translations.english:
For who in the skies can equal the LORD,
can compare with the LORD among the divine beings,

translations.hebrew: אֵ֣ל נַ֭עֲרָץ בְּסוֹד־קְדֹשִׁ֣ים רַבָּ֑ה וְ֝נוֹרָ֗א עַל־כׇּל־סְבִיבָֽיו׃
translations.english:
a God greatly dreaded in the council of holy beings,
held in awe by all around Him?

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ אֱלֹ֘הֵ֤י צְבָא֗וֹת מִי־כָמ֖וֹךָֽ חֲסִ֥ין ׀ יָ֑הּ וֶ֝אֱמ֥וּנָתְךָ֗ סְבִיבוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
O LORD, God of hosts,
who is mighty like You, O LORD?
Your faithfulness surrounds You;

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה מ֭וֹשֵׁל בְּגֵא֣וּת הַיָּ֑ם בְּשׂ֥וֹא גַ֝לָּ֗יו אַתָּ֥ה תְשַׁבְּחֵֽם׃
translations.english:
You rule the swelling of the sea;
when its waves surge, You still them.

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֤ה דִכִּ֣אתָ כֶחָלָ֣ל רָ֑הַב בִּזְר֥וֹעַ עֻ֝זְּךָ֗ פִּזַּ֥רְתָּ אוֹיְבֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
You crushed Rahab; he was like a corpse;
with Your powerful arm You scattered Your enemies.

translations.hebrew: לְךָ֣ שָׁ֭מַיִם אַף־לְךָ֥ אָ֑רֶץ תֵּבֵ֥ל וּ֝מְלֹאָ֗הּ אַתָּ֥ה יְסַדְתָּֽם׃
translations.english:
The heaven is Yours,
the earth too;
the world and all it holds—
You established them.

translations.hebrew: צָפ֣וֹן וְ֭יָמִין אַתָּ֣ה בְרָאתָ֑ם תָּב֥וֹר וְ֝חֶרְמ֗וֹן בְּשִׁמְךָ֥ יְרַנֵּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
North and south—
You created them;
Tabor and Hermon sing forth Your name.

translations.hebrew: לְךָ֣ זְ֭רוֹעַ עִם־גְּבוּרָ֑ה תָּעֹ֥ז יָ֝דְךָ֗ תָּר֥וּם יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Yours is an arm endowed with might;
Your hand is strong;
Your right hand, exalted.

translations.hebrew: צֶ֣דֶק וּ֭מִשְׁפָּט מְכ֣וֹן כִּסְאֶ֑ךָ חֶ֥סֶד וֶ֝אֱמֶ֗ת יְֽקַדְּמ֥וּ פָנֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Righteousness and justice are the base of Your throne;
steadfast love and faithfulness stand before You.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י הָ֭עָם יֹדְעֵ֣י תְרוּעָ֑ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בְּֽאוֹר־פָּנֶ֥יךָ יְהַלֵּכֽוּן׃
translations.english:
Happy is the people who know the joyful shout;
O LORD, they walk in the light of Your presence.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭שִׁמְךָ יְגִיל֣וּן כׇּל־הַיּ֑וֹם וּבְצִדְקָתְךָ֥ יָרֽוּמוּ׃
translations.english:
They rejoice in Your name all day long;
they are exalted through Your righteousness.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־תִפְאֶ֣רֶת עֻזָּ֣מוֹ אָ֑תָּה וּ֝בִרְצוֹנְךָ֗ (תרים) [תָּר֥וּם] קַרְנֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
For You are their strength in which they glory;
our horn is exalted through Your favor.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י לַ֭יהֹוָה מָגִנֵּ֑נוּ וְלִקְד֖וֹשׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל מַלְכֵּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Truly our shield is of the LORD,
our king, of the Holy One of Israel.

translations.hebrew: אָ֤ז דִּבַּ֥רְתָּֽ־בְחָז֡וֹן לַחֲסִידֶ֗יךָ וַתֹּ֗אמֶר שִׁוִּ֣יתִי עֵ֭זֶר עַל־גִּבּ֑וֹר הֲרִימ֖וֹתִי בָח֣וּר מֵעָֽם׃
translations.english:
ThenaReferring to vv. 4–5; cf. 2 Sam. 7.1–17. You spoke to Your faithful ones in a vision
and said, “I have conferred power upon a warrior;
I have exalted one chosen out of the people.

translations.hebrew: מָ֭צָאתִי דָּוִ֣ד עַבְדִּ֑י בְּשֶׁ֖מֶן קׇדְשִׁ֣י מְשַׁחְתִּֽיו׃
translations.english:
I have found David, My servant;
anointed him with My sacred oil.

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָ֭דִי תִּכּ֣וֹן עִמּ֑וֹ אַף־זְרוֹעִ֥י תְאַמְּצֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
My hand shall be constantly with him,
and My arm shall strengthen him.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־יַשִּׁ֣יא אוֹיֵ֣ב בּ֑וֹ וּבֶן־עַ֝וְלָ֗ה לֹ֣א יְעַנֶּֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
No enemy shall bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.oppress him,-b
no vile man afflict him.

translations.hebrew: וְכַתּוֹתִ֣י מִפָּנָ֣יו צָרָ֑יו וּמְשַׂנְאָ֥יו אֶגּֽוֹף׃
translations.english:
I will crush his adversaries before him;
I will strike down those who hate him.

translations.hebrew: וֶ֥אֱֽמוּנָתִ֣י וְחַסְדִּ֣י עִמּ֑וֹ וּ֝בִשְׁמִ֗י תָּר֥וּם קַרְנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
My faithfulness and steadfast love shall be with him;
his horn shall be exalted through My name.

translations.hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י בַיָּ֣ם יָד֑וֹ וּֽבַנְּהָר֥וֹת יְמִינֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
I will set his hand upon the sea,
his right hand upon the rivers.

translations.hebrew: ה֣וּא יִ֭קְרָאֵנִי אָ֣בִי אָ֑תָּה אֵ֝לִ֗י וְצ֣וּר יְשׁוּעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
He shall say to Me,
‘You are my father, my God, the rock of my deliverance.’

translations.hebrew: אַף־אָ֭נִי בְּכ֣וֹר אֶתְּנֵ֑הוּ עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן לְמַלְכֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
I will appoint him first-born,
highest of the kings of the earth.

translations.hebrew: לְ֭עוֹלָם (אשמור) [אֶשְׁמׇר־]ל֣וֹ חַסְדִּ֑י וּ֝בְרִיתִ֗י נֶאֱמֶ֥נֶת לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
I will maintain My steadfast love for him always;
My covenant with him shall endure.

translations.hebrew: וְשַׂמְתִּ֣י לָעַ֣ד זַרְע֑וֹ וְ֝כִסְא֗וֹ כִּימֵ֥י שָׁמָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
I will establish his line forever,
his throne, as long as the heavens last.

translations.hebrew: אִם־יַעַזְב֣וּ בָ֭נָיו תּוֹרָתִ֑י וּ֝בְמִשְׁפָּטַ֗י לֹ֣א יֵלֵכֽוּן׃
translations.english:
If his sons forsake My Teaching
and do not live by My rules;

translations.hebrew: אִם־חֻקֹּתַ֥י יְחַלֵּ֑לוּ וּ֝מִצְוֺתַ֗י לֹ֣א יִשְׁמֹֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
if they violate My laws,
and do not observe My commands,

translations.hebrew: וּפָקַדְתִּ֣י בְשֵׁ֣בֶט פִּשְׁעָ֑ם וּבִנְגָעִ֥ים עֲוֺנָֽם׃
translations.english:
I will punish their transgression with the rod,
their iniquity with plagues.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭חַסְדִּי לֹא־אָפִ֣יר מֵעִמּ֑וֹ וְלֹֽא־אֲ֝שַׁקֵּ֗ר בֶּאֱמוּנָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
But I will not take away My steadfast love from him;
I will not betray My faithfulness.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־אֲחַלֵּ֥ל בְּרִיתִ֑י וּמוֹצָ֥א שְׂ֝פָתַ֗י לֹ֣א אֲשַׁנֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
I will not violate My covenant,
or change what I have uttered.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭חַת נִשְׁבַּ֣עְתִּי בְקׇדְשִׁ֑י אִֽם־לְדָוִ֥ד אֲכַזֵּֽב׃
translations.english:
I have sworn by My holiness, once and for all;
I will not be false to David.

translations.hebrew: זַ֭רְעוֹ לְעוֹלָ֣ם יִהְיֶ֑ה וְכִסְא֖וֹ כַשֶּׁ֣מֶשׁ נֶגְדִּֽי׃
translations.english:
His line shall continue forever,
his throne, as the sun before Me,

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭יָרֵחַ יִכּ֣וֹן עוֹלָ֑ם וְעֵ֥ד בַּ֝שַּׁ֗חַק נֶאֱמָ֥ן סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
as the moon, established forever,
an enduring witness in the sky.” Selah.

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה זָ֭נַחְתָּ וַתִּמְאָ֑ס הִ֝תְעַבַּ֗רְתָּ עִם־מְשִׁיחֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Yet You have rejected, spurned,
and become enraged at Your anointed.

translations.hebrew: נֵ֭אַרְתָּה בְּרִ֣ית עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ חִלַּ֖לְתָּ לָאָ֣רֶץ נִזְרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
You have repudiated the covenant with Your servant;
You have dragged his dignity in the dust.

translations.hebrew: פָּרַ֥צְתָּ כׇל־גְּדֵרֹתָ֑יו שַׂ֖מְתָּ מִבְצָרָ֣יו מְחִתָּֽה׃
translations.english:
You have breached all his defenses,
shattered his strongholds.

translations.hebrew: שַׁ֭סֻּהוּ כׇּל־עֹ֣בְרֵי דָ֑רֶךְ הָיָ֥ה חֶ֝רְפָּ֗ה לִשְׁכֵנָֽיו׃
translations.english:
All who pass by plunder him;
he has become the butt of his neighbors.

translations.hebrew: הֲ֭רִימוֹתָ יְמִ֣ין צָרָ֑יו הִ֝שְׂמַ֗חְתָּ כׇּל־אוֹיְבָֽיו׃
translations.english:
You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries,
and made all his enemies rejoice.

translations.hebrew: אַף־תָּ֭שִׁיב צ֣וּר חַרְבּ֑וֹ וְלֹ֥א הֲ֝קֵימֹת֗וֹ בַּמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
translations.english:
You have turned back the blade of his sword,
and have not sustained him in battle.

translations.hebrew: הִשְׁבַּ֥תָּ מִטְּהָר֑וֹ וְ֝כִסְא֗וֹ לָאָ֥רֶץ מִגַּֽרְתָּה׃
translations.english:
You have brought bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.his splendor-b to an end
and have hurled his throne to the ground.

translations.hebrew: הִ֭קְצַרְתָּ יְמֵ֣י עֲלוּמָ֑יו הֶ֥עֱטִ֨יתָ עָלָ֖יו בּוּשָׁ֣ה סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
You have cut short the days of his youth;
You have covered him with shame. Selah.

translations.hebrew: עַד־מָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה תִּסָּתֵ֣ר לָנֶ֑צַח תִּבְעַ֖ר כְּמוֹ־אֵ֣שׁ חֲמָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
How long, O LORD; will You forever hide Your face,
will Your fury blaze like fire?

translations.hebrew: זְכׇר־אֲנִ֥י מֶה־חָ֑לֶד עַל־מַה־שָּׁ֝֗וְא בָּרָ֥אתָ כׇל־בְּנֵֽי־אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
O remember bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.how short my life is;-b
why should You have created every man in vain?

translations.hebrew: מִ֤י גֶ֣בֶר יִֽ֭חְיֶה וְלֹ֣א יִרְאֶה־מָּ֑וֶת יְמַלֵּ֨ט נַפְשׁ֖וֹ מִיַּד־שְׁא֣וֹל סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
What man can live and not see death,
can save himself from the clutches of Sheol? Selah.

translations.hebrew: אַיֵּ֤ה ׀ חֲסָדֶ֖יךָ הָרִאשֹׁנִ֥ים ׀ אֲדֹנָ֑י נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתָּ לְ֝דָוִ֗ד בֶּאֱמוּנָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
O Lord, where is Your steadfast love of old
which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?

translations.hebrew: זְכֹ֣ר אֲ֭דֹנָי חֶרְפַּ֣ת עֲבָדֶ֑יךָ שְׂאֵתִ֥י בְ֝חֵיקִ֗י כׇּל־רַבִּ֥ים עַמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
Remember, O Lord, the abuse flung at Your servants
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.that I have borne in my bosom [from] many peoples,-b

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר חֵרְפ֖וּ אוֹיְבֶ֥יךָ <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר חֵ֝רְפ֗וּ עִקְּב֥וֹת מְשִׁיחֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
how Your enemies, O LORD, have flung abuse,
abuse at Your anointed at every step.

translations.hebrew: בָּר֖וּךְ יְהֹוָ֥ה לְעוֹלָ֗ם אָ֘מֵ֥ן <small>׀</small> וְאָמֵֽן׃
translations.english:
Blessed is the LORD forever;
Amen and Amen.

translations.hebrew: תְּפִלָּה֮ לְמֹשֶׁ֢ה אִֽישׁ־הָאֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים אֲֽדֹנָ֗י מָע֣וֹן אַ֭תָּה הָיִ֥יתָ לָּ֗נוּ בְּדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃
translations.english:
A prayer of Moses, the man of God.

O Lord, You have been our refuge in every generation.

translations.hebrew: בְּטֶ֤רֶם ׀ הָ֘רִ֤ים יֻלָּ֗דוּ וַתְּח֣וֹלֵֽל אֶ֣רֶץ וְתֵבֵ֑ל וּֽמֵעוֹלָ֥ם עַד־ע֝וֹלָ֗ם אַתָּ֥ה אֵֽל׃
translations.english:
Before the mountains came into being,
before You brought forth the earth and the world,
from eternity to eternity You are God.

translations.hebrew: תָּשֵׁ֣ב אֱ֭נוֹשׁ עַד־דַּכָּ֑א וַ֝תֹּ֗אמֶר שׁ֣וּבוּ בְנֵֽי־אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
You return man to dust;aOr “contrition.”
You decreed, “Return you mortals!”

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֶ֪לֶף שָׁנִ֡ים בְּֽעֵינֶ֗יךָ כְּי֣וֹם אֶ֭תְמוֹל כִּ֣י יַעֲבֹ֑ר וְאַשְׁמוּרָ֥ה בַלָּֽיְלָה׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.For in Your sight a thousand years
are like yesterday that has passed,
like a watch of the night.

translations.hebrew: זְ֭רַמְתָּם שֵׁנָ֣ה יִהְי֑וּ בַּ֝בֹּ֗קֶר כֶּחָצִ֥יר יַחֲלֹֽף׃
translations.english:
You engulf men in sleep;-b
at daybreak they are like grass that renews itself;

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭בֹּקֶר יָצִ֣יץ וְחָלָ֑ף לָ֝עֶ֗רֶב יְמוֹלֵ֥ל וְיָבֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
at daybreak it flourishes anew;
by dusk it withers and dries up.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־כָלִ֥ינוּ בְאַפֶּ֑ךָ וּֽבַחֲמָתְךָ֥ נִבְהָֽלְנוּ׃
translations.english:
So we are consumed by Your anger,
terror-struck by Your fury.

translations.hebrew: שַׁתָּ֣ עֲוֺנֹתֵ֣ינוּ לְנֶגְדֶּ֑ךָ עֲ֝לֻמֵ֗נוּ לִמְא֥וֹר פָּנֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
You have set our iniquities before You,
our hidden sins in the light of Your face.
