translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י כׇל־יָ֭מֵינוּ פָּנ֣וּ בְעֶבְרָתֶ֑ךָ כִּלִּ֖ינוּ שָׁנֵ֣ינוּ כְמוֹ־הֶֽגֶה׃
translations.english:
All our days pass away in Your wrath;
we spend our years like a sigh.

translations.hebrew: יְמֵֽי־שְׁנוֹתֵ֨ינוּ בָהֶ֥ם שִׁבְעִ֪ים שָׁנָ֡ה וְאִ֤ם בִּגְבוּרֹ֨ת ׀ שְׁמ֘וֹנִ֤ים שָׁנָ֗ה וְ֭רׇהְבָּם עָמָ֣ל וָאָ֑וֶן כִּי־גָ֥ז חִ֝֗ישׁ וַנָּעֻֽפָה׃
translations.english:
The span of our life is seventy years,
or, given the strength, eighty years;
but the bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.best of them-b are trouble and sorrow.
They pass by speedily, and we cOr “fly away.”are in darkness.-c

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־י֭וֹדֵעַ עֹ֣ז אַפֶּ֑ךָ וּ֝כְיִרְאָתְךָ֗ עֶבְרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Who can know Your furious anger?
Your wrath matches the fear of You.

translations.hebrew: לִמְנ֣וֹת יָ֭מֵינוּ כֵּ֣ן הוֹדַ֑ע וְ֝נָבִ֗א לְבַ֣ב חׇכְמָֽה׃
translations.english:
Teach us to count our days rightly,
that we may obtain a wise heart.

translations.hebrew: שׁוּבָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה עַד־מָתָ֑י וְ֝הִנָּחֵ֗ם עַל־עֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Turn, O LORD!
How long?
Show mercy to Your servants.

translations.hebrew: שַׂבְּעֵ֣נוּ בַבֹּ֣קֶר חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וּֽנְרַנְּנָ֥ה וְ֝נִשְׂמְחָ֗ה בְּכׇל־יָמֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
Satisfy us at daybreak with Your steadfast love
that we may sing for joy all our days.

translations.hebrew: שַׂ֭מְּחֵנוּ כִּימ֣וֹת עִנִּיתָ֑נוּ שְׁ֝נ֗וֹת רָאִ֥ינוּ רָעָֽה׃
translations.english:
Give us joy for as long as You have afflicted us,
for the years we have suffered misfortune.

translations.hebrew: יֵרָאֶ֣ה אֶל־עֲבָדֶ֣יךָ פׇעֳלֶ֑ךָ וַ֝הֲדָרְךָ֗ עַל־בְּנֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Let Your deeds be seen by Your servants,
Your glory by their children.

translations.hebrew: וִיהִ֤י ׀ נֹ֤עַם אֲדֹנָ֥י אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ עָ֫לֵ֥ינוּ וּמַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יָ֭דֵינוּ כּוֹנְנָ֥ה עָלֵ֑ינוּ וּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָ֝דֵ֗ינוּ כּוֹנְנֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
May the favor of the Lord, our God, be upon us;
let the work of our hands prosper,
O prosper the work of our hands!

translations.hebrew: יֹ֭שֵׁב בְּסֵ֣תֶר עֶלְי֑וֹן בְּצֵ֥ל שַׁ֝דַּ֗י יִתְלוֹנָֽן׃
translations.english:
O you who dwell in the shelter of the Most High
and abide in the protection of Shaddai—

translations.hebrew: אֹמַ֗ר לַ֭יהֹוָה מַחְסִ֣י וּמְצוּדָתִ֑י אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י אֶבְטַח־בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
I say of the LORD, my refuge and stronghold,
my God in whom I trust,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ה֣וּא יַ֭צִּילְךָ מִפַּ֥ח יָק֗וּשׁ מִדֶּ֥בֶר הַוּֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
that He will save you from the fowler’s trap,
from the destructive plague.

translations.hebrew: בְּאֶבְרָת֨וֹ ׀ יָ֣סֶךְ לָ֭ךְ וְתַחַת־כְּנָפָ֣יו תֶּחְסֶ֑ה צִנָּ֖ה וְסֹחֵרָ֣ה אֲמִתּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He will cover you with His pinions;
you will find refuge under His wings;
His fidelity is an encircling shield.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־תִ֭ירָא מִפַּ֣חַד לָ֑יְלָה מֵ֝חֵ֗ץ יָע֥וּף יוֹמָֽם׃
translations.english:
You need not fear the terror by night,
or the arrow that flies by day,

translations.hebrew: מִ֭דֶּבֶר בָּאֹ֣פֶל יַהֲלֹ֑ךְ מִ֝קֶּ֗טֶב יָשׁ֥וּד צׇהֳרָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
the plague that stalks in the darkness,
or the scourge that ravages at noon.

translations.hebrew: יִפֹּ֤ל מִצִּדְּךָ֨ ׀ אֶ֗לֶף וּרְבָבָ֥ה מִימִינֶ֑ךָ אֵ֝לֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א יִגָּֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
A thousand may fall at your left side,
ten thousand at your right,
but it shall not reach you.

translations.hebrew: רַ֭ק בְּעֵינֶ֣יךָ תַבִּ֑יט וְשִׁלֻּמַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תִּרְאֶֽה׃
translations.english:
You will see it with your eyes,
you will witness the punishment of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה מַחְסִ֑י עֶ֝לְי֗וֹן שַׂ֣מְתָּ מְעוֹנֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Because you took the LORD—my refuge,
the Most High—as your haven,

translations.hebrew: לֹא־תְאֻנֶּ֣ה אֵלֶ֣יךָ רָעָ֑ה וְ֝נֶ֗גַע לֹא־יִקְרַ֥ב בְּאׇהֳלֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
no harm will befall you,
no disease touch your tent.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֣י מַ֭לְאָכָיו יְצַוֶּה־לָּ֑ךְ לִ֝שְׁמׇרְךָ֗ בְּכׇל־דְּרָכֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
For He will order His angels
to guard you wherever you go.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כַּפַּ֥יִם יִשָּׂא֑וּנְךָ פֶּן־תִּגֹּ֖ף בָּאֶ֣בֶן רַגְלֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
They will carry you in their hands
lest you hurt your foot on a stone.

translations.hebrew: עַל־שַׁ֣חַל וָפֶ֣תֶן תִּדְרֹ֑ךְ תִּרְמֹ֖ס כְּפִ֣יר וְתַנִּֽין׃
translations.english:
You will tread on cubs and vipers;
you will trample lions and asps.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י בִ֣י חָ֭שַׁק וַאֲפַלְּטֵ֑הוּ אֲ֝שַׂגְּבֵ֗הוּ כִּֽי־יָדַ֥ע שְׁמִֽי׃
translations.english:
“Because he is devoted to Me I will deliver him;
I will keep him safe, for he knows My name.

translations.hebrew: יִקְרָאֵ֨נִי ׀ וְֽאֶעֱנֵ֗הוּ עִמּֽוֹ־אָנֹכִ֥י בְצָרָ֑ה אֲ֝חַלְּצֵ֗הוּ וַאֲכַבְּדֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
When he calls on Me, I will answer him;
I will be with him in distress;
I will rescue him and make him honored;

translations.hebrew: אֹ֣רֶךְ יָ֭מִים אַשְׂבִּיעֵ֑הוּ וְ֝אַרְאֵ֗הוּ בִּישׁוּעָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
I will let him live to a ripe old age,
and show him My salvation.”

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֥וֹר שִׁ֗יר לְי֣וֹם הַשַּׁבָּֽת׃
translations.english: A psalm. A song; for the sabbath day.

translations.hebrew: ט֗וֹב לְהֹד֥וֹת לַיהֹוָ֑ה וּלְזַמֵּ֖ר לְשִׁמְךָ֣ עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
It is good to praise the LORD,
to sing hymns to Your name, O Most High,

translations.hebrew: לְהַגִּ֣יד בַּבֹּ֣קֶר חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וֶ֝אֱמ֥וּנָתְךָ֗ בַּלֵּילֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
To proclaim Your steadfast love at daybreak,
Your faithfulness each night

translations.hebrew: עֲֽלֵי־עָ֭שׂוֹר וַעֲלֵי־נָ֑בֶל עֲלֵ֖י הִגָּי֣וֹן בְּכִנּֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
With a ten-stringed harp,
with voice and lyre together.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י שִׂמַּחְתַּ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּפׇעֳלֶ֑ךָ בְּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֖י יָדֶ֣יךָ אֲרַנֵּֽן׃
translations.english:
You have gladdened me by Your deeds, O LORD;
I shout for joy at Your handiwork.

translations.hebrew: מַה־גָּדְל֣וּ מַעֲשֶׂ֣יךָ יְהֹוָ֑ה מְ֝אֹ֗ד עָמְק֥וּ מַחְשְׁבֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
How great are Your works, O LORD,
how very subtleaOr “profound.” Your designs!

translations.hebrew: אִֽישׁ־בַּ֭עַר לֹ֣א יֵדָ֑ע וּ֝כְסִ֗יל לֹא־יָבִ֥ין אֶת־זֹֽאת׃
translations.english:
A brutish man cannot know,
a fool cannot understand this:

translations.hebrew: בִּפְרֹ֤חַ רְשָׁעִ֨ים ׀ כְּמ֥וֹ־עֵ֗שֶׂב וַ֭יָּצִיצוּ כׇּל־פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָ֑וֶן לְהִשָּׁמְדָ֥ם עֲדֵי־עַֽד׃
translations.english:
though the wicked sprout like grass,
though all evildoers blossom,
it is only that they may be destroyed forever.

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֥ה מָר֗וֹם לְעֹלָ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english: But You are exalted, O LORD, for all time.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י הִנֵּ֪ה אֹיְבֶ֡יךָ יְֽהֹוָ֗ה כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֣ה אֹיְבֶ֣יךָ יֹאבֵ֑דוּ יִ֝תְפָּרְד֗וּ כׇּל־פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Surely, Your enemies, O LORD,
surely, Your enemies perish;
all evildoers are scattered.

translations.hebrew: וַתָּ֣רֶם כִּרְאֵ֣ים קַרְנִ֑י בַּ֝לֹּתִ֗י בְּשֶׁ֣מֶן רַעֲנָֽן׃
translations.english:
You raise my horn high like that of a wild ox;
I am soaked in freshening oil.

translations.hebrew: וַתַּבֵּ֥ט עֵינִ֗י בְּשׁ֫וּרָ֥י בַּקָּמִ֖ים עָלַ֥י מְרֵעִ֗ים תִּשְׁמַ֥עְנָה אׇזְנָֽי׃
translations.english:
I shall see the defeat of my watchful foes,
hear of the downfall of the wicked who beset me.

translations.hebrew: צַ֭דִּיק כַּתָּמָ֣ר יִפְרָ֑ח כְּאֶ֖רֶז בַּלְּבָנ֣וֹן יִשְׂגֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
The righteous bloom like a date-palm;
they thrive like a cedar in Lebanon;

translations.hebrew: שְׁ֭תוּלִים בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּחַצְר֖וֹת אֱלֹהֵ֣ינוּ יַפְרִֽיחוּ׃
translations.english:
planted in the house of the LORD,
they flourish in the courts of our God.

translations.hebrew: ע֭וֹד יְנוּב֣וּן בְּשֵׂיבָ֑ה דְּשֵׁנִ֖ים וְֽרַעֲנַנִּ֣ים יִהְיֽוּ׃
translations.english:
In old age they still produce fruit;
they are full of sap and freshness,

translations.hebrew: לְ֭הַגִּיד כִּֽי־יָשָׁ֣ר יְהֹוָ֑ה צ֝וּרִ֗י וְֽלֹא־[עַוְלָ֥תָה] (עלתה) בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
attesting that the LORD is upright,
my rock, in whom there is no wrong.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה מָלָךְ֮ גֵּא֢וּת לָ֫בֵ֥שׁ לָבֵ֣שׁ יְ֭הֹוָה עֹ֣ז הִתְאַזָּ֑ר אַף־תִּכּ֥וֹן תֵּ֝בֵ֗ל בַּל־תִּמּֽוֹט׃
translations.english:
The LORD is king,
He is robed in grandeur;
the LORD is robed,
He is girded with strength.
The world stands firm;
it cannot be shaken.

translations.hebrew: נָכ֣וֹן כִּסְאֲךָ֣ מֵאָ֑ז מֵעוֹלָ֣ם אָֽתָּה׃
translations.english:
Your throne stands firm from of old;
from eternity You have existed.

translations.hebrew: נָשְׂא֤וּ נְהָר֨וֹת ׀ יְֽהֹוָ֗ה נָשְׂא֣וּ נְהָר֣וֹת קוֹלָ֑ם יִשְׂא֖וּ נְהָר֣וֹת דׇּכְיָֽם׃
translations.english:
The ocean sounds, O LORD,
the ocean sounds its thunder,
the ocean sounds its pounding.

translations.hebrew: מִקֹּל֨וֹת ׀ מַ֤יִם רַבִּ֗ים אַדִּירִ֣ים מִשְׁבְּרֵי־יָ֑ם אַדִּ֖יר בַּמָּר֣וֹם יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Above the thunder of the mighty waters,
more majestic than the breakers of the sea
is the LORD, majestic on high.

translations.hebrew: עֵֽדֹתֶ֨יךָ ׀ נֶאֶמְנ֬וּ מְאֹ֗ד לְבֵיתְךָ֥ נַאֲוָה־קֹ֑דֶשׁ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לְאֹ֣רֶךְ יָמִֽים׃
translations.english:
Your decrees are indeed enduring;
holiness befits Your house,
O LORD, for all times.

translations.hebrew: אֵל־נְקָמ֥וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה אֵ֖ל נְקָמ֣וֹת הוֹפִֽיעַ׃
translations.english:
God of retribution, LORD,
God of retribution, appear!

translations.hebrew: הִ֭נָּשֵׂא שֹׁפֵ֣ט הָאָ֑רֶץ הָשֵׁ֥ב גְּ֝מ֗וּל עַל־גֵּאִֽים׃
translations.english:
Rise up, judge of the earth,
give the arrogant their deserts!

translations.hebrew: עַד־מָתַ֖י רְשָׁעִ֥ים <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה עַד־מָ֝תַ֗י רְשָׁעִ֥ים יַעֲלֹֽזוּ׃
translations.english:
How long shall the wicked, O LORD,
how long shall the wicked exult,

translations.hebrew: יַבִּ֣יעוּ יְדַבְּר֣וּ עָתָ֑ק יִ֝תְאַמְּר֗וּ כׇּל־פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
shall they utter insolent speech,
shall all evildoers vaunt themselves?

translations.hebrew: עַמְּךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֣ה יְדַכְּא֑וּ וְֽנַחֲלָתְךָ֥ יְעַנּֽוּ׃
translations.english:
They crush Your people, O LORD,
they afflict Your very own;

translations.hebrew: אַלְמָנָ֣ה וְגֵ֣ר יַהֲרֹ֑גוּ וִ֖יתוֹמִ֣ים יְרַצֵּֽחוּ׃
translations.english:
they kill the widow and the stranger;
they murder the fatherless,

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יֹּ֣אמְרוּ לֹ֣א יִרְאֶה־יָּ֑הּ וְלֹא־יָ֝בִ֗ין אֱלֹהֵ֥י יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
thinking, “The LORD does not see it,
the God of Jacob does not pay heed.”

translations.hebrew: בִּ֭ינוּ בֹּעֲרִ֣ים בָּעָ֑ם וּ֝כְסִילִ֗ים מָתַ֥י תַּשְׂכִּֽילוּ׃
translations.english:
Take heed, you most brutish people;
fools, when will you get wisdom?

translations.hebrew: הֲנֹ֣טַֽע אֹ֭זֶן הֲלֹ֣א יִשְׁמָ֑ע אִֽם־יֹ֥צֵֽר עַ֝֗יִן הֲלֹ֣א יַבִּֽיט׃
translations.english:
Shall He who implants the ear not hear,
He who forms the eye not see?

translations.hebrew: הֲיֹסֵ֣ר גּ֭וֹיִם הֲלֹ֣א יוֹכִ֑יחַ הַֽמְלַמֵּ֖ד אָדָ֣ם דָּֽעַת׃
translations.english:
Shall He who disciplines nations not punish,
He who instructs men in knowledge?

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה יֹ֭דֵעַ מַחְשְׁב֣וֹת אָדָ֑ם כִּי־הֵ֥מָּה הָֽבֶל׃
translations.english: The LORD knows the designs of men to be futile.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֤י ׀ הַגֶּ֣בֶר אֲשֶׁר־תְּיַסְּרֶ֣נּוּ יָּ֑הּ וּֽמִתּוֹרָתְךָ֥ תְלַמְּדֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
Happy is the man whom You discipline, O LORD,
the man You instruct in Your teaching,

translations.hebrew: לְהַשְׁקִ֣יט ל֭וֹ מִ֣ימֵי רָ֑ע עַ֤ד יִכָּרֶ֖ה לָרָשָׁ֣ע שָֽׁחַת׃
translations.english:
to give him tranquillity in times of misfortune,
until a pit be dug for the wicked.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ לֹא־יִטֹּ֣שׁ יְהֹוָ֣ה עַמּ֑וֹ וְ֝נַחֲלָת֗וֹ לֹ֣א יַעֲזֹֽב׃
translations.english:
For the LORD will not forsake His people;
He will not abandon His very own.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־עַד־צֶ֭דֶק יָשׁ֣וּב מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וְ֝אַחֲרָ֗יו כׇּל־יִשְׁרֵי־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
Judgment shall again accord with justice
and all the upright shall rally to it.

translations.hebrew: מִֽי־יָק֣וּם לִ֭י עִם־מְרֵעִ֑ים מִי־יִתְיַצֵּ֥ב לִ֝֗י עִם־פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Who will take my part against evil men?
Who will stand up for me against wrongdoers?

translations.hebrew: לוּלֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה עֶזְרָ֣תָה לִּ֑י כִּמְעַ֓ט ׀ שָׁכְנָ֖ה דוּמָ֣ה נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
Were not the LORD my help,
I should soon dwell in silence.

translations.hebrew: אִם־אָ֭מַרְתִּי מָ֣טָה רַגְלִ֑י חַסְדְּךָ֥ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יִסְעָדֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
When I think my foot has given way,
Your faithfulness, O LORD, supports me.

translations.hebrew: בְּרֹ֣ב שַׂרְעַפַּ֣י בְּקִרְבִּ֑י תַּ֝נְחוּמֶ֗יךָ יְֽשַׁעַשְׁע֥וּ נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
When I am filled with cares,
Your assurance soothes my soul.

translations.hebrew: הַֽ֭יְחׇבְרְךָ כִּסֵּ֣א הַוּ֑וֹת יֹצֵ֖ר עָמָ֣ל עֲלֵי־חֹֽק׃
translations.english:
Shall the seat of injustice be Your partner,
that frames mischief by statute?

translations.hebrew: יָ֭גוֹדּוּ עַל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ צַדִּ֑יק וְדָ֖ם נָקִ֣י יַרְשִֽׁיעוּ׃
translations.english:
They band together to do away with the righteous;
they condemn the innocent to death.

translations.hebrew: וַיְהִ֬י יְהֹוָ֣ה לִ֣י לְמִשְׂגָּ֑ב וֵ֝אלֹהַ֗י לְצ֣וּר מַחְסִֽי׃
translations.english:
But the LORD is my haven;
my God is my sheltering rock.

translations.hebrew: וַיָּ֤שֶׁב עֲלֵיהֶ֨ם ׀ אֶת־אוֹנָ֗ם וּבְרָעָתָ֥ם יַצְמִיתֵ֑ם יַ֝צְמִיתֵ֗ם יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
He will make their evil recoil upon them,
annihilate them through their own wickedness;
the LORD our God will annihilate them.

translations.hebrew: לְ֭כוּ נְרַנְּנָ֣ה לַיהֹוָ֑ה נָ֝רִ֗יעָה לְצ֣וּר יִשְׁעֵֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Come, let us sing joyously to the LORD,
raise a shout for our rock and deliverer;

translations.hebrew: נְקַדְּמָ֣ה פָנָ֣יו בְּתוֹדָ֑ה בִּ֝זְמִר֗וֹת נָרִ֥יעַֽ לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
let us come into His presence with praise;
let us raise a shout for Him in song!

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֣ל גָּד֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֑ה וּמֶ֥לֶךְ גָּ֝ד֗וֹל עַל־כׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
For the LORD is a great God,
the great king of all divine beings.

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּ֭יָדוֹ מֶחְקְרֵי־אָ֑רֶץ וְתוֹעֲפֹ֖ת הָרִ֣ים לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
In His hand are the depths of the earth;
the peaks of the mountains are His.

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־ל֣וֹ הַ֭יָּם וְה֣וּא עָשָׂ֑הוּ וְ֝יַבֶּ֗שֶׁת יָדָ֥יו יָצָֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
His is the sea, He made it;
and the land, which His hands fashioned.

translations.hebrew: בֹּ֭אוּ נִשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֣ה וְנִכְרָ֑עָה נִ֝בְרְכָ֗ה לִֽפְנֵי־יְהֹוָ֥ה עֹשֵֽׂנוּ׃
translations.english:
Come, let us bow down and kneel,
bend the knee before the LORD our maker,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֘י־ה֤וּא אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וַאֲנַ֤חְנוּ עַ֣ם מַ֭רְעִיתוֹ וְצֹ֣אן יָד֑וֹ הַ֝יּ֗וֹם אִֽם־בְּקֹל֥וֹ תִשְׁמָֽעוּ׃
translations.english:
for He is our God,
and we are the people He tends, the flock in His care.
O, if you would but heed His charge this day:

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּקְשׁ֣וּ לְ֭בַבְכֶם כִּמְרִיבָ֑ה כְּי֥וֹם מַ֝סָּ֗ה בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
translations.english:
Do not be stubborn as at Meribah,
as on the day of Massah, in the wilderness,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִ֭סּוּנִי אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶ֑ם בְּ֝חָנ֗וּנִי גַּם־רָא֥וּ פׇעֳלִֽי׃
translations.english:
when your fathers put Me to the test,
tried Me, though they had seen My deeds.

translations.hebrew: אַרְבָּ֘עִ֤ים שָׁנָ֨ה ׀ אָ֘ק֤וּט בְּד֗וֹר וָאֹמַ֗ר עַ֤ם תֹּעֵ֣י לֵבָ֣ב הֵ֑ם וְ֝הֵ֗ם לֹא־יָדְע֥וּ דְרָכָֽי׃
translations.english:
Forty years I was provoked by that generation;
I thought, “They are a senseless people;
they would not know My ways.”

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתִּי בְאַפִּ֑י אִם־יְ֝בֹא֗וּן אֶל־מְנוּחָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Concerning them I swore in anger,
“They shall never come to My resting-place!”

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֣ירוּ לַ֭יהֹוָה שִׁ֣יר חָדָ֑שׁ שִׁ֥ירוּ לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
aCf. 1 Chron. 16.23–33.Sing to the LORD a new song,
sing to the LORD, all the earth.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֣ירוּ לַ֭יהֹוָה בָּרְכ֣וּ שְׁמ֑וֹ בַּשְּׂר֥וּ מִיּֽוֹם־לְ֝י֗וֹם יְשׁוּעָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Sing to the LORD, bless His name,
proclaim His victory day after day.

translations.hebrew: סַפְּר֣וּ בַגּוֹיִ֣ם כְּבוֹד֑וֹ בְּכׇל־הָ֝עַמִּ֗ים נִפְלְאוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Tell of His glory among the nations,
His wondrous deeds, among all peoples.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֥י־גָ֘ד֤וֹל יְהֹוָ֣ה וּמְהֻלָּ֣ל מְאֹ֑ד נוֹרָ֥א ה֝֗וּא עַל־כׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
For the LORD is great and much acclaimed,
He is held in awe by all divine beings.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ׀ כׇּל־אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָעַמִּ֣ים אֱלִילִ֑ים וַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה שָׁמַ֥יִם עָשָֽׂה׃
translations.english:
All the gods of the peoples are mere idols,
but the LORD made the heavens.

translations.hebrew: הוֹד־וְהָדָ֥ר לְפָנָ֑יו עֹ֥ז וְ֝תִפְאֶ֗רֶת בְּמִקְדָּשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
Glory and majesty are before Him;
strength and splendor are in His temple.

translations.hebrew: הָב֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה מִשְׁפְּח֣וֹת עַמִּ֑ים הָב֥וּ לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה כָּב֥וֹד וָעֹֽז׃
translations.english:
Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the peoples,
ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

translations.hebrew: הָב֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה כְּב֣וֹד שְׁמ֑וֹ שְׂאֽוּ־מִ֝נְחָ֗ה וּבֹ֥אוּ לְחַצְרוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Ascribe to the LORD the glory of His name,
bring tribute and enter His courts.

translations.hebrew: הִשְׁתַּחֲו֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה בְּהַדְרַת־קֹ֑דֶשׁ חִ֥ילוּ מִ֝פָּנָ֗יו כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Bow down to the LORD majestic in holiness;
tremble in His presence, all the earth!

translations.hebrew: אִמְר֤וּ בַגּוֹיִ֨ם ׀ יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה מָלָ֗ךְ אַף־תִּכּ֣וֹן תֵּ֭בֵל בַּל־תִּמּ֑וֹט יָדִ֥ין עַ֝מִּ֗ים בְּמֵישָׁרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Declare among the nations, “The LORD is king!”
the world stands firm; it cannot be shaken;
He judges the peoples with equity.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׂמְח֣וּ הַ֭שָּׁמַיִם וְתָגֵ֣ל הָאָ֑רֶץ יִֽרְעַ֥ם הַ֝יָּ֗ם וּמְלֹאֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Let the heavens rejoice and the earth exult;
let the sea and all within it thunder,

translations.hebrew: יַעֲלֹ֣ז שָׂ֭דַי וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־בּ֑וֹ אָ֥ז יְ֝רַנְּנ֗וּ כׇּל־עֲצֵי־יָֽעַר׃
translations.english:
the fields and everything in them exult;
then shall all the trees of the forest shout for joy

translations.hebrew: לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ כִּ֬י בָ֗א כִּ֥י בָא֮ לִשְׁפֹּ֢ט הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ יִשְׁפֹּֽט־תֵּבֵ֥ל בְּצֶ֑דֶק וְ֝עַמִּ֗ים בֶּאֱמוּנָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
at the presence of the LORD, for He is coming,
for He is coming to rule the earth;
He will rule the world justly,
and its peoples in faithfulness.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה מָ֭לָךְ תָּגֵ֣ל הָאָ֑רֶץ יִ֝שְׂמְח֗וּ אִיִּ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃
translations.english:
The LORD is king!
Let the earth exult,
the many islands rejoice!

translations.hebrew: עָנָ֣ן וַעֲרָפֶ֣ל סְבִיבָ֑יו צֶ֥דֶק וּ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט מְכ֣וֹן כִּסְאֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Dense clouds are around Him,
righteousness and justice are the base of His throne.

translations.hebrew: אֵ֭שׁ לְפָנָ֣יו תֵּלֵ֑ךְ וּתְלַהֵ֖ט סָבִ֣יב צָרָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Fire is His vanguard,
burning His foes on every side.

translations.hebrew: הֵאִ֣ירוּ בְרָקָ֣יו תֵּבֵ֑ל רָאֲתָ֖ה וַתָּחֵ֣ל הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
His lightnings light up the world;
the earth is convulsed at the sight;

translations.hebrew: הָרִ֗ים כַּדּוֹנַ֗ג נָ֭מַסּוּ מִלִּפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה מִ֝לִּפְנֵ֗י אֲד֣וֹן כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
mountains melt like wax at the LORD’s presence,
at the presence of the Lord of all the earth.

translations.hebrew: הִגִּ֣ידוּ הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם צִדְק֑וֹ וְרָא֖וּ כׇל־הָעַמִּ֣ים כְּבוֹדֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The heavens proclaim His righteousness
and all peoples see His glory.

translations.hebrew: יֵבֹ֤שׁוּ ׀ כׇּל־עֹ֬בְדֵי פֶ֗סֶל הַמִּֽתְהַלְלִ֥ים בָּאֱלִילִ֑ים הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ־ל֝֗וֹ כׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
All who worship images,
who vaunt their idols,
are dismayed;
all divine beings bow down to Him.

translations.hebrew: שָׁמְעָ֬ה וַתִּשְׂמַ֨ח ׀ צִיּ֗וֹן וַ֭תָּגֵלְנָה בְּנ֣וֹת יְהוּדָ֑ה לְמַ֖עַן מִשְׁפָּטֶ֣יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Zion, hearing it, rejoices,
the townsaOr “women.” of Judah exult,
because of Your judgments, O LORD.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אַתָּ֤ה יְהֹוָ֗ה עֶלְי֥וֹן עַל־כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ מְאֹ֥ד נַ֝עֲלֵ֗יתָ עַל־כׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
For You, LORD, are supreme over all the earth;
You are exalted high above all divine beings.

translations.hebrew: אֹֽהֲבֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֗ה שִׂנְא֫וּ־רָ֥ע שֹׁ֭מֵר נַפְשׁ֣וֹת חֲסִידָ֑יו מִיַּ֥ד רְ֝שָׁעִ֗ים יַצִּילֵֽם׃
translations.english:
O you who love the LORD, hate evil!
He guards the lives of His loyal ones,
saving them from the hand of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: א֭וֹר זָרֻ֣עַ לַצַּדִּ֑יק וּֽלְיִשְׁרֵי־לֵ֥ב שִׂמְחָֽה׃
translations.english:
Light is sown for the righteous,
radiancebOthers “joy.” for the upright.

translations.hebrew: שִׂמְח֣וּ צַ֭דִּיקִים בַּיהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝הוֹד֗וּ לְזֵ֣כֶר קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
O you righteous, rejoice in the LORD
and acclaim His holy name!

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֡וֹר שִׁ֤ירוּ לַיהֹוָ֨ה ׀ שִׁ֣יר חָ֭דָשׁ כִּֽי־נִפְלָא֣וֹת עָשָׂ֑ה הוֹשִׁיעָה־לּ֥וֹ יְ֝מִינ֗וֹ וּזְר֥וֹעַ קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
A psalm.

Sing to the LORD a new song,
for He has worked wonders;
His right hand, His holy arm,
has won Him victory.

translations.hebrew: הוֹדִ֣יעַ יְ֭הֹוָה יְשׁוּעָת֑וֹ לְעֵינֵ֥י הַ֝גּוֹיִ֗ם גִּלָּ֥ה צִדְקָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The LORD has manifested His victory,
has displayed His triumph in the sight of the nations.

translations.hebrew: זָ֘כַ֤ר חַסְדּ֨וֹ ׀ וֶ֥אֱֽמוּנָתוֹ֮ לְבֵ֢ית יִשְׂרָ֫אֵ֥ל רָא֥וּ כׇל־אַפְסֵי־אָ֑רֶץ אֵ֝֗ת יְשׁוּעַ֥ת אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
He was mindful of His steadfast love and faithfulness toward the house of Israel;
all the ends of the earth beheld the victory of our God.

translations.hebrew: הָרִ֣יעוּ לַ֭יהֹוָה כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ פִּצְח֖וּ וְרַנְּנ֣וּ וְזַמֵּֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
Raise a shout to the LORD, all the earth,
break into joyous songs of praise!

translations.hebrew: זַמְּר֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה בְּכִנּ֑וֹר בְּ֝כִנּ֗וֹר וְק֣וֹל זִמְרָֽה׃
translations.english:
Sing praise to the LORD with the lyre,
with the lyre and melodious song.

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭חֲצֹ֣צְרוֹת וְק֣וֹל שׁוֹפָ֑ר הָ֝רִ֗יעוּ לִפְנֵ֤י ׀ הַמֶּ֬לֶךְ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
With trumpets and the blast of the horn
raise a shout before the LORD, the King.

translations.hebrew: יִרְעַ֣ם הַ֭יָּם וּמְלֹא֑וֹ תֵּ֝בֵ֗ל וְיֹ֣שְׁבֵי בָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Let the sea and all within it thunder,
the world and its inhabitants;

translations.hebrew: נְהָר֥וֹת יִמְחֲאוּ־כָ֑ף יַ֝֗חַד הָרִ֥ים יְרַנֵּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
let the rivers clap their hands,
the mountains sing joyously together

translations.hebrew: לִ֥פְֽנֵי־יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּ֥י בָא֮ לִשְׁפֹּ֢ט הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ יִשְׁפֹּֽט־תֵּבֵ֥ל בְּצֶ֑דֶק וְ֝עַמִּ֗ים בְּמֵישָׁרִֽים׃
translations.english:
at the presence of the LORD,
for He is coming to rule the earth;
He will rule the world justly,
and its peoples with equity.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה מָ֭לָךְ יִרְגְּז֣וּ עַמִּ֑ים יֹשֵׁ֥ב כְּ֝רוּבִ֗ים תָּנ֥וּט הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
aClauses transposed for clarity.The LORD, enthroned on cherubim, is king,
peoples tremble, the earth quakes.-a

translations.hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה בְּצִיּ֣וֹן גָּד֑וֹל וְרָ֥ם ה֝֗וּא עַל־כׇּל־הָעַמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
The LORD is great in Zion,
and exalted above all peoples.

translations.hebrew: יוֹד֣וּ שִׁ֭מְךָ גָּד֥וֹל וְנוֹרָ֗א קָד֥וֹשׁ הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
They praise Your name as great and awesome;
He is holy!

translations.hebrew: וְעֹ֥ז מֶלֶךְ֮ מִשְׁפָּ֢ט אָ֫הֵ֥ב אַ֭תָּה כּוֹנַ֣נְתָּ מֵישָׁרִ֑ים מִשְׁפָּ֥ט וּ֝צְדָקָ֗ה בְּיַעֲקֹ֤ב ׀ אַתָּ֬ה עָשִֽׂיתָ׃
translations.english:
bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Mighty king-b who loves justice,
it was You who established equity,
You who worked righteous judgment in Jacob.

translations.hebrew: רוֹמְמ֡וּ יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וְֽ֭הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לַהֲדֹ֥ם רַגְלָ֗יו קָד֥וֹשׁ הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
Exalt the LORD our God
and bow down to His footstool;
He is holy!

translations.hebrew: מֹ֘שֶׁ֤ה וְאַהֲרֹ֨ן ׀ בְּֽכֹהֲנָ֗יו וּ֭שְׁמוּאֵל בְּקֹרְאֵ֣י שְׁמ֑וֹ קֹרִ֥אים אֶל־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה וְה֣וּא יַעֲנֵֽם׃
translations.english:
Moses and Aaron among His priests,
Samuel, among those who call on His name—
when they called to the LORD,
He answered them.

translations.hebrew: בְּעַמּ֣וּד עָ֭נָן יְדַבֵּ֣ר אֲלֵיהֶ֑ם שָׁמְר֥וּ עֵ֝דֹתָ֗יו וְחֹ֣ק נָֽתַן־לָֽמוֹ׃
translations.english:
He spoke to them in a pillar of cloud;
they obeyed His decrees,
the law He gave them.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵינוּ֮ אַתָּ֢ה עֲנִ֫יתָ֥ם אֵ֣ל נֹ֭שֵׂא הָיִ֣יתָ לָהֶ֑ם וְ֝נֹקֵ֗ם עַל־עֲלִילוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
O LORD our God, You answered them;
You were a forgiving God for them,
but You exacted retribution for their misdeeds.

translations.hebrew: רוֹמְמ֡וּ יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וְֽ֭הִשְׁתַּחֲווּ לְהַ֣ר קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ כִּי־קָ֝ד֗וֹשׁ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
Exalt the LORD our God,
and bow toward His holy hill,
for the LORD our God is holy.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֥וֹר לְתוֹדָ֑ה הָרִ֥יעוּ לַ֝יהֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
A psalm aTraditionally “for the thanksgiving offering.”for praise.-a

Raise a shout for the LORD, all the earth;

translations.hebrew: עִבְד֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּשִׂמְחָ֑ה בֹּ֥אוּ לְ֝פָנָ֗יו בִּרְנָנָֽה׃
translations.english:
worship the LORD in gladness;
come into His presence with shouts of joy.

translations.hebrew: דְּע֗וּ כִּֽי־יְהֹוָה֮ ה֤וּא אֱלֹ֫הִ֥ים הֽוּא־עָ֭שָׂנוּ (ולא) [וְל֣וֹ] אֲנַ֑חְנוּ עַ֝מּ֗וֹ וְצֹ֣אן מַרְעִיתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Acknowledge that the LORD is God;
He made us and bSo qere; kethib and some ancient versions “not we ourselves.”we are His,-b
His people, the flock He tends.

translations.hebrew: בֹּ֤אוּ שְׁעָרָ֨יו ׀ בְּתוֹדָ֗ה חֲצֵרֹתָ֥יו בִּתְהִלָּ֑ה הוֹדוּ־ל֝֗וֹ בָּרְכ֥וּ שְׁמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Enter His gates with praise,
His courts with acclamation.
Praise Him!
Bless His name!

translations.hebrew: כִּי־ט֣וֹב יְ֭הֹוָה לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְעַד־דֹּ֥ר וָ֝דֹ֗ר אֱמוּנָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
For the LORD is good;
His steadfast love is eternal;
His faithfulness is for all generations.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֗ד מִ֫זְמ֥וֹר חֶֽסֶד־וּמִשְׁפָּ֥ט אָשִׁ֑ירָה לְךָ֖ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֲזַמֵּֽרָה׃
translations.english:
Of David. A psalm.

I will sing of faithfulness and justice;
I will chant a hymn to You, O LORD.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׂכִּ֤ילָה ׀ בְּדֶ֬רֶךְ תָּמִ֗ים מָ֭תַי תָּב֣וֹא אֵלָ֑י אֶתְהַלֵּ֥ךְ בְּתׇם־לְ֝בָבִ֗י בְּקֶ֣רֶב בֵּיתִֽי׃
translations.english:
I will study the way of the blameless;
when shall I attain it?
I will live without blame within my house.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־אָשִׁ֨ית ׀ לְנֶ֥גֶד עֵינַ֗י דְּֽבַר־בְּלִ֫יָּ֥עַל עֲשֹֽׂה־סֵטִ֥ים שָׂנֵ֑אתִי לֹ֖א יִדְבַּ֣ק בִּֽי׃
translations.english:
I will not set before my eyes anything base;
I hate crooked dealing;
I will have none of it.

translations.hebrew: לֵבָ֣ב עִ֭קֵּשׁ יָס֣וּר מִמֶּ֑נִּי רָ֝֗ע לֹ֣א אֵדָֽע׃
translations.english:
Perverse thoughts will be far from me;
I will know nothing of evil.

translations.hebrew: (מלושני) [מְלׇשְׁנִ֬י] בַסֵּ֨תֶר ׀ רֵעֵהוּ֮ אוֹת֢וֹ אַ֫צְמִ֥ית גְּֽבַהּ־עֵ֭ינַיִם וּרְחַ֣ב לֵבָ֑ב אֹ֝ת֗וֹ לֹ֣א אוּכָֽל׃
translations.english:
He who slanders his friend in secret I will destroy;
I cannot endure the haughty and proud man.

translations.hebrew: עֵינַ֤י ׀ בְּנֶֽאֶמְנֵי־אֶרֶץ֮ לָשֶׁ֢בֶת עִמָּ֫דִ֥י הֹ֭לֵךְ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ תָּמִ֑ים ה֝֗וּא יְשָׁרְתֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
My eyes are on the trusty men of the land,
to have them at my side.
He who follows the way of the blameless
shall be in my service.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־יֵשֵׁ֨ב ׀ בְּקֶ֥רֶב בֵּיתִי֮ עֹשֵׂ֢ה רְמִ֫יָּ֥ה דֹּבֵ֥ר שְׁקָרִ֑ים לֹא־יִ֝כּ֗וֹן לְנֶ֣גֶד עֵינָֽי׃
translations.english:
He who deals deceitfully
shall not live in my house;
he who speaks untruth
shall not stand before my eyes.

translations.hebrew: לַבְּקָרִ֗ים אַצְמִ֥ית כׇּל־רִשְׁעֵי־אָ֑רֶץ לְהַכְרִ֥ית מֵעִיר־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כׇּל־פֹּ֥עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Each morning I will destroy
all the wicked of the land,
to rid the city of the LORD
of all evildoers.

translations.hebrew: תְּ֭פִלָּה לְעָנִ֣י כִֽי־יַעֲטֹ֑ף וְלִפְנֵ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יִשְׁפֹּ֥ךְ שִׂיחֽוֹ׃
translations.english: A prayer of the lowly man when he is faint and pours forth his plea before the LORD.

translations.hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה שִׁמְעָ֣ה תְפִלָּתִ֑י וְ֝שַׁוְעָתִ֗י אֵלֶ֥יךָ תָבֽוֹא׃
translations.english:
O LORD, hear my prayer;
let my cry come before You.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּסְתֵּ֬ר פָּנֶ֨יךָ ׀ מִמֶּנִּי֮ בְּי֢וֹם צַ֫ר־לִ֥י הַטֵּֽה־אֵלַ֥י אׇזְנֶ֑ךָ בְּי֥וֹם אֶ֝קְרָ֗א מַהֵ֥ר עֲנֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Do not hide Your face from me
in my time of trouble;
turn Your ear to me;
when I cry, answer me speedily.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־כָל֣וּ בְעָשָׁ֣ן יָמָ֑י וְ֝עַצְמוֹתַ֗י כְּמוֹקֵ֥ד נִחָֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
For my days have vanished like smoke
and my bones are charred like a hearth.

translations.hebrew: הוּכָּה־כָעֵ֣שֶׂב וַיִּבַ֣שׁ לִבִּ֑י כִּֽי־שָׁ֝כַ֗חְתִּי מֵאֲכֹ֥ל לַחְמִֽי׃
translations.english:
My body is stricken and withered like grass;
aOthers “I forget.”too wasted-a to eat my food;

translations.hebrew: מִקּ֥וֹל אַנְחָתִ֑י דָּבְקָ֥ה עַ֝צְמִ֗י לִבְשָׂרִֽי׃
translations.english:
on account of my vehement groaning
my bones bLit. “cling to my flesh.”show through my skin.-b

translations.hebrew: דָּ֭מִיתִי לִקְאַ֣ת מִדְבָּ֑ר הָ֝יִ֗יתִי כְּכ֣וֹס חֳרָבֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
I am like a great owl in the wilderness,
an owl among the ruins.

translations.hebrew: שָׁקַ֥דְתִּי וָאֶהְיֶ֑ה כְּ֝צִפּ֗וֹר בּוֹדֵ֥ד עַל־גָּֽג׃
translations.english:
I lie awake; I am like
a lone bird upon a roof.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־הַ֭יּוֹם חֵרְפ֣וּנִי אוֹיְבָ֑י מְ֝הוֹלָלַ֗י בִּ֣י נִשְׁבָּֽעוּ׃
translations.english:
All day long my enemies revile me;
my deriders use my name to curse.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־אֵ֭פֶר כַּלֶּ֣חֶם אָכָ֑לְתִּי וְ֝שִׁקֻּוַ֗י בִּבְכִ֥י מָסָֽכְתִּי׃
translations.english:
For I have eaten ashes like bread
and mixed my drink with tears,

translations.hebrew: מִפְּנֵֽי־זַעַמְךָ֥ וְקִצְפֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י נְ֝שָׂאתַ֗נִי וַתַּשְׁלִיכֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
because of Your wrath and Your fury;
for You have cast me far away.

translations.hebrew: יָ֭מַי כְּצֵ֣ל נָט֑וּי וַ֝אֲנִ֗י כָּעֵ֥שֶׂב אִיבָֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
My days are like a lengthening shadow;
I wither like grass.

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה לְעוֹלָ֣ם תֵּשֵׁ֑ב וְ֝זִכְרְךָ֗ לְדֹ֣ר וָדֹֽר׃
translations.english:
But You, O LORD, are enthroned forever;
Your fame endures throughout the ages.

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה תָ֭קוּם תְּרַחֵ֣ם צִיּ֑וֹן כִּי־עֵ֥ת לְ֝חֶֽנְנָ֗הּ כִּי־בָ֥א מוֹעֵֽד׃
translations.english:
You will surely arise and take pity on Zion,
for it is time to be gracious to her;
the appointed time has come.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־רָצ֣וּ עֲ֭בָדֶיךָ אֶת־אֲבָנֶ֑יהָ וְֽאֶת־עֲפָרָ֥הּ יְחֹנֵֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Your servants take delight in its stones,
and cherish its dust.

translations.hebrew: וְיִֽירְא֣וּ ג֭וֹיִם אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וְֽכׇל־מַלְכֵ֥י הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ אֶת־כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
The nations will fear the name of the LORD,
all the kings of the earth, Your glory.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־בָנָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה צִיּ֑וֹן נִ֝רְאָ֗ה בִּכְבוֹדֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
For the LORD has built Zion;
He has appeared in all His glory.

translations.hebrew: פָּ֭נָה אֶל־תְּפִלַּ֣ת הָעַרְעָ֑ר וְלֹא־בָ֝זָ֗ה אֶת־תְּפִלָּתָֽם׃
translations.english:
He has turned to the prayer cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.of the destitute-c
and has not spurned their prayer.

translations.hebrew: תִּכָּ֣תֶב זֹ֭את לְד֣וֹר אַחֲר֑וֹן וְעַ֥ם נִ֝בְרָ֗א יְהַלֶּל־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
May this be written down for a coming generation,
that people yet to be created may praise the LORD.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הִ֭שְׁקִיף מִמְּר֣וֹם קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מִשָּׁמַ֤יִם ׀ אֶל־אֶ֬רֶץ הִבִּֽיט׃
translations.english:
For He looks down from His holy height;
the LORD beholds the earth from heaven

translations.hebrew: לִ֭שְׁמֹעַ אֶנְקַ֣ת אָסִ֑יר לְ֝פַתֵּ֗חַ בְּנֵ֣י תְמוּתָֽה׃
translations.english:
to hear the groans of the prisoner,
to release those condemned to death;

translations.hebrew: לְסַפֵּ֣ר בְּ֭צִיּוֹן שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה וּ֝תְהִלָּת֗וֹ בִּירוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
translations.english:
that the fame of the LORD may be recounted in Zion,
His praises in Jerusalem,

translations.hebrew: בְּהִקָּבֵ֣ץ עַמִּ֣ים יַחְדָּ֑ו וּ֝מַמְלָכ֗וֹת לַעֲבֹ֥ד אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
when the nations gather together,
the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.

translations.hebrew: עִנָּ֖ה בַדֶּ֥רֶךְ (כחו) [כֹּחִ֗י] קִצַּ֥ר יָמָֽי׃
translations.english:
He drained my strength in mid-course,
He shortened my days.

translations.hebrew: אֹמַ֗ר אֵלִ֗י אַֽל־תַּ֭עֲלֵנִי בַּחֲצִ֣י יָמָ֑י בְּד֖וֹר דּוֹרִ֣ים שְׁנוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I say, “O my God, do not take me away
in the midst of my days,
You whose years go on for generations on end.

translations.hebrew: לְ֭פָנִים הָאָ֣רֶץ יָסַ֑דְתָּ וּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יָדֶ֣יךָ שָׁמָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
Of old You established the earth;
the heavens are the work of Your hands.

translations.hebrew: הֵ֤מָּה ׀ יֹאבֵדוּ֮ וְאַתָּ֢ה תַ֫עֲמֹ֥ד וְ֭כֻלָּם כַּבֶּ֣גֶד יִבְל֑וּ כַּלְּב֖וּשׁ תַּחֲלִיפֵ֣ם וְֽיַחֲלֹֽפוּ׃
translations.english:
They shall perish, but You shall endure;
they shall all wear out like a garment;
You change them like clothing and they pass away.

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּה־ה֑וּא וּ֝שְׁנוֹתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א יִתָּֽמּוּ׃
translations.english: But You are the same, and Your years never end.

translations.hebrew: בְּנֵֽי־עֲבָדֶ֥יךָ יִשְׁכּ֑וֹנוּ וְ֝זַרְעָ֗ם לְפָנֶ֥יךָ יִכּֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
May the children of Your servants dwell securely
and their offspring endure in Your presence.”

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ בָּרְכִ֣י נַ֭פְשִׁי אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְכׇל־קְ֝רָבַ֗י אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם קׇדְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
Of David.

Bless the LORD, O my soul,
all my being, His holy name.

translations.hebrew: בָּרְכִ֣י נַ֭פְשִׁי אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאַל־תִּ֝שְׁכְּחִ֗י כׇּל־גְּמוּלָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Bless the LORD, O my soul
and do not forget all His bounties.

translations.hebrew: הַסֹּלֵ֥חַ לְכׇל־עֲוֺנֵ֑כִי הָ֝רֹפֵ֗א לְכׇל־תַּחֲלוּאָֽיְכִי׃
translations.english:
He forgives all your sins,
heals all your diseases.

translations.hebrew: הַגּוֹאֵ֣ל מִשַּׁ֣חַת חַיָּ֑יְכִי הַֽ֝מְעַטְּרֵ֗כִי חֶ֣סֶד וְרַחֲמִֽים׃
translations.english:
He redeems your life from the Pit,
surrounds you with steadfast love and mercy.

translations.hebrew: הַמַּשְׂבִּ֣יעַ בַּטּ֣וֹב עֶדְיֵ֑ךְ תִּתְחַדֵּ֖שׁ כַּנֶּ֣שֶׁר נְעוּרָֽיְכִי׃
translations.english:
He satisfies you with good things in aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.the prime of life,-a
so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.

translations.hebrew: עֹשֵׂ֣ה צְדָק֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה וּ֝מִשְׁפָּטִ֗ים לְכׇל־עֲשׁוּקִֽים׃
translations.english:
The LORD executes righteous acts
and judgments for all who are wronged.

translations.hebrew: יוֹדִ֣יעַ דְּרָכָ֣יו לְמֹשֶׁ֑ה לִבְנֵ֥י יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל עֲלִילוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He made known His ways to Moses,
His deeds to the children of Israel.

translations.hebrew: רַח֣וּם וְחַנּ֣וּן יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶ֖רֶךְ אַפַּ֣יִם וְרַב־חָֽסֶד׃
translations.english:
The LORD is compassionate and gracious,
slow to anger, abounding in steadfast love.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־לָנֶ֥צַח יָרִ֑יב וְלֹ֖א לְעוֹלָ֣ם יִטּֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
He will not contend forever,
or nurse His anger for all time.

translations.hebrew: לֹ֣א כַ֭חֲטָאֵינוּ עָ֣שָׂה לָ֑נוּ וְלֹ֥א כַ֝עֲוֺנֹתֵ֗ינוּ גָּמַ֥ל עָלֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
nor has He requited us according to our iniquities.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י כִגְבֹ֣הַּ שָׁ֭מַיִם עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ גָּבַ֥ר חַ֝סְדּ֗וֹ עַל־יְרֵאָֽיו׃
translations.english:
For as the heavens are high above the earth,
so great is His steadfast love toward those who fear Him.

translations.hebrew: כִּרְחֹ֣ק מִ֭זְרָח מִֽמַּעֲרָ֑ב הִֽרְחִ֥יק מִ֝מֶּ֗נּוּ אֶת־פְּשָׁעֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
As east is far from west,
so far has He removed our sins from us.

translations.hebrew: כְּרַחֵ֣ם אָ֭ב עַל־בָּנִ֑ים רִחַ֥ם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עַל־יְרֵאָֽיו׃
translations.english:
As a father has compassion for his children,
so the LORD has compassion for those who fear Him.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־ה֭וּא יָדַ֣ע יִצְרֵ֑נוּ זָ֝כ֗וּר כִּי־עָפָ֥ר אֲנָֽחְנוּ׃
translations.english:
For He knows how we are formed;
He is mindful that we are dust.

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭נוֹשׁ כֶּחָצִ֣יר יָמָ֑יו כְּצִ֥יץ הַ֝שָּׂדֶ֗ה כֵּ֣ן יָצִֽיץ׃
translations.english:
Man, his days are like those of grass;
he blooms like a flower of the field;

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י ר֣וּחַ עָֽבְרָה־בּ֣וֹ וְאֵינֶ֑נּוּ וְלֹֽא־יַכִּירֶ֖נּוּ ע֣וֹד מְקוֹמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
a wind passes by and it is no more,
its own place no longer knows it.

translations.hebrew: וְחֶ֤סֶד יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ מֵעוֹלָ֣ם וְעַד־ע֭וֹלָם עַל־יְרֵאָ֑יו וְ֝צִדְקָת֗וֹ לִבְנֵ֥י בָנִֽים׃
translations.english:
But the LORD’s steadfast love is for all eternity
toward those who fear Him,
and His beneficence is for the children’s children

translations.hebrew: לְשֹׁמְרֵ֥י בְרִית֑וֹ וּלְזֹכְרֵ֥י פִ֝קֻּדָ֗יו לַעֲשׂוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
of those who keep His covenant
and remember to observe His precepts.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה בַּ֭שָּׁמַיִם הֵכִ֣ין כִּסְא֑וֹ וּ֝מַלְכוּת֗וֹ בַּכֹּ֥ל מָשָֽׁלָה׃
translations.english:
The LORD has established His throne in heaven,
and His sovereign rule is over all.

translations.hebrew: בָּרְכ֥וּ יְהֹוָ֗ה מַלְאָ֫כָ֥יו גִּבֹּ֣רֵי כֹ֭חַ עֹשֵׂ֣י דְבָר֑וֹ לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗עַ בְּק֣וֹל דְּבָרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Bless the LORD, O His angels,
mighty creatures who do His bidding,
ever obedient to His bidding;

translations.hebrew: בָּרְכ֣וּ יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־צְבָאָ֑יו מְ֝שָׁרְתָ֗יו עֹשֵׂ֥י רְצוֹנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
bless the LORD, all His hosts,
His servants who do His will;

translations.hebrew: בָּרְכ֤וּ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ כׇּֽל־מַעֲשָׂ֗יו בְּכׇל־מְקֹמ֥וֹת מֶמְשַׁלְתּ֑וֹ בָּרְכִ֥י נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
bless the LORD, all His works,
through the length and breadth of His realm;
bless the LORD, O my soul.

translations.hebrew: בָּרְכִ֥י נַפְשִׁ֗י אֶת־יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱ֭לֹהַי גָּדַ֣לְתָּ מְּאֹ֑ד ה֖וֹד וְהָדָ֣ר לָבָֽשְׁתָּ׃
translations.english:
Bless the LORD, O my soul;
O LORD, my God, You are very great;
You are clothed in glory and majesty,

translations.hebrew: עֹֽטֶה־א֭וֹר כַּשַּׂלְמָ֑ה נוֹטֶ֥ה שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם כַּיְרִיעָֽה׃
translations.english:
wrapped in a robe of light;
You spread the heavens like a tent cloth.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥מְקָרֶ֥ה בַמַּ֗יִם עֲֽלִיּ֫וֹתָ֥יו הַשָּׂם־עָבִ֥ים רְכוּב֑וֹ הַֽ֝מְהַלֵּ֗ךְ עַל־כַּנְפֵי־רֽוּחַ׃
translations.english:
He sets the rafters of His lofts in the waters,
makes the clouds His chariot,
moves on the wings of the wind.

translations.hebrew: עֹשֶׂ֣ה מַלְאָכָ֣יו רוּח֑וֹת מְ֝שָׁרְתָ֗יו אֵ֣שׁ לֹהֵֽט׃
translations.english:
He makes the winds His messengers,
fiery flames His servants.

translations.hebrew: יָֽסַד־אֶ֭רֶץ עַל־מְכוֹנֶ֑יהָ בַּל־תִּ֝מּ֗וֹט עוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
translations.english:
He established the earth on its foundations,
so that it shall never totter.

translations.hebrew: תְּ֭הוֹם כַּלְּב֣וּשׁ כִּסִּית֑וֹ עַל־הָ֝רִ֗ים יַ֖עַמְדוּ־מָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
You made the deep cover it as a garment;
the waters stood above the mountains.

translations.hebrew: מִן־גַּעֲרָ֣תְךָ֣ יְנוּס֑וּן מִן־ק֥וֹל רַ֝עַמְךָ֗ יֵחָפֵזֽוּן׃
translations.english:
They fled at Your blast,
rushed away at the sound of Your thunder,

translations.hebrew: יַעֲל֣וּ הָ֭רִים יֵרְד֣וּ בְקָע֑וֹת אֶל־מְ֝ק֗וֹם זֶ֤ה ׀ יָסַ֬דְתָּ לָהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
—mountains rising, valleys sinking—
to the place You established for them.

translations.hebrew: גְּֽבוּל־שַׂ֭מְתָּ בַּל־יַעֲבֹר֑וּן בַּל־יְ֝שֻׁב֗וּן לְכַסּ֥וֹת הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
You set bounds they must not pass
so that they never again cover the earth.

translations.hebrew: הַֽמְשַׁלֵּ֣חַ מַ֭עְיָנִים בַּנְּחָלִ֑ים בֵּ֥ין הָ֝רִ֗ים יְהַלֵּכֽוּן׃
translations.english:
You make springs gush forth in torrents;
they make their way between the hills,

translations.hebrew: יַ֭שְׁקוּ כׇּל־חַיְת֣וֹ שָׂדָ֑י יִשְׁבְּר֖וּ פְרָאִ֣ים צְמָאָֽם׃
translations.english:
giving drink to all the wild beasts;
the wild asses slake their thirst.

translations.hebrew: עֲ֭לֵיהֶם עוֹף־הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם יִשְׁכּ֑וֹן מִבֵּ֥ין עֳ֝פָאיִ֗ם יִתְּנוּ־קֽוֹל׃
translations.english:
The birds of the sky dwell beside them
and sing among the foliage.

translations.hebrew: מַשְׁקֶ֣ה הָ֭רִים מֵעֲלִיּוֹתָ֑יו מִפְּרִ֥י מַ֝עֲשֶׂ֗יךָ תִּשְׂבַּ֥ע הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
You water the mountains from YouraLit. “His.” lofts;
the earth is sated from the fruit of Your work.

translations.hebrew: מַצְמִ֤יחַ חָצִ֨יר ׀ לַבְּהֵמָ֗ה וְ֭עֵשֶׂב לַעֲבֹדַ֣ת הָאָדָ֑ם לְה֥וֹצִיא לֶ֝֗חֶם מִן־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
You make the grass grow for the cattle,
and herbage for man’s labor
that he may get food out of the earth—

translations.hebrew: וְיַ֤יִן ׀ יְשַׂמַּ֬ח לְֽבַב־אֱנ֗וֹשׁ לְהַצְהִ֣יל פָּנִ֣ים מִשָּׁ֑מֶן וְ֝לֶ֗חֶם לְֽבַב־אֱנ֥וֹשׁ יִסְעָֽד׃
translations.english:
wine that cheers the hearts of men,
bLit. “to make the face shine from oil.”oil that makes the face shine,-b
and bread that sustains man’s life.

translations.hebrew: יִ֭שְׂבְּעוּ עֲצֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אַֽרְזֵ֥י לְ֝בָנ֗וֹן אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָטָֽע׃
translations.english:
The trees of the LORD drink their fill,
the cedars of Lebanon, His own planting,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־שָׁ֭ם צִפֳּרִ֣ים יְקַנֵּ֑נוּ חֲ֝סִידָ֗ה בְּרוֹשִׁ֥ים בֵּיתָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
where birds make their nests;
the stork has her home in the junipers.

translations.hebrew: הָרִ֣ים הַ֭גְּבֹהִים לַיְּעֵלִ֑ים סְ֝לָעִ֗ים מַחְסֶ֥ה לַֽשְׁפַנִּֽים׃
translations.english:
The high mountains are for wild goats;
the crags are a refuge for rock-badgers.

translations.hebrew: עָשָׂ֣ה יָ֭רֵחַ לְמוֹעֲדִ֑ים שֶׁ֝֗מֶשׁ יָדַ֥ע מְבוֹאֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He made the moon to mark the seasons;
the sun knows when to set.

translations.hebrew: תָּֽשֶׁת־חֹ֭שֶׁךְ וִ֣יהִי לָ֑יְלָה בּוֹ־תִ֝רְמֹ֗שׂ כׇּל־חַיְתוֹ־יָֽעַר׃
translations.english:
You bring on darkness and it is night,
when all the beasts of the forests stir.

translations.hebrew: הַ֭כְּפִירִים שֹׁאֲגִ֣ים לַטָּ֑רֶף וּלְבַקֵּ֖שׁ מֵאֵ֣ל אׇכְלָֽם׃
translations.english:
The lions roar for prey,
seeking their food from God.

translations.hebrew: תִּזְרַ֣ח הַ֭שֶּׁמֶשׁ יֵאָסֵפ֑וּן וְאֶל־מְ֝עוֹנֹתָ֗ם יִרְבָּצֽוּן׃
translations.english:
When the sun rises, they come home
and couch in their dens.

translations.hebrew: יֵצֵ֣א אָדָ֣ם לְפׇעֳל֑וֹ וְֽלַעֲבֹ֖דָת֣וֹ עֲדֵי־עָֽרֶב׃
translations.english:
Man then goes out to his work,
to his labor until the evening.

translations.hebrew: מָה־רַבּ֬וּ מַעֲשֶׂ֨יךָ ׀ יְֽהֹוָ֗ה כֻּ֭לָּם בְּחׇכְמָ֣ה עָשִׂ֑יתָ מָלְאָ֥ה הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ קִנְיָנֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
How many are the things You have made, O LORD;
You have made them all with wisdom;
the earth is full of Your creations.

translations.hebrew: זֶ֤ה ׀ הַיָּ֥ם גָּדוֹל֮ וּרְחַ֢ב יָ֫דָ֥יִם שָֽׁם־רֶ֭מֶשׂ וְאֵ֣ין מִסְפָּ֑ר חַיּ֥וֹת קְ֝טַנּ֗וֹת עִם־גְּדֹלֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
There is the sea, vast and wide,
with its creatures beyond number,
living things, small and great.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֭ם אֳנִיּ֣וֹת יְהַלֵּכ֑וּן לִ֝וְיָתָ֗ן זֶֽה־יָצַ֥רְתָּ לְשַֽׂחֶק־בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
There go the ships,
and Leviathan that You formed to sport with.

translations.hebrew: כֻּ֭לָּם אֵלֶ֣יךָ יְשַׂבֵּר֑וּן לָתֵ֖ת אׇכְלָ֣ם בְּעִתּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
All of them look to You
to give them their food when it is due.

translations.hebrew: תִּתֵּ֣ן לָ֭הֶם יִלְקֹט֑וּן תִּפְתַּ֥ח יָ֝דְךָ֗ יִשְׂבְּע֥וּן טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
Give it to them, they gather it up;
open Your hand, they are well satisfied;

translations.hebrew: תַּסְתִּ֥יר פָּנֶיךָ֮ יִֽבָּהֵ֫ל֥וּן תֹּסֵ֣ף ר֭וּחָם יִגְוָע֑וּן וְֽאֶל־עֲפָרָ֥ם יְשׁוּבֽוּן׃
translations.english:
hide Your face, they are terrified;
take away their breath, they perish
and turn again into dust;

translations.hebrew: תְּשַׁלַּ֣ח ר֭וּחֲךָ יִבָּרֵא֑וּן וּ֝תְחַדֵּ֗שׁ פְּנֵ֣י אֲדָמָֽה׃
translations.english:
send back Your breath, they are created,
and You renew the face of the earth.

translations.hebrew: יְהִ֤י כְב֣וֹד יְהֹוָ֣ה לְעוֹלָ֑ם יִשְׂמַ֖ח יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּמַעֲשָֽׂיו׃
translations.english:
May the glory of the LORD endure forever;
may the LORD rejoice in His works!

translations.hebrew: הַמַּבִּ֣יט לָ֭אָרֶץ וַתִּרְעָ֑ד יִגַּ֖ע בֶּהָרִ֣ים וְֽיֶעֱשָֽׁנוּ׃
translations.english:
He looks at the earth and it trembles;
He touches the mountains and they smoke.

translations.hebrew: אָשִׁ֣ירָה לַיהֹוָ֣ה בְּחַיָּ֑י אֲזַמְּרָ֖ה לֵאלֹהַ֣י בְּעוֹדִֽי׃
translations.english:
I will sing to the LORD as long as I live;
all my life I will chant hymns to my God.

translations.hebrew: יֶעֱרַ֣ב עָלָ֣יו שִׂיחִ֑י אָ֝נֹכִ֗י אֶשְׂמַ֥ח בַּיהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
May my prayer be pleasing to Him;
I will rejoice in the LORD.

translations.hebrew: יִתַּ֤מּוּ חַטָּאִ֨ים ׀ מִן־הָאָ֡רֶץ וּרְשָׁעִ֤ים ׀ ע֤וֹד אֵינָ֗ם בָּרְכִ֣י נַ֭פְשִׁי אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
May sinners disappear from the earth,
and the wicked be no more.
Bless the LORD, O my soul.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: הוֹד֣וּ לַ֭יהֹוָה קִרְא֣וּ בִשְׁמ֑וֹ הוֹדִ֥יעוּ בָ֝עַמִּ֗ים עֲלִילוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Praise the LORD;
call on His name;
proclaim His deeds among the peoples.

translations.hebrew: שִֽׁירוּ־ל֭וֹ זַמְּרוּ־ל֑וֹ שִׂ֝֗יחוּ בְּכׇל־נִפְלְאוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Sing praises to Him;
speak of all His wondrous acts.

translations.hebrew: הִֽ֭תְהַלְלוּ בְּשֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ יִ֝שְׂמַ֗ח לֵ֤ב ׀ מְבַקְשֵׁ֬י יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Exult in His holy name;
let all who seek the LORD rejoice.

translations.hebrew: דִּרְשׁ֣וּ יְהֹוָ֣ה וְעֻזּ֑וֹ בַּקְּשׁ֖וּ פָנָ֣יו תָּמִֽיד׃
translations.english:
Turn to the LORD, to His might;aI.e., the Ark; cf. Ps. 78.61; 132.8.
seek His presence constantly.

translations.hebrew: זִכְר֗וּ נִפְלְאוֹתָ֥יו אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֑ה מֹ֝פְתָ֗יו וּמִשְׁפְּטֵי־פִֽיו׃
translations.english:
Remember the wonders He has done,
His portents and the judgments He has pronounced,

translations.hebrew: זֶ֭רַע אַבְרָהָ֣ם עַבְדּ֑וֹ בְּנֵ֖י יַעֲקֹ֣ב בְּחִירָֽיו׃
translations.english:
O offspring of Abraham, His servant,
O descendants of Jacob, His chosen ones.

translations.hebrew: ה֭וּא יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ בְּכׇל־הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ מִשְׁפָּטָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He is the LORD our God;
His judgments are throughout the earth.

translations.hebrew: זָכַ֣ר לְעוֹלָ֣ם בְּרִית֑וֹ דָּבָ֥ר צִ֝וָּ֗ה לְאֶ֣לֶף דּֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
He is ever mindful of His covenant,
the promise He gave for a thousand generations,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּ֭רַת אֶת־אַבְרָהָ֑ם וּשְׁב֖וּעָת֣וֹ לְיִשְׂחָֽק׃
translations.english:
that He made with Abraham,
swore to Isaac,

translations.hebrew: וַיַּעֲמִידֶ֣הָ לְיַעֲקֹ֣ב לְחֹ֑ק לְ֝יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל בְּרִ֣ית עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
and confirmed in a decree for Jacob,
for Israel, as an eternal covenant,

translations.hebrew: לֵאמֹ֗ר לְךָ֗ אֶתֵּ֥ן אֶת־אֶֽרֶץ־כְּנָ֑עַן חֶ֝֗בֶל נַחֲלַתְכֶֽם׃
translations.english:
saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
as your allotted heritage.”

translations.hebrew: בִּֽ֭הְיוֹתָם מְתֵ֣י מִסְפָּ֑ר כִּ֝מְעַ֗ט וְגָרִ֥ים בָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
They were then few in number,
a mere handful, sojourning there,

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יִּֽתְהַלְּכוּ מִגּ֣וֹי אֶל־גּ֑וֹי מִ֝מַּמְלָכָ֗ה אֶל־עַ֥ם אַחֵֽר׃
translations.english:
wandering from nation to nation,
from one kingdom to another.

translations.hebrew: לֹא־הִנִּ֣יחַ אָדָ֣ם לְעׇשְׁקָ֑ם וַיּ֖וֹכַח עֲלֵיהֶ֣ם מְלָכִֽים׃
translations.english:
He allowed no one to oppress them;
He reproved kings on their account,

translations.hebrew: אַֽל־תִּגְּע֥וּ בִמְשִׁיחָ֑י וְ֝לִנְבִיאַ֗י אַל־תָּרֵֽעוּ׃
translations.english:
“Do not touch My anointed ones;
do not harm My prophets.”

translations.hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א רָ֭עָב עַל־הָאָ֑רֶץ כׇּֽל־מַטֵּה־לֶ֥חֶם שָׁבָֽר׃
translations.english:
He called down a famine on the land,
destroyed every staff of bread.

translations.hebrew: שָׁלַ֣ח לִפְנֵיהֶ֣ם אִ֑ישׁ לְ֝עֶ֗בֶד נִמְכַּ֥ר יוֹסֵֽף׃
translations.english:
He sent ahead of them a man,
Joseph, sold into slavery.

translations.hebrew: עִנּ֣וּ בַכֶּ֣בֶל (רגליו) [רַגְל֑וֹ] בַּ֝רְזֶ֗ל בָּ֣אָה נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
His feet were subjected to fetters;
an iron collar was put on his neck.

translations.hebrew: עַד־עֵ֥ת בֹּא־דְבָר֑וֹ אִמְרַ֖ת יְהֹוָ֣ה צְרָפָֽתְהוּ׃
translations.english:
Until his prediction came true
the decree of the LORD purged him.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֣לַח מֶ֭לֶךְ וַיַּתִּירֵ֑הוּ מֹשֵׁ֥ל עַ֝מִּ֗ים וַֽיְפַתְּחֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
The king sent to have him freed;
the ruler of nations released him.

translations.hebrew: שָׂמ֣וֹ אָד֣וֹן לְבֵית֑וֹ וּ֝מֹשֵׁ֗ל בְּכׇל־קִנְיָנֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He made him the lord of his household,
empowered him over all his possessions,

translations.hebrew: לֶאְסֹ֣ר שָׂרָ֣יו בְּנַפְשׁ֑וֹ וּזְקֵנָ֥יו יְחַכֵּֽם׃
translations.english:
to discipline his princes at will,
to teach his elders wisdom.

translations.hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל מִצְרָ֑יִם וְ֝יַעֲקֹ֗ב גָּ֣ר בְּאֶֽרֶץ־חָֽם׃
translations.english:
Then Israel came to Egypt;
Jacob sojourned in the land of Ham.

translations.hebrew: וַיֶּ֣פֶר אֶת־עַמּ֣וֹ מְאֹ֑ד וַ֝יַּעֲצִמֵ֗הוּ מִצָּרָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He made His people very fruitful,
more numerous than their foes.

translations.hebrew: הָפַ֣ךְ לִ֭בָּם לִשְׂנֹ֣א עַמּ֑וֹ לְ֝הִתְנַכֵּ֗ל בַּעֲבָדָֽיו׃
translations.english:
bOr “Their heart changed.”He changed their heart-b to hate His people,
to plot against His servants.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֭לַח מֹשֶׁ֣ה עַבְדּ֑וֹ אַ֝הֲרֹ֗ן אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּחַר־בּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He sent His servant Moses,
and Aaron, whom He had chosen.

translations.hebrew: שָֽׂמוּ־בָ֭ם דִּבְרֵ֣י אֹתוֹתָ֑יו וּ֝מֹפְתִ֗ים בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חָֽם׃
translations.english:
They performed His signs among them,
His wonders, against the land of Ham.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֣לַֽח חֹ֭שֶׁךְ וַיַּחְשִׁ֑ךְ וְלֹא־מָ֝ר֗וּ אֶת־[דְּבָרֽוֹ] (דבריו)׃
translations.english:
He sent darkness; it was very dark;
cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.did they not defy His word?-c

translations.hebrew: הָפַ֣ךְ אֶת־מֵימֵיהֶ֣ם לְדָ֑ם וַ֝יָּ֗מֶת אֶת־דְּגָתָֽם׃
translations.english:
He turned their waters into blood
and killed their fish.

translations.hebrew: שָׁרַ֣ץ אַרְצָ֣ם צְפַרְדְּעִ֑ים בְּ֝חַדְרֵ֗י מַלְכֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Their land teemed with frogs,
even the rooms of their king.

translations.hebrew: אָ֭מַר וַיָּבֹ֣א עָרֹ֑ב כִּ֝נִּ֗ים בְּכׇל־גְּבוּלָֽם׃
translations.english:
Swarms of insects came at His command,
lice, throughout their country.

translations.hebrew: נָתַ֣ן גִּשְׁמֵיהֶ֣ם בָּרָ֑ד אֵ֖שׁ לֶהָב֣וֹת בְּאַרְצָֽם׃
translations.english:
He gave them hail for rain,
and flaming fire in their land.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ גַּ֭פְנָם וּתְאֵנָתָ֑ם וַ֝יְשַׁבֵּ֗ר עֵ֣ץ גְּבוּלָֽם׃
translations.english:
He struck their vines and fig trees,
broke down the trees of their country.

translations.hebrew: אָ֭מַר וַיָּבֹ֣א אַרְבֶּ֑ה וְ֝יֶ֗לֶק וְאֵ֣ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
translations.english:
Locusts came at His command,
grasshoppers without number.

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אכַל כׇּל־עֵ֣שֶׂב בְּאַרְצָ֑ם וַ֝יֹּ֗אכַל פְּרִ֣י אַדְמָתָֽם׃
translations.english:
They devoured every green thing in the land;
they consumed the produce of the soil.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּ֣ךְ כׇּל־בְּכ֣וֹר בְּאַרְצָ֑ם רֵ֝אשִׁ֗ית לְכׇל־אוֹנָֽם׃
translations.english:
He struck down every first-born in the land,
the first fruit of their vigor.

translations.hebrew: וַֽ֭יּוֹצִיאֵם בְּכֶ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֑ב וְאֵ֖ין בִּשְׁבָטָ֣יו כּוֹשֵֽׁל׃
translations.english:
He led IsraeldLit. “them.” out with silver and gold;
none among their tribes faltered.

translations.hebrew: שָׂמַ֣ח מִצְרַ֣יִם בְּצֵאתָ֑ם כִּֽי־נָפַ֖ל פַּחְדָּ֣ם עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Egypt rejoiced when they left,
for dread of IsraeldLit. “them.” had fallen upon them.

translations.hebrew: פָּרַ֣שׂ עָנָ֣ן לְמָסָ֑ךְ וְ֝אֵ֗שׁ לְהָאִ֥יר לָֽיְלָה׃
translations.english:
He spread a cloud for a cover,
and fire to light up the night.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֭אַל וַיָּבֵ֣א שְׂלָ֑ו וְלֶ֥חֶם שָׁ֝מַ֗יִם יַשְׂבִּיעֵֽם׃
translations.english:
They asked and He brought them quail,
and satisfied them with food from heaven.

translations.hebrew: פָּ֣תַח צ֭וּר וַיָּז֣וּבוּ מָ֑יִם הָ֝לְכ֗וּ בַּצִּיּ֥וֹת נָהָֽר׃
translations.english:
He opened a rock so that water gushed forth;
it flowed as a stream in the parched land.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־זָ֭כַר אֶת־דְּבַ֣ר קׇדְשׁ֑וֹ אֶֽת־אַבְרָהָ֥ם עַבְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Mindful of His sacred promise
to His servant Abraham,

translations.hebrew: וַיּוֹצִ֣א עַמּ֣וֹ בְשָׂשׂ֑וֹן בְּ֝רִנָּ֗ה אֶת־בְּחִירָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He led His people out in gladness,
His chosen ones with joyous song.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לָ֭הֶם אַרְצ֣וֹת גּוֹיִ֑ם וַעֲמַ֖ל לְאֻמִּ֣ים יִירָֽשׁוּ׃
translations.english:
He gave them the lands of nations;
they inherited the wealth of peoples,

translations.hebrew: בַּעֲב֤וּר ׀ יִשְׁמְר֣וּ חֻ֭קָּיו וְתוֹרֹתָ֥יו יִנְצֹ֗רוּ הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
that they might keep His laws
and observe His teachings.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Hallelujah.
Praise the LORD for He is good;
His steadfast love is eternal.

translations.hebrew: מִ֗י יְ֭מַלֵּל גְּבוּר֣וֹת יְהֹוָ֑ה יַ֝שְׁמִ֗יעַ כׇּל־תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who can tell the mighty acts of the LORD,
proclaim all His praises?

translations.hebrew: אַ֭שְׁרֵי שֹׁמְרֵ֣י מִשְׁפָּ֑ט עֹשֵׂ֖ה צְדָקָ֣ה בְכׇל־עֵֽת׃
translations.english:
Happy are those who act justly,
who do right at all times.

translations.hebrew: זׇכְרֵ֣נִי יְ֭הֹוָה בִּרְצ֣וֹן עַמֶּ֑ךָ פׇּ֝קְדֵ֗נִי בִּישׁוּעָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Be mindful of me, O LORD, when You favor Your people;
take note of me when You deliver them,

translations.hebrew: לִרְא֤וֹת ׀ בְּט֘וֹבַ֤ת בְּחִירֶ֗יךָ לִ֭שְׂמֹחַ בְּשִׂמְחַ֣ת גּוֹיֶ֑ךָ לְ֝הִתְהַלֵּ֗ל עִם־נַחֲלָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
that I may enjoy the prosperity of Your chosen ones,
share the joy of Your nation,
glory in Your very own people.

translations.hebrew: חָטָ֥אנוּ עִם־אֲבוֹתֵ֗ינוּ הֶעֱוִ֥ינוּ הִרְשָֽׁעְנוּ׃
translations.english:
We have sinned like our forefathers;
we have gone astray, done evil.

translations.hebrew: אֲב֘וֹתֵ֤ינוּ בְמִצְרַ֨יִם ׀ לֹא־הִשְׂכִּ֬ילוּ נִפְלְאוֹתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א זָ֭כְרוּ אֶת־רֹ֣ב חֲסָדֶ֑יךָ וַיַּמְר֖וּ עַל־יָ֣ם בְּיַם־סֽוּף׃
translations.english:
Our forefathers in Egypt did not perceive Your wonders;
they did not remember Your abundant love,
but rebelled at the sea, at the Sea of Reeds.

translations.hebrew: וַֽ֭יּוֹשִׁיעֵם לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמ֑וֹ לְ֝הוֹדִ֗יעַ אֶת־גְּבוּרָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Yet He saved them, as befits His name,
to make known His might.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּגְעַ֣ר בְּיַם־ס֭וּף וַֽיֶּחֱרָ֑ב וַיּוֹלִיכֵ֥ם בַּ֝תְּהֹמ֗וֹת כַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
translations.english:
He sent His blast against the Sea of Reeds;
it became dry;
He led them through the deep as through a wilderness.

translations.hebrew: וַֽ֭יּוֹשִׁיעֵם מִיַּ֣ד שׂוֹנֵ֑א וַ֝יִּגְאָלֵ֗ם מִיַּ֥ד אוֹיֵֽב׃
translations.english:
He delivered them from the foe,
redeemed them from the enemy.

translations.hebrew: וַיְכַסּוּ־מַ֥יִם צָרֵיהֶ֑ם אֶחָ֥ד מֵ֝הֶ֗ם לֹ֣א נוֹתָֽר׃
translations.english:
Water covered their adversaries;
not one of them was left.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּאֲמִ֥ינוּ בִדְבָרָ֑יו יָ֝שִׁ֗ירוּ תְּהִלָּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Then they believed His promise,
and sang His praises.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭הֲרוּ שָׁכְח֣וּ מַעֲשָׂ֑יו לֹא־חִ֝כּ֗וּ לַעֲצָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
But they soon forgot His deeds;
they would not wait to learn His plan.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּתְאַוּ֣וּ תַ֭אֲוָה בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וַיְנַסּוּ־אֵ֝֗ל בִּישִׁימֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
They were seized with craving in the wilderness,
and put God to the test in the wasteland.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן לָ֭הֶם שֶׁאֱלָתָ֑ם וַיְשַׁלַּ֖ח רָז֣וֹן בְּנַפְשָֽׁם׃
translations.english:
He gave them what they asked for,
then made them waste away.

translations.hebrew: וַיְקַנְא֣וּ לְ֭מֹשֶׁה בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה לְ֝אַהֲרֹ֗ן קְד֣וֹשׁ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
There was envy of Moses in the camp,
and of Aaron, the holy one of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: תִּפְתַּח־אֶ֭רֶץ וַתִּבְלַ֣ע דָּתָ֑ן וַ֝תְּכַ֗ס עַל־עֲדַ֥ת אֲבִירָֽם׃
translations.english:
The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan,
closed over the party of Abiram.

translations.hebrew: וַתִּבְעַר־אֵ֥שׁ בַּעֲדָתָ֑ם לֶ֝הָבָ֗ה תְּלַהֵ֥ט רְשָׁעִֽים׃
translations.english:
A fire blazed among their party,
a flame that consumed the wicked.

translations.hebrew: יַעֲשׂוּ־עֵ֥גֶל בְּחֹרֵ֑ב וַ֝יִּשְׁתַּחֲו֗וּ לְמַסֵּכָֽה׃
translations.english:
They made a calf at Horeb
and bowed down to a molten image.

translations.hebrew: וַיָּמִ֥ירוּ אֶת־כְּבוֹדָ֑ם בְּתַבְנִ֥ית שׁ֝֗וֹר אֹכֵ֥ל עֵֽשֶׂב׃
translations.english:
They exchanged their glory
for the image of a bull that feeds on grass.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֭כְחוּ אֵ֣ל מוֹשִׁיעָ֑ם עֹשֶׂ֖ה גְדֹל֣וֹת בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
They forgot God who saved them,
who performed great deeds in Egypt,

translations.hebrew: נִ֭פְלָאוֹת בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חָ֑ם נ֝וֹרָא֗וֹת עַל־יַם־סֽוּף׃
translations.english:
wondrous deeds in the land of Ham,
awesome deeds at the Sea of Reeds.

translations.hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר לְֽהַשְׁמִ֫ידָ֥ם לוּלֵ֡י מֹ֘שֶׁ֤ה בְחִיר֗וֹ עָמַ֣ד בַּפֶּ֣רֶץ לְפָנָ֑יו לְהָשִׁ֥יב חֲ֝מָת֗וֹ מֵהַשְׁחִֽית׃
translations.english:
He would have destroyed them
had not Moses His chosen one
confronted Him in the breach
to avert His destructive wrath.

translations.hebrew: וַֽ֭יִּמְאֲסוּ בְּאֶ֣רֶץ חֶמְדָּ֑ה לֹא־הֶ֝אֱמִ֗ינוּ לִדְבָרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
They rejected the desirable land,
and put no faith in His promise.

translations.hebrew: וַיֵּרָגְנ֥וּ בְאׇהֳלֵיהֶ֑ם לֹ֥א שָׁ֝מְע֗וּ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
They grumbled in their tents
and disobeyed the LORD.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּשָּׂ֣א יָד֣וֹ לָהֶ֑ם לְהַפִּ֥יל א֝וֹתָ֗ם בַּמִּדְבָּֽר׃
translations.english:
So He raised His hand in oath
to make them fall in the wilderness,

translations.hebrew: וּלְהַפִּ֣יל זַ֭רְעָם בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם וּ֝לְזָרוֹתָ֗ם בָּאֲרָצֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
to disperseaCf. Targum, Kimhi. their offspring among the nations
and scatter them through the lands.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יִּצָּ֣מְדוּ לְבַ֣עַל פְּע֑וֹר וַ֝יֹּאכְל֗וּ זִבְחֵ֥י מֵתִֽים׃
translations.english:
They attached themselves to Baal Peor,
ate sacrifices offered to the dead.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יַּכְעִיסוּ בְּמַ֥עַלְלֵיהֶ֑ם וַתִּפְרׇץ־בָּ֝֗ם מַגֵּפָֽה׃
translations.english:
They provoked anger by their deeds,
and a plague broke out among them.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּעֲמֹ֣ד פִּֽ֭ינְחָס וַיְפַלֵּ֑ל וַ֝תֵּעָצַ֗ר הַמַּגֵּפָֽה׃
translations.english:
Phinehas stepped forth and intervened,
and the plague ceased.

translations.hebrew: וַתֵּחָ֣שֶׁב ל֭וֹ לִצְדָקָ֑ה לְדֹ֥ר וָ֝דֹ֗ר עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
It was reckoned to his merit
for all generations, to eternity.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יַּקְצִיפוּ עַל־מֵ֥י מְרִיבָ֑ה וַיֵּ֥רַע לְ֝מֹשֶׁ֗ה בַּעֲבוּרָֽם׃
translations.english:
They provoked wrath at the waters of Meribah
and Moses suffered on their account,

translations.hebrew: כִּי־הִמְר֥וּ אֶת־רוּח֑וֹ וַ֝יְבַטֵּ֗א בִּשְׂפָתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
because they rebelled against Him
and he spoke rashly.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־הִ֭שְׁמִידוּ אֶת־הָעַמִּ֑ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר אָמַ֖ר יְהֹוָ֣ה לָהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
They did not destroy the nations
as the LORD had commanded them,

translations.hebrew: וַיִּתְעָרְב֥וּ בַגּוֹיִ֑ם וַֽ֝יִּלְמְד֗וּ מַעֲשֵׂיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
but mingled with the nations
and learned their ways.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּעַבְד֥וּ אֶת־עֲצַבֵּיהֶ֑ם וַיִּהְי֖וּ לָהֶ֣ם לְמוֹקֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
They worshiped their idols,
which became a snare for them.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּזְבְּח֣וּ אֶת־בְּ֭נֵיהֶם וְאֶת־בְּנוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם לַשֵּׁדִֽים׃
translations.english:
Their own sons and daughters
they sacrificed to demons.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּ֥שְׁפְּכ֨וּ דָ֪ם נָקִ֡י דַּם־בְּנֵ֘יהֶ֤ם וּֽבְנוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר זִ֭בְּחוּ לַעֲצַבֵּ֣י כְנָ֑עַן וַתֶּחֱנַ֥ף הָ֝אָ֗רֶץ בַּדָּמִֽים׃
translations.english:
They shed innocent blood,
the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan;
so the land was polluted with bloodguilt.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּטְמְא֥וּ בְמַעֲשֵׂיהֶ֑ם וַ֝יִּזְנ֗וּ בְּמַ֥עַלְלֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Thus they became defiled by their acts,
debauched through their deeds.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּחַר־אַ֣ף יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּעַמּ֑וֹ וַ֝יְתָעֵ֗ב אֶת־נַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The LORD was angry with His people
and He abhorred His inheritance.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּתְּנֵ֥ם בְּיַד־גּוֹיִ֑ם וַֽיִּמְשְׁל֥וּ בָ֝הֶ֗ם שֹׂנְאֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
He handed them over to the nations;
their foes ruled them.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּלְחָצ֥וּם אוֹיְבֵיהֶ֑ם וַ֝יִּכָּנְע֗וּ תַּ֣חַת יָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
Their enemies oppressed them
and they were subject to their power.

translations.hebrew: פְּעָמִ֥ים רַבּ֗וֹת יַצִּ֫ילֵ֥ם וְ֭הֵמָּה יַמְר֣וּ בַעֲצָתָ֑ם וַ֝יָּמֹ֗כּוּ בַּעֲוֺנָֽם׃
translations.english:
He saved them time and again,
but they were deliberately rebellious,
and so they were brought low by their iniquity.

translations.hebrew: וַ֭יַּרְא בַּצַּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם בְּ֝שׇׁמְע֗וֹ אֶת־רִנָּתָֽם׃
translations.english:
When He saw that they were in distress,
when He heard their cry,

translations.hebrew: וַיִּזְכֹּ֣ר לָהֶ֣ם בְּרִית֑וֹ וַ֝יִּנָּחֵ֗ם כְּרֹ֣ב חֲסָדָֽו׃
translations.english:
He was mindful of His covenant
and in His great faithfulness relented.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן אוֹתָ֣ם לְרַחֲמִ֑ים לִ֝פְנֵ֗י כׇּל־שׁוֹבֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english: He made all their captors kindly disposed toward them.

translations.hebrew: הֽוֹשִׁיעֵ֨נוּ ׀ יְ֘הֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֗ינוּ וְקַבְּצֵנוּ֮ מִֽן־הַגּ֫וֹיִ֥ם לְ֭הֹדוֹת לְשֵׁ֣ם קׇדְשֶׁ֑ךָ לְ֝הִשְׁתַּבֵּ֗חַ בִּתְהִלָּתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Deliver us, O LORD our God,
and gather us from among the nations,
to acclaim Your holy name,
to glory in Your praise.

translations.hebrew: בָּ֤רֽוּךְ־יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵ֪י יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל מִן־הָ֤עוֹלָ֨ם ׀ וְעַ֬ד הָעוֹלָ֗ם וְאָמַ֖ר כׇּל־הָעָ֥ם אָמֵ֗ן הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Blessed is the LORD, God of Israel,
From eternity to eternity.
Let all the people say, “Amen.”
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: הֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
“Praise the LORD, for He is good;
His steadfast love is eternal!”

translations.hebrew: יֹ֭אמְרוּ גְּאוּלֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר גְּ֝אָלָ֗ם מִיַּד־צָֽר׃
translations.english:
Thus let the redeemed of the LORD say,
those He redeemed from adversity,

translations.hebrew: וּֽמֵאֲרָצ֗וֹת קִ֫בְּצָ֥ם מִמִּזְרָ֥ח וּמִֽמַּעֲרָ֑ב מִצָּפ֥וֹן וּמִיָּֽם׃
translations.english:
whom He gathered in from the lands,
from east and west,
from the north and from the sea.

translations.hebrew: תָּע֣וּ בַ֭מִּדְבָּר בִּישִׁימ֣וֹן דָּ֑רֶךְ עִ֥יר מ֝וֹשָׁ֗ב לֹ֣א מָצָֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
Some lost their way in the wilderness,
in the wasteland;
they found no settled place.

translations.hebrew: רְעֵבִ֥ים גַּם־צְמֵאִ֑ים נַ֝פְשָׁ֗ם בָּהֶ֥ם תִּתְעַטָּֽף׃
translations.english:
Hungry and thirsty,
their spirit failed.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּצְעֲק֣וּ אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בַּצַּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם מִ֝מְּצ֥וּקוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם יַצִּילֵֽם׃
translations.english:
In their adversity they cried to the LORD,
and He rescued them from their troubles.

translations.hebrew: וַֽ֭יַּדְרִיכֵם בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ יְשָׁרָ֑ה לָ֝לֶ֗כֶת אֶל־עִ֥יר מוֹשָֽׁב׃
translations.english:
He showed them a direct way
to reach a settled place.

translations.hebrew: יוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love,
His wondrous deeds for mankind;

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הִ֭שְׂבִּיעַ נֶ֣פֶשׁ שֹׁקֵקָ֑ה וְנֶ֥פֶשׁ רְ֝עֵבָ֗ה מִלֵּא־טֽוֹב׃
translations.english:
for He has satisfied the thirsty,
filled the hungry with all good things.

translations.hebrew: יֹ֭שְׁבֵי חֹ֣שֶׁךְ וְצַלְמָ֑וֶת אֲסִירֵ֖י עֳנִ֣י וּבַרְזֶֽל׃
translations.english:
Some lived in deepest darkness,
bound in cruel irons,

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הִמְר֥וּ אִמְרֵי־אֵ֑ל וַעֲצַ֖ת עֶלְי֣וֹן נָאָֽצוּ׃
translations.english:
because they defied the word of God,
spurned the counsel of the Most High.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּכְנַ֣ע בֶּעָמָ֣ל לִבָּ֑ם כָּ֝שְׁל֗וּ וְאֵ֣ין עֹזֵֽר׃
translations.english:
He humbled their hearts through suffering;
they stumbled with no one to help.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּזְעֲק֣וּ אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בַּצַּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם מִ֝מְּצֻ֥קוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם יוֹשִׁיעֵֽם׃
translations.english:
In their adversity they cried to the LORD,
and He rescued them from their troubles.

translations.hebrew: י֭וֹצִיאֵם מֵחֹ֣שֶׁךְ וְצַלְמָ֑וֶת וּמוֹסְר֖וֹתֵיהֶ֣ם יְנַתֵּֽק׃
translations.english:
He brought them out of deepest darkness,
broke their bonds asunder.

translations.hebrew: יוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love,
His wondrous deeds for mankind;

translations.hebrew: כִּי־שִׁ֭בַּר דַּלְת֣וֹת נְחֹ֑שֶׁת וּבְרִיחֵ֖י בַרְזֶ֣ל גִּדֵּֽעַ׃
translations.english:
for He shattered gates of bronze,
He broke their iron bars.

translations.hebrew: אֱ֭וִלִים מִדֶּ֣רֶךְ פִּשְׁעָ֑ם וּֽ֝מֵעֲוֺ֥נֹתֵיהֶ֗ם יִתְעַנּֽוּ׃
translations.english:
There were fools who suffered for their sinful way,
and for their iniquities.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־אֹ֭כֶל תְּתַעֵ֣ב נַפְשָׁ֑ם וַ֝יַּגִּ֗יעוּ עַד־שַׁ֥עֲרֵי מָֽוֶת׃
translations.english:
All food was loathsome to them;
they reached the gates of death.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּזְעֲק֣וּ אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בַּצַּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם מִ֝מְּצֻ֥קוֹתֵיהֶ֗ם יוֹשִׁיעֵֽם׃
translations.english:
In their adversity they cried to the LORD
and He saved them from their troubles.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׁלַ֣ח דְּ֭בָרוֹ וְיִרְפָּאֵ֑ם וִ֝ימַלֵּ֗ט מִשְּׁחִֽיתוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
He gave an order and healed them;
He delivered them from the pits.aViz., of death.

translations.hebrew: יוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love,
His wondrous deeds for mankind.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭יִזְבְּחוּ זִבְחֵ֣י תוֹדָ֑ה וִיסַפְּר֖וּ מַעֲשָׂ֣יו בְּרִנָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Let them offer thanksgiving sacrifices,
and tell His deeds in joyful song.

translations.hebrew: ׆ יוֹרְדֵ֣י הַ֭יָּם בׇּאֳנִיּ֑וֹת עֹשֵׂ֥י מְ֝לָאכָ֗ה בְּמַ֣יִם רַבִּֽים׃
translations.english:
Others go down to the sea in ships,
ply their trade in the mighty waters;

translations.hebrew: ׆ הֵ֣מָּה רָ֭אוּ מַעֲשֵׂ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו בִּמְצוּלָֽה׃
translations.english:
they have seen the works of the LORD
and His wonders in the deep.

translations.hebrew: ׆ וַיֹּ֗אמֶר וַֽ֭יַּעֲמֵד ר֣וּחַ סְעָרָ֑ה וַתְּרוֹמֵ֥ם גַּלָּֽיו׃
translations.english:
By His word He raised a storm wind
that made the waves surge.

translations.hebrew: ׆ יַעֲל֣וּ שָׁ֭מַיִם יֵרְד֣וּ תְהוֹמ֑וֹת נַ֝פְשָׁ֗ם בְּרָעָ֥ה תִתְמוֹגָֽג׃
translations.english:
Mounting up to the heaven,
plunging down to the depths,
disgorging in their misery,

translations.hebrew: ׆ יָח֣וֹגּוּ וְ֭יָנוּעוּ כַּשִּׁכּ֑וֹר וְכׇל־חׇ֝כְמָתָ֗ם תִּתְבַּלָּֽע׃
translations.english:
they reeled and staggered like a drunken man,
all their skill to no avail.

translations.hebrew: ׆ וַיִּצְעֲק֣וּ אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בַּצַּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם וּֽ֝מִמְּצ֥וּקֹתֵיהֶ֗ם יוֹצִיאֵֽם׃
translations.english:
In their adversity they cried to the LORD,
and He saved them from their troubles.

translations.hebrew: יָקֵ֣ם סְ֭עָרָה לִדְמָמָ֑ה וַ֝יֶּחֱשׁ֗וּ גַּלֵּיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
He reduced the storm to a whisper;
the waves were stilled.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּשְׂמְח֥וּ כִֽי־יִשְׁתֹּ֑קוּ וַ֝יַּנְחֵ֗ם אֶל־מְח֥וֹז חֶפְצָֽם׃
translations.english:
They rejoiced when all was quiet,
and He brought them to the port they desired.

translations.hebrew: יוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה חַסְדּ֑וֹ וְ֝נִפְלְאוֹתָ֗יו לִבְנֵ֥י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
Let them praise the LORD for His steadfast love,
His wondrous deeds for mankind.

translations.hebrew: וִֽ֭ירוֹמְמוּהוּ בִּקְהַל־עָ֑ם וּבְמוֹשַׁ֖ב זְקֵנִ֣ים יְהַלְלֽוּהוּ׃
translations.english:
Let them exalt Him in the congregation of the people,
acclaim Him in the assembly of the elders.

translations.hebrew: יָשֵׂ֣ם נְהָר֣וֹת לְמִדְבָּ֑ר וּמֹצָ֥אֵי מַ֝֗יִם לְצִמָּאֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
He turns the rivers into a wilderness,
springs of water into thirsty land,

translations.hebrew: אֶ֣רֶץ פְּ֭רִי לִמְלֵחָ֑ה מֵ֝רָעַ֗ת י֣וֹשְׁבֵי בָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
fruitful land into a salt marsh,
because of the wickedness of its inhabitants.

translations.hebrew: יָשֵׂ֣ם מִ֭דְבָּר לַאֲגַם־מַ֑יִם וְאֶ֥רֶץ צִ֝יָּ֗ה לְמֹצָ֥אֵי מָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
He turns the wilderness into pools,
parched land into springs of water.

translations.hebrew: וַיּ֣וֹשֶׁב שָׁ֣ם רְעֵבִ֑ים וַ֝יְכוֹנְנ֗וּ עִ֣יר מוֹשָֽׁב׃
translations.english:
There He settles the hungry;
they build a place to settle in.

translations.hebrew: וַיִּזְרְע֣וּ שָׂ֭דוֹת וַיִּטְּע֣וּ כְרָמִ֑ים וַ֝יַּעֲשׂ֗וּ פְּרִ֣י תְבוּאָֽה׃
translations.english:
They sow fields and plant vineyards
that yield a fruitful harvest.

translations.hebrew: וַיְבָרְכֵ֣ם וַיִּרְבּ֣וּ מְאֹ֑ד וּ֝בְהֶמְתָּ֗ם לֹ֣א יַמְעִֽיט׃
translations.english:
He blesses them and they increase greatly;
and He does not let their cattle decrease,

translations.hebrew: וַיִּמְעֲט֥וּ וַיָּשֹׁ֑חוּ מֵעֹ֖צֶר רָעָ֣ה וְיָגֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
after they had been few and crushed
by oppression, misery, and sorrow.

translations.hebrew: ׆ שֹׁפֵ֣ךְ בּ֭וּז עַל־נְדִיבִ֑ים וַ֝יַּתְעֵ֗ם בְּתֹ֣הוּ לֹא־דָֽרֶךְ׃
translations.english:
He pours contempt on great men
and makes them lose their way in trackless deserts;

translations.hebrew: וַיְשַׂגֵּ֣ב אֶבְי֣וֹן מֵע֑וֹנִי וַיָּ֥שֶׂם כַּ֝צֹּ֗אן מִשְׁפָּחֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
but the needy He secures from suffering,
and increases their families like flocks.

translations.hebrew: יִרְא֣וּ יְשָׁרִ֣ים וְיִשְׂמָ֑חוּ וְכׇל־עַ֝וְלָ֗ה קָ֣פְצָה פִּֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
The upright see it and rejoice;
the mouth of all wrongdoers is stopped.

translations.hebrew: מִי־חָכָ֥ם וְיִשְׁמׇר־אֵ֑לֶּה וְ֝יִתְבּוֹנְנ֗וּ חַֽסְדֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
The wise man will take note of these things;
he will consider the steadfast love of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֖יר מִזְמ֣וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: A song. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: נָכ֣וֹן לִבִּ֣י אֱלֹהִ֑ים אָשִׁ֥ירָה וַ֝אֲזַמְּרָ֗ה אַף־כְּבוֹדִֽי׃
translations.english:
aWith vv. 2–6, cf. Ps. 57.8–12.My heart is firm, O God;
I will sing and chant a hymn with all my soul.

translations.hebrew: ע֭וּרָֽה הַנֵּ֥בֶל וְכִנּ֗וֹר אָעִ֥ירָה שָּֽׁחַר׃
translations.english:
Awake, O harp and lyre!
I will wake the dawn.

translations.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ֖ בָעַמִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה וַ֝אֲזַמֶּרְךָ֗ בַּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
I will praise You among the peoples, O LORD,
sing a hymn to You among the nations;

translations.hebrew: כִּי־גָד֣וֹל מֵעַל־שָׁמַ֣יִם חַסְדֶּ֑ךָ וְֽעַד־שְׁחָקִ֥ים אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
for Your faithfulness is higher than the heavens;
Your steadfastness reaches to the sky.

translations.hebrew: ר֣וּמָה עַל־שָׁמַ֣יִם אֱלֹהִ֑ים וְעַ֖ל כׇּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ כְּבוֹדֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Exalt Yourself over the heavens, O God;
let Your glory be over all the earth!

translations.hebrew: לְ֭מַעַן יֵחָלְצ֣וּן יְדִידֶ֑יךָ הוֹשִׁ֖יעָה יְמִֽינְךָ֣ וַעֲנֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
bWith vv. 7–14, cf. Ps. 60.7–14.That those whom You love may be rescued,
deliver with Your right hand and answer me.

translations.hebrew: אֱלֹהִ֤ים ׀ דִּבֶּ֥ר בְּקׇדְשׁ֗וֹ אֶ֫עְלֹ֥זָה אֲחַלְּקָ֥ה שְׁכֶ֑ם וְעֵ֖מֶק סֻכּ֣וֹת אֲמַדֵּֽד׃
translations.english:
God promised cOr “by His holiness.”in His sanctuary-c
that I would exultingly divide up Shechem,
and measure the Valley of Sukkoth;

translations.hebrew: לִ֤י גִלְעָ֨ד ׀ לִ֤י מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה וְ֭אֶפְרַיִם מָע֣וֹז רֹאשִׁ֑י יְ֝הוּדָ֗ה מְחֹקְקִֽי׃
translations.english:
Gilead and Manasseh would be mine,
Ephraim my chief stronghold,
Judah my scepter;

translations.hebrew: מוֹאָ֤ב ׀ סִ֬יר רַחְצִ֗י עַל־אֱ֭דוֹם אַשְׁלִ֣יךְ נַעֲלִ֑י עֲלֵי־פְ֝לֶ֗שֶׁת אֶתְרוֹעָֽע׃
translations.english:
Moab would be my washbasin;
on Edom I would cast my shoe;
I would raise a shout over Philistia.

translations.hebrew: מִ֣י יֹ֭בִלֵנִי עִ֣יר מִבְצָ֑ר מִ֖י נָחַ֣נִי עַד־אֱדֽוֹם׃
translations.english:
Would that I were brought to the bastion!
Would that I were led to Edom!

translations.hebrew: הֲלֹֽא־אֱלֹהִ֥ים זְנַחְתָּ֑נוּ וְֽלֹא־תֵצֵ֥א אֱ֝לֹהִ֗ים בְּצִבְאֹתֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
But You have rejected us, O God;
God, You do not march with our armies.

translations.hebrew: הָבָה־לָּ֣נוּ עֶזְרָ֣ת מִצָּ֑ר וְ֝שָׁ֗וְא תְּשׁוּעַ֥ת אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
Grant us Your aid against the foe,
for the help of man is worthless.

translations.hebrew: בֵּאלֹהִ֥ים נַֽעֲשֶׂה־חָ֑יִל וְ֝ה֗וּא יָב֥וּס צָרֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
With God we shall triumph;
He will trample our foes.

translations.hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ לְדָוִ֣ד מִזְמ֑וֹר אֱלֹהֵ֥י תְ֝הִלָּתִ֗י אַֽל־תֶּחֱרַֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
For the leader. Of David. A psalm.

O God of my praise,
do not keep aloof,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י פִ֪י רָשָׁ֡ע וּֽפִי־מִ֭רְמָה עָלַ֣י פָּתָ֑חוּ דִּבְּר֥וּ אִ֝תִּ֗י לְשׁ֣וֹן שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
for the wicked and the deceitful
open their mouth against me;
they speak to me with lying tongue.

translations.hebrew: וְדִבְרֵ֣י שִׂנְאָ֣ה סְבָב֑וּנִי וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֥וּנִי חִנָּֽם׃
translations.english:
They encircle me with words of hate;
they attack me without cause.

translations.hebrew: תַּֽחַת־אַהֲבָתִ֥י יִשְׂטְנ֗וּנִי וַאֲנִ֥י תְפִלָּֽה׃
translations.english:
They answer my love with accusation
aOr “but I am all prayer”; meaning of Heb. uncertain, but see v. 7.and I must stand judgment.aOr “but I am all prayer”; meaning of Heb. uncertain, but see v. 7.

translations.hebrew: וַיָּ֘שִׂ֤ימוּ עָלַ֣י רָ֭עָה תַּ֣חַת טוֹבָ֑ה וְ֝שִׂנְאָ֗ה תַּ֣חַת אַהֲבָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
They repay me with evil for good,
with hatred for my love.

translations.hebrew: הַפְקֵ֣ד עָלָ֣יו רָשָׁ֑ע וְ֝שָׂטָ֗ן יַעֲמֹ֥ד עַל־יְמִינֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Appoint a wicked man over him;
may an accuser stand at his right side;

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭הִשָּׁ֣פְטוֹ יֵצֵ֣א רָשָׁ֑ע וּ֝תְפִלָּת֗וֹ תִּֽהְיֶ֥ה לַחֲטָאָֽה׃
translations.english:
may he be tried and convicted;
may he be judged and found guilty.

translations.hebrew: יִֽהְיוּ־יָמָ֥יו מְעַטִּ֑ים פְּ֝קֻדָּת֗וֹ יִקַּ֥ח אַחֵֽר׃
translations.english:
May his days be few;
may another take over bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.his position.-b

translations.hebrew: יִֽהְיוּ־בָנָ֥יו יְתוֹמִ֑ים וְ֝אִשְׁתּ֗וֹ אַלְמָנָֽה׃
translations.english:
May his children be orphans,
his wife a widow.

translations.hebrew: וְנ֤וֹעַ יָנ֣וּעוּ בָנָ֣יו וְשִׁאֵ֑לוּ וְ֝דָרְשׁ֗וּ מֵחׇרְבֽוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
May his children wander from their hovels,
begging in search of [bread].

translations.hebrew: יְנַקֵּ֣שׁ נ֭וֹשֶׁה לְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ וְיָבֹ֖זּוּ זָרִ֣ים יְגִיעֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
May his creditor seize all his possessions;
may strangers plunder his wealth.

translations.hebrew: אַל־יְהִי־ל֭וֹ מֹשֵׁ֣ךְ חָ֑סֶד וְֽאַל־יְהִ֥י ח֝וֹנֵ֗ן לִֽיתוֹמָֽיו׃
translations.english:
May no one show him mercy;
may none pity his orphans;

translations.hebrew: יְהִי־אַחֲרִית֥וֹ לְהַכְרִ֑ית בְּד֥וֹר אַ֝חֵ֗ר יִמַּ֥ח שְׁמָֽם׃
translations.english:
may his posterity be cut off;
may their names be blotted out in the next generation.

translations.hebrew: יִזָּכֵ֤ר ׀ עֲוֺ֣ן אֲ֭בֹתָיו אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה וְחַטַּ֥את אִ֝מּ֗וֹ אַל־תִּמָּֽח׃
translations.english:
May God be ever mindful of his father’s iniquity,
and may the sin of his mother not be blotted out.

translations.hebrew: יִהְי֣וּ נֶגֶד־יְהֹוָ֣ה תָּמִ֑יד וְיַכְרֵ֖ת מֵאֶ֣רֶץ זִכְרָֽם׃
translations.english:
May the LORD be aware of them always
and cause their names to be cut off from the earth,

translations.hebrew: יַ֗עַן אֲשֶׁ֤ר ׀ לֹ֥א זָכַר֮ עֲשׂ֢וֹת חָ֥֫סֶד וַיִּרְדֹּ֡ף אִישׁ־עָנִ֣י וְ֭אֶבְיוֹן וְנִכְאֵ֨ה לֵבָ֬ב לְמוֹתֵֽת׃
translations.english:
because he was not minded to act kindly,
and hounded to death the poor and needy man,
one crushed in spirit.

translations.hebrew: וַיֶּאֱהַ֣ב קְ֭לָלָה וַתְּבוֹאֵ֑הוּ וְֽלֹא־חָפֵ֥ץ בִּ֝בְרָכָ֗ה וַתִּרְחַ֥ק מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
He loved to curse—may a curse come upon him!
He would not bless—may blessing be far from him!

translations.hebrew: וַיִּלְבַּ֥שׁ קְלָלָ֗ה כְּמַ֫דּ֥וֹ וַתָּבֹ֣א כַמַּ֣יִם בְּקִרְבּ֑וֹ וְ֝כַשֶּׁ֗מֶן בְּעַצְמוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
May he be clothed in a curse like a garment,
may it enter his body like water,
his bones like oil.

translations.hebrew: תְּהִי־ל֭וֹ כְּבֶ֣גֶד יַעְטֶ֑ה וּ֝לְמֵ֗זַח תָּמִ֥יד יַחְגְּרֶֽהָ׃
translations.english:
Let it be like the cloak he wraps around him,
like the belt he always wears.

translations.hebrew: זֹ֤את פְּעֻלַּ֣ת שֹׂ֭טְנַי מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהַדֹּבְרִ֥ים רָ֝֗ע עַל־נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
May the LORD thus repay my accusers,
all those who speak evil against me.

translations.hebrew: וְאַתָּ֤ה ׀ יֱ֘הֹוִ֤ה אֲדֹנָ֗י עֲֽשֵׂה־אִ֭תִּי לְמַ֣עַן שְׁמֶ֑ךָ כִּי־ט֥וֹב חַ֝סְדְּךָ֗ הַצִּילֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Now You, O God, my Lord,
act on my behalf as befits Your name.
Good and faithful as You are, save me.

translations.hebrew: כִּי־עָנִ֣י וְאֶבְי֣וֹן אָנֹ֑כִי וְ֝לִבִּ֗י חָלַ֥ל בְּקִרְבִּֽי׃
translations.english:
For I am poor and needy,
and my heart is pierced within me.

translations.hebrew: כְּצֵל־כִּנְטוֹת֥וֹ נֶהֱלָ֑כְתִּי נִ֝נְעַ֗רְתִּי כָּאַרְבֶּֽה׃
translations.english:
I fade away like a lengthening shadow;
I am shaken off like locusts.

translations.hebrew: בִּ֭רְכַּי כָּשְׁל֣וּ מִצּ֑וֹם וּ֝בְשָׂרִ֗י כָּחַ֥שׁ מִשָּֽׁמֶן׃
translations.english:
My knees give way from fasting;
my flesh is lean, has lost its fat.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנִ֤י ׀ הָיִ֣יתִי חֶרְפָּ֣ה לָהֶ֑ם יִ֝רְא֗וּנִי יְנִיע֥וּן רֹאשָֽׁם׃
translations.english:
I am the object of their scorn;
when they see me, they shake their head.

translations.hebrew: עׇ֭זְרֵנִי יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהָ֑י ה֖וֹשִׁיעֵ֣נִי כְחַסְדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Help me, O LORD, my God;
save me in accord with Your faithfulness,

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭יֵדְעוּ כִּי־יָ֣דְךָ זֹּ֑את אַתָּ֖ה יְהֹוָ֣ה עֲשִׂיתָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
that men may know that it is Your hand,
that You, O LORD, have done it.

translations.hebrew: יְקַֽלְלוּ־הֵמָּה֮ וְאַתָּ֢ה תְבָ֫רֵ֥ךְ קָ֤מוּ ׀ וַיֵּבֹ֗שׁוּ וְֽעַבְדְּךָ֥ יִשְׂמָֽח׃
translations.english:
Let them curse, but You bless;
let them rise up, but come to grief,
while Your servant rejoices.

translations.hebrew: יִלְבְּשׁ֣וּ שׂוֹטְנַ֣י כְּלִמָּ֑ה וְיַעֲט֖וּ כַמְעִ֣יל בׇּשְׁתָּֽם׃
translations.english:
My accusers shall be clothed in shame,
wrapped in their disgrace as in a robe.

translations.hebrew: א֘וֹדֶ֤ה יְהֹוָ֣ה מְאֹ֣ד בְּפִ֑י וּבְת֖וֹךְ רַבִּ֣ים אֲהַלְלֶֽנּוּ׃
translations.english:
My mouth shall sing much praise to the LORD;
I will acclaim Him in the midst of a throng,

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יַ֭עֲמֹד לִימִ֣ין אֶבְי֑וֹן לְ֝הוֹשִׁ֗יעַ מִשֹּׁפְטֵ֥י נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
translations.english:
because He stands at the right hand of the needy,
to save him from those who would condemn him.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֗ד מִ֫זְמ֥וֹר נְאֻ֤ם יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ לַֽאדֹנִ֗י שֵׁ֥ב לִֽימִינִ֑י עַד־אָשִׁ֥ית אֹ֝יְבֶ֗יךָ הֲדֹ֣ם לְרַגְלֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Of David. A psalm.

The LORD said to my lord,
“Sit at My right hand
while I make your enemies your footstool.”

translations.hebrew: מַטֵּֽה־עֻזְּךָ֗ יִשְׁלַ֣ח יְ֭הֹוָה מִצִּיּ֑וֹן רְ֝דֵ֗ה בְּקֶ֣רֶב אֹיְבֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
The LORD will stretch forth from Zion your mighty scepter;
hold sway over your enemies!

translations.hebrew: עַמְּךָ֣ נְדָבֹת֮ בְּי֢וֹם חֵ֫ילֶ֥ךָ בְּֽהַדְרֵי־קֹ֭דֶשׁ מֵרֶ֣חֶם מִשְׁחָ֑ר לְ֝ךָ֗ טַ֣ל יַלְדֻתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Your people come forward willingly on your day of battle.
In majestic holiness, from the womb,
from the dawn, yours was the dew of youth.-a

translations.hebrew: נִשְׁבַּ֤ע יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ וְלֹ֥א יִנָּחֵ֗ם אַתָּֽה־כֹהֵ֥ן לְעוֹלָ֑ם עַל־דִּ֝בְרָתִ֗י מַלְכִּי־צֶֽדֶק׃
translations.english:
The LORD has sworn and will not relent,
“You are a priest forever, bOr “after the manner of Melchizedek.”a rightful king by My decree.”-b

translations.hebrew: אֲדֹנָ֥י עַל־יְמִֽינְךָ֑ מָחַ֖ץ בְּיוֹם־אַפּ֣וֹ מְלָכִֽים׃
