translations.english:
The Lord is at your right hand.
He crushes kings in the day of His anger.

translations.hebrew: יָדִ֣ין בַּ֭גּוֹיִם מָלֵ֣א גְוִיּ֑וֹת מָ֥חַץ רֹ֝֗אשׁ עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ רַבָּֽה׃
translations.english:
He works judgment upon the nations,
heaping up bodies,
crushing heads far and wide.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭נַּחַל בַּדֶּ֣רֶךְ יִשְׁתֶּ֑ה עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן יָרִ֥ים רֹֽאשׁ׃
translations.english:
He drinks from the stream on his way;
therefore he holds his head high.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ אוֹדֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה בְּכׇל־לֵבָ֑ב בְּס֖וֹד יְשָׁרִ֣ים וְעֵדָֽה׃
translations.english:
Hallelujah.
I praise the LORD with all my heart
in the assembled congregation of the upright.

translations.hebrew: גְּ֭דֹלִים מַעֲשֵׂ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה דְּ֝רוּשִׁ֗ים לְכׇל־חֶפְצֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
The works of the LORD are great,
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.within reach of all who desire them.-a

translations.hebrew: הוֹד־וְהָדָ֥ר פׇּעֳל֑וֹ וְ֝צִדְקָת֗וֹ עֹמֶ֥דֶת לָעַֽד׃
translations.english:
His deeds are splendid and glorious;
His beneficence is everlasting;

translations.hebrew: זֵ֣כֶר עָ֭שָׂה לְנִפְלְאוֹתָ֑יו חַנּ֖וּן וְרַח֣וּם יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
He has won renown for His wonders.
The LORD is gracious and compassionate;

translations.hebrew: טֶ֭רֶף נָתַ֣ן לִירֵאָ֑יו יִזְכֹּ֖ר לְעוֹלָ֣ם בְּרִיתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He gives food to those who fear Him;
He is ever mindful of His covenant.

translations.hebrew: כֹּ֣חַ מַ֭עֲשָׂיו הִגִּ֣יד לְעַמּ֑וֹ לָתֵ֥ת לָ֝הֶ֗ם נַחֲלַ֥ת גּוֹיִֽם׃
translations.english:
He revealed to His people His powerful works,
in giving them the heritage of nations.

translations.hebrew: מַעֲשֵׂ֣י יָ֭דָיו אֱמֶ֣ת וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט נֶ֝אֱמָנִ֗ים כׇּל־פִּקּוּדָֽיו׃
translations.english:
His handiwork is truth and justice;
all His precepts are enduring,

translations.hebrew: סְמוּכִ֣ים לָעַ֣ד לְעוֹלָ֑ם עֲ֝שׂוּיִ֗ם בֶּאֱמֶ֥ת וְיָשָֽׁר׃
translations.english:
well-founded for all eternity,
wrought of truth and equity.

translations.hebrew: פְּד֤וּת ׀ שָׁ֘לַ֤ח לְעַמּ֗וֹ צִוָּֽה־לְעוֹלָ֥ם בְּרִית֑וֹ קָד֖וֹשׁ וְנוֹרָ֣א שְׁמֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He sent redemption to His people;
He ordained His covenant for all time;
His name is holy and awesome.

translations.hebrew: רֵ֘אשִׁ֤ית חׇכְמָ֨ה ׀ יִרְאַ֬ת יְהֹוָ֗ה שֵׂ֣כֶל ט֭וֹב לְכׇל־עֹֽשֵׂיהֶ֑ם תְּ֝הִלָּת֗וֹ עֹמֶ֥דֶת לָעַֽד׃
translations.english:
The beginningbOr “chief part.” of wisdom is the fear of the LORD;
all who practice it gain sound understanding.
Praise of Him is everlasting.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ אַשְׁרֵי־אִ֭ישׁ יָרֵ֣א אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּ֝מִצְוֺתָ֗יו חָפֵ֥ץ מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
Hallelujah.
Happy is the man who fears the LORD,
who is ardently devoted to His commandments.

translations.hebrew: גִּבּ֣וֹר בָּ֭אָרֶץ יִהְיֶ֣ה זַרְע֑וֹ דּ֖וֹר יְשָׁרִ֣ים יְבֹרָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
His descendants will be mighty in the land,

a blessed generation of upright men.

translations.hebrew: הוֹן־וָעֹ֥שֶׁר בְּבֵית֑וֹ וְ֝צִדְקָת֗וֹ עֹמֶ֥דֶת לָעַֽד׃
translations.english:
Wealth and riches are in his house,
and his beneficence lasts forever.

translations.hebrew: זָ֘רַ֤ח בַּחֹ֣שֶׁךְ א֭וֹר לַיְשָׁרִ֑ים חַנּ֖וּן וְרַח֣וּם וְצַדִּֽיק׃
translations.english:
aOr “He shines as a light.”A light shines-a for the upright in the darkness;
he is gracious, compassionate, and beneficent.

translations.hebrew: טֽוֹב־אִ֭ישׁ חוֹנֵ֣ן וּמַלְוֶ֑ה יְכַלְכֵּ֖ל דְּבָרָ֣יו בְּמִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
All goes well with the man who lends generously,
who conducts his affairs with equity.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־לְעוֹלָ֥ם לֹֽא־יִמּ֑וֹט לְזֵ֥כֶר ע֝וֹלָ֗ם יִהְיֶ֥ה צַדִּֽיק׃
translations.english:
He shall never be shaken;
the beneficent man will be remembered forever.

translations.hebrew: מִשְּׁמוּעָ֣ה רָ֭עָה לֹ֣א יִירָ֑א נָכ֥וֹן לִ֝בּ֗וֹ בָּטֻ֥חַ בַּיהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
He is not afraid of evil tidings;
his heart is firm, he trusts in the LORD.

translations.hebrew: סָמ֣וּךְ לִ֭בּוֹ לֹ֣א יִירָ֑א עַ֖ד אֲשֶׁר־יִרְאֶ֣ה בְצָרָֽיו׃
translations.english:
His heart is resolute, he is unafraid;
in the end he will see the fall of his foes.

translations.hebrew: פִּזַּ֤ר ׀ נָ֘תַ֤ן לָאֶבְיוֹנִ֗ים צִ֭דְקָתוֹ עֹמֶ֣דֶת לָעַ֑ד קַ֝רְנ֗וֹ תָּר֥וּם בְּכָבֽוֹד׃
translations.english:
He gives freely to the poor;
his beneficence lasts forever;
his horn is exalted in honor.

translations.hebrew: רָ֘שָׁ֤ע יִרְאֶ֨ה ׀ וְכָעָ֗ס שִׁנָּ֣יו יַחֲרֹ֣ק וְנָמָ֑ס תַּאֲוַ֖ת רְשָׁעִ֣ים תֹּאבֵֽד׃
translations.english:
The wicked man shall see it and be vexed;
he shall gnash his teeth; his courage shall fail.
The desire of the wicked shall come to nothing.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ הַ֭לְלוּ עַבְדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הַֽ֝לְל֗וּ אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Hallelujah.
O servants of the LORD, give praise;
praise the name of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: יְהִ֤י שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֣ה מְבֹרָ֑ךְ מֵ֝עַתָּ֗ה וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
Let the name of the LORD be blessed
now and forever.

translations.hebrew: מִמִּזְרַח־שֶׁ֥מֶשׁ עַד־מְבוֹא֑וֹ מְ֝הֻלָּ֗ל שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
From east to west
the name of the LORD is praised.

translations.hebrew: רָ֖ם עַל־כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֥ם <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה עַ֖ל הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם כְּבוֹדֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The LORD is exalted above all nations;
His glory is above the heavens.

translations.hebrew: מִ֭י כַּיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ הַֽמַּגְבִּיהִ֥י לָשָֽׁבֶת׃
translations.english:
Who is like the LORD our God,
who, enthroned on high,

translations.hebrew: הַֽמַּשְׁפִּילִ֥י לִרְא֑וֹת בַּשָּׁמַ֥יִם וּבָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
sees what is below,
in heaven and on earth?

translations.hebrew: מְקִ֥ימִ֣י מֵעָפָ֣ר דָּ֑ל מֵ֝אַשְׁפֹּ֗ת יָרִ֥ים אֶבְיֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
He raises the poor from the dust,
lifts up the needy from the refuse heap

translations.hebrew: לְהוֹשִׁיבִ֥י עִם־נְדִיבִ֑ים עִ֝֗ם נְדִיבֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
to set them with the great,
with the great men of His people.

translations.hebrew: מֽוֹשִׁיבִ֨י ׀ עֲקֶ֬רֶת הַבַּ֗יִת אֵֽם־הַבָּנִ֥ים שְׂמֵחָ֗ה הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
He sets the childless woman among her household
as a happy mother of children.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: בְּצֵ֣את יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם בֵּ֥ית יַ֝עֲקֹ֗ב מֵעַ֥ם לֹעֵֽז׃
translations.english:
When Israel went forth from Egypt,
the house of Jacob from a people of strange speech,

translations.hebrew: הָיְתָ֣ה יְהוּדָ֣ה לְקׇדְשׁ֑וֹ יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל מַמְשְׁלוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Judah became His aOr “sanctuary.”holy one,-a
Israel, His dominion.

translations.hebrew: הַיָּ֣ם רָ֭אָה וַיָּנֹ֑ס הַ֝יַּרְדֵּ֗ן יִסֹּ֥ב לְאָחֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
The sea saw them and fled,
Jordan ran backward,

translations.hebrew: הֶ֭הָרִים רָקְד֣וּ כְאֵילִ֑ים גְּ֝בָע֗וֹת כִּבְנֵי־צֹֽאן׃
translations.english:
mountains skipped like rams,
hills like sheep.

translations.hebrew: מַה־לְּךָ֣ הַ֭יָּם כִּ֣י תָנ֑וּס הַ֝יַּרְדֵּ֗ן תִּסֹּ֥ב לְאָחֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
What alarmed you, O sea, that you fled,
Jordan, that you ran backward,

translations.hebrew: הֶ֭הָרִים תִּרְקְד֣וּ כְאֵילִ֑ים גְּ֝בָע֗וֹת כִּבְנֵי־צֹֽאן׃
translations.english:
mountains, that you skipped like rams,
hills, like sheep?

translations.hebrew: מִלִּפְנֵ֣י אָ֭דוֹן ח֣וּלִי אָ֑רֶץ מִ֝לִּפְנֵ֗י אֱל֣וֹהַּ יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
at the presence of the God of Jacob,

translations.hebrew: הַהֹפְכִ֣י הַצּ֣וּר אֲגַם־מָ֑יִם חַ֝לָּמִ֗ישׁ לְמַעְיְנוֹ־מָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
who turned the rock into a pool of water,
the flinty rock into a fountain.

translations.hebrew: לֹ֤א לָ֥נוּ יְהֹוָ֗ה לֹ֫א־לָ֥נוּ כִּֽי־לְ֭שִׁמְךָ תֵּ֣ן כָּב֑וֹד עַל־חַ֝סְדְּךָ֗ עַל־אֲמִתֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Not to us, O LORD, not to us
but to Your name bring glory
for the sake of Your love and Your faithfulness.

translations.hebrew: לָ֭מָּה יֹאמְר֣וּ הַגּוֹיִ֑ם אַיֵּה־נָ֝֗א אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Let the nations not say,
“Where, now, is their God?”

translations.hebrew: וֵאלֹהֵ֥ינוּ בַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־חָפֵ֣ץ עָשָֽׂה׃
translations.english:
when our God is in heaven
and all that He wills He accomplishes.

translations.hebrew: עֲֽ֭צַבֵּיהֶם כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֑ב מַ֝עֲשֵׂ֗ה יְדֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
aWith vv. 4–11, cf. Ps. 135.15–20.Their idols are silver and gold,
the work of men’s hands.

translations.hebrew: פֶּֽה־לָ֭הֶם וְלֹ֣א יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ עֵינַ֥יִם לָ֝הֶ֗ם וְלֹ֣א יִרְאֽוּ׃
translations.english:
They have mouths, but cannot speak,
eyes, but cannot see;

translations.hebrew: אׇזְנַ֣יִם לָ֭הֶם וְלֹ֣א יִשְׁמָ֑עוּ אַ֥ף לָ֝הֶ֗ם וְלֹ֣א יְרִיחֽוּן׃
translations.english:
they have ears, but cannot hear,
noses, but cannot smell;

translations.hebrew: יְדֵיהֶ֤ם ׀ וְלֹ֬א יְמִישׁ֗וּן רַ֭גְלֵיהֶם וְלֹ֣א יְהַלֵּ֑כוּ לֹא־יֶ֝הְגּ֗וּ בִּגְרוֹנָֽם׃
translations.english:
they have hands, but cannot touch,
feet, but cannot walk;
they can make no sound in their throats.

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭מוֹהֶם יִהְי֣וּ עֹשֵׂיהֶ֑ם כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־בֹּטֵ֣חַ בָּהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Those who fashion them,
all who trust in them,
shall become like them.

translations.hebrew: יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל בְּטַ֣ח בַּיהֹוָ֑ה עֶזְרָ֖ם וּמָגִנָּ֣ם הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
O Israel, trust in the LORD!
He is their help and shield.

translations.hebrew: בֵּ֣ית אַ֭הֲרֹן בִּטְח֣וּ בַיהֹוָ֑ה עֶזְרָ֖ם וּמָגִנָּ֣ם הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD!
He is their help and shield.

translations.hebrew: יִרְאֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה בִּטְח֣וּ בַיהֹוָ֑ה עֶזְרָ֖ם וּמָגִנָּ֣ם הֽוּא׃
translations.english:
O you who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD!
He is their help and shield.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָה֮ זְכָרָ֢נוּ יְבָ֫רֵ֥ךְ יְ֭בָרֵךְ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל יְ֝בָרֵ֗ךְ אֶת־בֵּ֥ית אַהֲרֹֽן׃
translations.english:
The LORD is mindful of us.
He will bless us;
He will bless the house of Israel;
He will bless the house of Aaron;

translations.hebrew: יְ֭בָרֵךְ יִרְאֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הַ֝קְּטַנִּ֗ים עִם־הַגְּדֹלִֽים׃
translations.english:
He will bless those who fear the LORD,
small and great alike.

translations.hebrew: יֹסֵ֣ף יְהֹוָ֣ה עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם עֲ֝לֵיכֶ֗ם וְעַל־בְּנֵיכֶֽם׃
translations.english:
May the LORD increase your numbers,
yours and your children’s also.

translations.hebrew: בְּרוּכִ֣ים אַ֭תֶּם לַיהֹוָ֑ה עֹ֝שֵׂ֗ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
May you be blessed by the LORD,
Maker of heaven and earth.

translations.hebrew: הַשָּׁמַ֣יִם שָׁ֭מַיִם לַיהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝הָאָ֗רֶץ נָתַ֥ן לִבְנֵי־אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
The heavens belong to the LORD,
but the earth He gave over to man.

translations.hebrew: לֹ֣א הַ֭מֵּתִים יְהַֽלְלוּ־יָ֑הּ וְ֝לֹ֗א כׇּל־יֹרְדֵ֥י דוּמָֽה׃
translations.english:
The dead cannot praise the LORD,
nor any who go down into silence.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲנַ֤חְנוּ ׀ נְבָ֘רֵ֤ךְ יָ֗הּ מֵעַתָּ֥ה וְעַד־עוֹלָ֗ם הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
But we will bless the LORD
now and forever.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: אָ֭הַבְתִּי כִּי־יִשְׁמַ֥ע <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶת־ק֝וֹלִ֗י תַּחֲנוּנָֽי׃
translations.english:
aHeb. transposed for clarity; others “I would love that the Lord hear,” etc.I love the LORD
for He hears-a my voice, my pleas;

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הִטָּ֣ה אׇזְנ֣וֹ לִ֑י וּבְיָמַ֥י אֶקְרָֽא׃
translations.english:
for He turns His ear to me
whenever I call.

translations.hebrew: אֲפָפ֤וּנִי ׀ חֶבְלֵי־מָ֗וֶת וּמְצָרֵ֣י שְׁא֣וֹל מְצָא֑וּנִי צָרָ֖ה וְיָג֣וֹן אֶמְצָֽא׃
translations.english:
The bonds of death encompassed me;
the torments of Sheol overtook me.
I came upon trouble and sorrow

translations.hebrew: וּבְשֵֽׁם־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֶקְרָ֑א אָנָּ֥ה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מַלְּטָ֥ה נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
and I invoked the name of the LORD,
“O LORD, save my life!”

translations.hebrew: חַנּ֣וּן יְהֹוָ֣ה וְצַדִּ֑יק וֵ֖אלֹהֵ֣ינוּ מְרַחֵֽם׃
translations.english:
The LORD is gracious and beneficent;
our God is compassionate.

translations.hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֣ר פְּתָאיִ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה דַּ֝לֹּתִ֗י וְלִ֣י יְהוֹשִֽׁיעַ׃
translations.english:
The LORD protects the simple;
I was brought low and He saved me.

translations.hebrew: שׁוּבִ֣י נַ֭פְשִׁי לִמְנוּחָ֑יְכִי כִּֽי־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה גָּמַ֥ל עָלָֽיְכִי׃
translations.english:
Be at rest, once again, O my soul,
for the LORD has been good to you.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י חִלַּ֥צְתָּ נַפְשִׁ֗י מִ֫מָּ֥וֶת אֶת־עֵינִ֥י מִן־דִּמְעָ֑ה אֶת־רַגְלִ֥י מִדֶּֽחִי׃
translations.english:
YoubI.e., God. have delivered me from death,
my eyes from tears,
my feet from stumbling.

translations.hebrew: אֶ֭תְהַלֵּךְ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּ֝אַרְצ֗וֹת הַחַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
I shall walk before the LORD
in the lands of the living.

translations.hebrew: הֶ֭אֱמַנְתִּי כִּ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר אֲ֝נִ֗י עָנִ֥יתִי מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.I trust [in the LORD];
out of great suffering I spoke-c

translations.hebrew: אֲ֭נִי אָמַ֣רְתִּי בְחׇפְזִ֑י כׇּֽל־הָאָדָ֥ם כֹּזֵֽב׃
translations.english:
and said rashly,
“All men are false.”

translations.hebrew: מָה־אָשִׁ֥יב לַיהֹוָ֑ה כׇּֽל־תַּגְמוּל֥וֹהִי עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
How can I repay the LORD
for all His bounties to me?

translations.hebrew: כּוֹס־יְשׁוּע֥וֹת אֶשָּׂ֑א וּבְשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶקְרָֽא׃
translations.english:
I raise the cup of deliverance
and invoke the name of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: נְ֭דָרַי לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֲשַׁלֵּ֑ם נֶגְדָה־נָּ֝֗א לְכׇל־עַמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
I will pay my vows to the LORD
in the presence of all His people.

translations.hebrew: יָ֭קָר בְּעֵינֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הַ֝מָּ֗וְתָה לַחֲסִידָֽיו׃
translations.english:
The death of His faithful ones
is grievous in the LORD’s sight.

translations.hebrew: אָנָּ֣ה יְהֹוָה֮ כִּי־אֲנִ֢י עַ֫בְדֶּ֥ךָ אֲֽנִי־עַ֭בְדְּךָ בֶּן־אֲמָתֶ֑ךָ פִּ֝תַּ֗חְתָּ לְמֽוֹסֵרָֽי׃
translations.english:
O LORD,
I am Your servant,
Your servant, the son of Your maidservant;
You have undone the cords that bound me.

translations.hebrew: לְֽךָ־אֶ֭זְבַּח זֶ֣בַח תּוֹדָ֑ה וּבְשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶקְרָֽא׃
translations.english:
I will sacrifice a thank offering to You
and invoke the name of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: נְ֭דָרַי לַיהֹוָ֣ה אֲשַׁלֵּ֑ם נֶגְדָה־נָּ֝֗א לְכׇל־עַמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
I will pay my vows to the LORD
in the presence of all His people,

translations.hebrew: בְּחַצְר֤וֹת ׀ בֵּ֤ית יְהֹוָ֗ה בְּֽת֘וֹכֵ֤כִי יְֽרוּשָׁלָ֗͏ִם הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
in the courts of the house of the LORD,
in the midst ofdOthers “of you.” Jerusalem.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: הַֽלְל֣וּ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֑ם שַׁ֝בְּח֗וּהוּ כׇּל־הָאֻמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
Praise the LORD, all you nations;
extol Him, all you peoples,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֥י־גָ֘בַ֤ר עָלֵ֨ינוּ ׀ חַסְדּ֗וֹ וֶאֱמֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה לְעוֹלָ֗ם הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
for great is His steadfast love toward us;
the faithfulness of the LORD endures forever.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Praise the LORD, for He is good,
His steadfast love is eternal.

translations.hebrew: יֹאמַר־נָ֥א יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Let Israel declare,
“His steadfast love is eternal.”

translations.hebrew: יֹאמְרוּ־נָ֥א בֵֽית־אַהֲרֹ֑ן כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Let the house of Aaron declare,
“His steadfast love is eternal.”

translations.hebrew: יֹאמְרוּ־נָ֭א יִרְאֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Let those who fear the LORD declare,
“His steadfast love is eternal.”

translations.hebrew: מִֽן־הַ֭מֵּצַר קָרָ֣אתִי יָּ֑הּ עָנָ֖נִי בַמֶּרְחָ֣ב יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
In distress I called on the LORD;
the Lord answered me and brought me relief.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה לִ֭י לֹ֣א אִירָ֑א מַה־יַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה לִ֣י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
The LORD is on my side,
I have no fear;
what can man do to me?

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֣ה לִ֭י בְּעֹזְרָ֑י וַ֝אֲנִ֗י אֶרְאֶ֥ה בְשֹׂנְאָֽי׃
translations.english:
With the LORD on my side as my helper,
I will see the downfall of my foes.

translations.hebrew: ט֗וֹב לַחֲס֥וֹת בַּיהֹוָ֑ה מִ֝בְּטֹ֗חַ בָּאָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
It is better to take refuge in the LORD
than to trust in mortals;

translations.hebrew: ט֗וֹב לַחֲס֥וֹת בַּיהֹוָ֑ה מִ֝בְּטֹ֗חַ בִּנְדִיבִֽים׃
translations.english:
it is better to take refuge in the LORD
than to trust in the great.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־גּוֹיִ֥ם סְבָב֑וּנִי בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כִּ֣י אֲמִילַֽם׃
translations.english:
All nations have beset me;
by the name of the LORD I will surely aMeaning of ’amilam in this and the following two verses uncertain.cut them down.-a

translations.hebrew: סַבּ֥וּנִי גַם־סְבָב֑וּנִי בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כִּ֣י אֲמִילַֽם׃
translations.english:
They beset me, they surround me;
by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.

translations.hebrew: סַבּ֤וּנִי כִדְבוֹרִ֗ים דֹּ֭עֲכוּ כְּאֵ֣שׁ קוֹצִ֑ים בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כִּ֣י אֲמִילַֽם׃
translations.english:
They have beset me like bees;
they shall be extinguished like burning thorns;
by the name of the LORD I will surely cut them down.

translations.hebrew: דַּחֹ֣ה דְחִיתַ֣נִי לִנְפֹּ֑ל וַ֖יהֹוָ֣ה עֲזָרָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
YoubI.e., the enemy. pressed me hard,
I nearly fell;
but the LORD helped me.

translations.hebrew: עׇזִּ֣י וְזִמְרָ֣ת יָ֑הּ וַֽיְהִי־לִ֝֗י לִישׁוּעָֽה׃
translations.english:
The LORD is my strength and might;cOthers “song.”
He has become my deliverance.

translations.hebrew: ק֤וֹל ׀ רִנָּ֬ה וִישׁוּעָ֗ה בְּאׇהֳלֵ֥י צַדִּיקִ֑ים יְמִ֥ין יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עֹ֣שָׂה חָֽיִל׃
translations.english:
The tents of the victoriousdOr “righteous.” resound with joyous shouts of deliverance,
“The right hand of the LORD is triumphant!

translations.hebrew: יְמִ֣ין יְ֭הֹוָה רוֹמֵמָ֑ה יְמִ֥ין יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה עֹ֣שָׂה חָֽיִל׃
translations.english:
The right hand of the LORD is exalted!
The right hand of the LORD is triumphant!”

translations.hebrew: לֹא־אָמ֥וּת כִּֽי־אֶחְיֶ֑ה וַ֝אֲסַפֵּ֗ר מַעֲשֵׂ֥י יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
I shall not die but live
and proclaim the works of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: יַסֹּ֣ר יִסְּרַ֣נִּי יָּ֑הּ וְ֝לַמָּ֗וֶת לֹ֣א נְתָנָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
The LORD punished me severely,
but did not hand me over to death.

translations.hebrew: פִּתְחוּ־לִ֥י שַׁעֲרֵי־צֶ֑דֶק אָבֹא־בָ֝֗ם אוֹדֶ֥ה יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Open the gates of victoryeOr “righteousness.” for me
that I may enter them and praise the LORD.

translations.hebrew: זֶה־הַשַּׁ֥עַר לַיהֹוָ֑ה צַ֝דִּיקִ֗ים יָבֹ֥אוּ בֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
This is the gateway to the LORD—
the victoriousdOr “righteous.” shall enter through it.

translations.hebrew: א֭וֹדְךָ כִּ֣י עֲנִיתָ֑נִי וַתְּהִי־לִ֝֗י לִישׁוּעָֽה׃
translations.english:
I praise You, for You have answered me,
and have become my deliverance.

translations.hebrew: אֶ֭בֶן מָאֲס֣וּ הַבּוֹנִ֑ים הָ֝יְתָ֗ה לְרֹ֣אשׁ פִּנָּֽה׃
translations.english:
The stone that the builders rejected
has become the chief cornerstone.

translations.hebrew: מֵאֵ֣ת יְ֭הֹוָה הָ֣יְתָה זֹּ֑את הִ֖יא נִפְלָ֣את בְּעֵינֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
This is the LORD’s doing;
it is marvelous in our sight.

translations.hebrew: זֶה־הַ֭יּוֹם עָשָׂ֣ה יְהֹוָ֑ה נָגִ֖ילָה וְנִשְׂמְחָ֣ה בֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
This is the day that the LORD has made—
let us exult and rejoice on it.

translations.hebrew: אָנָּ֣א יְ֭הֹוָה הוֹשִׁ֘יעָ֥ה נָּ֑א אָנָּ֥א יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה הַצְלִ֘יחָ֥ה נָּֽא׃
translations.english:
O LORD, deliver us!
O LORD, let us prosper!

translations.hebrew: בָּר֣וּךְ הַ֭בָּא בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה בֵּ֝רַ֥כְנוּכֶ֗ם מִבֵּ֥ית יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
May he who enters be blessed in the name of the LORD;
we bless you from the House of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: אֵ֤ל ׀ יְהֹוָה֮ וַיָּ֢אֶ֫ר לָ֥נוּ אִסְרוּ־חַ֥ג בַּעֲבֹתִ֑ים עַד־קַ֝רְנ֗וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
translations.english:
The LORD is God;
He has given us light;
fMeaning of Heb. uncertain.bind the festal offering to the horns of the altar with cords.-f

translations.hebrew: אֵלִ֣י אַתָּ֣ה וְאוֹדֶ֑ךָּ אֱ֝לֹהַ֗י אֲרוֹמְמֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
You are my God and I will praise You;
You are my God and I will extol You.

translations.hebrew: הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Praise the LORD for He is good,
His steadfast love is eternal.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֥י תְמִֽימֵי־דָ֑רֶךְ הַ֝הֹלְכִ֗ים בְּתוֹרַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Happy are those whose way is blameless,
who follow the teaching of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭שְׁרֵי נֹצְרֵ֥י עֵדֹתָ֗יו בְּכׇל־לֵ֥ב יִדְרְשֽׁוּהוּ׃
translations.english:
Happy are those who observe His decrees,
who turn to Him wholeheartedly.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭ף לֹא־פָעֲל֣וּ עַוְלָ֑ה בִּדְרָכָ֥יו הָלָֽכוּ׃
translations.english:
They have done no wrong,
but have followed His ways.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭תָּה צִוִּ֥יתָה פִקֻּדֶ֗יךָ לִשְׁמֹ֥ר מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
You have commanded that Your precepts
be kept diligently.

translations.hebrew: אַ֭חֲלַי יִכֹּ֥נוּ דְרָכָ֗י לִשְׁמֹ֥ר חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Would that my ways were firm
in keeping Your laws;

translations.hebrew: אָ֥ז לֹא־אֵב֑וֹשׁ בְּ֝הַבִּיטִ֗י אֶל־כׇּל־מִצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
then I would not be ashamed
when I regard all Your commandments.

translations.hebrew: א֭וֹדְךָ בְּיֹ֣שֶׁר לֵבָ֑ב בְּ֝לׇמְדִ֗י מִשְׁפְּטֵ֥י צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I will praise You with a sincere heart
as I learn Your just rules.

translations.hebrew: אֶת־חֻקֶּ֥יךָ אֶשְׁמֹ֑ר אַֽל־תַּעַזְבֵ֥נִי עַד־מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
I will keep Your laws;
do not utterly forsake me.

translations.hebrew: בַּמֶּ֣ה יְזַכֶּה־נַּ֭עַר אֶת־אׇרְח֑וֹ לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
How can a young man keep his way pure?—
by holding to Your word.

translations.hebrew: בְּכׇל־לִבִּ֥י דְרַשְׁתִּ֑יךָ אַל־תַּ֝שְׁגֵּ֗נִי מִמִּצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I have turned to You with all my heart;
do not let me stray from Your commandments.

translations.hebrew: בְּ֭לִבִּי צָפַ֣נְתִּי אִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ לְ֝מַ֗עַן לֹ֣א אֶחֱטָא־לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
In my heart I treasure Your promise;
therefore I do not sin against You.

translations.hebrew: בָּר֖וּךְ אַתָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֗ה לַמְּדֵ֥נִי חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Blessed are You, O LORD;
train me in Your laws.

translations.hebrew: בִּשְׂפָתַ֥י סִפַּ֑רְתִּי כֹּ֝֗ל מִשְׁפְּטֵי־פִֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
With my lips I rehearse
all the rules You proclaimed.

translations.hebrew: בְּדֶ֖רֶךְ עֵדְוֺתֶ֥יךָ שַּׂ֗שְׂתִּי כְּעַ֣ל כׇּל־הֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
I rejoice over the way of Your decrees
as over all riches.

translations.hebrew: בְּפִקּוּדֶ֥יךָ אָשִׂ֑יחָה וְ֝אַבִּ֗יטָה אֹֽרְחֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I study Your precepts;
I regard Your ways;

translations.hebrew: בְּחֻקֹּתֶ֥יךָ אֶֽשְׁתַּעֲשָׁ֑ע לֹ֖א אֶשְׁכַּ֣ח דְּבָרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I take delight in Your laws;
I will not neglect Your word.

translations.hebrew: גְּמֹ֖ל עַל־עַבְדְּךָ֥ אֶחְיֶ֗ה וְאֶשְׁמְרָ֥ה דְבָרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Deal kindly with Your servant,
that I may live to keep Your word.

translations.hebrew: גַּל־עֵינַ֥י וְאַבִּ֑יטָה נִ֝פְלָא֗וֹת מִתּוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Open my eyes, that I may perceive
the wonders of Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: גֵּ֣ר אָנֹכִ֣י בָאָ֑רֶץ אַל־תַּסְתֵּ֥ר מִ֝מֶּ֗נִּי מִצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I am only a sojourner in the land;
do not hide Your commandments from me.

translations.hebrew: גָּרְסָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֣י לְתַאֲבָ֑ה אֶֽל־מִשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ בְכׇל־עֵֽת׃
translations.english:
My soul is consumed with longing
for Your rules at all times.

translations.hebrew: גָּ֭עַרְתָּ זֵדִ֣ים אֲרוּרִ֑ים הַ֝שֹּׁגִ֗ים מִמִּצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
You blast the accursed insolent ones
who stray from Your commandments.

translations.hebrew: גַּ֣ל מֵ֭עָלַי חֶרְפָּ֣ה וָב֑וּז כִּ֖י עֵדֹתֶ֣יךָ נָצָֽרְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Take away from me taunt and abuse,
because I observe Your decrees.

translations.hebrew: גַּ֤ם יָשְׁב֣וּ שָׂ֭רִים בִּ֣י נִדְבָּ֑רוּ עַ֝בְדְּךָ֗ יָשִׂ֥יחַ בְּחֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Though princes meet and speak against me,
Your servant studies Your laws.

translations.hebrew: גַּֽם־עֵ֭דֹתֶיךָ שַׁעֲשֻׁעָ֗י אַנְשֵׁ֥י עֲצָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
For Your decrees are my delight,
my intimate companions.

translations.hebrew: דָּבְקָ֣ה לֶעָפָ֣ר נַפְשִׁ֑י חַ֝יֵּ֗נִי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My soul clings to the dust;
revive me in accordance with Your word.

translations.hebrew: דְּרָכַ֣י סִ֭פַּרְתִּי וַֽתַּעֲנֵ֗נִי לַמְּדֵ֥נִי חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I have declared my way, and You have answered me;
train me in Your laws.

translations.hebrew: דֶּרֶךְ־פִּקּוּדֶ֥יךָ הֲבִינֵ֑נִי וְ֝אָשִׂ֗יחָה בְּנִפְלְאוֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Make me understand the way of Your precepts,
that I may study Your wondrous acts.

translations.hebrew: דָּלְפָ֣ה נַ֭פְשִׁי מִתּוּגָ֑ה קַ֝יְּמֵ֗נִי כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I am racked with grief;
sustain me in accordance with Your word.

translations.hebrew: דֶּֽרֶךְ־שֶׁ֭קֶר הָסֵ֣ר מִמֶּ֑נִּי וְֽתוֹרָתְךָ֥ חׇנֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Remove all false ways from me;
favor me with Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: דֶּֽרֶךְ־אֱמוּנָ֥ה בָחָ֑רְתִּי מִשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ שִׁוִּֽיתִי׃
translations.english:
I have chosen the way of faithfulness;
I have set Your rules before me.

translations.hebrew: דָּבַ֥קְתִּי בְעֵדְוֺתֶ֑יךָ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אַל־תְּבִישֵֽׁנִי׃
translations.english:
I cling to Your decrees;
O LORD, do not put me to shame.

translations.hebrew: דֶּֽרֶךְ־מִצְוֺתֶ֥יךָ אָר֑וּץ כִּ֖י תַרְחִ֣יב לִבִּֽי׃
translations.english:
I eagerly pursue Your commandments,
for You broaden my understanding.

translations.hebrew: הוֹרֵ֣נִי יְ֭הֹוָה דֶּ֥רֶךְ חֻקֶּ֗יךָ וְאֶצְּרֶ֥נָּה עֵֽקֶב׃
translations.english:
Teach me, O LORD, the way of Your laws;
I will observe them aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.to the utmost.-a

translations.hebrew: הֲ֭בִינֵנִי וְאֶצְּרָ֥ה תוֹרָתֶ֗ךָ וְאֶשְׁמְרֶ֥נָּה בְכׇל־לֵֽב׃
translations.english:
Give me understanding, that I may observe Your teaching
and keep it wholeheartedly.

translations.hebrew: הַ֭דְרִיכֵנִי בִּנְתִ֣יב מִצְוֺתֶ֑יךָ כִּי־ב֥וֹ חָפָֽצְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Lead me in the path of Your commandments,
for that is my concern.

translations.hebrew: הַט־לִ֭בִּי אֶל־עֵדְוֺתֶ֗יךָ וְאַ֣ל אֶל־בָּֽצַע׃
translations.english:
Turn my heart to Your decrees
and not to love of gain.

translations.hebrew: הַעֲבֵ֣ר עֵ֭ינַי מֵרְא֣וֹת שָׁ֑וְא בִּדְרָכֶ֥ךָ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Avert my eyes from seeing falsehood;
by Your ways preserve me.

translations.hebrew: הָקֵ֣ם לְ֭עַבְדְּךָ אִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ אֲ֝שֶׁ֗ר לְיִרְאָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Fulfill Your promise to Your servant,
which is for those who worship You.

translations.hebrew: הַעֲבֵ֣ר חֶ֭רְפָּתִי אֲשֶׁ֣ר יָגֹ֑רְתִּי כִּ֖י מִשְׁפָּטֶ֣יךָ טוֹבִֽים׃
translations.english:
Remove the taunt that I dread,
for Your rules are good.

translations.hebrew: הִ֭נֵּה תָּאַ֣בְתִּי לְפִקֻּדֶ֑יךָ בְּצִדְקָתְךָ֥ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
See, I have longed for Your precepts;
by Your righteousness preserve me.

translations.hebrew: וִיבֹאֻ֣נִי חֲסָדֶ֣ךָ יְהֹוָ֑ה תְּ֝שׁ֥וּעָתְךָ֗ כְּאִמְרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
May Your steadfast love reach me, O LORD,
Your deliverance, as You have promised.

translations.hebrew: וְאֶעֱנֶ֣ה חֹרְפִ֣י דָבָ֑ר כִּֽי־בָ֝טַ֗חְתִּי בִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I shall have an answer for those who taunt me,
for I have put my trust in Your word.

translations.hebrew: וְֽאַל־תַּצֵּ֬ל מִפִּ֣י דְבַר־אֱמֶ֣ת עַד־מְאֹ֑ד כִּ֖י לְמִשְׁפָּטֶ֣ךָ יִחָֽלְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Do not utterly take the truth away from my mouth,
for I have put my hope in Your rules.

translations.hebrew: וְאֶשְׁמְרָ֖ה תוֹרָתְךָ֥ תָמִ֗יד לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
translations.english:
I will always obey Your teaching,
forever and ever.

translations.hebrew: וְאֶתְהַלְּכָ֥ה בָרְחָבָ֑ה כִּ֖י פִקֻּדֶ֣יךָ דָרָֽשְׁתִּי׃
translations.english:
I will walk about at ease,
for I have turned to Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: וַאֲדַבְּרָ֣ה בְ֭עֵדֹתֶיךָ נֶ֥גֶד מְלָכִ֗ים וְלֹ֣א אֵבֽוֹשׁ׃
translations.english:
I will speak of Your decrees,
and not be ashamed in the presence of kings.

translations.hebrew: וְאֶשְׁתַּעֲשַׁ֥ע בְּמִצְוֺתֶ֗יךָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אָהָֽבְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I will delight in Your commandments,
which I love.

translations.hebrew: וְאֶשָּֽׂא־כַפַּ֗י אֶֽל־מִ֭צְוֺתֶיךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר אָהָ֗בְתִּי וְאָשִׂ֥יחָה בְחֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I reach out for Your commandments, which I love;
I study Your laws.

translations.hebrew: זְכֹר־דָּבָ֥ר לְעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ עַ֝֗ל אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִחַלְתָּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Remember Your word to Your servant
through which You have given me hope.

translations.hebrew: זֹ֣את נֶחָמָתִ֣י בְעׇנְיִ֑י כִּ֖י אִמְרָתְךָ֣ חִיָּֽתְנִי׃
translations.english:
This is my comfort in my affliction,
that Your promise has preserved me.

translations.hebrew: זֵ֭דִים הֱלִיצֻ֣נִי עַד־מְאֹ֑ד מִ֝תּ֥וֹרָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א נָטִֽיתִי׃
translations.english:
Though the arrogant have cruelly mocked me,
I have not swerved from Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: זָ֘כַ֤רְתִּי מִשְׁפָּטֶ֖יךָ מֵעוֹלָ֥ם <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֗ה וָאֶתְנֶחָֽם׃
translations.english:
I remember Your rules of old, O LORD,
and find comfort in them.

translations.hebrew: זַלְעָפָ֣ה אֲ֭חָזַתְנִי מֵרְשָׁעִ֑ים עֹ֝זְבֵ֗י תּוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I am seized with rage
because of the wicked who forsake Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: זְ֭מִרוֹת הָיוּ־לִ֥י חֻקֶּ֗יךָ בְּבֵ֣ית מְגוּרָֽי׃
translations.english:
Your laws are bOr “songs for me.”a source of strength to me-b
wherever I may dwell.

translations.hebrew: זָ֘כַ֤רְתִּי בַלַּ֣יְלָה שִׁמְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֑ה וָ֝אֶשְׁמְרָ֗ה תּוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I remember Your name at night, O LORD,
and obey Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: זֹ֥את הָיְתָה־לִּ֑י כִּ֖י פִקֻּדֶ֣יךָ נָצָֽרְתִּי׃
translations.english:
This has been my lot,
for I have observed Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: חֶלְקִ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אָמַ֗רְתִּי לִשְׁמֹ֥ר דְּבָרֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
The LORD is my portion;
I have resolved to keep Your words.

translations.hebrew: חִלִּ֣יתִי פָנֶ֣יךָ בְכׇל־לֵ֑ב חׇ֝נֵּ֗נִי כְּאִמְרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I have implored You with all my heart;
have mercy on me, in accordance with Your promise.

translations.hebrew: חִשַּׁ֥בְתִּי דְרָכָ֑י וָאָשִׁ֥יבָה רַ֝גְלַ֗י אֶל־עֵדֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I have considered my ways,
and have turned back to Your decrees.

translations.hebrew: חַ֭שְׁתִּי וְלֹ֣א הִתְמַהְמָ֑הְתִּי לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר מִצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I have hurried and not delayed
to keep Your commandments.

translations.hebrew: חֶבְלֵ֣י רְשָׁעִ֣ים עִוְּדֻ֑נִי תּ֥֝וֹרָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Though the bonds of the wicked are coiled round me,
I have not neglected Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: חֲצֽוֹת־לַ֗יְלָה אָ֭קוּם לְהוֹד֣וֹת לָ֑ךְ עַ֝֗ל מִשְׁפְּטֵ֥י צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I arise at midnight to praise You
for Your just rules.

translations.hebrew: חָבֵ֣ר אָ֭נִי לְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְרֵא֑וּךָ וּ֝לְשֹׁמְרֵ֗י פִּקּוּדֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I am a companion to all who fear You,
to those who keep Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: חַסְדְּךָ֣ יְ֭הֹוָה מָלְאָ֥ה הָאָ֗רֶץ חֻקֶּ֥יךָ לַמְּדֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Your steadfast love, O LORD, fills the earth;
teach me Your laws.

translations.hebrew: ט֭וֹב עָשִׂ֣יתָ עִֽם־עַבְדְּךָ֑ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כִּדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
You have treated Your servant well,
according to Your word, O LORD.

translations.hebrew: ט֤וּב טַ֣עַם וָדַ֣עַת לַמְּדֵ֑נִי כִּ֖י בְמִצְוֺתֶ֣יךָ הֶאֱמָֽנְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Teach me good sense and knowledge,
for I have put my trust in Your commandments.

translations.hebrew: טֶ֣רֶם אֶ֭עֱנֶה אֲנִ֣י שֹׁגֵ֑ג וְ֝עַתָּ֗ה אִמְרָתְךָ֥ שָׁמָֽרְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Before I was humbled I went astray,
but now I keep Your word.

translations.hebrew: טוֹב־אַתָּ֥ה וּמֵטִ֗יב לַמְּדֵ֥נִי חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
You are good and beneficent;
teach me Your laws.

translations.hebrew: טָפְל֬וּ עָלַ֣י שֶׁ֣קֶר זֵדִ֑ים אֲ֝נִ֗י בְּכׇל־לֵ֤ב ׀ אֶצֹּ֬ר פִּקּוּדֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Though the arrogant have accused me falsely,
I observe Your precepts wholeheartedly.

translations.hebrew: טָפַ֣שׁ כַּחֵ֣לֶב לִבָּ֑ם אֲ֝נִ֗י תּוֹרָתְךָ֥ שִׁעֲשָֽׁעְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Their minds are thick like fat;
as for me, Your teaching is my delight.

translations.hebrew: טֽוֹב־לִ֥י כִי־עֻנֵּ֑יתִי לְ֝מַ֗עַן אֶלְמַ֥ד חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
It was good for me that I was humbled,
so that I might learn Your laws.

translations.hebrew: טֽוֹב־לִ֥י תוֹרַת־פִּ֑יךָ מֵ֝אַלְפֵ֗י זָהָ֥ב וָכָֽסֶף׃
translations.english:
I prefer the teaching You proclaimed
to thousands of gold and silver pieces.

translations.hebrew: יָדֶ֣יךָ עָ֭שׂוּנִי וַֽיְכוֹנְנ֑וּנִי הֲ֝בִינֵ֗נִי וְאֶלְמְדָ֥ה מִצְוֺתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Your hands made me and fashioned me;
give me understanding that I may learn Your commandments.

translations.hebrew: יְ֭רֵאֶיךָ יִרְא֣וּנִי וְיִשְׂמָ֑חוּ כִּ֖י לִדְבָרְךָ֣ יִחָֽלְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Those who fear You will see me and rejoice,
for I have put my hope in Your word.

translations.hebrew: יָדַ֣עְתִּי יְ֭הֹוָה כִּי־צֶ֣דֶק מִשְׁפָּטֶ֑יךָ וֶ֝אֱמוּנָ֗ה עִנִּיתָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
I know, O LORD, that Your rulings are just;
rightly have You humbled me.

translations.hebrew: יְהִי־נָ֣א חַסְדְּךָ֣ לְנַחֲמֵ֑נִי כְּאִמְרָתְךָ֥ לְעַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
May Your steadfast love comfort me
in accordance with Your promise to Your servant.

translations.hebrew: יְבֹא֣וּנִי רַחֲמֶ֣יךָ וְאֶחְיֶ֑ה כִּי־ת֥֝וֹרָתְךָ֗ שַׁעֲשֻׁעָֽי׃
translations.english:
May Your mercy reach me, that I might live,
for Your teaching is my delight.

translations.hebrew: יֵבֹ֣שׁוּ זֵ֭דִים כִּי־שֶׁ֣קֶר עִוְּת֑וּנִי אֲ֝נִ֗י אָשִׂ֥יחַ בְּפִקּוּדֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Let the insolent be dismayed, for they have wronged me without cause;
I will study Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: יָשׁ֣וּבוּ לִ֣י יְרֵאֶ֑יךָ (וידעו) [וְ֝יֹדְעֵ֗י] עֵדֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
May those who fear You,
those who know Your decrees,
turn again to me.

translations.hebrew: יְהִי־לִבִּ֣י תָמִ֣ים בְּחֻקֶּ֑יךָ לְ֝מַ֗עַן לֹ֣א אֵבֽוֹשׁ׃
translations.english:
May I wholeheartedly follow Your laws
so that I do not come to grief.

translations.hebrew: כָּלְתָ֣ה לִתְשׁוּעָתְךָ֣ נַפְשִׁ֑י לִדְבָרְךָ֥ יִחָֽלְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I long for Your deliverance;
I hope for Your word.

translations.hebrew: כָּל֣וּ עֵ֭ינַי לְאִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ לֵ֝אמֹ֗ר מָתַ֥י תְּֽנַחֲמֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
My eyes pine away for Your promise;
I say, “When will You comfort me?”

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־הָ֭יִיתִי כְּנֹ֣אד בְּקִיט֑וֹר חֻ֝קֶּ֗יךָ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Though I have become like a water-skin dried in smoke,
I have not neglected Your laws.

translations.hebrew: כַּמָּ֥ה יְמֵֽי־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ מָתַ֬י תַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה בְרֹדְפַ֣י מִשְׁפָּֽט׃
translations.english:
How long has Your servant to live?
when will You bring my persecutors to judgment?

translations.hebrew: כָּרוּ־לִ֣י זֵדִ֣ים שִׁיח֑וֹת אֲ֝שֶׁ֗ר לֹ֣א כְתוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
The insolent have dug pits for me,
flouting Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: כׇּל־מִצְוֺתֶ֥יךָ אֱמוּנָ֑ה שֶׁ֖קֶר רְדָפ֣וּנִי עׇזְרֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
All Your commandments are enduring;
I am persecuted without cause; help me!

translations.hebrew: כִּ֭מְעַט כִּלּ֣וּנִי בָאָ֑רֶץ וַ֝אֲנִ֗י לֹא־עָזַ֥בְתִּי פִקֻּדֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Though they almost wiped me off the earth,
I did not abandon Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: כְּחַסְדְּךָ֥ חַיֵּ֑נִי וְ֝אֶשְׁמְרָ֗ה עֵד֥וּת פִּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
As befits Your steadfast love, preserve me,
so that I may keep the decree You proclaimed.

translations.hebrew: לְעוֹלָ֥ם יְהֹוָ֑ה דְּ֝בָרְךָ֗ נִצָּ֥ב בַּשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
The LORD exists forever;
Your word stands firm in heaven.

translations.hebrew: לְדֹ֣ר וָ֭דֹר אֱמוּנָתֶ֑ךָ כּוֹנַ֥נְתָּֽ אֶ֝֗רֶץ וַֽתַּעֲמֹֽד׃
translations.english:
Your faithfulness is for all generations;
You have established the earth, and it stands.

translations.hebrew: לְֽ֭מִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ עָמְד֣וּ הַיּ֑וֹם כִּ֖י הַכֹּ֣ל עֲבָדֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
They stand this day to [carry out] Your rulings,
for all are Your servants.

translations.hebrew: לוּלֵ֣י ת֭וֹרָתְךָ שַׁעֲשֻׁעָ֑י אָ֝֗ז אָבַ֥דְתִּי בְעׇנְיִֽי׃
translations.english:
Were not Your teaching my delight
I would have perished in my affliction.

translations.hebrew: לְ֭עוֹלָם לֹא־אֶשְׁכַּ֣ח פִּקּוּדֶ֑יךָ כִּ֥י בָ֝֗ם חִיִּיתָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
I will never neglect Your precepts,
for You have preserved my life through them.

translations.hebrew: לְֽךָ־אֲ֭נִי הוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי כִּ֖י פִקּוּדֶ֣יךָ דָרָֽשְׁתִּי׃
translations.english:
I am Yours; save me!
For I have turned to Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: לִ֤י קִוּ֣וּ רְשָׁעִ֣ים לְאַבְּדֵ֑נִי עֵ֝דֹתֶ֗יךָ אֶתְבּוֹנָֽן׃
translations.english:
The wicked hope to destroy me,
but I ponder Your decrees.

translations.hebrew: לְֽכׇל־תִּ֭כְלָה רָאִ֣יתִי קֵ֑ץ רְחָבָ֖ה מִצְוָתְךָ֣ מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
I have seen that all things have their limit,
but Your commandment is broad beyond measure.

translations.hebrew: מָה־אָהַ֥בְתִּי תוֹרָתֶ֑ךָ כׇּל־הַ֝יּ֗וֹם הִ֣יא שִׂיחָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
O how I love Your teaching!
It is my study all day long.

translations.hebrew: מֵֽ֭אֹיְבַי תְּחַכְּמֵ֣נִי מִצְוֺתֶ֑ךָ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם הִיא־לִֽי׃
translations.english:
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies;
they always stand by me.

translations.hebrew: מִכׇּל־מְלַמְּדַ֥י הִשְׂכַּ֑לְתִּי כִּ֥י עֵ֝דְוֺתֶ֗יךָ שִׂ֣יחָה לִֽי׃
translations.english:
I have gained more insight than all my teachers,
for Your decrees are my study.

translations.hebrew: מִזְּקֵנִ֥ים אֶתְבּוֹנָ֑ן כִּ֖י פִקּוּדֶ֣יךָ נָצָֽרְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I have gained more understanding than my elders,
for I observe Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: מִכׇּל־אֹ֣רַח רָ֭ע כָּלִ֣אתִי רַגְלָ֑י לְ֝מַ֗עַן אֶשְׁמֹ֥ר דְּבָרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I have avoided every evil way
so that I may keep Your word.

translations.hebrew: מִמִּשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ לֹא־סָ֑רְתִּי כִּי־אַ֝תָּ֗ה הוֹרֵתָֽנִי׃
translations.english:
I have not departed from Your rules,
for You have instructed me.

translations.hebrew: מַה־נִּמְלְצ֣וּ לְ֭חִכִּי אִמְרָתֶ֗ךָ מִדְּבַ֥שׁ לְפִֽי׃
translations.english:
How pleasing is Your word to my palate,
sweeter than honey.

translations.hebrew: מִפִּקּוּדֶ֥יךָ אֶתְבּוֹנָ֑ן עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן שָׂנֵ֤אתִי ׀ כׇּל־אֹ֬רַח שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
I ponder Your precepts;
therefore I hate every false way.

translations.hebrew: נֵר־לְרַגְלִ֥י דְבָרֶ֑ךָ וְ֝א֗וֹר לִנְתִיבָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
Your word is a lamp to my feet,
a light for my path.

translations.hebrew: נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתִּי וָאֲקַיֵּ֑מָה לִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר מִשְׁפְּטֵ֥י צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I have firmly sworn
to keep Your just rules.

translations.hebrew: נַעֲנֵ֥יתִי עַד־מְאֹ֑ד יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה חַיֵּ֥נִי כִדְבָרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I am very much afflicted;
O LORD, preserve me in accordance with Your word.

translations.hebrew: נִדְב֣וֹת פִּ֭י רְצֵה־נָ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה וּֽמִשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ לַמְּדֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Accept, O LORD, my freewill offerings;
teach me Your rules.

translations.hebrew: נַפְשִׁ֣י בְכַפִּ֣י תָמִ֑יד וְ֝ת֥וֹרָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Though my life is always in danger,
I do not neglect Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: נָתְנ֬וּ רְשָׁעִ֣ים פַּ֣ח לִ֑י וּ֝מִפִּקּוּדֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א תָעִֽיתִי׃
translations.english:
Though the wicked have set a trap for me,
I have not strayed from Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: נָחַ֣לְתִּי עֵדְוֺתֶ֣יךָ לְעוֹלָ֑ם כִּֽי־שְׂשׂ֖וֹן לִבִּ֣י הֵֽמָּה׃
translations.english:
Your decrees are my eternal heritage;
they are my heart’s delight.

translations.hebrew: נָטִ֣יתִי לִ֭בִּי לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת חֻקֶּ֗יךָ לְעוֹלָ֥ם עֵֽקֶב׃
translations.english:
I am resolved to follow Your laws
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.to the utmost-a forever.

translations.hebrew: סֵעֲפִ֥ים שָׂנֵ֑אתִי וְֽתוֹרָתְךָ֥ אָהָֽבְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I hate men of divided heart,
but I love Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: סִתְרִ֣י וּמָגִנִּ֣י אָ֑תָּה לִדְבָרְךָ֥ יִחָֽלְתִּי׃
translations.english:
You are my protection and my shield;
I hope for Your word.

translations.hebrew: סוּרוּ־מִמֶּ֥נִּי מְרֵעִ֑ים וְ֝אֶצְּרָ֗ה מִצְוֺ֥ת אֱלֹהָֽי׃
translations.english:
Keep away from me, you evildoers,
that I may observe the commandments of my God.

translations.hebrew: סׇמְכֵ֣נִי כְאִמְרָתְךָ֣ וְאֶחְיֶ֑ה וְאַל־תְּ֝בִישֵׁ֗נִי מִשִּׂבְרִֽי׃
translations.english:
Support me as You promised, so that I may live;
do not thwart my expectation.

translations.hebrew: סְעָדֵ֥נִי וְאִוָּשֵׁ֑עָה וְאֶשְׁעָ֖ה בְחֻקֶּ֣יךָ תָמִֽיד׃
translations.english:
Sustain me that I may be saved,
and I will always muse upon Your laws.

translations.hebrew: סָ֭לִיתָ כׇּל־שׁוֹגִ֣ים מֵחֻקֶּ֑יךָ כִּי־שֶׁ֝֗קֶר תַּרְמִיתָֽם׃
translations.english:
You reject all who stray from Your laws,
for they are false and deceitful.

translations.hebrew: סִגִ֗ים הִשְׁבַּ֥תָּ כׇל־רִשְׁעֵי־אָ֑רֶץ לָ֝כֵ֗ן אָהַ֥בְתִּי עֵדֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
You do away with the wicked as if they were dross;
rightly do I love Your decrees.

translations.hebrew: סָמַ֣ר מִפַּחְדְּךָ֣ בְשָׂרִ֑י וּֽמִמִּשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ יָרֵֽאתִי׃
translations.english:
My flesh creeps from fear of You;
I am in awe of Your rulings.

translations.hebrew: עָ֭שִׂיתִי מִשְׁפָּ֣ט וָצֶ֑דֶק בַּל־תַּ֝נִּיחֵ֗נִי לְעֹשְׁקָֽי׃
translations.english:
I have done what is just and right;
do not abandon me to those who would wrong me.

translations.hebrew: עֲרֹ֣ב עַבְדְּךָ֣ לְט֑וֹב אַֽל־יַעַשְׁקֻ֥נִי זֵדִֽים׃
translations.english:
Guarantee Your servant’s well-being;
do not let the arrogant wrong me.

translations.hebrew: עֵ֭ינַי כָּל֣וּ לִישׁוּעָתֶ֑ךָ וּלְאִמְרַ֥ת צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My eyes pine away for Your deliverance,
for Your promise of victory.

translations.hebrew: עֲשֵׂ֖ה עִם־עַבְדְּךָ֥ כְחַסְדֶּ֗ךָ וְחֻקֶּ֥יךָ לַמְּדֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Deal with Your servant as befits Your steadfast love;
teach me Your laws.

translations.hebrew: עַבְדְּךָ־אָ֥נִי הֲבִינֵ֑נִי וְ֝אֵדְעָ֗ה עֵדֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I am Your servant;
give me understanding,
that I might know Your decrees.

translations.hebrew: עֵ֭ת לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת לַיהֹוָ֑ה הֵ֝פֵ֗רוּ תּוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
It is a time to act for the LORD,
for they have violated Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֭ן אָהַ֣בְתִּי מִצְוֺתֶ֑יךָ מִזָּהָ֥ב וּמִפָּֽז׃
translations.english:
Rightly do I love Your commandments
more than gold, even fine gold.

translations.hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֤ן ׀ כׇּל־פִּקּ֣וּדֵי כֹ֣ל יִשָּׁ֑רְתִּי כׇּל־אֹ֖רַח שֶׁ֣קֶר שָׂנֵֽאתִי׃
translations.english:
Truly cOr “I declare all [Your] precepts to be just.”by all [Your] precepts I walk straight;-c
I hate every false way.

translations.hebrew: פְּלָא֥וֹת עֵדְוֺתֶ֑יךָ עַל־כֵּ֝֗ן נְצָרָ֥תַם נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
Your decrees are wondrous;
rightly do I observe them.

translations.hebrew: פֵּ֖תַח דְּבָרֶ֥יךָ יָאִ֗יר מֵבִ֥ין פְּתָיִֽים׃
translations.english:
dWith Targum; or “The exposition of Your words gives”; meaning of Heb. uncertain.The words You inscribed give-d light,
and grant understanding to the simple.

translations.hebrew: פִּֽי־פָ֭עַרְתִּי וָאֶשְׁאָ֑פָה כִּ֖י לְמִצְוֺתֶ֣יךָ יָאָֽבְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I open my mouth wide, I pant,
longing for Your commandments.

translations.hebrew: פְּנֵה־אֵלַ֥י וְחׇנֵּ֑נִי כְּ֝מִשְׁפָּ֗ט לְאֹהֲבֵ֥י שְׁמֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
as is Your rule with those who love Your name.

translations.hebrew: פְּ֭עָמַי הָכֵ֣ן בְּאִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ וְֽאַל־תַּשְׁלֶט־בִּ֥י כׇל־אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Make my feet firm through Your promise;
do not let iniquity dominate me.

translations.hebrew: פְּ֭דֵנִי מֵעֹ֣שֶׁק אָדָ֑ם וְ֝אֶשְׁמְרָ֗ה פִּקּוּדֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Redeem me from being wronged by man,
that I may keep Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: פָּ֭נֶיךָ הָאֵ֣ר בְּעַבְדֶּ֑ךָ וְ֝לַמְּדֵ֗נִי אֶת־חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Show favor to Your servant,
and teach me Your laws.

translations.hebrew: פַּלְגֵי־מַ֭יִם יָרְד֣וּ עֵינָ֑י עַ֝֗ל לֹא־שָׁמְר֥וּ תוֹרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My eyes shed streams of water
because men do not obey Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: צַדִּ֣יק אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝יָשָׁ֗ר מִשְׁפָּטֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
You are righteous, O LORD;
Your rulings are just.

translations.hebrew: צִ֭וִּיתָ צֶ֣דֶק עֵדֹתֶ֑יךָ וֶאֱמוּנָ֥ה מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
You have ordained righteous decrees;
they are firmly enduring.

translations.hebrew: צִמְּתַ֥תְנִי קִנְאָתִ֑י כִּֽי־שָׁכְח֖וּ דְבָרֶ֣יךָ צָרָֽי׃
translations.english:
I am consumed with rage
over my foes’ neglect of Your words.

translations.hebrew: צְרוּפָ֖ה אִמְרָתְךָ֥ מְאֹ֗ד וְֽעַבְדְּךָ֥ אֲהֵבָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Your word is exceedingly pure,
and Your servant loves it.

translations.hebrew: צָעִ֣יר אָנֹכִ֣י וְנִבְזֶ֑ה פִּ֝קֻּדֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Though I am belittled and despised,
I have not neglected Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: צִדְקָתְךָ֣ צֶ֣דֶק לְעוֹלָ֑ם וְֽתוֹרָתְךָ֥ אֱמֶֽת׃
translations.english:
Your righteousness is eternal;
Your teaching is true.

translations.hebrew: צַר־וּמָצ֥וֹק מְצָא֑וּנִי מִ֝צְוֺתֶ֗יךָ שַׁעֲשֻׁעָֽי׃
translations.english:
Though anguish and distress come upon me,
Your commandments are my delight.

translations.hebrew: צֶ֖דֶק עֵדְוֺתֶ֥יךָ לְעוֹלָ֗ם הֲבִינֵ֥נִי וְאֶחְיֶֽה׃
translations.english:
Your righteous decrees are eternal;
give me understanding, that I might live.

translations.hebrew: קָרָ֣אתִי בְכׇל־לֵ֭ב עֲנֵ֥נִי יְהֹוָ֗ה חֻקֶּ֥יךָ אֶצֹּֽרָה׃
translations.english:
I call with all my heart;
answer me, O LORD,
that I may observe Your laws.

translations.hebrew: קְרָאתִ֥יךָ הוֹשִׁיעֵ֑נִי וְ֝אֶשְׁמְרָ֗ה עֵדֹתֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
I call upon You; save me,
that I may keep Your decrees.

translations.hebrew: קִדַּ֣מְתִּי בַ֭נֶּשֶׁף וָאֲשַׁוֵּ֑עָה (לדבריך) [לִדְבָרְךָ֥] יִחָֽלְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I rise before dawn and cry for help;
I hope for Your word.

translations.hebrew: קִדְּמ֣וּ עֵ֭ינַי אַשְׁמֻר֑וֹת לָ֝שִׂ֗יחַ בְּאִמְרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
My eyes greet each watch of the night,
as I meditate on Your promise.

translations.hebrew: ק֭וֹלִי שִׁמְעָ֣ה כְחַסְדֶּ֑ךָ יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כְּֽמִשְׁפָּטֶ֥ךָ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Hear my voice as befits Your steadfast love;
O LORD, preserve me, as is Your rule.

translations.hebrew: קָ֭רְבוּ רֹדְפֵ֣י זִמָּ֑ה מִתּוֹרָתְךָ֥ רָחָֽקוּ׃
translations.english:
Those who pursue intrigue draw near;
they are far from Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: קָר֣וֹב אַתָּ֣ה יְהֹוָ֑ה וְֽכׇל־מִצְוֺתֶ֥יךָ אֱמֶֽת׃
translations.english:
You, O LORD, are near,
and all Your commandments are true.

translations.hebrew: קֶ֣דֶם יָ֭דַעְתִּי מֵעֵדֹתֶ֑יךָ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם יְסַדְתָּֽם׃
translations.english:
I know from Your decrees of old
that You have established them forever.

translations.hebrew: רְאֵה־עׇנְיִ֥י וְחַלְּצֵ֑נִי כִּי־ת֥֝וֹרָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
translations.english:
See my affliction and rescue me,
for I have not neglected Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: רִיבָ֣ה רִ֭יבִי וּגְאָלֵ֑נִי לְאִמְרָתְךָ֥ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Champion my cause and redeem me;
preserve me according to Your promise.

translations.hebrew: רָח֣וֹק מֵרְשָׁעִ֣ים יְשׁוּעָ֑ה כִּי־חֻ֝קֶּ֗יךָ לֹ֣א דָרָֽשׁוּ׃
translations.english:
Deliverance is far from the wicked,
for they have not turned to Your laws.

translations.hebrew: רַחֲמֶ֖יךָ רַבִּ֥ים <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֑ה כְּֽמִשְׁפָּטֶ֥יךָ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Your mercies are great, O LORD;
as is Your rule, preserve me.

translations.hebrew: רַ֭בִּים רֹדְפַ֣י וְצָרָ֑י מֵ֝עֵדְוֺתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א נָטִֽיתִי׃
translations.english:
Many are my persecutors and foes;
I have not swerved from Your decrees.

translations.hebrew: רָאִ֣יתִי בֹ֭גְדִים וָאֶתְקוֹטָ֑טָה אֲשֶׁ֥ר אִ֝מְרָתְךָ֗ לֹ֣א שָׁמָֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
I have seen traitors and loathedeOr “have contended with.” them,
because they did not keep Your word in mind.

translations.hebrew: רְ֭אֵה כִּי־פִקּוּדֶ֣יךָ אָהָ֑בְתִּי יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה כְּֽחַסְדְּךָ֥ חַיֵּֽנִי׃
translations.english:
See that I have loved Your precepts;
O LORD, preserve me, as befits Your steadfast love.

translations.hebrew: רֹאשׁ־דְּבָרְךָ֥ אֱמֶ֑ת וּ֝לְעוֹלָ֗ם כׇּל־מִשְׁפַּ֥ט צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Truth is the essence of Your word;
Your just rules are eternal.

translations.hebrew: שָׂ֭רִים רְדָפ֣וּנִי חִנָּ֑ם (ומדבריך) [וּ֝מִדְּבָרְךָ֗] פָּחַ֥ד לִבִּֽי׃
translations.english:
Princes have persecuted me without reason;
my heart thrills at Your word.

translations.hebrew: שָׂ֣שׂ אָ֭נֹכִי עַל־אִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ כְּ֝מוֹצֵ֗א שָׁלָ֥ל רָֽב׃
translations.english:
I rejoice over Your promise
as one who obtains great spoil.

translations.hebrew: שֶׁ֣קֶר שָׂ֭נֵאתִי וַאֲתַעֵ֑בָה תּוֹרָתְךָ֥ אָהָֽבְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I hate and abhor falsehood;
I love Your teaching.

translations.hebrew: שֶׁ֣בַע בַּ֭יּוֹם הִלַּלְתִּ֑יךָ עַ֝֗ל מִשְׁפְּטֵ֥י צִדְקֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I praise You seven times each day
for Your just rules.

translations.hebrew: שָׁל֣וֹם רָ֭ב לְאֹהֲבֵ֣י תוֹרָתֶ֑ךָ וְאֵֽין־לָ֥מוֹ מִכְשֽׁוֹל׃
translations.english:
Those who love Your teaching enjoy well-being;
they encounter no adversity.

translations.hebrew: שִׂבַּ֣רְתִּי לִישׁוּעָתְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֑ה וּֽמִצְוֺתֶ֥יךָ עָשִֽׂיתִי׃
translations.english:
I hope for Your deliverance, O LORD;
I observe Your commandments.

translations.hebrew: שָֽׁמְרָ֣ה נַ֭פְשִׁי עֵדֹתֶ֑יךָ וָאֹהֲבֵ֥ם מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
I obey Your decrees
and love them greatly.

translations.hebrew: שָׁמַ֣רְתִּי פִ֭קּוּדֶיךָ וְעֵדֹתֶ֑יךָ כִּ֖י כׇל־דְּרָכַ֣י נֶגְדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I obey Your precepts and decrees;
all my ways are before You.

translations.hebrew: תִּקְרַ֤ב רִנָּתִ֣י לְפָנֶ֣יךָ יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּדְבָרְךָ֥ הֲבִינֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
May my plea reach You, O LORD;
grant me understanding according to Your word.

translations.hebrew: תָּב֣וֹא תְחִנָּתִ֣י לְפָנֶ֑יךָ כְּ֝אִמְרָתְךָ֗ הַצִּילֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
May my petition come before You;
save me in accordance with Your promise.

translations.hebrew: תַּבַּ֣עְנָה שְׂפָתַ֣י תְּהִלָּ֑ה כִּ֖י תְלַמְּדֵ֣נִי חֻקֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
My lips shall pour forth praise,
for You teach me Your laws.

translations.hebrew: תַּ֣עַן לְ֭שׁוֹנִי אִמְרָתֶ֑ךָ כִּ֖י כׇל־מִצְוֺתֶ֣יךָ צֶּֽדֶק׃
translations.english:
My tongue shall declare Your promise,
for all Your commandments are just.

translations.hebrew: תְּהִי־יָדְךָ֥ לְעׇזְרֵ֑נִי כִּ֖י פִקּוּדֶ֣יךָ בָחָֽרְתִּי׃
translations.english:
Lend Your hand to help me,
for I have chosen Your precepts.

translations.hebrew: תָּאַ֣בְתִּי לִישׁוּעָתְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֑ה וְ֝ת֥וֹרָתְךָ֗ שַׁעֲשֻׁעָֽי׃
translations.english:
I have longed for Your deliverance, O LORD;
Your teaching is my delight.

translations.hebrew: תְּֽחִי־נַ֭פְשִׁי וּֽתְהַלְלֶ֑ךָּ וּֽמִשְׁפָּטֶ֥ךָ יַעְזְרֻֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Let me live, that I may praise You;
may Your rules be my help;

translations.hebrew: תָּעִ֗יתִי כְּשֶׂ֣ה אֹ֭בֵד בַּקֵּ֣שׁ עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֥י מִ֝צְוֺתֶ֗יךָ לֹ֣א שָׁכָֽחְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I have strayed like a lost sheep;
search for Your servant,
for I have not neglected Your commandments.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת אֶל־יְ֭הֹוָה בַּצָּרָ֣תָה לִּ֑י קָ֝רָ֗אתִי וַֽיַּעֲנֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents.aA term of uncertain meaning.

In my distress I called to the LORD
and He answered me.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה הַצִּ֣ילָה נַ֭פְשִׁי מִשְּׂפַת־שֶׁ֑קֶר מִלָּשׁ֥וֹן רְמִיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
O LORD, save me from treacherous lips,
from a deceitful tongue!

translations.hebrew: מַה־יִּתֵּ֣ן לְ֭ךָ וּמַה־יֹּסִ֥יף לָ֗ךְ לָשׁ֥וֹן רְמִיָּֽה׃
translations.english:
What can you profit,
what can you gain,
O deceitful tongue?

translations.hebrew: חִצֵּ֣י גִבּ֣וֹר שְׁנוּנִ֑ים עִ֝֗ם גַּחֲלֵ֥י רְתָמִֽים׃
translations.english:
A warrior’s sharp arrows,
with hot coals of broom-wood.

translations.hebrew: אֽוֹיָה־לִ֭י כִּי־גַ֣רְתִּי מֶ֑שֶׁךְ שָׁ֝כַ֗נְתִּי עִֽם־אׇהֳלֵ֥י קֵדָֽר׃
translations.english:
Woe is me, that I live with Meshech,
that I dwell among the clans of Kedar.

translations.hebrew: רַ֭בַּת שָֽׁכְנָה־לָּ֣הּ נַפְשִׁ֑י עִ֝֗ם שׂוֹנֵ֥א שָׁלֽוֹם׃
translations.english: Too long have I dwelt with those who hate peace.

translations.hebrew: אֲֽנִי־שָׁ֭לוֹם וְכִ֣י אֲדַבֵּ֑ר הֵ֝֗מָּה לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
translations.english:
I am all peace;
but when I speak,
they are for war.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֗יר לַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת אֶשָּׂ֣א עֵ֭ינַי אֶל־הֶהָרִ֑ים מֵ֝אַ֗יִן יָבֹ֥א עֶזְרִֽי׃
translations.english:
A song for ascents.

I turn my eyes to the mountains;
from where will my help come?

translations.hebrew: עֶ֭זְרִי מֵעִ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה עֹ֝שֵׂ֗ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
My help comes from the LORD,
maker of heaven and earth.

translations.hebrew: אַל־יִתֵּ֣ן לַמּ֣וֹט רַגְלֶ֑ךָ אַל־יָ֝נ֗וּם שֹׁמְרֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
He will not let your foot give way;
your guardian will not slumber;

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה לֹֽא־יָ֭נוּם וְלֹ֣א יִישָׁ֑ן שׁ֝וֹמֵ֗ר יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
See, the guardian of Israel
neither slumbers nor sleeps!

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה שֹׁמְרֶ֑ךָ יְהֹוָ֥ה צִ֝לְּךָ֗ עַל־יַ֥ד יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
The LORD is your guardian,
the LORD is your protection
at your right hand.

translations.hebrew: יוֹמָ֗ם הַשֶּׁ֥מֶשׁ לֹֽא־יַכֶּ֗כָּה וְיָרֵ֥חַ בַּלָּֽיְלָה׃
translations.english:
By day the sun will not strike you,
nor the moon by night.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה יִשְׁמׇרְךָ֥ מִכׇּל־רָ֑ע יִ֝שְׁמֹ֗ר אֶת־נַפְשֶֽׁךָ׃
translations.english:
The LORD will guard you from all harm;
He will guard your life.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה יִשְׁמׇר־צֵאתְךָ֥ וּבוֹאֶ֑ךָ מֵ֝עַתָּ֗ה וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
The LORD will guard your going and coming
now and forever.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לְדָ֫וִ֥ד שָׂ֭מַחְתִּי בְּאֹמְרִ֣ים לִ֑י בֵּ֖ית יְהֹוָ֣ה נֵלֵֽךְ׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents. Of David. I rejoiced when they said to me,
“We are going to the House of the LORD.”

translations.hebrew: עֹ֭מְדוֹת הָי֣וּ רַגְלֵ֑ינוּ בִּ֝שְׁעָרַ֗יִךְ יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃
translations.english: Our feet stood inside your gates, O Jerusalem,

translations.hebrew: יְרוּשָׁלַ֥͏ִם הַבְּנוּיָ֑ה כְּ֝עִ֗יר שֶׁחֻבְּרָה־לָּ֥הּ יַחְדָּֽו׃
translations.english: Jerusalem built up, a city knit together,

translations.hebrew: שֶׁשָּׁ֨ם עָל֪וּ שְׁבָטִ֡ים שִׁבְטֵי־יָ֭הּ עֵד֣וּת לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל לְ֝הֹד֗וֹת לְשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
to which tribes would make pilgrimage,
the tribes of the LORD,
—as was enjoined upon Israel—
to praise the name of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁ֨מָּה ׀ יָשְׁב֣וּ כִסְא֣וֹת לְמִשְׁפָּ֑ט כִּ֝סְא֗וֹת לְבֵ֣ית דָּוִֽד׃
translations.english:
There the thrones of judgment stood,
thrones of the house of David.

translations.hebrew: שַׁ֭אֲלוּ שְׁל֣וֹם יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם יִ֝שְׁלָ֗יוּ אֹהֲבָֽיִךְ׃
translations.english:
Pray for the well-being of Jerusalem;
“May those who love you be at peace.

translations.hebrew: יְהִי־שָׁל֥וֹם בְּחֵילֵ֑ךְ שַׁ֝לְוָ֗ה בְּאַרְמְנוֹתָֽיִךְ׃
translations.english:
May there be well-being within your ramparts,
peace in your citadels.”

translations.hebrew: לְ֭מַעַן אַחַ֣י וְרֵעָ֑י אֲדַבְּרָה־נָּ֖א שָׁל֣וֹם בָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
For the sake of my kin and friends,
I pray for your well-being;

translations.hebrew: לְ֭מַעַן בֵּית־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ אֲבַקְשָׁ֖ה ט֣וֹב לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
for the sake of the house of the LORD our God,
I seek your good.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת אֵ֭לֶיךָ נָשָׂ֣אתִי אֶת־עֵינַ֑י הַ֝יֹּשְׁבִ֗י בַּשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents.

To You, enthroned in heaven,
I turn my eyes.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה כְעֵינֵ֪י עֲבָדִ֡ים אֶל־יַ֤ד אֲֽדוֹנֵיהֶ֗ם כְּעֵינֵ֣י שִׁפְחָה֮ אֶל־יַ֢ד גְּבִ֫רְתָּ֥הּ כֵּ֣ן עֵ֭ינֵינוּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ עַ֝֗ד שֶׁיְּחׇנֵּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
As the eyes of slaves follow their master’s hand,
as the eyes of a slave-girl follow the hand of her mistress,
so our eyes are toward the LORD our God,
awaiting His favor.

translations.hebrew: חׇנֵּ֣נוּ יְהֹוָ֣ה חׇנֵּ֑נוּ כִּי־רַ֝֗ב שָׂבַ֥עְנוּ בֽוּז׃
translations.english:
Show us favor, O LORD,
show us favor!
We have had more than enough of contempt.

translations.hebrew: רַבַּת֮ שָֽׂבְעָה־לָּ֢הּ נַ֫פְשֵׁ֥נוּ הַלַּ֥עַג הַשַּֽׁאֲנַנִּ֑ים הַ֝בּ֗וּז (לגאיונים) [לִגְאֵ֥י יוֹנִֽים]׃
translations.english:
Long enough have we endured
the scorn of the complacent,
the contempt of the haughty.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לְדָ֫וִ֥ד לוּלֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה שֶׁהָ֣יָה לָ֑נוּ יֹאמַר־נָ֝֗א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents. Of David.

Were it not for the LORD, who was on our side,
let Israel now declare,

translations.hebrew: לוּלֵ֣י יְ֭הֹוָה שֶׁהָ֣יָה לָ֑נוּ בְּק֖וּם עָלֵ֣ינוּ אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
were it not for the LORD, who was on our side
when men assailed us,

translations.hebrew: אֲ֭זַי חַיִּ֣ים בְּלָע֑וּנוּ בַּחֲר֖וֹת אַפָּ֣ם בָּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
they would have swallowed us alive
in their burning rage against us;

translations.hebrew: אֲ֭זַי הַמַּ֣יִם שְׁטָפ֑וּנוּ נַ֝֗חְלָה עָבַ֥ר עַל־נַפְשֵֽׁנוּ׃
translations.english:
the waters would have carried us off,
the torrent would have swept over us;

translations.hebrew: אֲ֭זַי עָבַ֣ר עַל־נַפְשֵׁ֑נוּ הַ֝מַּ֗יִם הַזֵּידוֹנִֽים׃
translations.english:
over us would have swept
the seething waters.

translations.hebrew: בָּר֥וּךְ יְהֹוָ֑ה שֶׁלֹּ֥א נְתָנָ֥נוּ טֶ֝֗רֶף לְשִׁנֵּיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Blessed is the LORD, who did not let us
be ripped apart by their teeth.

translations.hebrew: נַפְשֵׁ֗נוּ כְּצִפּ֥וֹר נִמְלְטָה֮ מִפַּ֢ח י֫וֹקְשִׁ֥ים הַפַּ֥ח נִשְׁבָּ֗ר וַאֲנַ֥חְנוּ נִמְלָֽטְנוּ׃
translations.english:
We are like a bird escaped from the fowler’s trap;
the trap broke and we escaped.

translations.hebrew: עֶ֭זְרֵנוּ בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה עֹ֝שֵׂ֗ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
Our help is the name of the LORD,
maker of heaven and earth.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת הַבֹּטְחִ֥ים בַּיהֹוָ֑ה כְּֽהַר־צִיּ֥וֹן לֹא־יִ֝מּ֗וֹט לְעוֹלָ֥ם יֵשֵֽׁב׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents.

Those who trust in the LORD
are like Mount Zion
that cannot be moved,
enduring forever.

translations.hebrew: יְֽרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם הָרִים֮ סָבִ֢יב לָ֥֫הּ וַ֭יהֹוָה סָבִ֣יב לְעַמּ֑וֹ מֵ֝עַתָּ֗ה וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
Jerusalem, hills enfold it,
and the LORD enfolds His people
now and forever.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י לֹ֪א יָנ֡וּחַ שֵׁ֤בֶט הָרֶ֗שַׁע עַל֮ גּוֹרַ֢ל הַֽצַּדִּ֫יקִ֥ים לְמַ֡עַן לֹא־יִשְׁלְח֖וּ הַצַּדִּיקִ֨ים בְּעַוְלָ֬תָה יְדֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.The scepter of the wicked shall never rest
upon the land allotted to the righteous,
that the righteous not set their hand to wrongdoing.-a

translations.hebrew: הֵיטִ֣יבָה יְ֭הֹוָה לַטּוֹבִ֑ים וְ֝לִישָׁרִ֗ים בְּלִבּוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
Do good, O LORD, to the good,
to the upright in heart.

translations.hebrew: וְהַמַּטִּ֤ים עֲֽקַלְקַלּוֹתָ֗ם יוֹלִיכֵ֣ם יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־פֹּעֲלֵ֣י הָאָ֑וֶן שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.But those who in their crookedness act corruptly,-a
let the LORD make them go the way of evildoers.
May it be well with Israel!

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת בְּשׁ֣וּב יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־שִׁיבַ֣ת צִיּ֑וֹן הָ֝יִ֗ינוּ כְּחֹלְמִֽים׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents.

When the LORD restores the fortunes of Zion
—aLit. “we are veritable dreamers.”we see it as in a dream-a—

translations.hebrew: אָ֤ז יִמָּלֵ֪א שְׂח֡וֹק פִּינוּ֮ וּלְשׁוֹנֵ֢נוּ רִ֫נָּ֥ה אָ֭ז יֹאמְר֣וּ בַגּוֹיִ֑ם הִגְדִּ֥יל יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת עִם־אֵֽלֶּה׃
translations.english:
our mouths shall be filled with laughter,
our tongues, with songs of joy.
Then shall they say among the nations,
“The LORD has done great things for them!”

translations.hebrew: הִגְדִּ֣יל יְ֭הֹוָה לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת עִמָּ֗נוּ הָיִ֥ינוּ שְׂמֵחִֽים׃
translations.english:
The LORD will do great things for us
and we shall rejoice.

translations.hebrew: שׁוּבָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־[שְׁבִיתֵ֑נוּ] (שבותנו) כַּאֲפִיקִ֥ים בַּנֶּֽגֶב׃
translations.english:
Restore our fortunes, O LORD,
like watercourses in the Negeb.

translations.hebrew: הַזֹּרְעִ֥ים בְּדִמְעָ֗ה בְּרִנָּ֥ה יִקְצֹֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
They who sow in tears
shall reap with songs of joy.

translations.hebrew: הָ֘ל֤וֹךְ יֵלֵ֨ךְ ׀ וּבָכֹה֮ נֹשֵׂ֢א מֶשֶׁךְ־הַ֫זָּ֥רַע בֹּא־יָבֹ֥א בְרִנָּ֑ה נֹ֝שֵׂ֗א אֲלֻמֹּתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Though he goes along weeping,
carrying the seed-bag,
he shall come back with songs of joy,
carrying his sheaves.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לִשְׁלֹ֫מֹ֥ה אִם־יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ לֹא־יִבְנֶ֬ה בַ֗יִת שָׁ֤וְא עָמְל֣וּ בוֹנָ֣יו בּ֑וֹ אִם־יְהֹוָ֥ה לֹא־יִשְׁמׇר־עִ֝֗יר שָׁ֤וְא ׀ שָׁקַ֬ד שׁוֹמֵֽר׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents. Of Solomon.

Unless the LORD builds the house,
its builders labor in vain on it;
unless the LORD watches over the city,
the watchman keeps vigil in vain.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֤וְא לָכֶ֨ם מַשְׁכִּ֪ימֵֽי ק֡וּם מְאַחֲרֵי־שֶׁ֗בֶת אֹ֭כְלֵי לֶ֣חֶם הָעֲצָבִ֑ים כֵּ֤ן יִתֵּ֖ן לִידִיד֣וֹ שֵׁנָֽא׃
translations.english:
In vain do you rise early
and stay up late,
you who toil for the bread you eat;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.He provides as much for His loved ones while they sleep.-a

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֤ה נַחֲלַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֣ה בָּנִ֑ים שָׂ֝כָ֗ר פְּרִ֣י הַבָּֽטֶן׃
translations.english:
Sons are the provisionbLit. “heritage.” of the LORD;
the fruit of the womb, His reward.

translations.hebrew: כְּחִצִּ֥ים בְּיַד־גִּבּ֑וֹר כֵּ֝֗ן בְּנֵ֣י הַנְּעוּרִֽים׃
translations.english:
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior
are sons born to a man in his youth.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֤י הַגֶּ֗בֶר אֲשֶׁ֤ר מִלֵּ֥א אֶת־אַשְׁפָּת֗וֹ מֵ֫הֶ֥ם לֹֽא־יֵבֹ֑שׁוּ כִּֽי־יְדַבְּר֖וּ אֶת־אוֹיְבִ֣ים בַּשָּֽׁעַר׃
translations.english:
Happy is the man who fills his quiver with them;
they shall not be put to shame
when they contend with the enemy in the gate.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת אַ֭שְׁרֵי כׇּל־יְרֵ֣א יְהֹוָ֑ה הַ֝הֹלֵ֗ךְ בִּדְרָכָֽיו׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents.

Happy are all who fear the LORD,
who follow His ways.

translations.hebrew: יְגִ֣יעַ כַּ֭פֶּיךָ כִּ֣י תֹאכֵ֑ל אַ֝שְׁרֶ֗יךָ וְט֣וֹב לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
You shall enjoy the fruit of your labors;
you shall be happy and you shall prosper.

translations.hebrew: אֶשְׁתְּךָ֤ ׀ כְּגֶ֥פֶן פֹּרִיָּה֮ בְּיַרְכְּתֵ֢י בֵ֫יתֶ֥ךָ בָּ֭נֶיךָ כִּשְׁתִלֵ֣י זֵיתִ֑ים סָ֝בִ֗יב לְשֻׁלְחָנֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine within your house;
your sons, like olive saplings around your table.

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה כִי־כֵ֭ן יְבֹ֥רַךְ גָּ֗בֶר יְרֵ֣א יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english: So shall the man who fears the LORD be blessed.

translations.hebrew: יְבָרֶכְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֗ה מִצִּ֫יּ֥וֹן וּ֭רְאֵה בְּט֣וּב יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם כֹּ֝֗ל יְמֵ֣י חַיֶּֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
May the LORD bless you from Zion;
may you share the prosperity of Jerusalem
all the days of your life,

translations.hebrew: וּרְאֵֽה־בָנִ֥ים לְבָנֶ֑יךָ שָׁ֝ל֗וֹם עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
and live to see your children’s children.
May all be well with Israel!

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת רַ֭בַּת צְרָר֣וּנִי מִנְּעוּרַ֑י יֹאמַר־נָ֝֗א יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents.

Since my youth they have often assailed me,
let Israel now declare,

translations.hebrew: רַ֭בַּת צְרָר֣וּנִי מִנְּעוּרָ֑י גַּ֝֗ם לֹא־יָ֥כְלוּ לִֽי׃
translations.english:
since my youth they have often assailed me,
but they have never overcome me.

translations.hebrew: עַל־גַּ֭בִּי חָרְשׁ֣וּ חֹרְשִׁ֑ים הֶ֝אֱרִ֗יכוּ (למענותם) [לְמַעֲנִיתָֽם]׃
translations.english:
Plowmen plowed across my back;
they made long furrows.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֥ה צַדִּ֑יק קִ֝צֵּ֗ץ עֲב֣וֹת רְשָׁעִֽים׃
translations.english:
The LORD, the righteous one,
has snapped the cords of the wicked.

translations.hebrew: יֵ֭בֹשׁוּ וְיִסֹּ֣גוּ אָח֑וֹר כֹּ֝֗ל שֹׂנְאֵ֥י צִיּֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
Let all who hate Zion
fall back in disgrace.

translations.hebrew: יִ֭הְיוּ כַּחֲצִ֣יר גַּגּ֑וֹת שֶׁקַּדְמַ֖ת שָׁלַ֣ף יָבֵֽשׁ׃
translations.english:
Let them be like grass on roofs
that fades before it can be pulled up,

translations.hebrew: שֶׁלֹּ֤א מִלֵּ֖א כַפּ֥וֹ קוֹצֵ֗ר וְחִצְנ֥וֹ מְעַמֵּֽר׃
translations.english:
that affords no handful for the reaper,
no armful for the gatherer of sheaves,

translations.hebrew: וְלֹ֤א אָמְר֨וּ ׀ הָעֹבְרִ֗ים בִּרְכַּֽת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם בֵּרַ֥כְנוּ אֶ֝תְכֶ֗ם בְּשֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
no exchange with passersby:
“The blessing of the LORD be upon you.”
“We bless you by the name of the LORD.”

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֑וֹת מִמַּעֲמַקִּ֖ים קְרָאתִ֣יךָ יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents.

Out of the depths I call You, O LORD.

translations.hebrew: אֲדֹנָי֮ שִׁמְעָ֢ה בְק֫וֹלִ֥י תִּהְיֶ֣ינָה אׇ֭זְנֶיךָ קַשֻּׁב֑וֹת לְ֝ק֗וֹל תַּחֲנוּנָֽי׃
translations.english:
O Lord, listen to my cry;
let Your ears be attentive
to my plea for mercy.

translations.hebrew: אִם־עֲוֺנ֥וֹת תִּשְׁמׇר־יָ֑הּ אֲ֝דֹנָ֗י מִ֣י יַעֲמֹֽד׃
translations.english:
If You keep account of sins, O LORD,
Lord, who will survive?

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־עִמְּךָ֥ הַסְּלִיחָ֑ה לְ֝מַ֗עַן תִּוָּרֵֽא׃
translations.english:
Yours is the power to forgive
so that You may be held in awe.

translations.hebrew: קִוִּ֣יתִי יְ֭הֹוָה קִוְּתָ֣ה נַפְשִׁ֑י וְֽלִדְבָר֥וֹ הוֹחָֽלְתִּי׃
translations.english:
I look to the LORD;
I look to Him;
I await His word.

translations.hebrew: נַפְשִׁ֥י לַאדֹנָ֑י מִשֹּׁמְרִ֥ים לַ֝בֹּ֗קֶר שֹׁמְרִ֥ים לַבֹּֽקֶר׃
translations.english:
I am more eager for the Lord
than watchmen for the morning,
watchmen for the morning.

translations.hebrew: יַחֵ֥ל יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל אֶל־יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה כִּֽי־עִם־יְהֹוָ֥ה הַחֶ֑סֶד וְהַרְבֵּ֖ה עִמּ֣וֹ פְדֽוּת׃
translations.english:
O Israel, wait for the LORD;
for with the LORD is steadfast love
and great power to redeem.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭הוּא יִפְדֶּ֣ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל מִ֝כֹּ֗ל עֲוֺנֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english: It is He who will redeem Israel from all their iniquities.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לְדָ֫וִ֥ד יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ לֹא־גָבַ֣הּ לִ֭בִּי וְלֹא־רָמ֣וּ עֵינַ֑י וְלֹֽא־הִלַּ֓כְתִּי ׀ בִּגְדֹל֖וֹת וּבְנִפְלָא֣וֹת מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents. Of David.

O LORD, my heart is not proud
nor my look haughty;
I do not aspire to great things
or to what is beyond me;

translations.hebrew: אִם־לֹ֤א שִׁוִּ֨יתִי ׀ וְדוֹמַ֗מְתִּי נַ֫פְשִׁ֥י כְּ֭גָמֻל עֲלֵ֣י אִמּ֑וֹ כַּגָּמֻ֖ל עָלַ֣י נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.but I have taught myself to be contented
like a weaned child with its mother;
like a weaned child am I in my mind.-a

translations.hebrew: יַחֵ֣ל יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל אֶל־יְהֹוָ֑ה מֵ֝עַתָּ֗ה וְעַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
O Israel, wait for the LORD
now and forever.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת זְכוֹר־יְהֹוָ֥ה לְדָוִ֑ד אֵ֝֗ת כׇּל־עֻנּוֹתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents.

O LORD, remember in David’s favor
his extreme self-denial,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִ֭שְׁבַּע לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה נָ֝דַ֗ר לַאֲבִ֥יר יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
how he swore to the LORD,
vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob,

translations.hebrew: אִם־אָ֭בֹא בְּאֹ֣הֶל בֵּיתִ֑י אִם־אֶ֝עֱלֶ֗ה עַל־עֶ֥רֶשׂ יְצוּעָֽי׃
translations.english:
“I will not enter my house,
nor will I mount my bed,

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֶתֵּ֣ן שְׁנַ֣ת לְעֵינָ֑י לְֽעַפְעַפַּ֥י תְּנוּמָֽה׃
translations.english:
I will not give sleep to my eyes,
or slumber to my eyelidsaLit. “eyes.”

translations.hebrew: עַד־אֶמְצָ֣א מָ֭קוֹם לַיהֹוָ֑ה מִ֝שְׁכָּנ֗וֹת לַאֲבִ֥יר יַעֲקֹֽב׃
translations.english:
until I find a place for the LORD,
an abode for the Mighty One of Jacob.”

translations.hebrew: הִנֵּֽה־שְׁמַעֲנ֥וּהָ בְאֶפְרָ֑תָה מְ֝צָאנ֗וּהָ בִּשְׂדֵי־יָֽעַר׃
translations.english:
We heard it was in Ephrath;
we came upon it in the region of Jaar.bCf. 1 Sam. 7.1–2; 1 Chron. 13.5–6.

translations.hebrew: נָב֥וֹאָה לְמִשְׁכְּנוֹתָ֑יו נִ֝שְׁתַּחֲוֶ֗ה לַהֲדֹ֥ם רַגְלָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Let us enter His abode,
bow at His footstool.

translations.hebrew: קוּמָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה לִמְנוּחָתֶ֑ךָ אַ֝תָּ֗ה וַאֲר֥וֹן עֻזֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Advance, O LORD, to Your resting-place,
You and Your mighty Ark!

translations.hebrew: כֹּהֲנֶ֥יךָ יִלְבְּשׁוּ־צֶ֑דֶק וַחֲסִידֶ֥יךָ יְרַנֵּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Your priests are clothed in triumph;
Your loyal ones sing for joy.

translations.hebrew: בַּ֭עֲבוּר דָּוִ֣ד עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ אַל־תָּ֝שֵׁ֗ב פְּנֵ֣י מְשִׁיחֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
For the sake of Your servant David
do not reject Your anointed one.

translations.hebrew: נִשְׁבַּֽע־יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ לְדָוִ֡ד אֱמֶת֮ לֹא־יָשׁ֢וּב מִ֫מֶּ֥נָּה מִפְּרִ֥י בִטְנְךָ֑ אָ֝שִׁ֗ית לְכִסֵּא־לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
The LORD swore to David
a firm oath that He will not renounce,
“One of your own issue I will set upon your throne.

translations.hebrew: אִֽם־יִשְׁמְר֬וּ בָנֶ֨יךָ ׀ בְּרִיתִי֮ וְעֵדֹתִ֥י ז֗וֹ אֲלַ֫מְּדֵ֥ם גַּם־בְּנֵיהֶ֥ם עֲדֵי־עַ֑ד יֵ֝שְׁב֗וּ לְכִסֵּא־לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
If your sons keep My covenant
and My decrees that I teach them,
then their sons also,
to the end of time,
shall sit upon your throne.”

translations.hebrew: כִּי־בָחַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּצִיּ֑וֹן אִ֝וָּ֗הּ לְמוֹשָׁ֥ב לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
For the LORD has chosen Zion;
He has desired it for His seat.

translations.hebrew: זֹאת־מְנוּחָתִ֥י עֲדֵי־עַ֑ד פֹּה־אֵ֝שֵׁ֗ב כִּ֣י אִוִּתִֽיהָ׃
translations.english:
“This is my resting-place for all time;
here I will dwell, for I desire it.

translations.hebrew: צֵ֭ידָהּ בָּרֵ֣ךְ אֲבָרֵ֑ךְ אֶ֝בְיוֹנֶ֗יהָ אַשְׂבִּ֥יעַֽ לָֽחֶם׃
translations.english:
I will amply bless its store of food,
give its needy their fill of bread.

translations.hebrew: וְֽ֭כֹהֲנֶיהָ אַלְבִּ֣ישׁ יֶ֑שַׁע וַ֝חֲסִידֶ֗יהָ רַנֵּ֥ן יְרַנֵּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
I will clothe its priests in victory,
its loyal ones shall sing for joy.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֤ם אַצְמִ֣יחַ קֶ֣רֶן לְדָוִ֑ד עָרַ֥כְתִּי נֵ֝֗ר לִמְשִׁיחִֽי׃
translations.english:
There I will make a horn sprout for David;
I have prepared a lamp for My anointed one.

translations.hebrew: א֭וֹיְבָיו אַלְבִּ֣ישׁ בֹּ֑שֶׁת וְ֝עָלָ֗יו יָצִ֥יץ נִזְרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
I will clothe his enemies in disgrace,
while on him his crown shall sparkle.”

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֥יר הַֽמַּעֲל֗וֹת לְדָ֫וִ֥ד הִנֵּ֣ה מַה־טּ֭וֹב וּמַה־נָּעִ֑ים שֶׁ֖בֶת אַחִ֣ים גַּם־יָֽחַד׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents. Of David.

How good and how pleasant it is
that brothers dwell together.

translations.hebrew: כַּשֶּׁ֤מֶן הַטּ֨וֹב ׀ עַל־הָרֹ֗אשׁ יֹרֵ֗ד עַֽל־הַזָּקָ֥ן זְקַֽן־אַהֲרֹ֑ן שֶׁ֝יֹּרֵ֗ד עַל־פִּ֥י מִדּוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
It is like fine oil on the head
running down onto the beard,
the beard of Aaron,
that comes down over the collar of his robe;

translations.hebrew: כְּטַל־חֶרְמ֗וֹן שֶׁיֹּרֵד֮ עַל־הַרְרֵ֢י צִ֫יּ֥וֹן כִּ֤י שָׁ֨ם ׀ צִוָּ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־הַבְּרָכָ֑ה חַ֝יִּ֗ים עַד־הָעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
like the dew of Hermon
that falls upon the mountains of Zion.
There the LORD ordained blessing,
everlasting life.

translations.hebrew: שִׁ֗יר הַֽמַּ֫עֲל֥וֹת הִנֵּ֤ה ׀ בָּרְכ֣וּ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־עַבְדֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה הָעֹמְדִ֥ים בְּבֵית־יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בַּלֵּילֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
A song of ascents.

Now bless the LORD,
all you servants of the LORD
who stand nightly
in the house of the LORD.

translations.hebrew: שְׂאֽוּ־יְדֵכֶ֥ם קֹ֑דֶשׁ וּ֝בָרְכ֗וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Lift your hands toward the sanctuary
and bless the LORD.

translations.hebrew: יְבָרֶכְךָ֣ יְ֭הֹוָה מִצִּיּ֑וֹן עֹ֝שֵׂ֗ה שָׁמַ֥יִם וָאָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
May the LORD,
maker of heaven and earth,
bless you from Zion.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ הַֽ֭לְלוּ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה הַֽ֝לְל֗וּ עַבְדֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Hallelujah.
Praise the name of the LORD;
give praise, you servants of the LORD

translations.hebrew: שֶׁ֣֭עֹמְדִים בְּבֵ֣ית יְהֹוָ֑ה בְּ֝חַצְר֗וֹת בֵּ֣ית אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
who stand in the house of the LORD,
in the courts of the house of our God.

translations.hebrew: הַֽלְלוּ־יָ֭הּ כִּֽי־ט֣וֹב יְהֹוָ֑ה זַמְּר֥וּ לִ֝שְׁמ֗וֹ כִּ֣י נָעִֽים׃
translations.english:
Praise the LORD, for the LORD is good;
sing hymns to His name, for it is pleasant.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יַעֲקֹ֗ב בָּחַ֣ר ל֣וֹ יָ֑הּ יִ֝שְׂרָאֵ֗ל לִסְגֻלָּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
For the LORD has chosen Jacob for Himself,
Israel, as His treasured possession.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֲנִ֣י יָ֭דַעְתִּי כִּֽי־גָד֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֑ה וַ֝אֲדֹנֵ֗ינוּ מִכׇּל־אֱלֹהִֽים׃
translations.english:
For I know that the LORD is great,
that our Lord is greater than all gods.

translations.hebrew: כֹּ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־חָפֵ֥ץ יְהֹוָ֗ה עָ֫שָׂ֥ה בַּשָּׁמַ֥יִם וּבָאָ֑רֶץ בַּ֝יַּמִּ֗ים וְכׇל־תְּהֹמֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
Whatever the LORD desires He does
in heaven and earth,
in the seas and all the depths.

translations.hebrew: מַעֲלֶ֣ה נְשִׂאִים֮ מִקְצֵ֢ה הָ֫אָ֥רֶץ בְּרָקִ֣ים לַמָּטָ֣ר עָשָׂ֑ה מֽוֹצֵא־ר֝֗וּחַ מֵאֽוֹצְרוֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He makes clouds rise from the end of the earth;
He makes lightning for the rain;
He releases the wind from His vaults.

translations.hebrew: שֶׁ֭הִכָּה בְּכוֹרֵ֣י מִצְרָ֑יִם מֵ֝אָדָ֗ם עַד־בְּהֵמָֽה׃
translations.english:
He struck down the first-born of Egypt,
man and beast alike;

translations.hebrew: שָׁלַ֤ח ׀ אוֹתֹ֣ת וּ֭מֹפְתִים בְּתוֹכֵ֣כִי מִצְרָ֑יִם בְּ֝פַרְעֹ֗ה וּבְכׇל־עֲבָדָֽיו׃
translations.english:
He sent signs and portents againstaOthers “against you.” Egypt,
against Pharaoh and all his servants;

translations.hebrew: שֶׁ֭הִכָּה גּוֹיִ֣ם רַבִּ֑ים וְ֝הָרַ֗ג מְלָכִ֥ים עֲצוּמִֽים׃
translations.english:
He struck down many nations
and slew numerous kings—

translations.hebrew: לְסִיח֤וֹן ׀ מֶ֤לֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֗י וּ֭לְעוֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֑ן וּ֝לְכֹ֗ל מַמְלְכ֥וֹת כְּנָֽעַן׃
translations.english:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
Og, king of Bashan,
and all the royalty of Canaan—

translations.hebrew: וְנָתַ֣ן אַרְצָ֣ם נַחֲלָ֑ה נַ֝חֲלָ֗ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עַמּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
and gave their lands as a heritage,
as a heritage to His people Israel.

translations.hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה שִׁמְךָ֣ לְעוֹלָ֑ם יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה זִכְרְךָ֥ לְדֹר־וָדֹֽר׃
translations.english:
O LORD, Your name endures forever,
Your fame, O LORD, through all generations;

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־יָדִ֣ין יְהֹוָ֣ה עַמּ֑וֹ וְעַל־עֲ֝בָדָ֗יו יִתְנֶחָֽם׃
translations.english:
for the LORD will champion His people,
and obtain satisfaction for His servants.

translations.hebrew: עֲצַבֵּ֣י הַ֭גּוֹיִם כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֑ב מַ֝עֲשֵׂ֗ה יְדֵ֣י אָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
bWith vv. 15–20, cf. Ps. 115.4–11.The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
the work of men’s hands.

translations.hebrew: פֶּֽה־לָ֭הֶם וְלֹ֣א יְדַבֵּ֑רוּ עֵינַ֥יִם לָ֝הֶ֗ם וְלֹ֣א יִרְאֽוּ׃
translations.english:
They have mouths, but cannot speak;
they have eyes, but cannot see;

translations.hebrew: אׇזְנַ֣יִם לָ֭הֶם וְלֹ֣א יַאֲזִ֑ינוּ אַ֝֗ף אֵין־יֶשׁ־ר֥וּחַ בְּפִיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
they have ears, but cannot hear,
nor is there breath in their mouths.

translations.hebrew: כְּ֭מוֹהֶם יִהְי֣וּ עֹשֵׂיהֶ֑ם כֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־בֹּטֵ֣חַ בָּהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Those who fashion them,
all who trust in them,
shall become like them.

translations.hebrew: בֵּ֣ית יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל בָּרְכ֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה בֵּ֥ית אַ֝הֲרֹ֗ן בָּרְכ֥וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
O house of Israel, bless the LORD;
O house of Aaron, bless the LORD;

translations.hebrew: בֵּ֣ית הַ֭לֵּוִי בָּרְכ֣וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה יִֽרְאֵ֥י יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה בָּרְכ֥וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
O house of Levi, bless the LORD;
you who fear the LORD, bless the LORD.

translations.hebrew: בָּ֘ר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ מִצִּיּ֗וֹן שֹׁ֘כֵ֤ן יְֽרוּשָׁלָ֗͏ִם הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Blessed is the LORD from Zion,
He who dwells in Jerusalem.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: הוֹד֣וּ לַיהֹוָ֣ה כִּי־ט֑וֹב כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Praise the LORD; for He is good,
His steadfast love is eternal.

translations.hebrew: ה֭וֹדוּ לֵאלֹהֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Praise the God of gods,
His steadfast love is eternal.

translations.hebrew: ה֭וֹדוּ לַאֲדֹנֵ֣י הָאֲדֹנִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Praise the Lord of lords,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: לְעֹ֘שֵׂ֤ה נִפְלָא֣וֹת גְּדֹל֣וֹת לְבַדּ֑וֹ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who alone works great marvels,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: לְעֹשֵׂ֣ה הַ֭שָּׁמַיִם בִּתְבוּנָ֑ה כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who made the heavens with wisdom,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: לְרֹקַ֣ע הָ֭אָרֶץ עַל־הַמָּ֑יִם כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who spread the earth over the water,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: לְ֭עֹשֵׂה אוֹרִ֣ים גְּדֹלִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who made the great lights,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: אֶת־הַ֭שֶּׁמֶשׁ לְמֶמְשֶׁ֣לֶת בַּיּ֑וֹם כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
the sun to dominate the day,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: אֶת־הַיָּרֵ֣חַ וְ֭כוֹכָבִים לְמֶמְשְׁל֣וֹת בַּלָּ֑יְלָה כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
the moon and the stars to dominate the night,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: לְמַכֵּ֣ה מִ֭צְרַיִם בִּבְכוֹרֵיהֶ֑ם כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who struck Egypt through their first-born,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: וַיּוֹצֵ֣א יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל מִתּוֹכָ֑ם כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
and brought Israel out of their midst,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: בְּיָ֣ד חֲ֭זָקָה וּבִזְר֣וֹעַ נְטוּיָ֑ה כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
with a strong hand and outstretched arm,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: לְגֹזֵ֣ר יַם־ס֭וּף לִגְזָרִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who split apart the Sea of Reeds,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: וְהֶעֱבִ֣יר יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל בְּתוֹכ֑וֹ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
and made Israel pass through it,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: וְנִ֘עֵ֤ר פַּרְעֹ֣ה וְחֵיל֣וֹ בְיַם־ס֑וּף כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who hurled Pharaoh and his army into the Sea of Reeds,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: לְמוֹלִ֣יךְ עַ֭מּוֹ בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who led His people through the wilderness,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: לְ֭מַכֵּה מְלָכִ֣ים גְּדֹלִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who struck down great kings,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: וַֽ֭יַּהֲרֹג מְלָכִ֣ים אַדִּירִ֑ים כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
and slew mighty kings—
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: לְ֭סִיחוֹן מֶ֣לֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֑י כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: וּ֭לְעוֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֑ן כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Og, king of Bashan—
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: וְנָתַ֣ן אַרְצָ֣ם לְנַחֲלָ֑ה כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
and gave their land as a heritage,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: נַ֭חֲלָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עַבְדּ֑וֹ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
a heritage to His servant Israel,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: שֶׁ֭בְּשִׁפְלֵנוּ זָ֣כַר לָ֑נוּ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who took note of us in our degradation,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: וַיִּפְרְקֵ֥נוּ מִצָּרֵ֑ינוּ כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
and rescued us from our enemies,
His steadfast love is eternal;

translations.hebrew: נֹתֵ֣ן לֶ֭חֶם לְכׇל־בָּשָׂ֑ר כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Who gives food to all flesh,
His steadfast love is eternal.

translations.hebrew: ה֭וֹדוּ לְאֵ֣ל הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם כִּ֖י לְעוֹלָ֣ם חַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Praise the God of heaven,
His steadfast love is eternal.
