translations.hebrew: עַ֥ל־נַהֲר֨וֹת ׀ בָּבֶ֗ל שָׁ֣ם יָ֭שַׁבְנוּ גַּם־בָּכִ֑ינוּ בְּ֝זׇכְרֵ֗נוּ אֶת־צִיּֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
By the rivers of Babylon,
there we sat,
sat and wept,
as we thought of Zion.

translations.hebrew: עַֽל־עֲרָבִ֥ים בְּתוֹכָ֑הּ תָּ֝לִ֗ינוּ כִּנֹּרוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
There on the poplars
we hung up our lyres,

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י שָׁ֨ם שְֽׁאֵל֪וּנוּ שׁוֹבֵ֡ינוּ דִּבְרֵי־שִׁ֭יר וְתוֹלָלֵ֣ינוּ שִׂמְחָ֑ה שִׁ֥ירוּ לָ֝֗נוּ מִשִּׁ֥יר צִיּֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
for our captors asked us there for songs,
our tormentors,aMeaning of Heb. uncertain. for amusement:
“Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”

translations.hebrew: אֵ֗יךְ נָשִׁ֥יר אֶת־שִׁיר־יְהֹוָ֑ה עַ֝֗ל אַדְמַ֥ת נֵכָֽר׃
translations.english:
How can we sing a song of the LORD
on alien soil?

translations.hebrew: אִֽם־אֶשְׁכָּחֵ֥ךְ יְֽרוּשָׁלָ֗͏ִם תִּשְׁכַּ֥ח יְמִינִֽי׃
translations.english:
If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
let my right hand wither;bOthers “forget its cunning.”

translations.hebrew: תִּדְבַּֽק־לְשׁוֹנִ֨י ׀ לְחִכִּי֮ אִם־לֹ֢א אֶ֫זְכְּרֵ֥כִי אִם־לֹ֣א אַ֭עֲלֶה אֶת־יְרוּשָׁלַ֑͏ִם עַ֝֗ל רֹ֣אשׁ שִׂמְחָתִֽי׃
translations.english:
let my tongue stick to my palate
if I cease to think of you,
if I do not keep Jerusalem in memory
even at my happiest hour.

translations.hebrew: זְכֹ֤ר יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ לִבְנֵ֬י אֱד֗וֹם אֵת֮ י֤וֹם יְֽר֫וּשָׁלָ֥͏ִם הָ֭אֹ֣מְרִים עָ֤רוּ ׀ עָ֑רוּ עַ֝֗ד הַיְס֥וֹד בָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Remember, O LORD, against the Edomites
the day of Jerusalem’s fall;
how they cried, “Strip her, strip her
to her very foundations!”

translations.hebrew: בַּת־בָּבֶ֗ל הַשְּׁד֫וּדָ֥ה אַשְׁרֵ֥י שֶׁיְשַׁלֶּם־לָ֑ךְ אֶת־גְּ֝מוּלֵ֗ךְ שֶׁגָּמַ֥לְתְּ לָֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
Fair Babylon, you predator,cWith Targum; others “who are to be destroyed.”
a blessing on him who repays you in kind
what you have inflicted on us;

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֤י ׀ שֶׁיֹּאחֵ֓ז וְנִפֵּ֬ץ אֶֽת־עֹלָלַ֗יִךְ אֶל־הַסָּֽלַע׃
translations.english:
a blessing on him who seizes your babies
and dashes them against the rocks!

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ אוֹדְךָ֥ בְכׇל־לִבִּ֑י נֶ֖גֶד אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲזַמְּרֶֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
Of David.

I praise You with all my heart,
sing a hymn to You before the divine beings;

translations.hebrew: אֶשְׁתַּחֲוֶ֨ה אֶל־הֵיכַ֪ל קׇדְשְׁךָ֡ וְא֘וֹדֶ֤ה אֶת־שְׁמֶ֗ךָ עַל־חַסְדְּךָ֥ וְעַל־אֲמִתֶּ֑ךָ כִּֽי־הִגְדַּ֥לְתָּ עַל־כׇּל־שִׁ֝מְךָ֗ אִמְרָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
I bow toward Your holy temple
and praise Your name for Your steadfast love and faithfulness,
because You have exalted aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.Your name, Your word, above all.a

translations.hebrew: בְּי֣וֹם קָ֭רָֽאתִי וַֽתַּעֲנֵ֑נִי תַּרְהִבֵ֖נִי בְנַפְשִׁ֣י עֹֽז׃
translations.english:
When I called, You answered me,
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.You inspired me with courage.-a

translations.hebrew: יוֹד֣וּךָ יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־מַלְכֵי־אָ֑רֶץ כִּ֥י שָׁ֝מְע֗וּ אִמְרֵי־פִֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
All the kings of the earth shall praise You, O LORD,
for they have heard the words You spoke.

translations.hebrew: וְ֭יָשִׁירוּ בְּדַרְכֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּֽי־גָ֝ד֗וֹל כְּב֣וֹד יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
They shall sing of the ways of the LORD,
“Great is the majesty of the LORD!”

translations.hebrew: כִּי־רָ֣ם יְ֭הֹוָה וְשָׁפָ֣ל יִרְאֶ֑ה וְ֝גָבֹ֗הַּ מִמֶּרְחָ֥ק יְיֵדָֽע׃
translations.english:
High though the LORD is, He sees the lowly;
lofty, He perceives from afar.

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֵלֵ֤ךְ ׀ בְּקֶ֥רֶב צָרָ֗ה תְּחַ֫יֵּ֥נִי עַ֤ל אַ֣ף אֹ֭יְבַי תִּשְׁלַ֣ח יָדֶ֑ךָ וְת֖וֹשִׁיעֵ֣נִי יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
Though I walk among enemies,
You preserve me in the face of my foes;
You extend Your hand;
with Your right hand You deliver me.

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָה֮ יִגְמֹ֢ר בַּ֫עֲדִ֥י יְ֭הֹוָה חַסְדְּךָ֣ לְעוֹלָ֑ם מַעֲשֵׂ֖י יָדֶ֣יךָ אַל־תֶּֽרֶף׃
translations.english:
The LORD will settle accounts for me.
O LORD, Your steadfast love is eternal;
do not forsake the work of Your hands.

translations.hebrew: לַ֭מְנַצֵּחַ לְדָוִ֣ד מִזְמ֑וֹר יְהֹוָ֥ה חֲ֝קַרְתַּ֗נִי וַתֵּדָֽע׃
translations.english:
For the leader. Of David. A psalm.

O LORD, You have examined me and know me.

translations.hebrew: אַתָּ֣ה יָ֭דַעְתָּ שִׁבְתִּ֣י וְקוּמִ֑י בַּ֥נְתָּה לְ֝רֵעִ֗י מֵרָחֽוֹק׃
translations.english:
When I sit down or stand up You know it;
You discern my thoughts from afar.

translations.hebrew: אׇרְחִ֣י וְרִבְעִ֣י זֵרִ֑יתָ וְֽכׇל־דְּרָכַ֥י הִסְכַּֽנְתָּה׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.You observe-a my walking and reclining,
and are familiar with all my ways.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵ֣ין מִ֭לָּה בִּלְשׁוֹנִ֑י הֵ֥ן יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה יָדַ֥עְתָּ כֻלָּֽהּ׃
translations.english:
There is not a word on my tongue
but that You, O LORD, know it well.

translations.hebrew: אָח֣וֹר וָקֶ֣דֶם צַרְתָּ֑נִי וַתָּ֖שֶׁת עָלַ֣י כַּפֶּֽכָה׃
translations.english:
You hedge me before and behind;
You lay Your hand upon me.

translations.hebrew: (פלאיה) [פְּלִ֣יאָֽה] דַ֣עַת מִמֶּ֑נִּי נִ֝שְׂגְּבָ֗ה לֹא־א֥וּכַֽל לָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
It is beyond my knowledge;
it is a mystery; I cannot fathom it.

translations.hebrew: אָ֭נָֽה אֵלֵ֣ךְ מֵרוּחֶ֑ךָ וְ֝אָ֗נָה מִפָּנֶ֥יךָ אֶבְרָֽח׃
translations.english:
Where can I escape from Your spirit?
Where can I flee from Your presence?

translations.hebrew: אִם־אֶסַּ֣ק שָׁ֭מַיִם שָׁ֣ם אָ֑תָּה וְאַצִּ֖יעָה שְּׁא֣וֹל הִנֶּֽךָּ׃
translations.english:
If I ascend to heaven, You are there;
if I descend to Sheol, You are there too.

translations.hebrew: אֶשָּׂ֥א כַנְפֵי־שָׁ֑חַר אֶ֝שְׁכְּנָ֗ה בְּאַחֲרִ֥ית יָֽם׃
translations.english:
If I take wing with the dawn
to come to rest on the western horizon,

translations.hebrew: גַּם־שָׁ֭ם יָדְךָ֣ תַנְחֵ֑נִי וְֽתֹאחֲזֵ֥נִי יְמִינֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
even there Your hand will be guiding me,
Your right hand will be holding me fast.

translations.hebrew: וָ֭אֹמַר אַךְ־חֹ֣שֶׁךְ יְשׁוּפֵ֑נִי וְ֝לַ֗יְלָה א֣וֹר בַּעֲדֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
If I say, “Surely darkness bCf. Rashi, Ibn Ezra; meaning of Heb. uncertain.will conceal me,
night will provide me with cover,”-b

translations.hebrew: גַּם־חֹשֶׁךְ֮ לֹא־יַחְשִׁ֢יךְ מִ֫מֶּ֥ךָּ וְ֭לַיְלָה כַּיּ֣וֹם יָאִ֑יר כַּ֝חֲשֵׁיכָ֗ה כָּאוֹרָֽה׃
translations.english:
darkness is not dark for You;
night is as light as day;
darkness and light are the same.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־אַ֭תָּה קָנִ֣יתָ כִלְיֹתָ֑י תְּ֝סֻכֵּ֗נִי בְּבֶ֣טֶן אִמִּֽי׃
translations.english:
It was You who created my conscience;cLit. “kidneys.”
You fashioned me in my mother’s womb.

translations.hebrew: אוֹדְךָ֗ עַ֤ל כִּ֥י נוֹרָא֗וֹת נִ֫פְלֵ֥יתִי נִפְלָאִ֥ים מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ וְ֝נַפְשִׁ֗י יֹדַ֥עַת מְאֹֽד׃
translations.english:
I praise You,
for I am awesomely, wondrously made;
Your work is wonderful;
I know it very well.

translations.hebrew: לֹֽא־נִכְחַ֥ד עׇצְמִ֗י מִ֫מֶּ֥ךָּ אֲשֶׁר־עֻשֵּׂ֥יתִי בַסֵּ֑תֶר רֻ֝קַּ֗מְתִּי בְּֽתַחְתִּיּ֥וֹת אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
My frame was not concealed from You
when I was shaped in a hidden place,
knit together in the recesses of the earth.

translations.hebrew: גׇּלְמִ֤י ׀ רָ֘א֤וּ עֵינֶ֗יךָ וְעַֽל־סִפְרְךָ֮ כֻּלָּ֢ם יִכָּ֫תֵ֥בוּ יָמִ֥ים יֻצָּ֑רוּ (ולא) [וְל֖וֹ] אֶחָ֣ד בָּהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
Your eyes saw my unformed limbs;
they were all recorded in Your book;
in due time they were formed,
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.to the very last one of them.-a

translations.hebrew: וְלִ֗י מַה־יָּקְר֣וּ רֵעֶ֣יךָ אֵ֑ל מֶ֥ה עָ֝צְמ֗וּ רָאשֵׁיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
How weighty Your thoughts seem to me, O God,
how great their number!

translations.hebrew: אֶ֭סְפְּרֵם מֵח֣וֹל יִרְבּ֑וּן הֱ֝קִיצֹ֗תִי וְעוֹדִ֥י עִמָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
I count them—they exceed the grains of sand;
I end—but am still with You.

translations.hebrew: אִם־תִּקְטֹ֖ל אֱל֥וֹהַּ <small>׀</small> רָשָׁ֑ע וְאַנְשֵׁ֥י דָ֝מִ֗ים ס֣וּרוּ מֶֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
O God, if You would only slay the wicked—
you murderers, away from me!—

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר יֹ֭מְרוּךָ לִמְזִמָּ֑ה נָשׂ֖וּא לַשָּׁ֣וְא עָרֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.who invoke You for intrigue,
Your enemies who swear by You falsely.-a

translations.hebrew: הֲלֽוֹא־מְשַׂנְאֶ֖יךָ יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> אֶשְׂנָ֑א וּ֝בִתְקוֹמְמֶ֗יךָ אֶתְקוֹטָֽט׃
translations.english:
O LORD, You know I hate those who hate You,
and loathe Your adversaries.

translations.hebrew: תַּכְלִ֣ית שִׂנְאָ֣ה שְׂנֵאתִ֑ים לְ֝אוֹיְבִ֗ים הָ֣יוּ לִֽי׃
translations.english:
I feel a perfect hatred toward them;
I count them my enemies.

translations.hebrew: חׇקְרֵ֣נִי אֵ֭ל וְדַ֣ע לְבָבִ֑י בְּ֝חָנֵ֗נִי וְדַ֣ע שַׂרְעַפָּֽי׃
translations.english:
Examine me, O God, and know my mind;
probe me and know my thoughts.

translations.hebrew: וּרְאֵ֗ה אִם־דֶּֽרֶךְ־עֹ֥צֶב בִּ֑י וּ֝נְחֵ֗נִי בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
See if I have vexatious ways,
and guide me in ways everlasting.

translations.hebrew: לַמְנַצֵּ֗חַ מִזְמ֥וֹר לְדָוִֽד׃
translations.english: For the leader. A psalm of David.

translations.hebrew: חַלְּצֵ֣נִי יְ֭הֹוָה מֵאָדָ֣ם רָ֑ע מֵאִ֖ישׁ חֲמָסִ֣ים תִּנְצְרֵֽנִי׃
translations.english:
Rescue me, O LORD, from evil men;
save me from the lawless,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר חָשְׁב֣וּ רָע֣וֹת בְּלֵ֑ב כׇּל־י֝֗וֹם יָג֥וּרוּ מִלְחָמֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
whose minds are full of evil schemes,
who plot war every day.

translations.hebrew: שָׁ֥נְנ֣וּ לְשׁוֹנָם֮ כְּֽמוֹ־נָ֫חָ֥שׁ חֲמַ֥ת עַכְשׁ֑וּב תַּ֖חַת שְׂפָתֵ֣ימוֹ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
They sharpen their tongues like serpents;
spiders’ poison is on their lips. Selah.

translations.hebrew: שׇׁמְרֵ֤נִי יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ מִ֘ידֵ֤י רָשָׁ֗ע מֵאִ֣ישׁ חֲמָסִ֣ים תִּנְצְרֵ֑נִי אֲשֶׁ֥ר חָ֝שְׁב֗וּ לִדְח֥וֹת פְּעָמָֽי׃
translations.english:
O LORD, keep me out of the clutches of the wicked;
save me from lawless men
who scheme to aLit. “push my feet.”make me fall.-a

translations.hebrew: טָ֥מְנֽוּ־גֵאִ֨ים ׀ פַּ֡ח לִ֗י וַחֲבָלִ֗ים פָּ֣רְשׂוּ רֶ֭שֶׁת לְיַד־מַעְגָּ֑ל מֹקְשִׁ֖ים שָׁתוּ־לִ֣י סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
Arrogant men laid traps with ropes for me;
they spread out a net along the way;
they set snares for me. Selah.

translations.hebrew: אָמַ֣רְתִּי לַ֭יהֹוָה אֵ֣לִי אָ֑תָּה הַאֲזִ֥ינָה יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה ק֣וֹל תַּחֲנוּנָֽי׃
translations.english:
I said to the LORD: You are my God;
give ear, O LORD, to my pleas for mercy.

translations.hebrew: יֱהֹוִ֣ה אֲ֭דֹנָי עֹ֣ז יְשׁוּעָתִ֑י סַכֹּ֥תָה לְ֝רֹאשִׁ֗י בְּי֣וֹם נָֽשֶׁק׃
translations.english:
O GOD, my Lord, the strength of my deliverance,
You protected my head on the day of battle.bLit. “arms.”

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּתֵּ֣ן יְ֭הֹוָה מַאֲוַיֵּ֣י רָשָׁ֑ע זְמָמ֥וֹ אַל־תָּ֝פֵ֗ק יָר֥וּמוּ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
O LORD, do not grant the desires of the wicked;
do not let their plan succeed,
cMeaning of Heb. uncertain.else they be exalted. Selah.

translations.hebrew: רֹ֥אשׁ מְסִבָּ֑י עֲמַ֖ל שְׂפָתֵ֣ימוֹ (יכסומו) [יְכַסֵּֽימוֹ]׃
translations.english:
May the heads of those who beset me
be covered with the mischief of their lips.-c

translations.hebrew: (ימיטו) [יִמּ֥וֹטוּ] עֲלֵיהֶ֗ם גֶּחָ֫לִ֥ים בָּאֵ֥שׁ יַפִּלֵ֑ם בְּ֝מַהֲמֹר֗וֹת בַּל־יָקֽוּמוּ׃
translations.english:
may coals of fire drop down upon them,
and they be cast into pits, never to rise again.

translations.hebrew: אִ֥ישׁ לָשׁוֹן֮ בַּל־יִכּ֢וֹן בָּ֫אָ֥רֶץ אִישׁ־חָמָ֥ס רָ֑ע יְ֝צוּדֶ֗נּוּ לְמַדְחֵפֹֽת׃
translations.english:
Let slanderers have no place in the land;
let the evil of the lawless man drive him into corrals.

translations.hebrew: (ידעת) [יָדַ֗עְתִּי] כִּֽי־יַעֲשֶׂ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה דִּ֣ין עָנִ֑י מִ֝שְׁפַּ֗ט אֶבְיֹנִֽים׃
translations.english:
I know that the LORD will champion
the cause of the poor, the right of the needy.

translations.hebrew: אַ֣ךְ צַ֭דִּיקִים יוֹד֣וּ לִשְׁמֶ֑ךָ יֵשְׁב֥וּ יְ֝שָׁרִ֗ים אֶת־פָּנֶֽיךָ׃
translations.english:
Righteous men shall surely praise Your name;
the upright shall dwell in Your presence.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָ֫וִ֥ד יְהֹוָ֣ה קְ֭רָאתִיךָ ח֣וּשָׁה לִּ֑י הַאֲזִ֥ינָה ק֝וֹלִ֗י בְּקׇרְאִי־לָֽךְ׃
translations.english:
A psalm of David.

I call You, O LORD, hasten to me;
give ear to my cry when I call You.

translations.hebrew: תִּכּ֤וֹן תְּפִלָּתִ֣י קְטֹ֣רֶת לְפָנֶ֑יךָ מַֽשְׂאַ֥ת כַּ֝פַּ֗י מִנְחַת־עָֽרֶב׃
translations.english:
Take my prayer as an offering of incense,
my upraised hands as an evening sacrifice.

translations.hebrew: שִׁיתָ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה שׇׁמְרָ֣ה לְפִ֑י נִ֝צְּרָ֗ה עַל־דַּ֥ל שְׂפָתָֽי׃
translations.english:
O LORD, set a guard over my mouth,
a watch at the door of my lips;

translations.hebrew: אַל־תַּט־לִבִּ֨י לְדָבָ֪ר ׀ רָ֡ע לְהִתְע֘וֹלֵ֤ל עֲלִל֨וֹת ׀ בְּרֶ֗שַׁע אֶת־אִישִׁ֥ים פֹּעֲלֵי־אָ֑וֶן וּבַל־אֶ֝לְחַ֗ם בְּמַנְעַמֵּיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
let my mind not turn to an evil thing,
to practice deeds of wickedness
with men who are evildoers;
let me not feast on their dainties.

translations.hebrew: יֶ֥הֶלְמֵֽנִי־צַדִּ֨יק ׀ חֶ֡סֶד וְֽיוֹכִיחֵ֗נִי שֶׁ֣מֶן רֹ֭אשׁ אַל־יָנִ֣י רֹאשִׁ֑י כִּי־ע֥וֹד וּ֝תְפִלָּתִ֗י בְּרָעוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃
translations.english:
aMeaning of vv. 5–7 uncertain.Let the righteous man strike me in loyalty,
let him reprove me;
let my head not refuse such choice oil.
My prayers are still against theirbI.e., the evildoers of v. 4. evil deeds.

translations.hebrew: נִשְׁמְט֣וּ בִֽידֵי־סֶ֭לַע שֹׁפְטֵיהֶ֑ם וְשָׁמְע֥וּ אֲ֝מָרַ֗י כִּ֣י נָעֵֽמוּ׃
translations.english:
May their judges slip on the rock,
but let my words be heard, for they are sweet.

translations.hebrew: כְּמ֤וֹ פֹלֵ֣חַ וּבֹקֵ֣עַ בָּאָ֑רֶץ נִפְזְר֥וּ עֲ֝צָמֵ֗ינוּ לְפִ֣י שְׁאֽוֹל׃
translations.english:
As when the earth is cleft and broken up
our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֤י אֵלֶ֨יךָ ׀ יֱהֹוִ֣ה אֲדֹנָ֣י עֵינָ֑י בְּכָ֥ה חָ֝סִ֗יתִי אַל־תְּעַ֥ר נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
My eyes are fixed upon You, O GOD my Lord;
I seek refuge in You, do not put me in jeopardy.

translations.hebrew: שׇׁמְרֵ֗נִי מִ֣ידֵי פַ֭ח יָ֣קְשׁוּ לִ֑י וּ֝מֹקְשׁ֗וֹת פֹּ֣עֲלֵי אָֽוֶן׃
translations.english:
Keep me from the trap laid for me,
and from the snares of evildoers.

translations.hebrew: יִפְּל֣וּ בְמַכְמֹרָ֣יו רְשָׁעִ֑ים יַ֥חַד אָ֝נֹכִ֗י עַֽד־אֶעֱבֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Let the wicked fall into their nets
while I alone come through.

translations.hebrew: מַשְׂכִּ֥יל לְדָוִ֑ד בִּֽהְיוֹת֖וֹ בַמְּעָרָ֣ה תְפִלָּֽה׃
translations.english: A maskil of David, while he was in the cave.aCf. 1 Sam. 24.3–4. A prayer.

translations.hebrew: ק֭וֹלִי אֶל־יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶזְעָ֑ק ק֝וֹלִ֗י אֶל־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֶתְחַנָּֽן׃
translations.english:
I cry aloud to the LORD;
I appeal to the LORD loudly for mercy.

translations.hebrew: אֶשְׁפֹּ֣ךְ לְפָנָ֣יו שִׂיחִ֑י צָ֝רָתִ֗י לְפָנָ֥יו אַגִּֽיד׃
translations.english:
I pour out my complaint before Him;
I lay my trouble before Him

translations.hebrew: בְּהִתְעַטֵּ֬ף עָלַ֨י ׀ רוּחִ֗י וְאַתָּה֮ יָדַ֢עְתָּ נְֽתִיבָ֫תִ֥י בְּאֹֽרַח־ז֥וּ אֲהַלֵּ֑ךְ טָמְנ֖וּ פַ֣ח לִֽי׃
translations.english:
when my spirit fails within me.
You know my course;
they have laid a trap in the path I walk.

translations.hebrew: הַבֵּ֤יט יָמִ֨ין ׀ וּרְאֵה֮ וְאֵֽין־לִ֢י מַ֫כִּ֥יר אָבַ֣ד מָנ֣וֹס מִמֶּ֑נִּי אֵ֖ין דּוֹרֵ֣שׁ לְנַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
Look at my right and see—
I have no friend;
there is nowhere I can flee,
no one cares about me.

translations.hebrew: זָעַ֥קְתִּי אֵלֶ֗יךָ יְ֫הֹוָ֥ה אָ֭מַרְתִּי אַתָּ֣ה מַחְסִ֑י חֶ֝לְקִ֗י בְּאֶ֣רֶץ הַחַיִּֽים׃
translations.english:
So I cry to You, O LORD;
I say, “You are my refuge,
all I have in the land of the living.”

translations.hebrew: הַקְשִׁ֤יבָה ׀ אֶֽל־רִנָּתִי֮ כִּֽי־דַלּ֢וֹתִ֫י מְאֹ֥ד הַצִּילֵ֥נִי מֵרֹדְפַ֑י כִּ֖י אָמְצ֣וּ מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
translations.english:
Listen to my cry, for I have been brought very low;
save me from my pursuers,
for they are too strong for me.

translations.hebrew: ה֘וֹצִ֤יאָה מִמַּסְגֵּ֨ר ׀ נַפְשִׁי֮ לְהוֹד֢וֹת אֶת־שְׁ֫מֶ֥ךָ בִּ֭י יַכְתִּ֣רוּ צַדִּיקִ֑ים כִּ֖י תִגְמֹ֣ל עָלָֽי׃
translations.english:
Free me from prison,
that I may praise Your name.
The righteous bMeaning of Heb. uncertain.shall glory in me-b
for Your gracious dealings with me.

translations.hebrew: מִזְמ֗וֹר לְדָ֫וִ֥ד יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ שְׁמַ֬ע תְּפִלָּתִ֗י הַאֲזִ֥ינָה אֶל־תַּחֲנוּנַ֑י בֶּאֱמֻנָתְךָ֥ עֲ֝נֵ֗נִי בְּצִדְקָתֶֽךָ׃
translations.english:
A psalm of David.

O LORD, hear my prayer;
give ear to my plea, as You are faithful;
answer me, as You are beneficent.

translations.hebrew: וְאַל־תָּב֣וֹא בְ֭מִשְׁפָּט אֶת־עַבְדֶּ֑ךָ כִּ֤י לֹֽא־יִצְדַּ֖ק לְפָנֶ֣יךָ כׇל־חָֽי׃
translations.english:
Do not enter into judgment with Your servant,
for before You no creature is in the right.

translations.hebrew: כִּ֥י רָ֘דַ֤ף אוֹיֵ֨ב ׀ נַפְשִׁ֗י דִּכָּ֣א לָ֭אָרֶץ חַיָּתִ֑י הוֹשִׁבַ֥נִי בְ֝מַחֲשַׁכִּ֗ים כְּמֵתֵ֥י עוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
My foe hounded me;
he crushed me to the ground;
he made me dwell in darkness
like those long dead.

translations.hebrew: וַתִּתְעַטֵּ֣ף עָלַ֣י רוּחִ֑י בְּ֝תוֹכִ֗י יִשְׁתּוֹמֵ֥ם לִבִּֽי׃
translations.english:
My spirit failed within me;
my mind was numbed with horror.

translations.hebrew: זָ֘כַ֤רְתִּי יָמִ֨ים ׀ מִקֶּ֗דֶם הָגִ֥יתִי בְכׇל־פׇּעֳלֶ֑ךָ בְּֽמַעֲשֵׂ֖ה יָדֶ֣יךָ אֲשׂוֹחֵֽחַ׃
translations.english:
Then I thought of the days of old;
I rehearsed all Your deeds,
recounted the work of Your hands.

translations.hebrew: פֵּרַ֣שְׂתִּי יָדַ֣י אֵלֶ֑יךָ נַפְשִׁ֓י ׀ כְּאֶרֶץ־עֲיֵפָ֖ה לְךָ֣ סֶֽלָה׃
translations.english:
I stretched out my hands to You,
longing for You like thirsty earth. Selah.

translations.hebrew: מַ֘הֵ֤ר עֲנֵ֨נִי ׀ יְהֹוָה֮ כָּלְתָ֢ה ר֫וּחִ֥י אַל־תַּסְתֵּ֣ר פָּנֶ֣יךָ מִמֶּ֑נִּי וְ֝נִמְשַׁ֗לְתִּי עִם־יֹ֥רְדֵי בֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Answer me quickly, O LORD;
my spirit can endure no more.
Do not hide Your face from me,
or I shall become like those who descend into the Pit.

translations.hebrew: הַשְׁמִ֘יעֵ֤נִי בַבֹּ֨קֶר ׀ חַסְדֶּךָ֮ כִּֽי־בְךָ֢ בָ֫טָ֥חְתִּי הוֹדִיעֵ֗נִי דֶּרֶךְ־ז֥וּ אֵלֵ֑ךְ כִּי־אֵ֝לֶ֗יךָ נָשָׂ֥אתִי נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
Let me learn of Your faithfulness by daybreak,
for in You I trust;
let me know the road I must take,
for on You I have set my hope.

translations.hebrew: הַצִּילֵ֖נִי מֵאֹיְבַ֥י <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֗ה אֵלֶ֥יךָ כִסִּֽתִי׃
translations.english:
Save me from my foes, O LORD;
aMeaning of Heb. uncertain.to You I look for cover.-a

translations.hebrew: לַמְּדֵ֤נִי ׀ לַ֥עֲשׂ֣וֹת רְצוֹנֶךָ֮ כִּֽי־אַתָּ֢ה אֱל֫וֹהָ֥י רוּחֲךָ֥ טוֹבָ֑ה תַּ֝נְחֵ֗נִי בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִישֽׁוֹר׃
translations.english:
Teach me to do Your will,
for You are my God.
Let Your gracious spirit lead me
on level ground.

translations.hebrew: לְמַעַן־שִׁמְךָ֣ יְהֹוָ֣ה תְּחַיֵּ֑נִי בְּצִדְקָתְךָ֓ ׀ תּוֹצִ֖יא מִצָּרָ֣ה נַפְשִֽׁי׃
translations.english:
For the sake of Your name, O LORD, preserve me;
as You are beneficent, free me from distress.

translations.hebrew: וּֽבְחַסְדְּךָ֮ תַּצְמִ֢ית אֹ֫יְבָ֥י וְֽ֭הַאֲבַדְתָּ כׇּל־צֹרְרֵ֣י נַפְשִׁ֑י כִּ֝֗י אֲנִ֣י עַבְדֶּֽךָ׃
translations.english:
As You are faithful, put an end to my foes;
destroy all my mortal enemies,
for I am Your servant.

translations.hebrew: לְדָוִ֨ד ׀ בָּ֘ר֤וּךְ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ צוּרִ֗י הַֽמְלַמֵּ֣ד יָדַ֣י לַקְרָ֑ב אֶ֝צְבְּעוֹתַ֗י לַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
translations.english:
Of David.

Blessed is the LORD, my rock,
who trains my hands for battle,
my fingers for warfare;

translations.hebrew: חַסְדִּ֥י וּמְצוּדָתִי֮ מִשְׂגַּבִּ֢י וּֽמְפַלְטִ֫י־לִ֥י מָ֭גִנִּי וּב֣וֹ חָסִ֑יתִי הָרוֹדֵ֖ד עַמִּ֣י תַחְתָּֽי׃
translations.english:
my faithful one, my fortress,
my haven and my deliverer,
my shield, in whom I take shelter,
who makes peoplesaSo Targum, Saadia; others “my people.” subject to me.

translations.hebrew: יְֽהֹוָ֗ה מָֽה־אָ֭דָם וַתֵּדָעֵ֑הוּ בֶּן־אֱ֝נ֗וֹשׁ וַֽתְּחַשְּׁבֵֽהוּ׃
translations.english:
O LORD, what is man that You should care about him,
mortal man, that You should think of him?

translations.hebrew: אָ֭דָם לַהֶ֣בֶל דָּמָ֑ה יָ֝מָ֗יו כְּצֵ֣ל עוֹבֵֽר׃
translations.english:
Man is like a breath;
his days are like a passing shadow.

translations.hebrew: יְ֭הֹוָה הַט־שָׁמֶ֣יךָ וְתֵרֵ֑ד גַּ֖ע בֶּהָרִ֣ים וְֽיֶעֱשָֽׁנוּ׃
translations.english:
O LORD, bend Your sky and come down;
touch the mountains and they will smoke.

translations.hebrew: בְּר֣וֹק בָּ֭רָק וּתְפִיצֵ֑ם שְׁלַ֥ח חִ֝צֶּ֗יךָ וּתְהֻמֵּֽם׃
translations.english:
Make lightning flash and scatter them;
shoot Your arrows and rout them.

translations.hebrew: שְׁלַ֥ח יָדֶ֗יךָ מִ֫מָּר֥וֹם פְּצֵ֣נִי וְ֭הַצִּילֵנִי מִמַּ֣יִם רַבִּ֑ים מִ֝יַּ֗ד בְּנֵ֣י נֵכָֽר׃
translations.english:
Reach Your hand down from on high;
rescue me, save me from the mighty waters,
from the hands of foreigners,

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֣ר פִּ֭יהֶם דִּבֶּר־שָׁ֑וְא וִ֝ימִינָ֗ם יְמִ֣ין שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
whose mouths speak lies,
and whose oathsbWith Rashi; lit. “right hand.” are false.

translations.hebrew: אֱֽלֹהִ֗ים שִׁ֣יר חָ֭דָשׁ אָשִׁ֣ירָה לָּ֑ךְ בְּנֵ֥בֶל עָ֝שׂ֗וֹר אֲזַמְּרָה־לָּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
O God, I will sing You a new song,
sing a hymn to You with a ten-stringed harp,

translations.hebrew: הַנּוֹתֵ֥ן תְּשׁוּעָ֗ה לַמְּלָ֫כִ֥ים הַ֭פּוֹצֶה אֶת־דָּוִ֥ד עַבְדּ֗וֹ מֵחֶ֥רֶב רָעָֽה׃
translations.english:
to You who give victory to kings,
who rescue His servant David from the deadly sword.

translations.hebrew: פְּצֵ֥נִי וְהַצִּילֵנִי֮ מִיַּ֢ד בְּֽנֵי־נֵ֫כָ֥ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר פִּ֭יהֶם דִּבֶּר־שָׁ֑וְא וִ֝ימִינָ֗ם יְמִ֣ין שָֽׁקֶר׃
translations.english:
Rescue me, save me from the hands of foreigners,
whose mouths speak lies,
and whose oathsbWith Rashi; lit. “right hand.” are false.

translations.hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֤ר בָּנֵ֨ינוּ ׀ כִּנְטִעִים֮ מְגֻדָּלִ֢ים בִּֽנְעוּרֵ֫יהֶ֥ם בְּנוֹתֵ֥ינוּ כְזָוִיֹּ֑ת מְ֝חֻטָּב֗וֹת תַּבְנִ֥ית הֵיכָֽל׃
translations.english:
cThe meaning of several phrases in vv. 12–14 is uncertain.For our sons are like saplings,
well-tended in their youth;
our daughters are like cornerstones
trimmed to give shape to a palace.

translations.hebrew: מְזָוֵ֣ינוּ מְלֵאִים֮ מְפִיקִ֥ים מִזַּ֗ן אֶ֫ל־זַ֥ן צֹאונֵ֣נוּ מַ֭אֲלִיפוֹת מְרֻבָּב֗וֹת בְּחוּצוֹתֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
Our storehouses are full,
supplying produce of all kinds;
our flocks number thousands,
even myriads, in our fields;

translations.hebrew: אַלּוּפֵ֗ינוּ מְֽסֻבָּ֫לִ֥ים אֵֽין־פֶּ֭רֶץ וְאֵ֣ין יוֹצֵ֑את וְאֵ֥ין צְ֝וָחָ֗ה בִּרְחֹבֹתֵֽינוּ׃
translations.english:
our cattle are well cared for.
There is no breaching and no sortie,
and no wailing in our streets.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣י הָ֭עָם שֶׁכָּ֣כָה לּ֑וֹ אַֽשְׁרֵ֥י הָ֝עָ֗ם שֱׁיְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Happy the people who have it so;
happy the people whose God is the LORD.

translations.hebrew: תְּהִלָּ֗ה לְדָ֫וִ֥ד אֲרוֹמִמְךָ֣ אֱלוֹהַ֣י הַמֶּ֑לֶךְ וַאֲבָרְכָ֥ה שִׁ֝מְךָ֗ לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
translations.english:
A song of praise. Of David.

I will extol You, my God and king,
and bless Your name forever and ever.

translations.hebrew: בְּכׇל־י֥וֹם אֲבָרְכֶ֑ךָּ וַאֲהַלְלָ֥ה שִׁ֝מְךָ֗ לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
translations.english:
Every day will I bless You
and praise Your name forever and ever.

translations.hebrew: גָּ֘ד֤וֹל יְהֹוָ֣ה וּמְהֻלָּ֣ל מְאֹ֑ד וְ֝לִגְדֻלָּת֗וֹ אֵ֣ין חֵֽקֶר׃
translations.english:
Great is the LORD and much acclaimed;
His greatness cannot be fathomed.

translations.hebrew: דּ֣וֹר לְ֭דוֹר יְשַׁבַּ֣ח מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ וּגְב֖וּרֹתֶ֣יךָ יַגִּֽידוּ׃
translations.english:
One generation shall laud Your works to another
and declare Your mighty acts.

translations.hebrew: הֲ֭דַר כְּב֣וֹד הוֹדֶ֑ךָ וְדִבְרֵ֖י נִפְלְאֹתֶ֣יךָ אָשִֽׂיחָה׃
translations.english:
The glorious majesty of Your splendor
aA Qumran Pss. scroll reads: “they will speak of, and Your wonders.”and Your wondrous acts-a will I recite.

translations.hebrew: וֶעֱז֣וּז נֽוֹרְאֹתֶ֣יךָ יֹאמֵ֑רוּ (וגדלותיך) [וּגְדֻלָּתְךָ֥] אֲסַפְּרֶֽנָּה׃
translations.english:
Men shall talk of the might of Your awesome deeds,
and I will recount Your greatness.

translations.hebrew: זֵ֣כֶר רַב־טוּבְךָ֣ יַבִּ֑יעוּ וְצִדְקָתְךָ֥ יְרַנֵּֽנוּ׃
translations.english:
They shall celebrate Your abundant goodness,
and sing joyously of Your beneficence.

translations.hebrew: חַנּ֣וּן וְרַח֣וּם יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶ֥רֶךְ אַ֝פַּ֗יִם וּגְדׇל־חָֽסֶד׃
translations.english:
The LORD is gracious and compassionate,
slow to anger and abounding in kindness.

translations.hebrew: טוֹב־יְהֹוָ֥ה לַכֹּ֑ל וְ֝רַחֲמָ֗יו עַל־כׇּל־מַעֲשָֽׂיו׃
translations.english:
The LORD is good to all,
and His mercy is upon all His works.

translations.hebrew: יוֹד֣וּךָ יְ֭הֹוָה כׇּל־מַעֲשֶׂ֑יךָ וַ֝חֲסִידֶ֗יךָ יְבָרְכֽוּכָה׃
translations.english:
All Your works shall praise You, O LORD,
and Your faithful ones shall bless You.

translations.hebrew: כְּב֣וֹד מַלְכוּתְךָ֣ יֹאמֵ֑רוּ וּגְבוּרָתְךָ֥ יְדַבֵּֽרוּ׃
translations.english:
They shall talk of the majesty of Your kingship,
and speak of Your might,

translations.hebrew: לְהוֹדִ֤יעַ ׀ לִבְנֵ֣י הָ֭אָדָם גְּבוּרֹתָ֑יו וּ֝כְב֗וֹד הֲדַ֣ר מַלְכוּתֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
to make His mighty acts known among men
and the majestic glory of His kingship.

translations.hebrew: מַֽלְכוּתְךָ֗ מַלְכ֥וּת כׇּל־עֹלָמִ֑ים וּ֝מֶֽמְשַׁלְתְּךָ֗ בְּכׇל־דּ֥וֹר וָדֹֽר׃
translations.english:
Your kingship is an eternal kingship;
Your dominion is for all generations.

translations.hebrew: סוֹמֵ֣ךְ יְ֭הֹוָה לְכׇל־הַנֹּפְלִ֑ים וְ֝זוֹקֵ֗ף לְכׇל־הַכְּפוּפִֽים׃
translations.english:
The LORD supports all who stumble,
and makes all who are bent stand straight.

translations.hebrew: עֵֽינֵי־כֹ֭ל אֵלֶ֣יךָ יְשַׂבֵּ֑רוּ וְאַתָּ֤ה נֽוֹתֵן־לָהֶ֖ם אֶת־אׇכְלָ֣ם בְּעִתּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
The eyes of all look to You expectantly,
and You give them their food when it is due.

translations.hebrew: פּוֹתֵ֥חַ אֶת־יָדֶ֑ךָ וּמַשְׂבִּ֖יעַ לְכׇל־חַ֣י רָצֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
You give it openhandedly,
feeding every creature to its heart’s content.

translations.hebrew: צַדִּ֣יק יְ֭הֹוָה בְּכׇל־דְּרָכָ֑יו וְ֝חָסִ֗יד בְּכׇל־מַעֲשָֽׂיו׃
translations.english:
The LORD is beneficent in all His ways
and faithful in all His works.

translations.hebrew: קָר֣וֹב יְ֭הֹוָה לְכׇל־קֹרְאָ֑יו לְכֹ֤ל אֲשֶׁ֖ר יִקְרָאֻ֣הוּ בֶאֱמֶֽת׃
translations.english:
The LORD is near to all who call Him,
to all who call Him with sincerity.

translations.hebrew: רְצוֹן־יְרֵאָ֥יו יַעֲשֶׂ֑ה וְֽאֶת־שַׁוְעָתָ֥ם יִ֝שְׁמַ֗ע וְיוֹשִׁיעֵֽם׃
translations.english:
He fulfills the wishes of those who fear Him;
He hears their cry and delivers them.

translations.hebrew: שׁוֹמֵ֣ר יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־כׇּל־אֹהֲבָ֑יו וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־הָרְשָׁעִ֣ים יַשְׁמִֽיד׃
translations.english:
The LORD watches over all who love Him,
but all the wicked He will destroy.

translations.hebrew: תְּהִלַּ֥ת יְהֹוָ֗ה יְֽדַבֶּ֫ר־פִּ֥י וִיבָרֵ֣ךְ כׇּל־בָּ֭שָׂר שֵׁ֥ם קׇדְשׁ֗וֹ לְעוֹלָ֥ם וָעֶֽד׃
translations.english:
My mouth shall utter the praise of the LORD,
and all creaturesbLit. “flesh.” shall bless His holy name forever and ever.

translations.hebrew: הַֽלְלוּ־יָ֡הּ הַֽלְלִ֥י נַ֝פְשִׁ֗י אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
translations.english:
Hallelujah.
Praise the LORD, O my soul!

translations.hebrew: אֲהַלְלָ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּחַיָּ֑י אֲזַמְּרָ֖ה לֵאלֹהַ֣י בְּעוֹדִֽי׃
translations.english:
I will praise the LORD all my life,
sing hymns to my God while I exist.

translations.hebrew: אַל־תִּבְטְח֥וּ בִנְדִיבִ֑ים בְּבֶן־אָדָ֓ם ׀ שֶׁ֤אֵ֖ין ל֥וֹ תְשׁוּעָֽה׃
translations.english:
Put not your trust in the great,
in mortal man who cannot save.

translations.hebrew: תֵּצֵ֣א ר֭וּחוֹ יָשֻׁ֣ב לְאַדְמָת֑וֹ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַ֝ה֗וּא אָבְד֥וּ עֶשְׁתֹּנֹתָֽיו׃
translations.english:
His breath departs;
he returns to the dust;
on that day his plans come to nothing.

translations.hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֗י שֶׁ֤אֵ֣ל יַעֲקֹ֣ב בְּעֶזְר֑וֹ שִׂ֝בְר֗וֹ עַל־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽיו׃
translations.english:
Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help,
whose hope is in the LORD his God,

translations.hebrew: עֹשֶׂ֤ה ׀ שָׁ֘מַ֤יִם וָאָ֗רֶץ אֶת־הַיָּ֥ם וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֑ם הַשֹּׁמֵ֖ר אֱמֶ֣ת לְעוֹלָֽם׃
translations.english:
maker of heaven and earth,
the sea and all that is in them;
who keeps faith forever;

translations.hebrew: עֹשֶׂ֤ה מִשְׁפָּ֨ט ׀ לָעֲשׁוּקִ֗ים נֹתֵ֣ן לֶ֭חֶם לָרְעֵבִ֑ים יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה מַתִּ֥יר אֲסוּרִֽים׃
translations.english:
who secures justice for those who are wronged,
gives food to the hungry.
The LORD sets prisoners free;

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ פֹּ֘קֵ֤חַ עִוְרִ֗ים יְ֭הֹוָה זֹקֵ֣ף כְּפוּפִ֑ים יְ֝הֹוָ֗ה אֹהֵ֥ב צַדִּיקִֽים׃
translations.english:
The LORD restores sight to the blind;
the LORD makes those who are bent stand straight;
the LORD loves the righteous;

translations.hebrew: יְהֹוָ֤ה ׀ שֹׁ֘מֵ֤ר אֶת־גֵּרִ֗ים יָת֣וֹם וְאַלְמָנָ֣ה יְעוֹדֵ֑ד וְדֶ֖רֶךְ רְשָׁעִ֣ים יְעַוֵּֽת׃
translations.english:
The LORD watches over the stranger;
He gives courage to the orphan and widow,
but makes the path of the wicked tortuous.

translations.hebrew: יִמְלֹ֤ךְ יְהֹוָ֨ה ׀ לְעוֹלָ֗ם אֱלֹהַ֣יִךְ צִ֭יּוֹן לְדֹ֥ר וָדֹ֗ר הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
The LORD shall reign forever,
your God, O Zion, for all generations.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ כִּי־ט֭וֹב זַמְּרָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֑ינוּ כִּי־נָ֝עִ֗ים נָאוָ֥ה תְהִלָּֽה׃
translations.english:
Hallelujah.
It is good to chant hymns to our God;
it is pleasant to sing glorious praise.

translations.hebrew: בּוֹנֵ֣ה יְרוּשָׁלַ֣͏ִם יְהֹוָ֑ה נִדְחֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל יְכַנֵּֽס׃
translations.english:
The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem;
He gathers in the exiles of Israel.

translations.hebrew: הָ֭רֹפֵא לִשְׁב֣וּרֵי לֵ֑ב וּ֝מְחַבֵּ֗שׁ לְעַצְּבוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
He heals their broken hearts,
and binds up their wounds.

translations.hebrew: מוֹנֶ֣ה מִ֭סְפָּר לַכּוֹכָבִ֑ים לְ֝כֻלָּ֗ם שֵׁמ֥וֹת יִקְרָֽא׃
translations.english:
He reckoned the number of the stars;
to each He gave its name.

translations.hebrew: גָּד֣וֹל אֲדוֹנֵ֣ינוּ וְרַב־כֹּ֑חַ לִ֝תְבוּנָת֗וֹ אֵ֣ין מִסְפָּֽר׃
translations.english:
Great is our Lord and full of power;
His wisdom is beyond reckoning.

translations.hebrew: מְעוֹדֵ֣ד עֲנָוִ֣ים יְהֹוָ֑ה מַשְׁפִּ֖יל רְשָׁעִ֣ים עֲדֵי־אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
The LORD gives courage to the lowly,
and brings the wicked down to the dust.

translations.hebrew: עֱנ֣וּ לַֽיהֹוָ֣ה בְּתוֹדָ֑ה זַמְּר֖וּ לֵאלֹהֵ֣ינוּ בְכִנּֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Sing to the LORD a song of praise,
chant a hymn with a lyre to our God,

translations.hebrew: הַֽמְכַסֶּ֬ה שָׁמַ֨יִם ׀ בְּעָבִ֗ים הַמֵּכִ֣ין לָאָ֣רֶץ מָטָ֑ר הַמַּצְמִ֖יחַ הָרִ֣ים חָצִֽיר׃
translations.english:
who covers the heavens with clouds,
provides rain for the earth,
makes mountains put forth grass;

translations.hebrew: נוֹתֵ֣ן לִבְהֵמָ֣ה לַחְמָ֑הּ לִבְנֵ֥י עֹ֝רֵ֗ב אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִקְרָֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
who gives the beasts their food,
to the raven’s brood what they cry for.

translations.hebrew: לֹ֤א בִגְבוּרַ֣ת הַסּ֣וּס יֶחְפָּ֑ץ לֹא־בְשׁוֹקֵ֖י הָאִ֣ישׁ יִרְצֶֽה׃
translations.english:
He does not prize the strength of horses,
nor value the fleetnessaLit. “thighs.” of men;

translations.hebrew: רוֹצֶ֣ה יְ֭הֹוָה אֶת־יְרֵאָ֑יו אֶת־הַֽמְיַחֲלִ֥ים לְחַסְדּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
but the LORD values those who fear Him,
those who depend on His faithful care.

translations.hebrew: שַׁבְּחִ֣י יְ֭רוּשָׁלַ͏ִם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה הַֽלְלִ֖י אֱלֹהַ֣יִךְ צִיּֽוֹן׃
translations.english:
O Jerusalem, glorify the LORD;
praise your God, O Zion!

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־חִ֭זַּק בְּרִיחֵ֣י שְׁעָרָ֑יִךְ בֵּרַ֖ךְ בָּנַ֣יִךְ בְּקִרְבֵּֽךְ׃
translations.english:
For He made the bars of your gates strong,
and blessed your children within you.

translations.hebrew: הַשָּׂם־גְּבוּלֵ֥ךְ שָׁל֑וֹם חֵ֥לֶב חִ֝טִּ֗ים יַשְׂבִּיעֵֽךְ׃
translations.english:
He endows your realm with well-being,
and satisfies you with choice wheat.

translations.hebrew: הַשֹּׁלֵ֣חַ אִמְרָת֣וֹ אָ֑רֶץ עַד־מְ֝הֵרָ֗ה יָר֥וּץ דְּבָרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
He sends forth His word to the earth;
His command runs swiftly.

translations.hebrew: הַנֹּתֵ֣ן שֶׁ֣לֶג כַּצָּ֑מֶר כְּ֝פ֗וֹר כָּאֵ֥פֶר יְפַזֵּֽר׃
translations.english:
He lays down snow like fleece,
scatters frost like ashes.

translations.hebrew: מַשְׁלִ֣יךְ קַֽרְח֣וֹ כְפִתִּ֑ים לִפְנֵ֥י קָ֝רָת֗וֹ מִ֣י יַעֲמֹֽד׃
translations.english:
He tosses down hail like crumbs—
who can endure His icy cold?

translations.hebrew: יִשְׁלַ֣ח דְּבָר֣וֹ וְיַמְסֵ֑ם יַשֵּׁ֥ב ר֝וּח֗וֹ יִזְּלוּ־מָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
He issues a command—it melts them;
He breathes—the waters flow.

translations.hebrew: מַגִּ֣יד דְּבָרָ֣ו לְיַעֲקֹ֑ב חֻקָּ֥יו וּ֝מִשְׁפָּטָ֗יו לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
translations.english:
He issued His commands to Jacob,
His statutes and rules to Israel.

translations.hebrew: לֹ֘א־עָ֤שָׂה כֵ֨ן ׀ לְכׇל־גּ֗וֹי וּמִשְׁפָּטִ֥ים בַּל־יְדָע֗וּם הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
He did not do so for any other nation;
of such rules they know nothing.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ הַֽלְל֣וּ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֑יִם הַֽ֝לְל֗וּהוּ בַּמְּרוֹמִֽים׃
translations.english:
Hallelujah.
Praise the LORD from the heavens;
praise Him on high.

translations.hebrew: הַֽלְל֥וּהוּ כׇל־מַלְאָכָ֑יו הַ֝לְל֗וּהוּ כׇּל־צְבָאָֽו׃
translations.english:
Praise Him, all His angels,
praise Him, all His hosts.

translations.hebrew: הַֽ֭לְלוּהוּ שֶׁ֣מֶשׁ וְיָרֵ֑חַ הַֽ֝לְל֗וּהוּ כׇּל־כּ֥וֹכְבֵי אֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Praise Him, sun and moon,
praise Him, all bright stars.

translations.hebrew: הַֽ֭לְלוּהוּ שְׁמֵ֣י הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם וְ֝הַמַּ֗יִם אֲשֶׁ֤ר ׀ מֵעַ֬ל הַשָּׁמָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
Praise Him, highest heavens,
and you waters that are above the heavens.

translations.hebrew: יְֽ֭הַלְלוּ אֶת־שֵׁ֣ם יְהֹוָ֑ה כִּ֤י ה֖וּא צִוָּ֣ה וְנִבְרָֽאוּ׃
translations.english:
Let them praise the name of the LORD,
for it was He who commanded that they be created.

translations.hebrew: וַיַּעֲמִידֵ֣ם לָעַ֣ד לְעוֹלָ֑ם חׇק־נָ֝תַ֗ן וְלֹ֣א יַעֲבֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
He made them endure forever,
establishing an order that shall never change.

translations.hebrew: הַֽלְל֣וּ אֶת־יְ֭הֹוָה מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ תַּ֝נִּינִ֗ים וְכׇל־תְּהֹמֽוֹת׃
translations.english:
Praise the LORD, O you who are on earth,
all sea monsters and ocean depths,

translations.hebrew: אֵ֣שׁ וּ֭בָרָד שֶׁ֣לֶג וְקִיט֑וֹר ר֥וּחַ סְ֝עָרָ֗ה עֹשָׂ֥ה דְבָרֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
fire and hail, snow and smoke,
storm wind that executes His command,

translations.hebrew: הֶהָרִ֥ים וְכׇל־גְּבָע֑וֹת עֵ֥ץ פְּ֝רִ֗י וְכׇל־אֲרָזִֽים׃
translations.english:
all mountains and hills,
all fruit trees and cedars,

translations.hebrew: הַחַיָּ֥ה וְכׇל־בְּהֵמָ֑ה רֶ֝֗מֶשׂ וְצִפּ֥וֹר כָּנָֽף׃
translations.english:
all wild and tamed beasts,
creeping things and winged birds,

translations.hebrew: מַלְכֵי־אֶ֭רֶץ וְכׇל־לְאֻמִּ֑ים שָׂ֝רִ֗ים וְכׇל־שֹׁ֥פְטֵי אָֽרֶץ׃
translations.english:
all kings and peoples of the earth,
all princes of the earth and its judges,

translations.hebrew: בַּחוּרִ֥ים וְגַם־בְּתוּל֑וֹת זְ֝קֵנִ֗ים עִם־נְעָרִֽים׃
translations.english:
youths and maidens alike,
old and young together.

translations.hebrew: יְהַלְל֤וּ ׀ אֶת־שֵׁ֬ם יְהֹוָ֗ה כִּֽי־נִשְׂגָּ֣ב שְׁמ֣וֹ לְבַדּ֑וֹ ה֝וֹד֗וֹ עַל־אֶ֥רֶץ וְשָׁמָֽיִם׃
translations.english:
Let them praise the name of the LORD,
for His name, His alone, is sublime;
His splendor covers heaven and earth.

translations.hebrew: וַיָּ֤רֶם קֶ֨רֶן ׀ לְעַמּ֡וֹ תְּהִלָּ֤ה לְֽכׇל־חֲסִידָ֗יו לִבְנֵ֣י יִ֭שְׂרָאֵל עַ֥ם קְרֹב֗וֹ הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
He has exalted the horn of His people
for the glory of all His faithful ones,
Israel, the people close to Him.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ שִׁ֣ירוּ לַֽ֭יהֹוָה שִׁ֣יר חָדָ֑שׁ תְּ֝הִלָּת֗וֹ בִּקְהַ֥ל חֲסִידִֽים׃
translations.english:
Hallelujah.
Sing to the LORD a new song,
His praises in the congregation of the faithful.

translations.hebrew: יִשְׂמַ֣ח יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל בְּעֹשָׂ֑יו בְּנֵֽי־צִ֝יּ֗וֹן יָגִ֥ילוּ בְמַלְכָּֽם׃
translations.english:
Let Israel rejoice in its maker;
let the children of Zion exult in their king.

translations.hebrew: יְהַלְל֣וּ שְׁמ֣וֹ בְמָח֑וֹל בְּתֹ֥ף וְ֝כִנּ֗וֹר יְזַמְּרוּ־לֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Let them praise His name in dance;
with timbrel and lyre let them chant His praises.

translations.hebrew: כִּֽי־רוֹצֶ֣ה יְהֹוָ֣ה בְּעַמּ֑וֹ יְפָאֵ֥ר עֲ֝נָוִ֗ים בִּישׁוּעָֽה׃
translations.english:
For the LORD delights in His people;
He adorns the lowly with victory.

translations.hebrew: יַעְלְז֣וּ חֲסִידִ֣ים בְּכָב֑וֹד יְ֝רַנְּנ֗וּ עַל־מִשְׁכְּבוֹתָֽם׃
translations.english:
Let the faithful exult in glory;
let them shout for joy upon their couches,

translations.hebrew: רוֹמְמ֣וֹת אֵ֭ל בִּגְרוֹנָ֑ם וְחֶ֖רֶב פִּיפִיּ֣וֹת בְּיָדָֽם׃
translations.english:
with paeans to God in their throats
and two-edged swords in their hands,

translations.hebrew: לַעֲשׂ֣וֹת נְ֭קָמָה בַּגּוֹיִ֑ם תּ֝וֹכֵח֗וֹת בַּלְאֻמִּֽים׃
translations.english:
to impose retribution upon the nations,
punishment upon the peoples,

translations.hebrew: לֶאְסֹ֣ר מַלְכֵיהֶ֣ם בְּזִקִּ֑ים וְ֝נִכְבְּדֵיהֶ֗ם בְּכַבְלֵ֥י בַרְזֶֽל׃
translations.english:
binding their kings with shackles,
their nobles with chains of iron,

translations.hebrew: לַעֲשׂ֤וֹת בָּהֶ֨ם ׀ מִשְׁפָּ֬ט כָּת֗וּב הָדָ֣ר ה֭וּא לְכׇל־חֲסִידָ֗יו הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
executing the doom decreed against them.
This is the glory of all His faithful.
Hallelujah.

translations.hebrew: הַ֥לְלוּ־יָ֨הּ ׀ הַֽלְלוּ־אֵ֥ל בְּקׇדְשׁ֑וֹ הַֽ֝לְל֗וּהוּ בִּרְקִ֥יעַ עֻזּֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Hallelujah.
Praise God in His sanctuary;
praise Him in the sky, His stronghold.

translations.hebrew: הַלְל֥וּהוּ בִגְבוּרֹתָ֑יו הַ֝לְל֗וּהוּ כְּרֹ֣ב גֻּדְלֽוֹ׃
translations.english:
Praise Him for His mighty acts;
praise Him foraOr “as befits.” His exceeding greatness.

translations.hebrew: הַ֭לְלוּהוּ בְּתֵ֣קַע שׁוֹפָ֑ר הַ֝לְל֗וּהוּ בְּנֵ֣בֶל וְכִנּֽוֹר׃
translations.english:
Praise Him with blasts of the horn;
praise Him with harp and lyre.

translations.hebrew: הַ֭לְלוּהוּ בְּתֹ֣ף וּמָח֑וֹל הַֽ֝לְל֗וּהוּ בְּמִנִּ֥ים וְעֻגָֽב׃
translations.english:
Praise Him with timbrel and dance;
praise Him with lute and pipe.

translations.hebrew: הַלְל֥וּהוּ בְצִלְצְלֵי־שָׁ֑מַע הַֽ֝לְל֗וּהוּ בְּֽצִלְצְלֵ֥י תְרוּעָֽה׃
translations.english:
Praise Him with resounding cymbals;
praise Him with loud-clashing cymbals.

translations.hebrew: כֹּ֣ל הַ֭נְּשָׁמָה תְּהַלֵּ֥ל יָ֗הּ הַֽלְלוּ־יָֽהּ׃
translations.english:
Let all that breathes praise the LORD.
Hallelujah.
